description:
What a great place. Small, divey, and cash only - with a diverse and friendly crowd of beer lovers. You don't come here for the fine dining or the views, you come for the amazing beer selection.

I got to enjoy a few delicious pints with an added bonus - the guy checking IDs at the door had an adorable chihuahua wearing a Slayer jacket that snuggled up in my lap all evening.
author: Christina R.

description:
If you're a fan of craft beers at a very reasonable price this is the place to be! 

Great dive bar, there's tons of craft beer on tap and they also sell cans to go. FYI it's cash only. 

I usually start off with the tried and true Pliny the elder and then check out the big board of beers to decide what's next. You can bring food in - there's a sausage place next door that goes perfect with your beer!
author: G T.

description:
My boyfriend and I checked out this little hole in the wall dive that was near our Airbnb and we were pleasantly surprised! The beer offerings were great, with a huge taplist that included some rarer beers that we hadn't tried before. They even had a Founders beer that we had to look up because we hadn't heard of it (and we live in Grand Rapids, where Founders was ... founded)! When we stopped in on a weekday afternoon there was a small crowd at the bar and a couple of dogs hanging out. The guy checking our IDs was polite and the bartender was patient when we were browsing the options. Prices were beyond reasonable and probably even cheap for this area.

Toronado is cash-only and they don't have any food, but it's definitely worth a stop if you're a craft beer lover. We would have gone in again but unfortunately didn't end up having enough time during our stay. Until next time, Toronado!
author: Katy C.

description:
Best beer place tamale lady is the bomb, Really chill atmosphere. Where anyone can have fun. 
The beer selection is incredible.
author: Robert C.

description:
On a recent visit, the place was crowded even at one PM on a Tuesday.  Doesn't anybody in this town have a job?  New brews tried:

- Mad River John Barleycorn Barleywine-Style Ale 2017.  Approximately 10% ABV.  Clear copper, one-finger head, lacing the glass.  Mild caramel malt nose.  Taste is caramel malt, peach, and ethanol, with some bitterness in the finish. 

- Tioga-Sequoia Bourbon-Barrel-Aged Vanilla Midnight Lightning.   13.6% ABV.  Opaque black, cream-colored halo head.  Nose reminiscent of cream soda.  Intense taste of sweet roast malt, chocolate, dark fruit, and ethanol. Aged in Stranahan whiskey barrels, with vanilla beans.

- Anderson Valley Wild Turkey Bourbon Barrel Stout.  6.9% ABV, rather low for the style; 14 IBU.  Opaque dark brown; one-finger head.  Winy, grape-y nose.  Fizzy, with a rather thin mouth feel.  Chocolate note, but I couldn't identify much Wild Turkey presence.  Moderately boozy.  Lightly hopped with Columbus and Northern Brewer.  A barrel-aged version of Barney Flats Oatmeal Stout. 

Oh, and mark your calendar:  Toronado's annual Barleywine Festival opens on November 13 this year.
author: Alan F.

description:
Holy snopes this place was awesome! Divey, a little stinky, and tons of great beer. As others have said, it's cash only. The bartenders were helpful and worked the bar well. 

If you are a fan of great beer, head here. And yes, the sausage place next door is freaking amazing if you are hungry!
author: Erik Y.

description:
Came here for some Pliny the Younger for beer week 2018. On a Monday i didn't think there would be a line at 11:00 AM for some beer, but sure enough there was. They moved the line really fast as soon as they opened and once i got in I was surprised at how much space they had to fit everyone in that was in line. 

All the bartenders knew what everyone was there for so they handled the traffic well, moving from one side down to the end and back over again. Keg kicked in about 20 minutes, but that's to be expected for the Younger. 

Came back after leaving for some food and grabbed some Pliny the elder on tap too. Solid, solid place. All good beers on tap, especially Pliny the Elder which is rare. And they also have all the old taps they used to have all over the walls so you know they've been doing this for a while and did a damn good job at it too.
author: Andrew B.

description: Terrible service, super dirty place & crazy hostile owner. Went in there to wind down with some friends & the owner got hostile with us out of the blue. Found out from other guests that you have have to earn to be there. What a bs. Spare you money & time. Avoid this place.
author: Ruslan B.

description:
Can't believe I haven't ventured to Lower Haight area as there's a good selection of bars & eateries. For some reason I had already bookmarked Toronado so I was glad that my friends suggested to meet up at this bar. We showed up around 8pm on a Saturday and beat the crowd just by 30 mins or so. If you're a beer fanatic, this is the spot for you. Pliny is on tap as well as a decent selection of stouts (there's a Chai flavored one), ciders, and lots of whatever you're in the mood for. 

The place can get crowded if you're in the front area but there's additional seating and two restrooms at the back. There's no food but feel free to step next door to Rosamunde Sausage Grill and bring your food back -- there's actually a menu on the table.

Cash only.
author: Ruby C.

description: Huge beer selection! Only complaint is cash only and at the time, the ATM was not working. Other than that, I enjoyed it. Laid back atmosphere
author: Bianca C.

description:
Good beer after good beer after good beer. 

This is definitely your typical dive bar, so if you're looking for an intimate/bougie setting then this is not your place. BUT if you want to indulge in some damn good beer selections, catch a classic film playing on the tele (Indiana Jones was on when I came through), and/or be out late on a random day of the week, Toronado is your jam. 

The bartender did take a bit to get our order even though there weren't many people in the bar, but he apologized for the wait as soon as he tuned into us. Don't forget - CASH ONLY!
author: Allie L.

description: Bah. These people are just plain mean. Buy your beer elsewhere.
author: Chris D.

description:
Amazing craft beer selection always! 

Casual grungy dive bar cash only vibes. Most times I've been here it's the perfect amount of busy but not too busy. I love that they always have my favorites: Russian river, cellar maker and fieldwork. Great spot for beer fans.
author: Daniela J.

description:
This is an incredible beer bar but at the same time I can't help but consider that it's cash only and it's like, hey cmon bro I'm broke too but I still figure out a way to make it look like I pay my taxes. What's with this cash-only stuff? I guess it weeds out those bougie 'on the books' people, so there's that. But maaaan do I love the convenience of not having to handle paper. 

P good number of beers on tap and they had Pliny and a ton of other not necessarily things you'd consider rarities, but not super basic stuff either.

One thing to note, as a lady, lots of dick in here. Almost exclusively. Do what you will with that information. I did nothing with it. So there's my hot take on that.
author: Candice G.

description: Updating this just because I left a 1-star review 12 years ago in a snit. It's a righteous beer bar, decent selection, not pretentious. At the time this was a rarity. Now that good beer is more common it's still a good option.
author: Gil S.

description:
This is your classic beer only bar in San Francisco. They have very reasonably priced beers with a large and interesting variety. Some of the beers are special, meaning they were brewed just to serve at this bar specifically. 

Beers from places like Russian River brewing, only costing $5. What a deal!

Although they don't serve food, menus for the sausage place next door sit on the tables so you can easily order from there. 

Issues: Cash only! like many places. Also the bathroom didn't have any paper towels...not a big deal but could be fixed easily.

My husband is a super beer enthusiast, he would have given this place 5 stars. We will be back for sure!!! Street parking is metered but completely free on Sundays if you're thinking about driving to the area.
author: Alyssa A.

description:
Your classic beer bar. The selection is incredible and the place doesn't feel too crowded. If you have a decent sized group there is a corner sofa in the back with some tables that can definitely seat about 15 people. Drinks run the price range between $5-$10, which is definitely on the low end in the city.

They do not serve food, but there is an excellent sausage place next door and you are allowed to bring your food in

Make sure you hit an ATM ahead of time. The place is cash only
author: Henry Z.

description:
If I had a 6th star, the Toronado would get it. This place combines 2 of my all-time favorite past times that I never knew existed in one place: dive bars and craft beer. Seriously, what's not to love? And not only do they have craft beer but they have some of the best the county has to offer. The night I was there, they had 2 of my favorites on tap: Russian River Pliney the Elder and Boneyard (from my home of Bend, OR).

The bartenders are awesome as well, something you don't always get in the dive bar atmosphere. What is typical of a good dive bar at the Toronado: cash only, so don't forget to swing by an ATM before going. 

All in all, this is definitely worth the visit unless you are looking for cheap beer you'd find at a typical dive, then it might not be the place for you.
author: Jaime H.

description: This was one of the worst bar experiences I've ever had. While we were trying to leave, the bark back at the restaurant on 8/16-8/17 told us to "get the fuck out." He also said "go back to the Marina" implying something. He called the female members of the group "bitches" while we were trying to finish our beers. The owner and bartender where very defensive of this employee despite this behavior?
author: Amy G.

description:
If I could leave a 0.5 star review, I would. 

I had like 3 beers at a previous bar and was looking for not-beer. We tried ordering a whiskey (big mistake). I saw signs that said cash only but nothing that said "we only serve beer". Anyways, when I made a face at my friend when she mentioned beer only the bartender freaked out and started screaming at us to get out of the bar if we didn't like beer. Insane. For a place that tries it's very hardest to be "chill" and "not pretentious" it was difficult for them to pull that off up on their high horse.
author: Tyler G.

description:
Loud, unapologetic beer bar with a fantastic beer selection.
Cash only. Always have beers from Russian River on tap and for purchase to-go.
author: Gerald D.

description:
Coming from a regular:

Don't come into this place unprepared. Theres a beer list online and having one bartender for 70+ people is a pain in the ass.

Great beer, "great" service, and sci fi movies on Tuesday during lunch. what's not to like?
author: Edward F.

description:
Pro-tip: CASH ONLY! 

It's amazing to me how tech-heavy this city is and that so many places are cash only. Unless the place is worth it I would totally avoid. Luckily this place is worth the hassle. Not only do they have Pliny the Elder on tap they have one of the nicest bartenders I have ever encountered. 

I was lucky to snag a bar seat on a crowded Friday. I overheard the bartender talking with numerous people putting in orders. He was so patient and never made anyone feel rushed or stupid if they weren't beer connoisseurs, in fact, he eagerly offered samples to make sure you got just the beer you were looking for. 

This place has a cozy, no frills vibe (I wouldn't call it a dive bar but definitely no need to dress up) and a fantastic selection of beers on tap.
author: Tarah P.

description:
One of the best beer bars around. Cool bartenders. If you don't care about beer don't come here. Heaven for a micro brew drinker.

Been around for so long much respect has to be given for that. Not much has changed over the years either, except maybe the prices. 

If your a Blue Moon drinker save yourself the hassle of coming here. There is no point. Only a beer snob would appreciate this place. If you don't know what you want don't waste the bartenders time. 

Drinking cheap, junky beer here is forbidden. Go elsewhere.
author: Stefan T.

description: This place is one of the coolest bars I have ever been too. I was on the search for some Pliney The Elder and a friend told me about this gem. The bartender helped make the experience even better. After 2 alpha acid ipa's I got the Pliney. The history behind that area and the bar was very unique. I can't wait to go back to San Francisco mainly for this bar!
author: Derek M.

description: During an extended layover at SFO I ventured into the city to find some stuff to do. After an extended montage of city sights, I arrive at this glorious place. It's a bit grimy and a bit run down, and I like that. The bar tenders are busy but friendly and one even noticed my Westworld shirt, and I like that. They have a ridiculous tap and bottle list and almost have too many choices (including some serious whalez, bro), but I like that. It's packed at 4pm on a Saturday AND it's happy hour, but I like that. They're cash only, and that's kind of a bummer but it works. Boy howdy if I lived in SF this would be my jam. Highly recommended if you like the beers.
author: Mike M.

description: If you live in SF and love beer, you've probably been here. You get the sense that this is one of those places that could care less about something like a Yelp review - a long-standing neighborhood bar with welcoming vibe. Open the lower half of the Dutch door, and you'll find OG SF folks, one or more dogs laying on the floor, and lots of lively conversation happening. The menu board is very clear and easy to read even with beer-vision. Once you've got the attention of the bartender, you'd better know what you want! Tap list is extensive and often features great California brews, as well as selections from all over. One of my favorite places to grab a Russian River Blind Pig or Pliny at while on a weekend afternoon walk. Its not too hard to get a seat but does get crowded at peak times. Be patient, have a conversation and hover aroudn with your beer to find a spot to sit. Its worth it!
author: Michael M.

description: Great local dive bar. Owner is amazing. Super selection of draft beers. I think they have a small food menu but I didn't come to eat. Pliny on draft; nuff said.
author: Drew O.

description:
There's no place like it.

It's divey. It's dirty. It's cash only. The jukebox is filled with metal. The staff can be a little rough around the edges. 

But it's my favorite bar in the city. The beer list here is unbeatable and the prices are great. Also, they have local cans and bottles of Pliny to go.

Don't:
Ask for recommendations.
Ask for tasters.
Ask for anything other than beer.

Do:
Lookup the list in advance (http://www.toronado.com/whats-on-tap/).
Bring cash (there's an ATM in the back as well).
Bring your well-behaved doggo.
Bring in a sausage from next door.
author: Tom J.

description: Great beer selection, for IPA lovers. Which I am not unfortunately. Pretty gnarly spot in the Haight. Obnoxious music so it depends what kind of person you are honestly. More like a spot for young punk rockers, not really a good spot to have a conversation and chill. Not sure if I'd come back but grateful for the experience. And pretty good LARGE Pilsner for $5. Can't beat that anywhere.
author: Elizabeth G.

description: Options galore! This amazing craft dive bar is welcoming, clean and friendly. Tons of IPA's to choose from. Went on a Thursday night and felt like i was in a neighborhood party.
author: Henry F.

description:
Terrible customer service. They wouldn't take back the shitty newly tapped warm ass beer they poured me. Rosamunde is on point though, but take that sausage to
Mad dog!
author: Safeer J.

description: Super pretentious and rude. They do have a lot of great beers but they treat everyone as if we should already know their namesake and establishment. The place smells like mildew and urine and the staff is not at all friendly. I raised my hand once after waiting for 15 mins and no one making eye contact with me and got yelled at by the grumpy old lady owner that she sees me and I don't need to wave! Yes, they have great beers but you're also paying for the beer. There's plenty of beer bars in sf that gives great service and sell great beers but this is not one of them.
author: Buttercup N.

description:
One of the best beer selections of any bar in the city, all in a divey setting that evokes a time when the Lower Haight wasn't as gentrified as it is now. The ambience is casual and boisterous, and while the service is somewhat Soup Nazi-like in that you need to know what you want and be ready with your cash when you head up to the bar, you can stand aside and peruse the large menu dominating the establishment as you walk in. 

Simply put, if you're a beer aficionado and love to immerse yourself in new beers - all while admiring their endless collection of tap handles and other beer-related paraphernalia - you'll be in heaven here. Perhaps the best and biggest beer selection in all of SF, and probably the most extensive at a place that's not called Yard House.
author: Vincent L.

description:
I moved a couple blocks away from Toronado in 1988 and it was the second SF bar I went to. I was a solid regular for years until I moved to The Mission but until recently still came as often as I could.

I have a lot of respect and loyalty for Toronado but respect and loyalty only go so far.

I understand that rudeness is your schtick but you should understand that there are many options for good beer in San Francisco now and beer people are tired of your bullshit. I bet you've noticed the gradual drop in business.

You should take a lesson from Zeitgeist, a place that was also known for rudeness until around five years ago when they remodeled and fired all the worst employees. They are busier than ever.

I've been to your 10th, 20th, and 30th anniversaries but after the way your doorman treated me it might be your 40th before I come back; if you are still in business then.
author: Manny F.

description: Served us hot beer and when I asked for a cold beer on an unbelievably hot day, they gave me endless attitude. Sorry if I expected beer under 83 degrees for $9. Rude.
author: Celie H.

description: Heard about this place from a family member. That it was totally a dive bar that only sold beer but that they had a lot of great beers on tap. So of course I had to check this place out. It was packed, so we Decided to walk around and check out the other places around the area and hopefully later it would be easier to get in. We got came back about 2 hours later and it was still packed. So we went in anyways and made our way through the crazy crowd to the bar. They had Pliny the Elder on tap, Score! Only ever had it in bottle til this point. They also had Flying Pig! Which in my opinion was a better beer, I never had it before but fall in love with it. It's a must try!! Found out way it was so packed, they were doing a special release of Pliny the Younger. Score again! Never had it before. So we waited the 1 1/2 til the release. It was a good beer, a little stronger then the Elder. They had one younger staff member that delivered fast and friendly service and another one, an older staff member that was just out right Mean, Rude and had No customer service. He was even screaming at other customers. I have never seen such bad customer service at this level before. I asked around and guess they are known for that kind of service or lack of service. You definitely come here for the selection of beer and not for service. Unless you get the younger guy. He was good.
author: Ron V.

description:
This is the absolute worst place I have ever been to. The bartenders niche is that they're mean to their customers. That's not a niche. That's rude. We tried to order three times and each time they ignored us or had a pseudo reason to walk away. Then finally we asked "when you get a minute, could we please have this beer?" The bartender snapped and said "you must have me confused for a servant. There is a difference between a server and a servant."  He was extremely hostile and overall rude. 

I'm surprised this crap hole has been around for thirty years. Despicable.
author: Carmen C.

description: This is the best craft beer bar that I've ever been to, by far.  They have an amazing tap list including Pliny the Elder, DeGarde Petit Blanc and Fieldwork The Baker.  It's a cash only place and always super busy.  The bartenders can be a little brusque at times but that only adds to the ambiance.
author: Patrick H.

description:
BYOS (Bring Your Own Sausage) from Rosamunde next door and head over here to order a brewski. Yes, they let you eat your order from next door, here. NOICE. Chill dive bar (a little rough on the edges), grungy white crowd, extensive beer selection, cheap prices, plenty of seating. Good times. 

For him: Blind Pig IPA
For her: Edel-Weisse

Don't expect any service. 

+ Cash only, ATM on-site
author: Merica S.

description: Beer lovers paradise with no frills. Simply a great place to sit and try new beers that you have never heard of at a super reasonable price. We will definitely be back in the future.
author: Kathy B.

description:
Worse experience.  Unfortunately I didn't read the reviews beforehand to know how bad the bar tenders are.

We were meeting a friend that was running late.  I setup a laptop to do some work while I wait and the bar was empty.  The first interaction with the bar tender was her yelling at my girlfriend that said "you need to order a beer, tick tock!".  Not, hey do you know what you would like? Nothing.

When I went up to order a beer, girlfriend was fuming so she didn't want anything, she said "if she doesn't get a drink then you need to leave.  You are using our wifi (which I wasn't) and our power (which I was on battery and had only been there for 10 minutes), and you need to order beer or leave".  I told her that I was waiting for a friend and she said, "I don't care who you are waiting for, either both of you get a drink or get out."  We left.

I'm not sure the environment that conditioned them to be like this.  I get that they probably have to run off people and they don't want any loitering, but they could easily get that across without being this aggressive.

This place sucks.  If you don't know how to treat people you shouldn't be in the service industry.  Bad service = bad tips so no wonder they are pissed off.  There would be a pretty good opportunity to improve this with a change of ownership.
author: Brandon S.

description: The rudest bar staff possible - we all bad days but taking out your bad feelings by insulting and grandstanding against your customers is a joke. Apparently asking about a particular beer is below the dignity of the bar staff to answer - especially when the place was near empty. Avoid. I will not be returning.
author: Will J.

description: The beer selection now consists of too many thick pineapple beers. Not like the Ballast Point Pineapple Sculpin... but rather they look like a glass of OJ and taste like straight pineapple juice. Also, the staff here are very rude. Not worth the trouble. Tons of better/friendlier places.
author: Gray H.

description: Classic beer bar institution. Best selection and prices in all of SF with an array of limited, barrel-aged, collabs, and one-offs. The San Diego location is not quite as nostalgic, but the service is friendlier down there. At one point last night the bartender here disappeared for over ten minutes to talk to his buddies across the bar while thirsty patrons waited anxiously for a brew.
author: Jeff B.

description: I see some bad reviews that I can't really touch on. I just know they had great stuff on tap and was packed. The inside of the bar has a cool hipster vibe, but I'd come back just because they are known for good stuff on tap usually. Good beer bar.
author: Nick D.

description: Make sure you bring cash to this super divey bar with a great beer selection. Next door is the famous sausage shop, and it pairs nicely with a cold beer. The service is kind, and despite being typically busy, they are quick to bring drinks and keep your glass full. A decent amount of seating and a standard loud divey bar experience make this a great place for locals or visitors. I'll be going back to make sure I try their wide selection of beers.
author: John W.

description:
I'm not sure where the bad bartenders and bouncer came from but I had a great experience here. TIP: come with a great attitude, cash at hand, and know what you are going to order so they won't give you a hard time?

Great place to get hard to find beers! Pliny the Elder! Always on tap and Blind Pig. Yes bathrooms are gross but it's a bar! Great place for great beer!
author: Marcie A.

description:
My partner had a drink accidentally spilled on her by our friend. She went up to the bar to ask for napkins to wipe the beer off her phone and pants, and the bartender verbally assaulted her, just because she asked for napkins and "they don't serve food so why the fuck would he have any napkins for her."

Literally cannot believe that this guy is a bartender. Must be the same one that is in all the other negative, 1-star Yelp reviews. Do not go here, the bartender is a psychopath.
author: Eli W.

description: Great selection of beers, but the bartenders always make you feel like an ass for being there. The most recent time I was there he was giving me my change, put it in my palm, then snatched it away and placed it a few feet away from me in the bar. Why? Don't know. We just had a beer prior and tipped well on it. Won't be going back.
author: Dave L.

description:
I'm very bummed to say that my friends and I won't be revisiting Toronado anytime soon. This bar used to be our favorite hangout spot as we loved their selection of beers and, seemingly, chill vibes. I always wondered where the rude bartenders mentioned in the yelp reviews were hiding until my last experience here.
    Long story short, after being screamed at and threatened by the bar owner and bouncer for taking a photo, we were made so uncomfortable that we left our untouched drinks on the bar and left... mind you, we weren't taking photos of any faces and there was not a single "no cameras" sign to be found.
     Great beer selection though and obviously one shouldn't expect five-star service in a dive bar, but I think that being rude and unkind to paying customers anywhere is just unacceptable... we definitely won't be back.
author: Milan F.

description:
PLINY

make sure to grab brats at rosamund's next door
author: Dr. S.

description:
- Great beer selection
- Casual dive bar
- Good food (nearby)
- Good jukebox music selection
- Dog friendly

That's as good as it gets, so this place is among my favorites.
author: Charles R.

description:
Brass-Tacks:  If you want to have as good of a beer list at your disposal that you will find in San Francisco, you better take note of Toronado.  By my count, they typically have about 50 beers on tap here, and I can always find at least 5 to 10 beers that I want to try on any given visit.  And, their prices are good and their pours are never of the sampler-sized variety.  I haven't even touched bottles here, if they even have them.  Oh yeah, it's also open around noon.  So, this place would slide to magical 6-star for beer if such a thing were possible.

Now, folks....  There are 1, 2 and 3-star reviews.  My first question is:  What did you think this place was when you walked in?  It's beer first, and, frankly, nothing second.  And, let's be real, if you think you can find this stuff anywhere, then go show us how it's done.  There are a lot of good beer places in SF but you won't find this range on tap with these prices.  So, expect to be on their program.  And, that means, be here on purpose - and on purpose means you get how good the beer you have access to is and you actually really appreciate it.  Want your ass kissed and told that you are special because you have plenty of money to waste on beer you don't like, understand or care about, you can go waste your money plenty of other places.  No one is here to hold your hand.  And, your spot at the bar is damn valuable.  For $20 I can pick you three beers here that you a) Won't find on a tap list that day, and b) Are REALLY good and would give you three different distinct takes on the craft.  These will be full beers.  There's no sitting at the bar while the beer drinker in your group finishes their beer.  Get your own.  Finished it, get another.  Gonna get one later, now is as good as later.  Not using your seat, I'll take it.  Those are the people who write low-rated reviews.  They are people who don't realize where they are.  These are the same people that show up at art galleries and say "I could do that."  They don't get what goes into actually making it.  Walk into an art gallery and they kiss your ass, their art likely sucks.

So, yes, the beer is really good here.  And, I respect their service.  If you stay long enough and show enough of your true colors, they do open up.  You'll also realized that there are a lot of tips to be gained and there are some awesome people to meet at this bar if you are looking to get to know the real movers and shakers and super-stars of Bay Area Beer.  And, I like the fact that they don't cater to pretension and non-sense.  I would only walk in here being ready to be on the top of my beer-drinking game.  I recommend having a good beer APP at your disposal because one thing they don't do it list out style and ABV, which a lot of the 20-30 tap places do on an electronic board.  If you have a certain style (I mean, for real, not like... Strong) you can get some good suggestions as you go through your session, especially if you are a few deep and you didn't start by ordering a Stella.  (no Stella?!?!  what else is like Stella?!?! ... ...)  They aren't mean here.  They just do not have tolerance for annoying hindrances to being one of the best beer bars you will find anywhere.  

If you do this the right way, you will put this on your life list of really good beer bars.  You will drink good beer.  You will meet cool people who are really into beer.  And, while this place doesn't serve food, you can also get some awesome Rosamunde Sausage, Mystic Pizza or my favorite Mock Duck sandwich from Love 'N Haight Deli and bring it in to eat.  You can also pay a visit to another great beer bar, Noc Noc, which is a trip and is close by.  But, I digress in taking attention of the super-star here, which is Toronado.  It's all about the beer.  Beer first, and nothing second.

Well done!
author: Adam S.

description:
If I could give this place 6 stars a would.  Best beer selection I've seen/drank on the west coast.  Bartenders are awesome and take care of their locals.  They tell it like it is, no fluff.

Consistently bringing in new breweries and always have fresh kegs.  If you're looking for a great beer in SF it's a one stop shop.

Also door guys are great and help bus the empty glasses for the bartenders so they can keep on serving you.  Stand up place, top notch hands down.
author: Patrick H.

description: This place is overhyped. I've been a few times. They have a great beer selection but the poor customer service from the bartenders is not worth the hassle. Guess what Toronado, lots of other places to buy great beer.
author: David F.

description: I used to love this bar but came here and ordered 4 beers that were warm and flat and asked the bar to replace it and was told the beer was supposed to be that way. I asked again for them to exchange full beers and they would not.
author: Jenna C.

description: Wearing a flannel is typical for me and my boyfriend but I laughed at the fact that a shit ton of clientele were also wearing flannels. So far this is my favorite dive bar that I've been to. The music is dope, the bartender is kind of a standoffish British jerk but he's still pretty awesome in my opinion. No food available but there's tons of places around and the bar let's you bring outside food in. The beer selection is great and the bartender is extremely knowledgeable about what's on tap.
author: Val C.

description: HORRIBLE HORRIBLE  EXPERIENCE here with the bearded bartender yelling. Ordered a beer and realized quickly that the bar was cash only - asked the bartender to stop pulling the beer and he insisted someone pay for it. I did not have cash on hand (and tried to ask those around me) and told him as much, and he proceeded to yell (loudly) at me as I tried to leave the bar and left me in tears: I have never had such an unpleasant experience at a bar - I will never return and am genuinely traumatized by the experience
author: Emily C.

description:
I totally forgot to write a review about one of the most epic dive bars in the City.

I actually used to live on Steiner and McAllister, so whenever I had friends visiting from outside of the City we'd walk down to the corner of Filmore/Haight and start our bar crawl from Knoc-Knoc and hit up every bar until we got to Hobson's Choice in Haight-Ashbury. As I wasn't a beer nerd back then I remember trying to avoid Toronado whenever we had our pub crawls because for one it was an overly-crowded dive bar, and back when I had no idea what good beer tasted like, this bar was just filled with beers I'd never even heard of and charging way too much for a pint.

Fast-forward a few years and a couple thousand beers later, I visited Toronado during the daytime around four after having drinks earlier that day at City Beer and Cellarmaker. Whereas they didn't have anything too impressive pouring on tap that day (they had a sign up that said "Pliny the Elder is not on tap today") I did see a myriad of rare bottles (including the previously mentioned Pliny) on the bottle list, and then it struck me that a week ago was Cable Car week. Whereas I had heard rumors that Toronado was cracking open verticals of  Cable Car during their event, it didn't cross my mind until I was about two beers in, that they could probably still have some bottles left.

$40 and about 45 minutes later, I left happy having hogged a bottle of Lost Abbey's Cable Car Ale all to myself.

Personal anecdotes and bragging aside, Toronado has a huge rotating tap selection and an even bigger bottle menu; whereas they don't serve food you can always bring in food from either Rosamunde next door or Ali Baba's. The service is what you expect from a dive bar, but the bartender was nice enough to humor me and my questions about the place while I was drinking. Cash only isn't all that bad as they do have an ATM machine on premises.
author: Scott S.

description:
Arguably one of the best beer bars in the City - a place I have taken friends from out of town, taken dates, and the first stop on my recent birthday. 

You enter into a bit divey, mix of regulars and visitors - all friendly, bar with a huge beer selection on a support wall. There are a lot of beers, but they are listed by brewery, labeled by type of glass, and as Sours have become popular, if you see a "S" next to anything that is what it means. Also talk to the bar tenders, they know what they have and can provide recommendations.

Though every other person walking through that door is going to order Pliny. 

With drink sit at the bar, one of the high tables or in a group take over some of the tables in the back room. On an early weekend afternoon you should be able to get a seat anywhere, but expect standing room only on most nights. 

If hungry, you have to go next door to Rosamunde, who will give you a tray to bring back to Toronado.

If I'm ever in the Lower Haight, Toronado is a must stop and should be for anyone.

Note: During SF Beer Week this place does get some specialty items. Be on the look out for the week's schedule and arrive early.
author: Michael C.

description:
If you love grumpy ass dive bars with loud punk music and profound beer love then you have found your mecca. 100+ beers on the list including award-winning sours from tiny breweries impossible to find elsewhere (and yes, Pliny the Elder on tap). I don't know really what else to say except that I have often felt not quite at home in San Francisco but that feeling evaporated in the Lower Haight, specifically the moment I walked through the saloon-style half door into the loud and gloriously graffiti'd belly of Toronado. This looks and sounds and smells like the bar I kind of grew up in in Kensington Market in Toronto, but with way better brew options. 

I've heard that the bartender is notoriously cantankerous, but that wasn't my experience, probably because I had been forewarned so I knew what I wanted when I went up, and knew that it was cash only and didn't waste much of his time. So consider this your friendly heads up: go in the proper mindset and enjoy!!
author: Risa D.

description: I love this place so much it's a great place if you really love beer like I do. They have a crazy selection of beer on tap and in bottles. Also they have a great sausage place right next door that you can bring over and enjoy while you have a cold one.
author: Anthony O.

description:
Went here a few weeks ago looking for Pliny the Younger, like I'm sure many beer lovers were. If they had it, great, if not, we were prepared to drink something else.

Both the bouncer and bartender with the tats were incredibly rude. Yes, it's beer week and I'm sure you guys have been slammed and you're tired/annoyed/whatever but you work in a service industry and the service you provided us that day was downright terrible. 

Bouncer: just a tip - not all Asians look the same. Getting in to a long, drawn out debate insisting we've been to your bar and that you had already answered our question earlier in the week, is borderline racist. 

Bartender: We asked if you had Pliny the Younger and you gave us attitude and ignored us. A simple yes or no would have resulted in us spending money at your bar. Isn't that the point? 

Instead, I took my business elsewhere and I'm leaving a 1* yelp review about my experience at your bar. Try to remember that next time.
author: Logan T.

description: CASH ONLY. door man is rude, but the bartenders are nice and they have a TON of beer selection which kinda makes up for it. Crowded and nowhere to sit, noisy as hell. I'd go back when its not super crowded. Try the coconut milk IPA!
author: Alison J.

description: Sunday night January. I was hanging out with a long-term resident of the lower Haight who was a punk some 40+ years ago. Around midnight we were feeling nostalgic and decided to head on in. While we were sampling a few beers, trying to chose the perfect one to fit our moods and palates, the bartender starts screaming at a patron. "I will come over there and I will BLOODY your nose. You might think I am kidding but I am not."  We had the nerve to ask what the customer's egregious act was. It turns out he was singing along to the Billy Joel song. Really? He was threatening violence for THAT ?!? We got away from the mentally unstable and/or amped up bartender and went across the street. I won't be back any time soon.
author: John B.

description: My buddy is visiting from out of town and he wanted to get some craft beer from this bar because it had a good reputation! However, the bartender (girl don't know her name) literally gave us the worst time in the world. She constantly said we were the reason we were holding the line up, and blatantly talked down to us to other customers while we were in the bar. Best part is, she flicked us off on the way out of the bar. We were only polite and kind and this is the treatment we get. Please fire this trash bar tender.
author: Chris A.

description: Cash only dive bar with an amazing selection of draft beers. Decorated with taps and beer posters throughout the bar. Decent amount of seating and it's dog friendly!
author: Parnian D.

description: Asked for a suggestion for a double ipa, bar tender walks away. Comes asks if I figured it out? Nothing says double on the list. Ask for ipa, he refuses to serve me and says I'm being an ass hole. Wait for him to come back again and he still refuses to serve me and kicks me out of the bar. Fucking worse experience at a bar.
author: Tony W.

description: Great dive bar with excellent beer choices on tap. I was thoroughly pleased with the beer selection. Everyone there seems so chill. Definitely will make my way back.
author: Annabelle C.

description:
The bouncer, the bartender...all rude and bad attitudes. Just asked the bouncer a simple question if they still had any Pliny the Younger and he raised his voice and told me to stop asking him the question and that he told me where to find out several times before. I told him I'd never come here any day this week or earlier that day and for that matter in the past two years and he kept insisting that I came multiple times asking the same question in the past few days. 

I know that there are signs everywhere to order your beer by number. I just wanted to ask a simple question and asked the bartender. Then he just gives me a stern look and then walks away without taking my order. You can simply just say "no, we're out." 

We have cash in hand to spend money to buy beers here and if that's the attitude the staff wants to have, then I can just go somewhere else to get a beer rather than put up with this attitude.
author: Rick T.

description:
They have a decent selection of craft beers here, and the prices are reasonable but it still retains its identity of a dive bar if you want to brave going into the bathrooms here.

The one older bartender with the tats was pretty rude. It was Beer Week and Pliny the Younger was released on a limited time: 2 per customer.  To save trouble and time,  I was going to buy 2 for myself and 2 for my friend who was standing next to me.  The rude bartender ignored my request and just bluntly and rudely said "No.  2." I saw others getting 4, so what was the difference?  We gave up because we knew we couldn't win with this guy, bought the beers separately, and went to some seats near the bar.

I could hear him complain to another patron that I didn't tip and complimented another person for tipping.  Here's the thing:  I always tip for good customer service, but you were rude to me and a selected number of patrons so why did you expect me to give you one?
author: Chan L.

description:
Having visited Toronado on multiple occasions and until recently was a long term resident of SF, this place seriously sucks. It takes everything good about a dive bar with a great beer selection and flushes it down the toilet. The potential that Toronado has is fantastic but the way that they squander it is akin to the lottery winners who wind up bankrupt after a few years. Such wasted potential.

You walk in, it's your typical dive/beer bar. They're my favorite and I've been to many. Rock music, stickers and graffiti on the walls and a (genuinely) great selection of beers. Then you notice the side-eye the bartender is giving you for no reason. You walk up to the bar and the bartenders treat you like shit, aren't interested in answering any questions and if you look even remotely not like them physically, they dismiss you. The irony of all of this is that the tough-guy bartender vibe that they put out is just as pretentious and douchey as the SF tech bros that they so loathe here. Pot, meet kettle. 

This review isn't one of those "this is how you should run your business" reviews. This review is a "don't be an asshole to people you interact with" review. Regardless of the fact that you're spending money at an establishment that exists to serve it's customers (which is 100% of businesses), the people who work here don't have to be such pricks. The golden rule is definitely not in effect here. 

With rising rents in SF and the way these folks run their business, very few San Franciscans will shed a tear when they are inevitably forced to close their doors. I am certain that the owners either don't read Yelp reviews or laugh at the negative ones.
author: Johnathon F.

description:
Oh Toronado, I love you. 
Each time I come here I forgot how great it is. The beer selection, the dive atmosphere, great bartender, good crowd, oh and you can bring your own food!
Heads up, this place is cash only, there is an ATM on site but I believe it charges about $2.99 for getting cash so come prepared.
I typically come here mid-day and catch the ridiculously cheap happy hour (beers about $3-4) watch some TV and grab food from one of the neighborhood joints. If you want great beer, good crowd and somewhere to relax come here.
author: Kelsey B.

description:
I'm probably going to be at this bar every time I visit San Francisco from now on.  

There is so much that I loved about this joint that I'm certain to forget something.  It's a no frills dive bar that is cash only.  The stellar draft list included three beers from Russian River: Blind Pig IPA, one of the -tion sours, and the Pliny the Elder double IPA.  Found a few seats in the back area and I went to the bar to procure our obligatory round of Pliny to start with.  I went about getting this delicious nectar as if I were dealing with the Soup Nazi.  I think about the only words I muttered were "two Plinys" and "thanks".  We were not to be denied.  While you are certain to find beers on the list that you know nothing (Jon Snow) about, save your questions.  Order. Pay. Clear. Drink. Repeat.  

You can bring in food and the Rosamunde sausages from next door were just what the doctor ordered.  Ballast Point Sculpin for my next round and then Anderson Valley's Bourbon Stout to cap my night here.  It was pretty crowded by the time we left and we could understand why.  Excellent craft beer selections, four casks, and the most expensive pint I had all night was only $7 (the bourbon one).  We loved it.  Remember, no kissing in line.
author: Dan G.

description: Love the atmosphere of this tiny dive bar in the Haight. Great spot to chill with friends and a pint or get to know some of the locals!
author: Josh F.

description: Super unfriendly staff who sweated at a friend of mine. Came here with a large group hoping to have a good time. Beer was warm, flat and the whole bar stinks of piss.
author: Sarah F.

description: Great beer. Such an awesome selection. Beer lovers must come here. It's awesome when you go early and can get a table to just hang at.
author: Jenna G.

description: A Pliny for $5 on a Friday afternoon beats some fancy & trendy beer bar where the same thing might be $9. That's all I need to say.
author: Adrian Z.

description: The tap list here is whatever, and by no means justifies the horrible attitudes of the bartenders. Only time I have ever been here I got yelled at within minutes for walking to an open spot at the other end of the bar.
author: Jacob H.

description: Got yelled at, kicked out, and told to never come back because the lady bartender with the glasses thought I was tipping $2 for 3 beers AS I was pulling out my wallet to give her a couple more dollars. Not my fault I only had a 20 in my hand, not chill
author: Sarah G.

description: Came here on a Saturday at 230pm. Good, mellow crowd. Was served promptly. Got a ginger beer; husband asked for a Stella Artois but was given something that "was like Stella" served in a tallboy glass. Sat in the back room. Dimly lit. Next to the unisex bathroom. Lots of memorabilia covering the walls. The jukebox had an assortment of metal, rock, and 50's rock n roll. Dog friendly. Cash only. They have an ATM on site.
author: Ana V.

description: Best beer bar, bar none. Even the eccentric servers, some surly, contribute to the essence of the experience. After a few down years, the list is as strong as ever.  Always some stellar beers.  (Posted in honor of a true beerman, Mark Insull)
author: TJ M.

description:
Polarizing place, if you're not a beer dork, I'd probably say you shouldn't even bother.

If you ARE one, however, this spot should be #1 on your list!

Let's get some things out of the way:
- loud
- cramped
- not fancy
- cash only
- one surly staff member working the whole joint

Scared? Still with me? 

They have awesome shit on tap.  Real good shit.  I'm one of those people that, after all these years, STILL thinks that Pliny the Elder is one of the finest beers a person can buy.  There's a lot of sour grapes over this beer in places where you can't get it "I never loved her anyway!", but, to quote "The Interview": they're just peanut butter and JELLY.  Put another way: They hate us cuz they a(ain)n('t)us!

Anyway, grab some cash, squeeze in next to some burly bearded beer bros, and crank back some tasty pints. Everything is good.  No bullshit, just good shit.
author: Andrew H.

description:
I came here with my boyfriend after Superbowl 50. It was surprisingly not crowded. I guess everyone was down at Levi's Stadium. Anyways, Toronado has an impressive beer selection with plenty of seating in the main bar area and a back room. I can imagine that this place gets pretty packed on some nights, especially because there are TVs for watching sports. 

The bartender that night was soooo unfriendly and rude. He was ignoring customers left and right, and I was getting pretty annoyed. What a jerk! Then I realized that his team probably lost the Superbowl so I had to give him the benefit of the doubt and cut him some slack. Regardless, this put a damper on my experience. Plus the area around the end of that long bar smells funny. Ugh. Not a fan of this place.

I got my Pliny the Elder (cash only) and chilled with my boyfriend in the back room where we enjoyed a great conversation and beer. Someone had also brought their dogs into the bar, so that made up for all my annoyances earlier. So cute! Anyways, not impressed by this place but at least I got to cross it off my list.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Most irritating black bouncer. Bouncer used a door to assault people and unremoreseful. Then followed customers into bar to start a fight. An American business that hires someone who purposely causes problems for their business and their customers has management issues. Quaint bar that is to be enjoyed by select few selected by staff personally. 

Toronado, if you want to be exclusive, just put signs up and we'll stay clear. Simple. Thanks.
author: Albert W.

description: bartender was very rude to us.  it was very busy but he ran from behind the bar to card the four of us. we are all 26-35 yo. i asked where the restroom was and hr told me to take a piss outside. rude. we left off that impression. we went to noc noc next door. they were a better ambiance.
author: Victoria R.

description: Kind of the soup nazi beer version, Great beer selection but prepare yourself for verbal abuse from a bartender with a bad attitude. I'm sure there are customers who don't have this experience. I'm not one of them.
author: Mike M.

description: Other than being CASH ONLY this place had a great selection of beers and not your typical selection most bars that tout a large number of craft beers usually have. Some great local beers and a number I've never heard of. Try a couple of the IPAs.
author: Jared M.

description: Awesome place. Stoked to finally make after going to the one in San Diego all the time. Always a great beer selection
author: J C.

description: My favorite beer bar in SF. Gritty enough with great hardcore music and a huge selection of craft brews. Amongst other speciality brews, Pliny the Elder on tap and one of the few places that gets The a Younger when released.
author: Steven B.

description: A rad beer bar, I brought a hat.  I'll wear this har to remind myself of the redness of this bar.  It was the bartender's birthday, there was some metal on the jukeboxl.  They got those big chewy pretzels here bjertyardhizen, five dollars?!  Get outta here...
author: Geoffrey E.

description: Great beer selection in a funky ambiance. However last night the bartender thought I was taking his picture when I was trying to get a shot of the neon Garage Service sign on the back bar. He threatened to "smash that fucking thing" referring to my phone. I put my phone away and stepped away from the bar. He later patted me on the shoulder but did not say anything much less apologize for threatening me. I felt unsafe, finished my beer and left. Not going back.
author: Enrique V.

description: Not impressed - good to great craft beer but lame location & very poor decor - if you go for one beer & you happen to be in the local area, then it might be a good stop, but I wouldn't go out of your way to go here - I mean it's kinda cool to go once but I don't plan to go back !!!
author: Steve H.

description:
I have been a regular here for over 27 years....it has been at the forefront of introducing quality beer, providing a wonderful platform for up and coming independents. Bartenders can get cranky, the music can be a bit loud sometimes, but overall it's the same great place that made me originally come all those years ago, some of the staff I've known for decades.

I would also like to respond to a particularly insidious review made by Tbone M who states that a friend of his was Not allowed to order from a friend's tab   because of his color. Beware of reviews like this, this one appears very convincing save for the fact that Toronado does not take credit cards or run tabs. Everyone who goes there knows it's a cash only bar.it really makes you wonder about the motive of the person who wrote that review...
author: Bill g.

description: Awful and abusive experience from the staff. After not pulling out cash fast enough for the bartender (darth Vader t shirt) , he threatened to deny me service by pulling the beer away from my hands. Shortly after , my 5 ft 95 pound girlfriend kindly asked for one of the seasonal beers on the menu and the same bartender yelled at her profusely for even asking.  I will take my business to places like zeitgeist where the beer selection is better and the staff is knowledgeable and appreciative of their clientele.
author: David B.

description:
As a former home-brewer and assistant brewmaster, it's refreshing to know that places like Tornado exist. I'm good for a couple stops a year into this joint, and am always mesmerized with their eclectic their beer list. If you nerd out on the rare exclusives (Pliney, sours, etc.) and dig a dive bar feel, this is your jam. 

Located in one of the most underrated "beverage" blocks in SF, the Lower Haight is such a gem. A stones throw from Molotov's, Memphis Minne's, Danny O'Coyles, make this area a must stop. 

OK, back to the beer. Tornado is notorious for getting the famed, "Pliney de Younger" and the line forms way in advance. Beer month starts at the end of January, so if you haven't had the chance to experience Russian River Brewing's most coveted item, I would suggest hitting up Tornado early. Get on their email list for updates...

Also, cash only.
author: Benjamin F.

description: If you love craft beer, this place is for you! Toronado always has the freshest beer on tap and a beer style for everybody. Plus free wifi! The one thing you should know is that the bar is cash only, so hit up an ATM beforehand. Great beer and great vibes
author: Mark C.

description:
3 years ago I was reprimanded by a good beer friend for passing by Toronado and not dropping in. Finally, I had the chance to redeem myself. There's not much more to add to Yelp so I'll keep it brief...Toronado is focused on the beer and nothing but the beer. Prices are awesome. When I went Boulevard Tank 7 (shoutout!) was only $6. That's a standard/slightly lower price than even in Kansas City, where it's local! Plus, come for HH before 5pm and it's $1 off everything. Which makes a pint of Pliny only $5. WHATTT? Are we still in the Bay area??

Go to Toronado. Get good, cheap beer. And then go to Rosamunde next door after you get the munchies...
author: Clarice W.

description: Awesome beer selection at reasonable prices. Dog friendly bar which as a dog lover only adds to the great vibe. Cash only but ATM available. Welcome to bring your own food in to enjoy with your beer. If you're a beer fan this one needs to be on your list. I will definitely return on my next trip back to SF!
author: Anna N.

description: Sure the beer selection is good everyone knows that. Place smells terribly of urine or vomit or a combination of the two. One of the bartenders looked at my friend and literally said "what the fuck do you want" so rude. Terrible service. There were 10 people in the place and I couldn't even get the bartender to look at me. You can't make this stuff up. Shockingly bad. Younger guy with the beard should not have a job... anywhere. So bad.
author: Will W.

description:
**Look at the review trends here. 2017 has seen an average review score of 2.5**

We get it, guys. You have all the beers. Some people will come for that- and ignore how snarky and rude you are to people.
There are a lot of cash-only dive bars with jaded, salty bartenders in this city to choose from. 
I've grown accustomed to service with attitude in SF dive bars, it's part of the experience. But Toronado takes the cake.
I avoid Toronado like the plague now. There are soooo many other places with similar beer selections. Go literally anywhere else.
author: Trevor H.

description:
I am was sitting here, with my friend. We both ordered the same beer and I am actually quiet enjoying it. My friend mentioned casually that she think the beer taste a little flat. After hearing this I took a sip of my beer again, and then hers too just in case. I know fully well that we ordered at the same time and the beer came from the same tap, but I just wanted to make sure. Maybe it's the psychology part of it, the beer did taste a little flat after my friend mentioned it. Full disclosure, I'm not sure at all if the beer was tasting more flat than normal. As a result, I asked the bartender that happened to be walking past me that if there beer was a little flat. I said: "I'm not sure if it's me but does this beer taste a little flat?". To which the bartender responded "it's not the beer, your palette is wrong". Frankly I wasn't expect top of the line customer service, however I am a little appalled that the bartender's first response was neither asking for what beer I got nor test tasting from the tap, but to accuse me of genetic defect. Maybe the bartender should've applied to med school, and I'm sure he would've aced his mcat.

**Edit**
Right after writing this I witnessed the bouncer sitting right by to the entrance smoking(violating the law which require smoking to be take place certain distance from entrances and vents) flick a cigarette to the car parked in front, creating a fabulous spark on the car. I'm sure that's the kind of respect this bar has towards the neighborhood and the people who live here
author: Maxim L.

description: Great personality, friendly and knowledgeable bartenders. Beer selection is immense. Overall authentic and pleasant.
author: Michael R.

description:
This place is awesome, there's so many beers here. All kinds of beer on tap and multiple beers you can order by bottle. There's a few seats here and then there's the back area where there are more of the bigger tables.

I took off one star because they do not take card. There is an ATM there but I really wish they took card. I don't have food here but you can bring food from the areas around there and eat it in here. 

Overall, this place is great if you like beer but make sure you bring cash.
author: Paul U.

description:
Best beer selection. Period. And cheap (for San Francisco)! Lots of people seem to come here for the Pliney (which you can get bottles to go), but their selection in general is pretty spectacular. 

Added bonus. Rosamunde next door. Amazing sausages which you can order and eat at Toronado. 

Only downside is it gets incredibly packed - be prepared to stand, but if you move away from the front door where everyone seems to congregate, you'll have a little breathing room.

If you like beer, this is your place!
author: Derrick S.

description:
I spent the day in SF in cafes and "tech" offices and was starting to get a bit turned off the by the tech bro vibe and Toronada was THE PERFECT antidote, despite the fact that the bar was packed (and is relatively small). 

From the music (heavy metal and rock) to the bouncer and his chihuahua adorned in metal attire, this place rocks. 

Also doubt you'll find a cheaper and better draft beer selection in SF. 

Seriously, if you're sick of the SF pretension and hipster BS, come to Toronado for a good time and real people.
author: Salim Z.

description: Wow what a rad fucking time. We were from out of town, feeling a little touristy and out of place, till we made it to toronado. Princess and Seth we're way way rad. What a amazing family vibe and tap list that rocks. Definitely go here!!
author: Tuk B.

description: Used to like this bar. It has a great selection of beers, but my experiences with the bartenders and the crowd have ruined it. I've been yelled at by the bartender and others 3 times when leaving saying I didn't belong and to f*** off, mostly commenting on my clothes... I was in work clothes because I came straight from work.
author: Luke C.

description:
This review really encapsulates a great story for me in San Francisco.  Here we go......

I'm in San Francisco for business, and finished up working around 5:00 PM.  Knowing that I am in the vicinity of Russian River Brewery, I fire up my GPS and see that with traffic it is going to be insanity for me to drive there, and drive back without getting home in the early AM hours.  I think to myself that there has to be a way for me to get some Pliny the Elder without going all the way out there.  I fire up my Yelp app, do some searches for bars, and lo and behold, I find Toronado.  Thanks to the Yelp faithful, I see they regularly have it on tap, as well as other Russian River beers.  Not only that, but thanks to the reviewers I also see it is cash only, and inexpensive.  I fire up the rental car, sit in mega traffic, and go nuts trying to find parking (I'm from Florida, we don't have this parking issue).  

Once inside, this place is exactly as I expected.  A dive bar with loud music (good music), with the TV's on playing Thursday night football (no volume), and a quick bar staff.  I loved every minute of being here.  Pliny the Elder was amazing, and their other beer choices were top notch as well.  I would not hesitate to run right back here the next time I'm in San Francisco.  Yelp comes through yet again.
author: Brian M.

description:
The more I go to Toronado, the more I think of it as an indispensable part of Lower Haight-dom. Really, it's an indispensable part of living in SF if you're an avid beer drinker. 

The selection is killer, frequently rotated out, and all at a very reasonable price. If you want to get the best bang for your buck, you can go by during happy hour and get that extra buck off. While in the past I've felt the service/friendliness is lacking, I now think perhaps the problem was stopping by when it was crowded and full of amateurs. I too would probably be a less than thrilled bartender if I had to deal with some of the people that pass through there on a weekend night. 

And last but not least, I must say again how much I appreciate bringing in a sausage or sandwich from love n haight. Just the thought of that delicious pairing makes me want to drop in every time I walk by.
author: Jon T.

description: Fun dive bar with sometimes crazy beers on tap (or in bottle). Worth checking out if you're a beer fan, enjoy dive bars, and looking for something unique. Enjoy!
author: Matthew M.

description: The best thing about this place, they have PLINY on TAP!!!!!!!! Bar was small and a lil dirty with an interesting crowd. Cash only is kind of annoying, but how bout that PLINY!!!!???!!!!!?!?!?
author: Eric H.

description:
I've been to Toronado's a couple of times before and really liked Pliny, but didn't have to deal with the bartenders. However, last night I wanted to treat my brother because he was visiting from out of town. I slightly raised my hand, so the bartender could see me. He didn't acknowledge  me at all, so I slightly raised my hand again. He suddenly went off on me and said that me waving my hand around the place was distracting him. He then stepped back and started projecting his voice, so everyone could hear is oration and make an example out of me. He went on about how I was trying to cut everyone else in the bar, trying to make me look like some rude asshole. Seeing that he was just power tripping, I simply stood up got my brother and left. As I left, the bartender screamed "Welcome to Toronado's."

Minus Plinys, Toronado would only have a sad little bartender, that gets off on abusing the small amount of power he has. After reading the other reviews, it's clear he does this a lot. I feel sorry for the guy. He's obviously a miserable man.

The good reviews for this place mainly credit the fact the have Pliny. There are many bars in SF that have Pliny and good bartenders. Don't go to Toronado's. Spend you time and money on a quality bar.
author: Kyle W.

description:
Great beer selection, but bartender is a total douchebag.  I order an Almanac Grand Cru White (which, by the way, is terrific) and a Black & Tan for my friend. My friend hasn't been to Toronado in more than a decade and has fond memories of drinking Black & Tans there. The bartender says, "I don't do that."  I say, "you can't take a stout and a lager and mix them in a glass?"  He says, "I can, but I won't."

What the f---?  Who's the customer here?  And why is it that you'll serve sour beers, strawberry infused beers and crappy, overly-hopped ales of all sorts but draw the line at something a true, down and dirty, beer-loving nation like Ireland has been doing for more than a century. I don't even understand the elitism that's being brandished here. Maybe the bartender would say that's the point; that I don't get it. 

Well, I could drink at Toronado in the future. But I won't.
author: Paul S.

description:
Favorite all time dive bar... Cash only by the way... 

Not pretentious and always have Pliny and other great beers on tap.  Good music, we were there during some eclectic choices.
author: Scott P.

description:
Bar only, no food. Just CHEAP, GOOD beer, no liquor. A lot of locations nearby for food like the sausage joint nearby. I mean you can't complain about their food situation. It helps keep the beer prices low. 

Small space, extra room near the back. Quintessential dive bar. Not upscale or high maintenance. It's loud, dirty, and cheap. But all in a good way. If you're into that. 

Cash only, ATM in the back. Doesn't matter because everything is so damn cheap. 

10/10 would come back. This place is amazing to grab drinks by yourself, with the guys, a night out, or with your SO.
author: Izzy L.

description: They got Pliny The Elder on tap! Regularly! One of the few places in the city that carries Russian River's highly sought-after golden child of craftbeer! Who cares that the staff may or may not be rude, who cares if the place gives off a dive bar vibe that might or might not make you feel welcome inside, there's beer! Lots of good beer! I had a field day at Toronado & should be on everyone's list when visiting San Fran, or San Diego for that matter since they also have a location there.
author: Jeff S.

description:
Writing a review of any bar is definitely not one of my stronger points. Though I love drinking beers, I do not go to a lot of bars to get hammered.

I do all my beer-drinking at the privacy of my home or other's home.  I also drink at Oracle Arena, my home of my Golden State Warriors..."ha-ha, get it?"

But this dive bar in the Lower Haight area is very cool and laid back. The bar is also located next to the popular hot dog place-Rosamunde Sausage Grill. Many of the people buy the juicy hot dog(s) and head next door to the dive bar for one of many rotating local and imported micro-brewed beers on tap.

I have been to the sausage place many times for lunch and on-duty. But this is my first time I have bought a hot dog and went next door to the popular dive bar on Haight Street. I had a pint of Anchor Steam, a San Francisco brew for $4.00. Add that brew with a pair of Coney Island beef hot dogs for $7.50, which is Rosamunde's Monday Special, you have yourself a meal.

As I was enjoying my meal, I was staring at the bar's funky and unique tap-handles from many various brews. Many beer-handles were used and served at the bar and some of them are now retired. 

If you are a tourist, you can also buy merchandise at the bar too. 

Grab a hot dog from Rosamunde and bring that hot dog next door to the Tornado Bar for a beer is your two-step plan.
author: Matt G.

description:
I met a work colleague here yesterday for a couple beers and conversation. He's based in Calgary, was visiting with Family and since we're part of the same global work group, it was convenient opportunity to catch up. 

He had actually been to Toronado before, while this place was on my list for it's divey and huge beer selection reputation. No food is served, although you can bring it in. Please also note that this is a cash only establishment (ATM on premises) and that you need to order at the bar. That was fine by me, although one of the barkeeps could have been a little more cheerful when he handed me my IPA and mentioned that it was happy hour ($1 off my pint).

We snagged one of the tables on this relatively crowded afternoon. That was also due to one particularly loud guy and the fact the the Giants/Dodgers were on the bar TV. We enjoyed our conversation, our beer, and the whole vibe that Toronado throws out. I could be a regular here if I lived closer.
author: Eric B.

description: Worst bar in SF. Dude with a beard and a bald head will try to sell you $200 of beer if you ask his opinion and kick you out of the bar if you tell him you don't want to pay that much. Don't be persuaded by the iconic status of this place. It's staffed by a  bunch of pretentious judgmental beer snobs.
author: Michael G.

description: Gross, crappy bar, with an extremely rude bouncer who yelled at my 6 months pregnant, 30 year old friend and made her cry, when all she wanted was to go in and be with our friend who was celebrating his birthday. We all had to leave and enjoyed excellent cocktails at the nearby Maven, which is much nicer, has expert bartenders, and didn't make my pregnant friend cry. Avoid this crap hole at all costs.
author: Jackie O.

description:
A great recommendation from a local. But the beer snob pretense can leave you sour. My tip, make sure your ordering is done by a female. Even frail hipsters have a hard time being rude to a gal. 
It's a dive, tight quarters, good if you just want to drink. They do have one fail, television. Who needs it? I hear that's the norm in Cali.
author: Adam K.

description:
I was in town for a conference and a co-worker was set on finding Pliny the Elder so we headed over to the Toronado. This is your quintessential dive bar (cash only, but ATM on site). The place was packed and we grabbed the last two barstools. Great selection of beers posted on the wall including three from Russian River - Pliny the Elder, Blind Pig IPA and Damnation. We tried all three and Blind Pig was my favorite.

There was one bartender working while we were there and he wasn't messing around! It may come across as rudeness to some, but he was serious about the beer and serious about serving folks quickly. He wasn't about to waste time chatting up his customers, but he'll pour you a great beer!

I talked to several locals so I know this place is well respected - it's a dive bar with great beer!
author: Amy H.

description:
I appreciate when a business sticks to their guns sometimes. You have a clientele you want to keep and you don't care about offending people that you don't want there in the first place. I get it.

Not saying that I always LIKE it, but I can appreciate it. Businesses are afraid of change, afraid of gentrification and want to keep their old school regulars happy. Toronado has a very inclusive feeling and yeah, they don't need to cater to you in order to stay open. It's a place for people who actually KNOW beer, which is another rarity around here.

In the Bay area, consumers and customers are so damn sensitive. They demand to be treated like royalty. They'll leave a 1 star Yelp review because they weren't instantly said "HELLO!" to with a smile the second they walk in a building. Get over yourself. It's like the saying goes, "If everyone you meet is an asshole, then you're in actuality, the asshole"

I found Toronado to be refreshing in a way and friendlier than I expected. I had no problem from the bouncer or the bartender. The music was WAY too loud in a way that makes no sense, but hey that's the way they like it!

I was actually kind of disappointed at how pleasant they were after reading all these reviews. I wanted to see them rip into some annoying beer newbie. 

When a tech bro and his girlfriend in extravagant pearls started asking for light beer suggestions and samples, I thought to myself "Oh boy, here we go!" But alas, the bartender declared that they were lucky because he was in "A good mood" that day and helped them make a decision.

Sighhhh...oh well. I'll have to come back again and see if I can witness someone getting screamed at.
author: P S.

description:
Nastiest staff in the city. The first couple of times I went here I liked it. I love beer, they have a lot of great beer. However, the staff is so incredibly and unnecessarily rude that I won't be coming back. I was in there with a friend about a year ago and we say down at an empty table with someone else's used pizza boxes, plates, etc. still on it. The bartender walked up and said "clean up your f-ing trash". No hi or anything first. We calmly explained that the trash wasn't ours and was there when we got there. He said he didn't give a sh!t, clean it up anyway. We left. 

I decided to give them another try recently after seeing them on several lists of dog friendly bars in sf. Called to confirm that they allowed dogs, thinking that was the polite thing to do.  Instead, I got probably the rudest response I ever have from someone I the service industry. The guy went on an extremely condescending and nasty rant about the sf health code and god knows what else and ended his speech with "ok, sweetie?" in the nastiest voice he could muster. This was not a stupid question-plenty of bars in the city allow dogs, and these guys were included in multiple lists of dog-friendly bars. I don't appreciate being spoken to that way, and I will not be returning to a business that treats their customers so poorly. It's a shame though, they do have one of the best beer selections in sf.
author: Sara S.

description:
Hipster wanna-be tough guy bartenders who moved to SF 6 months ago. This place is crap. I know it's a crappy job serving drinks -- but that doesn't mean you have to be a jerk to customers.
This bar sucks. It tries so hard to be an intentionally crappy "dive bar" to keep it's "cool" factor but it lives off yuppie $$.
I can't wait until you go out of business and get replaced with a vegan kale salad bar. lol
author: Arthur L.

description:
When constructively bringing up an issue and providing ideas for solutions (let people who wait in line for hours for specialty beers know if they will be getting a pour or are just wasting their time), I was told this, publicly, through their social media account:

"If you can't find "happiness" when you come drink at our bar, they sell tissues and lollipops at Walgreens on the corner. Best Wishes, *kissing emoji*."

As a longtime customer who is very aware of the fact that many of the employees at this establishment can often be egotistical scumbags (I only ever used to go there because of their beer selection), I was still shocked and saddened to see that this is how they treat even their most loyal customers.
author: Dom C.

description: Populated by wannabes served by jerks. This place isnt close to what it once was. And even that wasnt great.It never really was fun. Yet it flourishes on people who think theyre on to something. They arent.
author: Hardy S.

description:
This is like, my dream bar. Why did it take me so long to find it?  

Not only were my friends and I able to bring in our own happy hour bread and cheese, we were also able to bring in our dogs. There's actually a people bouncer and a dog bouncer at the door... an amazing little chihuahua with a studded collar and punk-rock shirt. I love everything about it.

I liked the vibe - everyone was hanging out, doing their thing. Bartenders were cool, bouncers were cool, and some of the staff came over to visit our dogs and offer them treats. 

I LOVED the beer selection. I generally have a hard time finding a beer I am excited about, but this bar had WAY TOO MANY. Seriously, reading the roster of taps was like reading the toy catalogue as a kid. You want to circle them all and put them all on your list for santa (or in this case, in your mouth). And they're affordable!

A word of advice: bring cash, bring napkins, and maybe a clorox-wipe if you're a bathroom phobe.
author: Catie F.

description:
Don't come here when it's busy! I know that sounds very odd, but unless you know your beers or the bartender they will ignore you. There's no wait service it's all at the bar. 
My friend has his birthday party here and rented the back of the room, but you had to go to the bar to get a drink! They didn't provide a waiter! 
All in all, great beer selection when you come on a calm night, but when it's packed you'll have to wait 15-25mins for a drink!
author: Miguel E.

description:
This rating is about the service only. Seems like I am not the only one being yelled at for nothing. 

In my case, after two quick rounds of beer with friends, I took a drinking break while sitting on a bar chair. The bartender asked me to stand up, because I was not drinking at that moment. When I told him that I will have another beer in a few minutes he screamed the F-word at me and asked me to leave and come back when I want another drink.

Looking at other reviews it seems that they made it their signature experience to be rude to guests - tolerated by the management.
author: Sven E.

description: I ordered 4 cans of Alvarado to go and he ignored me and refused serivce and even lectured me in saying that "hey, I only make $10 bucks an hour your killing me smalls with how much you tip me so I'm moving on." The guy who looks like Gimli would ignore me and refuse service to me because I bought 4 cans of beer to go and didn't tip him for reaching into the cooler. He and the other bartender expected me to tip him for reaching into a cooler.
author: Christian P.
