It was well worth a visit for this out-of-town beer fan, and a fine little stop in the Haight to drink in some vibe.  Not exactly pilgrimage worthy (as with Delilah's in Chicago), but I'm glad I've experienced it.
author: Ben S.

description:
Good beer selection, friendly staff, decent location. 

But man, is this place loud. It's near impossible to carry on a conversation. Docked a star for terrible acoustics.
author: J. M.

description:
My cousin is an owner at Seattle Toronado and it is much nicer than this dive bar. My father and I went here today for the first time expecting a bar tender who knows beer and will sample beers and talk to customers about the many unique beers. The bar tender was an asshole and couldn't handle working in a bar and serving many people evidently. He had some serious issues with operating under stress and didn't seem to know anything about craft beer. I would not recommend going here unless you know what you want and want to sit there and keep your mouth shut.  I won't be going back to this toronado ever and I'll be letting my cousin know that this bar is giving toronado a bad name.
**(BEWARE OF THE LONG HAIRED POT BELLY BARTENDER)
author: Ben E.

description: Cash only. Dirty, grungy beer bar, with some of the best taps in town. Place to go for a fresh pint of Pliney. Good for small groups, but gets crowded early.
author: Beatmonmkey X.

description:
You will find no beautiful female bartenders here, but hopefully you are coming here for some amazing beer! Toronado is a small-medium sized dive bar which gets pretty packed. It may take a few tries to order, but it'll all be worth it! They have a huge variety of beers, all local and craft. If you are looking for a corona or heineken, you've come to the wrong place .. Toronado is too good for that! I am all about the IPAs, so I've tried quite a few of them here. My favorite and must-get-everytime beer is Pliny the Elder straight from the Russian River. This is probably the tastiest and smoothest IPA I've ever had! Whats special about Toronado is that they have Pliny on tap! Other places I've checked out have them by the bottles only. Try other beers like Damnation and Death & Taxes as well! They have sour beers too if you're into that. 

There are pizza and wings you can grab at nearby restaurants. The tamale lady comes in around 11-12 and sells pork/chicken/beef tamales for $5. This is a must try!! They are so bomb!

All in all, Toronado is a great place to get your night started, end your night, or just hang out all night!
author: Herman H.

description:
It is odd parity to combine the grittiness of a head-banging rock bar with the classiness of locally brewed gems and belgian decor. Their beer list is off the chain and their no bull-shit staff is more than gracious to a crowd of customers who were not the greatest on a weekend night. 
Underberg, sours, and some oddities showcase some of the niche choices of beer geeks nationally and abroad. Will be back again on a non-weekend night.
author: Sven And Krysta G.

description:
Cool place.  But it's a dive bar... Divey and proud - I dig it, but once you go to Rudy's it's hard to get impressed by Dive bars...

They did have a great draft line though.
author: Josh D.

description: Great beer selection. Jerk off service. the bartender was totally rude and he gave my gf a sculpin when she ordered a grand crue. The San Diego location is better.
author: Everyday C.

description:
I give this place a 3.5 out of 5, I guess I hyped myself too much to go here. Do not get me wrong this is a very cool bar. The vibe is very chill and a huge hipster atmosphere. The difficult part is to get to a bartender since it does get crowded; however, that is not a bad thing at all since it is a popular place to hang out after hours. The chocolate stout they have is really good best one I have had so far. I bought my girlfriend the pomegranate cider which smelled very fruity but had a sweet and sour taste which was very intriguing. The negative part of it was that a fly was in her drink. I do not blame them for it sometimes things like that happen but they did replace the drink. Secondly I had a Honey Saigon did not really enjoy it, should of just gone with a Hefe instead. Overall it's a cool place to come in here and then or if you want to just catch up with the boys. 

P.S; The jukebox is at a very cheap price and has a good selection. Before I forget it's cash only but they do have an ATM.
author: David U.

description: Awesome, no nonsense, beer Mecca !  Great service and prices.  Definitely worth visiting and spending some time there!
author: George F.

description:
Amazing beer selection and friendly people! I had Blind Pig, and also a Bourbon Barrel Stout, but the selection is massive. 

Be sure to go next door for a sausage dog experience you will remember (I highly recommend the duck and fig sausage dog)!
author: C A C.

description: Laid back bar. Personally, not a huge fan of beer, but this place has such a wide selection of beers if you are. When I come here I get a pomegranate cider, which is a bit sour, but I enjoy it. Pretty divey and casual bar. Guys are super nice here. They weren't able to fill my friends glass (probably a quarter of the glass short), so they gave her a full other beer, plus the not filled glass for the price of one. Pretty sweet.
author: Julie L.

description:
Why 2 stars?  Because everything pretty much sucked.

   ---   ---   ---

So here was my debate:  I'd already been traveling around all day by myself around San Francisco and was back at the hotel to change and get some much needed re-charging of my iPhone.  I was tired and cold.  Watching March Madness from the comfort of my warm hotel bed had me tempted to skip out on my night plans, which happened to be Toronado.  But I'd heard it was possibly the best beer bar in the city, so I decided to give in and head over.

After a decent trek through the city, I arrived at a crowded bar with no open seats and squeezed my way to the bar.  I am no beer expert by any stretch of the imagination...so when walking into a bar with 50+ beers that I have never heard of and know nothing about...is it abnormal for a question or two to be asked?  I asked bartender #1 for a Belgium style beer that wasn't too hoppy and was given the answer, "Belgium is just a country, that could mean a lot of things."  

Well, why is it that when I go to any other bar across America with a similar question, the bartender immediately has a suggestion or three for me?  Eventually I got something and slipped away from the bar.

Finally a couple of guys left and two bar stools opened up.  I took one and was ready for beer #2, this time, from bartender #2.  I had been reading my Yelp app for suggestions, but then leaned my hand down on the bar, as I was checking out the taps to see what seemed appealing.  Bartender #2 comes up and asks - what I would like: 

Me:  "Can I try this?" as I point to a tab.  

Him (snarky tone) "do you want to SAMPLE or do you want to DRINK it?" 

Me: "ummm I want to samp..." as he cuts me off.  

Him: "Do you want to drink or do you want to be on your phone?"  

Me: "Huh??"

Him: "Put your phone away if you want to order"  *looks around at the other patrons for someone to agree with him...

Me: "I am not even looking at my phone, it's dimmed, what are you talking about?"

He then hands me my "sample" which is awful, so I quickly choose something else, drink it, close my tab, and depart never to return.

I understand that they were busy, but they were in no way "slammed."  It was the most rude and least helpful bar service I've ever had, and my worst experience at any place in San Francisco.
author: Brett N.

description: Seemed like a good amount of beer on tap. Rode from across town just to try this place. Older lady that seemed to be a owner was a complete snatch right from the get go. Didn't even bother giving her my hard earned money to support her miserable life.
author: Kevin B.

description:
I was so looking forward to my visit to Toronado long before we arrived in San Francisco.  I had heard such great things about the place and their beer selection.  They do have a great selection at reasonable prices for what they have.  I personally did not have a bad experience with the service either and we were here on a Friday night.
Why I gave this place a 1 star rating is due to the smell and cleanliness or lack thereof.  I know this is a dive bar and love dive bars.  This place reeked worse that Bourbon Street in New Orleans does before they was it down.  We looked past that and went ahead and ordered a beer.  Then I had to use the restroom.  Ladies beware.  These are unisex bathrooms and the boys there like to pee all over the place and leave the seat up.  It was the most disgusting thing I have ever seen and I have seen a lot in my travels.  I guess if you are able to stomach the rotten beer smell and the smell of urine then this is the place for you.  Otherwise we found plenty of other places in town with great beer selections.
author: Shannon B.

description:
I have been to the Toronado's in both San Francisco and San Diego.  The San Diego venue is 4 stars, and could teach a lot to the staff at SF about running a bar.  Hard to believe it's the same owner?  Anyway, to describe the Toronado SF experience - you walk in after driving around looking for a place to park for 20 minutes and finding a spot a 6 block hike away.  Yes, it's to be expected that parking will suck on Haight Street, but it is part of the experience.  I have actually planned a Haight Street pub crawl and parked 2 miles away and taken the Ol Reliable 22 bus to Haight and Divisidero.  Anyway, as you walk in after your trek, the first thing you notice is the smell.  Stale beer.  The place needs a good airing out and a deep bleaching.  Next, the clientele.  I thought the sausage place was next door....This place looks like a casting call for a live action version of a Simpsons comic store scene.  More than a couple big guys on barstools showing a lot of ass crack.  The service, while not as surly as some have reported, could definitely use some help also - maybe some of us need a little help ordering.  Sorry we don't have your breadth of experience in shitty Bakersfield craft brew offerings.  The beer selection is extensive, of course heavily weighted to west coast craft breweries, with one or two Europeans. I would show more diversity, personally, but you kinda know what you are getting into walking in.  Plenty of German restaurants and English/Irish pubs in SF if I want something with a little more history.  The beers I ordered were excellent, but the overall scuzziness of the place made me a little leery of their glassware.  Anyway, finally, the bathroom.  Horrifying.  
So - Toronado SF is the place to visit if you are in the area and want a local craft brew.  Just be prepared for the whole experience that comes with.
author: Ken P.

description: This place is a dump and I love it! A true dive bar, with bartenders that have dumpy attitudes to match. I can't stop coming here though! It's great, and the beer selection is awesome! I come all of the way from the central Valley to visit this bar.
author: Aaron A.

description:
Probably the most impressive tap beer selection I'm aware of in SF and with low prices. Wow, just wow. If you appreciate IPAs or any type of ale, make sure you drop by. When you enter, be sure to look around the wall and stare in awe at all the beer they either carry or once carried.

Keep in mind the place is very divey and busy so if I were you, get your beer fix in and hop somewhere else to use the bathroom, your nose will thank you later.

It helps to have some knowledge of what styles of beer you like to drink and breweries since there's not much time for talking when ordering. Problem?
author: Steven C.

description:
Ugh.

I wanted so badly to like this place and spend the entire day there because dive bar + craft beer. Seriously. I was prepared to do nothing else but eat sausage from Rosamude's next door and drink from every tap in the bar until they kicked me out.

I mean, I've been to dive bars. Real dive bars. Bars so dive-y you wonder if you might not ever make it out again. Spots where you really don't give a shit about who's serving the beer, so long as the beer keeps coming.

And I've been to craft beer bars, where I'm surrounded by neck-beards and snobs and shitty attitudes.

So I thought, this place is going to be incredible. How can you throw those things together and not be incredible? Good beer without the pretentiousness.

The first two minutes of being in Toronado proved that my math was way wrong. In this case you end up with a bartender that has no business interacting with the public. 

So bad that I don't even know how to describe the whole experience.

Needless to say, we each ordered one beer (both of which were great) and then got the hell out of there.
author: J J.

description:
3.5 stars.

I loooved the vibe of this place. A great bar to hit later in the night.
author: Giacomo C.

description:
Beer Stop 26
---

Toronado is a great place. Sure, it can is cramped and can be sweaty, but if you come at the right time, you can grab a seat at the bar and watch everyone else struggle to order a drink.

This place is a beer geeks palace. While the beer is mainly from the US, they did have a few Cantillon bottles hidden away. The bartender was able to find one and it was pretty good.

After that, my girlfriend and I enjoyed a few beers on tap. The selection is pretty wide and it shouldn't be too hard to find a beer you like.

Some of the reviews here point out that the bartenders are very rude. I didn't experience this at all- The bartender was very friendly and she even enjoyed a drink with us.  It just comes down to how YOU act people.

hi5.
author: Justin A.

description: Bouncer took a swing at me after calling my wife an ignorant slut...wow. Time for a new staff.
author: Aaron U.

description: Cool dim lit divey beer bar with cool stickers all over the walls. Great beer selection starting at about $5 a draft. Interesting mix of people as well who were all easy to strike a conversation with. Will be back!
author: Mike M.

description:
Great selection of beers, but I heard the bartenders here are snobs, so my friend with the beer knowledge ordered for us.

The plus side is it's located right next to Rosamunde Sausage and a pizza place :D
author: Christine C.

description: They serve my favorite beer and are right next door to a great sausage sandwich shop...Need I say more!
author: Scott V.

description:
Honestly I really didn't order for myself, I didn't look at the beer menu.  I just sat there and beers were brought to me by my husband.  I also just drank what ever Tom R. was drinking.

The beer was dark and delicious which is what I enjoy.

We sat at two little tables in the side room and talked.  It is really loud in there.  I saw people in the other room bobbing their heads as if they were hearing some good music but I never heard any music.

They also have 3 bathrooms.  Which is the best thing a bar could ever have.  Never a line and that's what I like to see.  

It was a great hang and will totally come back again.
author: Ivy R.

description:
Brought a few international friends to this place to watch the World Cup since this place was empty (other bars were packed!). It was silent since everyone was focused on the game and out of nowhere, the bartender yells at us saying we need to buy something or leave. I'm sorry, the people next to us have water... you didn't yell at them? Extremely rude - NEVER coming back here again.
Terrible service and cash only.

Edit: he just yelled at another table for "taking up space". Note to bartender- THERE ARE EMPTY SEATS HERE!!?!
author: Cadence C.

description: This is definitely one of my favorite bars to go to whenever I'm in the Haight. Its easy to get to, they are always open late, and they have a massive selection of beers to choose from. This bar is within close proximity of quite a few public transportation routes, which is definitely  a plus in my book, that means I get to enjoy twice as many beers without driving, which is definitely good  because they have quite a few of my favorites. I always grab at least one pint of Death and Taxes and one pint of Pliny The Elder, and from there, I let my palette guide me. They have something for every beer afficiando, no matter if you choose to drink sours, IPA, Stout, or Cider. I would have given this place 5 stars, but they have some rude staff members, other than that, they are awesome.
author: Joseph A.

description:
Fuck these assholes. Don't come here. Fat people with pony tails with diabetes serving you beer. Ruthless employees that have zero respect for customers. Die a slow death. 

Pompous assholes. Eat $HIT.
author: Nareg K.

description: I felt like I was in an 80's heavy metal scene with the dim lit bar, neon signs, rough-edgy dive feel. What way better to rock it out with super high content craft beers? It gets crazy packed and you will get left in the hustle and bustle if you don't know the code words/process to ordering your beers!
author: Briget P.

description: Awesome beer bar for the true craft beer lovers. Probably the best draft list I've experienced, ever. Atmosphere is unique and definitely gives you the dive bar feel. Cash only and not the friendliest of bartenders - however, this isn't' really what I care about when coming to a bar like this.
author: Kyle M.

description:
They have an amazing beer selection. But the bartenders and attitude of the Toronado completely overshadow the beer selection, and while I've given the place many chances over the years, I believe I am finally ready to move on from the Toronado.

The Toronado has always had a reputation for having rude bartenders, and I've seen first-hand evidence of this on a few occasions myself, but last Thursday I witnessed one that spoke volumes about the way the bar treats its patrons.

A group of 4 entered the bar while I was having a beer with a friend. They went to the bar to order a beer, and when I noticed them again 15-20 min later they were still at the bar, just receiving their drinks from the bartender. Then suddenly the bartender started shouting at them and telling them they had to leave. Apparently, one of the people in their group had sat down to reserve a table while they waited for their beers, and the bartender claimed that that person had fallen asleep, and that he and his group had to leave the bar immediately. No warnings or second chances. Just time to go. The bartender grabbed the barely touched beers back from his friends and aggressively escorted them all out of the bar. From where I was sitting, the whole incident looked like it was blown wayyyyy out of proportion by the bartender, and the fact that the friends who had paid for their beers and had done nothing wrong had their drinks taken from them seems completely unreasonable. 

But this type of situation seems pretty par for the course with the Toronado, from what I've heard from others. And thus, my relationship with Toronado ends. Lots of places have great beer. Why would I go to one that treats its customers so terribly?
author: Nathan L.

description:
Pros:
-Cash only
-Beer on tap selection is UNBEATABLE
-price is fair
-one of the few places that will serve Pliny the Younger
-no non sense bar tenders

Cons:
-Cash only
-during busy hours the place gets cramped

I frequented the sister location in San Diego when I lived there, now I frequent here quite a bit.
author: Moses L.

description:
Beer bar!  They had to have at least one option of cider right?  Yep, just one! Haha. 

Tip: Cash Only and there is an ATM across the street to hit up for only $2.25, not sure what the ATM is inside.  

Upon walking up to the location, one of the girls I was with warned us that they would not be nice in here because there was a very specific crowd that attended this bar.  I didn't feel any sort of uncomfortable-ness in the least, which was awesome!  We strolled up to the bar and took 3 seats and the bartender (Stewie) immediately took our order.  

While my girl was in the b-room I took her drink and Stewie told me to tell her it was her "Dalmatian" (please keep in mind that I never drink beer, ever) so when I repeated it, I said ok so this is her "Dalmatian" and he laughed and said no, It's not the spotted pup, tell her she is going to hell "Damnation" - I could not stop laughing, it was awesome!  Ahhhhh I make funny from stupidity gotta love it.  

After sitting there for about an hour Stewie chimed in and said he usually gets annoyed overhearing all the chatter at the bar but that we were keeping him entertained with the stories he was over hearing, SCORE! Haha.  He then joined our conversation and gave us a bit of his background, super nice guy!  Tell him what's up if you ever head in there.

Only bad thing, the bathroom was atrocious.  There was only one available because the other one was taped off, I have a feeling it was just too disgusting.  The floor was just soaked and it smelled so bad.  Oh well, dive bar, dive b-room right?
author: Colleen B.

description:
This is pretty much the OG for craft beer in SF. Speakeasy's Big Daddy IPA is named after the (former?) owner. It's iconic.

Everything about Toronado screams "we did this first!". It's so part of the craft beer establishment in the city, yet still kicks and screams like a rebellious teenager who, wears nothing but black and like.. totally doesn't even want you to like his/her music.

So what you get is:

-  a great beer list (does anyone else have Pliny on tap?)
-  a dive-bar aesthetic including loud, punky music
-  rude doormen, even ruder and slow service unless you've earned your stripes and god-only-knows how you do that.

Do: Go if you want to drink exceptional beer in an iconic noisy dive bar, chowing down on the sausages from the hot dog joint next door.

Don't: Go if you're from out of town, and don't have a high tolerance for the 'eff you attitude you're going to get.
author: Matt G.

description: Stopped in here last Sunday after we arrived in San Francisco.  I knew going in that the bartenders were a little tough to deal with and it was cash only, so I knew what to expect.  Went in with my wife, sat at a table, and ordered a Pliny and something else.  Paid with cash, tipped a buck a beer, no issues. It was cool that you can grab some great food next door and bring it in as well.  Later on, a couple of seats opened up at the bar, so we decided to move.  We made some small talk with the bartender and had some more great local beers.  My wife asked him a question about something and he got kind of surly, but whatever.  We came for the great beer list and it did not disappoint.  I'd go back if I'm ever in the area again.
author: Bill W.

description: First time in The City that wasn't a tourist trap, and Toronado delivered. A very local vibe, and amazing beer selection. I will definitely come here again!
author: Brandon L.

description: I'm not a huge fan of dive bars in general, but this spot has a lot of great beers and seems to be a neighborhood favorite for people in Hayes Valley or Lower Haight. Also cheap which is nice!
author: Molly V.

description: Excellent selection of craft beers!  One visit is not enough for beer connoisseurs!   The sausages next door are an interesting variety to accompany the beers... Stewart is a great friendly bartender happy to assist you as well!   (& they have cool t-shirts! )
author: Laura H.

description:
It was a Saturday night.  Mr.MC and I were meeting up with some of his fun coworkers at Toronado. First time, never been here, haven't even heard of it.  All Mr. MC told me was that it was a dive bar. Um...dive bar? Not too sure about those..especially with a bunch of guys.

If you have never been here, let me tell you, street parking only. You gotta get lucky! Which I did. With sharp eyes and some luck, you'll find a street parking within 5 minutes.  We walked over to the front and was greeted by the bouncer.  Very chill guy.  THIS BAR WAS PACKED.  Pretty damn packed for a dive bar.  Not sure what to order? Just look up towards the beer list and pick a name that interests you, or you can simply go with Hefenweizen, can never go wrong, right?

All beers are around $5-6.  IPAs, amber ale, lighter stouts, whatever you want.  If you don't want to piss off the bartender, make sure you know what you want before ordering.  The bartender we ordered from didn't like walking twice back and forth.  So order everything at once.  

Plenty of tables for a small dive bar.  However, we arrived around 10pm on a Saturday night and there were barely any space to stand.  

3 individual bathrooms. CASH ONLY. LOUD atmosphere. A variety of BEERS ON TAP. Bring a couple friends and have a great night.
author: Stephy L.

description:
This is one of the more fun bars I've been to in SF that is much more laid back, more casual, and you can bring in your favorite sausage dog from next door to feast on while you enjoy a deliciously well priced beer from the extensive availability on draft or a great deal of variety in the bottle. 

The bartenders are friendly and the local regulars are even friendly. They will not hesitant to strike up a conversation with you at the bar or recommend their favorites. There is a TV so you can catch up on the game and other big action that is happening and the menu is pretty self explanatory although you may have a hard time trying to figure out how to pronounce most of it.

They are CASH ONLY just like the sausage spot next door, but it's well worth your cold hard green backs for a refreshing taste of something out of the ordinary.
author: Lorrie M.

description: These guys have a serious attitude problem. You work in a bar. People come in to get a drink. It happens, get over it or get a different job. To be honest, beers weren't as good as expected. I'm no expert however.
author: Kevin W.

description:
What more needs to be said about this iconic place?

A beer bar mecca.  One that maintains old school classic dive bar roots, but serves up amazing brews for next to nothing.  

Top notch ambiance.  Stickered walls, grafitti bathrooms, no bullshit here folks.  And that tap list to boot.  Where else are you going to go to get amazing beers from Russian River, Alpine, Moonlight Brewing, Deschutes, and many more for 5 or 6 bucks a pint?

Not fancy dancy.  Doesn't need to be, so don't come here out holding your pinky talking about the latest whale you just slayed either.  Bottle list does have some interesting ones, but it's a bit small surprisingly, and the coveted stuff goes fast.

Great people also work here as well who enjoy talking and shagging and serving pints.  Much thanks to Steve (Steven?).  And Bill Gould lives down the street and has popped in from time to time.  How cool is that!

Nothing more needs to be said, take it in proper how you like it, either early when no one is there to have to yourself, or packed like a mad house its up to you.  Either way you'll never forget the beers you have here.   A must stop place.
author: Ethan L.

description:
The beer selection is probably the best I have ever seen.  There are places that have a larger selection, but this is by far the highest quality EVER!  I know a thing or two about beer, so take my word for it.

And I swear they pour the fastest beer in the West, order, look down to count out money, BAM!  Two beers are done.

I also like the jukebox.  If you are looking for Dave Matthews or Jack Johnson, I am sure you can find a wine bar or some other bland unoffensive place to go.  You won't find any lame shit on this jukebox.
author: Daniel W.

description: Bartender was an asshole. Would rate -5 stars. I asked for a beer, the bar tender asked if that was all, and I said yes, and then my friend approached and wanted a beer and when the bar tender returned with my beer and I requested another beer the bar tender lectured me about how I wasted his time and was such a jerk.
author: Matthew S.

description:
Moonlight Brewing features in their tap selection, so that should be the one of the main reasons for coming to this bar.  Death and Taxes black lager is brilliant, just brilliant.  Another fave of mine, Deschutes, is also on offer.  I'm pleased to say that they've both Obsidian stout and Black Butte porter on draught. 

The dudes behind the bar expect you to not dilly-dally, so scan the massive beer list before catching their eye.  Oh, and, I had a dippy ex-boyfriend who used to try and get a sample of whatever it was he might have been interested in drinking.  You try it, you buy it.  There is to be no sampling of beers here.

Loud-ass, metal-ish music circa when-I-had-feathered-hair is on the juke (iPod?) to make your ears bleed.  A good pint should drown that crap out!
author: Bea B.

description:
To put it simply, I cannot think of a better place to enjoy a beer. Whether you want to try something new or an old favorite, chances are that they'll have several options that more than fit the bill. They always have a great mix of beers from the many great West Coast breweries along with a well-curated selection from Belgium, Germany, etc and they cover any style (from sours to stouts, hefeweizens to double (or often triple) IPAs).

Since moving to the city over 10 years ago, it's quite possible that the bartenders here have seen more of my money than anyone except my landlord. Aside from the great selection of beers, I also love their happy hour (a dollar off of their already very reasonably priced selections) and their proximity to Rosamunde (another absolute favorite).

Can it be loud or crowded? Certainly (at least at times), but its the sound of people having a great time (maybe scored by Motorhead). Also, I will go on the record that their bartenders are lovely people (in addition to being excellent at their jobs). Is the bar packed three deep? Maybe not the best time to try to ask the bartender a time consuming question. While waiting, that should give you plenty of time to decide on your drink and those that you're ordering for your friend. 

One of the best bars in the country
author: Brad G.

description:
It makes me sad that they have such great beers at this bar. Also, despite all the things I've read and heard about obnoxious bartenders, I've not actually experienced that myself.

This one goes down as a one star for a particularly special experience I had at the bar. While hanging out at the bar, my friend was assaulted (completely unprovoked) by another very drunk patron. No fault to the bar as they shouldn't be held responsible for someone else's actions. I do fault them however for having their bouncers come over and do absolutely nothing to break things up while my friend has the other gentleman's forearm at his throat. They then aggressively question my friend, asking him what he did to provoke the altercation. As we walked away from the area, it became clear by how the bouncers' were talking to the patron on a first-name basis that he was a regular at the bar. When we left and sarcastically thanked the bouncers for all their help, they made sure to yell at us to tell us to never come the f**k back. Done, no problem.
author: Jonathan T.

description:
Great bar with extensive beer selection. The noise level is lower than most other nearby bars, so you can go to enjoy a craft beer and talk with pals. It's also in close proximity to late-night eateries.

Make sure to check out which specialty brews are on tap. They have Belgian weeks, and so on.
author: Dan B.

description:
When planning on exploring Haight-Ashbury it was suggested to me by a few friends that we hit up this spot for good beer. Good beer, you say? I'm there.

Located on Haight near tattoo shops, vintage stores and cafés, Toronado's barn style half-door leads into a dark sanctuary for any beer lover. The wall on the bar-side is adorned with hundreds of stickers from breweries (we spotted amongst the mostly-local brew stickers one for Michigan's Bell's) and various beer-related ephemera, bumper stickers (pro-cyclist, -union, -legalization) and a poster that's everywhere around town for a tapping of Lagunita's next batch: Waldo's.

The bar has a reputation for being anti-tourist (ie. you'd better know what you want) but we didn't find this to be true. The bartender was annoyed when K ordered something not on the board but in fairness K had checked the website and it was listed on there.

The jukebox is kind of bizarre but fits perfectly and is wicked cheap.

We enjoyed Russian River's Blind Pig IPA and Deschute's Obsidian Stout while people and dog-watching (the bar is dog-friendly) and plan on grabbing a brew there again tomorrow. Definitely our kind of beer bar.
author: Nancy K.

description: The bartender snatched my drink out of my face when he decided it was time for his bar to close. I have never felt so under-valued as a paying customer. I also saw a cockroach inside the bar.
author: Dana G.

description:
I went here for the beer list. The first impression was from the dude by the door, grunting and checking IDs. Not a negative first impression by any means, it just made me chuckle.

Anyway, got in and I already knew what beer I wanted so I asked my boyfriend for his choice, then stood by the counter to order.

Now let me preface, I was at this bar with a group of guyfriends who were all standing beside me at the counter. I was the first one ready to order. However, this bartender proceeded to ignore / overlook me and ask the other dudes what they wanted. After asking my third guyfriend (who of course wasn't ready), my friend points at me and says, "Hey, weren't you ready to order?" Finally. 

Aside from that, the experience was pretty enjoyable. Typical dive bar bathrooms, loud music, and chill environment. I'll go back for the beer, but will remember to be more obvious / annoying when ordering at the bar.
author: Katrina M.

description:
OVERRATED - SKIP IT.  There are dozens of better places that have wide selections at cheaper prices without the hostile bartenders and negative vibes.

Five minutes after I sat down, the bartender walked up to the table next to me and began screaming at some poor guy who was just sitting quietly.  He then kicked the guy's entire group out and took their beers!  Perhaps the bartender mistook him for a ne'er-do-well?  The guy did look a little "alternative".  He had dreadlocks and piercings.  Which maybe didn't fit in with the marina vibe that Toronado seems to be trying to cultivate these days.

You go to a bar to relax, drink good beer, and have a good time with friends.  This is not the place to do it.  Go several doors down to either side and you'll find much better places!
author: Chris F.

description:
This was an exceptional dive bar with a great selection of draft beers. 

I highly recommend a visit to it.  They even had 
Pliny the Elder on tap
author: Anand A.

description:
I read around 25 reviews before I went to Toronado to help me understand how they have a 4 star rating with so may terrible reviews. 

To be fair an balanced I will only share facts first

1) Barn door to get in
2) Dark setting 
3) Dirty bathrooms
4) Non proactive waitstaff/bartenders
5) So many beers, the staff has to look up some of them to see if they have it

My Experience

Even the 3 and 4 star reviews say the bartenders are rude, so when I ordered I made sure I was not "annoying" to avoid an attitude. I asked if they had Dales Pale ale and he said "look on the board". I saw more beers on their wall than their menu so that didn't make too much sense. I ordered a beer I've never heard of and left following. 

I feel like reading  reviews prior helped me have a 2 star experience vs a 1 star experience. I personally enjoy asking questions about beers and learning about them. It's as if they expect their customers to just know about all beer before going there, however I feel like that's not reasonable. We learn about new beers by experiencing them the first time and usually by recommendation. 

If you know exactly what you want and know they have it, this a cheap place to drink in SF, otherwise I do not feel like it's a great hangout spot.
author: John W.

description:
Being a beer lover and a fan of the Toronado in San Diego I had to make a pit stop while visiting SF. It was just what I expected. Same feel and vibe as the one in SD but with more history. It wasn't crowded at all on a Sunday night but that may be because the Niners had lost earlier that day in a play off game. They probably went home to lick their wounds. 
We walked up and sat at the bar, bartender was friendly and attentive. We chit chatted about the beer and knowing the same people in the industry. Of course I started off with ordering a Pliny the elder.
Coming here was a huge treat because of the beer selection Toronado is known for. For 3 days I had a hard time finding a good beer at the different restaurants and bars we had visited. Lagunitas was the best I could find. Which isn't bad but I like to have options. Toro is a true San Fran gem! I'm very spoiled to live in a city that has several craft beer options. I guess you can say I take it for granted living in San Diego. 
Toronado is a must for any beer lover!
author: Tony C.

description: Smells like wet socks and b.o. when you walk in, but the beers are great and the smell magically disappears. It's also next to the best sausage joint in town.
author: Alfonzo J.

description:
This place is awesome and would be my local, if only I was a local. 

Sure you might be a bit nervous getting past the scary looking bouncer with a chihuahua, and you may not meet the tattoo quota, but once you settle inside you'll realise that all types are welcome (or happily tolerated?) here. Old hippy dudes sat between tattooed, bearded, black clad young men and a sixty year old woman with a hair sprayed bouffant and pink silk tent dress. 

This is your quintessential dive bar with a beer menu to impress. Happy hour meant $4 beers! I enjoyed the Honey Queen by Brooklyn Brewing and went back for another. 

The bartender was friendly and unruffled as he easily covered all the work alone in this busy place. He even nodded politely and refrained from throwing us out when we mentioned Anthony Bourdain. (Such tourists!)

The jukebox pumped out patrons' choices of gritty, thumping rock and I was impressed to see Grinderman amongst the choices. Go Aussie music!

We'll be back even though we only have four days in SF. 

Although can someone tell me how such a divey bar with rockstar cred has such clean, white toilets?
author: Jodie A.

description: Im a beer hound and this place was like heaven! Place was beyond crowded but the beertenders made sure we got our brewskis! Had a few plineys-tried a few other! And pantera & heavy music in the background! Awesome all the way around. Will def go back. Only gripe-get a debit machine. Cash only is a bit of a pisser. Cheers toronado!
author: Chunkymunky F.

description: Toronado is my favorite area bar next to CJ's in Pleasant Hill. I searched on Yelp for Pliny the Elder and the query brought me here. They had 3 Russian River offerings on tap along with a bunch of other quality west coast brews. Pliny drafts were $6. It is one of my favorite IPA's but I do think that Heady Topper and Hop Slam have it beat. Just another case of another over-hyped coastal phenom. Some more phenomenology for you, like Cru said "Now, this ain't funny so don't you dare laugh. Just another case about the wrong path!" (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ol0Y1rlMoto)
author: P W.

description: Love beer? This is the place. In all my days of beer drinking, which has been a lot, I have never seen a place with such awesome beers on tap. I know everyone says it, but Pliny? Seriously? Obviously the beer to my heart. Parking sucks, but the crowd is cool. Just be aware it's cash only, but totally worth that annoying trip to the ATM.
author: Nicole C.

description:
I don't get to this part of town often, but I had the chance to stop into Toronado right before Christmas.  They had no fewer than 16 different winter/holiday/christmas beers on tap.

Toronado is simple:  if you really, really like beer, trying different beers, then this place is heaven.  Ambiance, service, tourists - nothing else really matters if you're here for the beer.

PS - the really gruff lady bartender is actually a sweetheart once you get to know her, but don't tell her I wrote this or she'll kick my butt next I'm in.
author: dan s.

description:
I'm not gonna write a review per se. Just want to share my experience. You be the judge. 

I walk up to the bar. The bartender approaches me and here's our exchange. B = bartender. M = me

B: what can I get you?
M: do you have any sour beers?
B: yes, we have four sour beers. 
M: which ones?
B: look at our board right above you. 

I look up and scan the sea of beers they have listed with no particular order or coherence. A couple have Stout or IPA in the name, but they're not categorized. 

M: ok, which ones are the sours?
B: you know, if you have a smartphone you can look up the beers instead of me explaining to you.

She then walks away before I speak another word nor have a chance to order. I ask my friend, do you think she meant to look up all the beers on the board online and then figure out which one is sour? Idk. Maybe she meant there's an app on iTunes that tells you what beers they have on tap for the week and gives you explanations. Idk. Well, a few minutes goes by until she approaches our end of the bar again. 

M: can you tell me which 4 are the sour beers you mentioned? 
B: I don't know what you want me to tell you. 
M: I just wanna know which ones are sour, so I can look them up.  
B: (she pauses and stares me square in the eye) I don't know. 

She then walks away. 

Oh, did I mention they were not busy at all. I was very polite with my inquiries. Her retorts were short and snobbish. 

I still wanted a beer. Instead she started talking to someone else at the end of the bar and never returned. 

Is this typical customer treatment at this place?
author: Danny I.

description: This place is absolutely awesome! I was on the hunt to find Pliney the Elder and struck gold at this bar.  No frills, authentic people, nice & knowledgeable bartender and I even took home a few Plineys back to Chicago to make my neighbors happy.  Can't wait to return to this little gem.
author: Dan B.

description:
Love it. 

So many beers!!

You can bring in your bratwurst from next door and eat at the bar.

Very divey.

Cash only.
author: Nikki H.

description:
When it comes to bars, I don't need frills. Actually, the only kind of frill a bar should have, in my humble opinion, is an excellent beer selection. Toronado is the quintessential dive in San Francisco amidst the noisy herd, with every kind of dreamy beer your can imagine, wrapped up in a heavy metal bear-hug. 

Toronado is loud and crowded and fun and grimy and everything a biker bar should be. The crowd is always a fantastic goodie bag of San Francisco characters--you can never pinpoint what you might get. And the proximity to Rosamunde is a ridiculously perfect combination of beers and brats--the set-up is practically a gift. Maybe even my idea of the perfect night in SF...
author: Meredith C.

description:
While the Blind Tiger in NYC is still my favorite and IMHO the most impressive brew pub as far as assortment of impressive beers are concerned, this place comes in a close second.

Unlike Blind Tiger, the clientele here is a lot more diverse - biker dudes, beer snobs, after work professionals, hipsters and locals. Beer list on tap was amazing - they had freakin Pliny the Elder on tap from Russian River.  Right there, I knew this place was special.  Beer list on tap looked to be about 60 in my estimation with a focus - but not all - on local craft brews.  A few well respected favorites like Founders could be found as well.

Please is an L-shaped bar with indie music playing with a long bar when you walk in and high tables along the other side of the wall.  There's a corner room tucked in the back near the bathrooms with a couple of tables for a larger group.  Everyone seemed to hang out front.

Walls are decorated with numerous and various microbrewery tin signs against a emerald green painted wall.  Like - and this is not a slam - a TGIFs feel is they were only beer signs.  I liked the look - and don't like TGIF.

Tucked in a cool little area of SF of various shops, stores, restaurants and bars.  Street parking not too bad.  Cash only bar. Or as the say here, "Johnny Cash Only"

Will be back
author: Spencer P.

description:
The bartenders are hipster jerkoffs who are pissed at the world because no one likes their crappy band and they want to take it out on you

I don't see well and I tried to just order a shock top because I couldn't read the board
The jerk bartender acted like I was insane and angrily barked that they don't serve shock top
Rather that suggesting something they did have, he just pointed up at the board and said that's what we have and then wouldn't give me the time of day for the rest of the time I was there

Not everyone can read the poorly lit board
Also, if you had a little patience for your customer and little less contempt for the world maybe this place would not suck as badly as it does
author: Ja A.

description: My husband and I got their ipa. I had the coconut milk ipa, and it was delicious. We also brought in sausage from next door. The best part is that they are dog friendly as long as the dog stays under the table.
author: Sangee D.

description: Well, if it says "dive bar" under category, I'm not sure what some people might be expecting in terms of service.  In terms of beer, it certainly has interesting stuff that other places don't carry.  But it was impossible to walk through, much less talk to the bartender, Saturday night around 10:30 and forget trying to have a conversation that wasn't a screaming match.  The place is what you'd expect for a beer dive.  It has a second room but you'll never get to it through the monstrous crowd.  We came back after 11:30 and it was a lot more tolerable...  actually even grabbed seats at the bar.  Overall, I enjoyed the beer and hanging out with friends but it's not a place to get great service or sit and enjoy the atmosphere.
author: Anita T.

description:
Was our favorite place to hangout in San Francisco.  Don't go here if you don't like enjoying great beer in a divey, true SF setting.

Here are some tips:

1. Cash only
2. Choose the beer you want from the board before you inquire with the bartender, have cash in hand, make your order, and pay.  If the bar is busy at all, don't ask a bunch of questions, or any questions for that matter.
3. Happy hour - before 7pm every beer is $1 off.  Pint of Pliny for $5!  What a steal.
4. They always have Russian River Pliny the Elder and Russian River Blind Pig; only place in the Bay area besides the brewery itself that can say that.
5. Bottle list is high quality and beers are available to go.
6. They have Pliny, you should always get a fresh Pliny while you are there!
7. No food but you can always bring in from other places; most would recommend (and I concur) that you grab a sausage at Rosamunde next door.
8. Just chill and have a good time.  Some people complain in their reviews about the pretention of servers, the smell, I don't know, none of these are issues.  We loved this place, went all the time, took all our visiting friends, they all loved it.  Just go!

Toronado is a place unlike any other.  It's been there forever (from a craft beer scene point of view).  You just can't find a place like this anywhere else.  In an awesome neighborhood too.  There is no better craft beer destination in SF, from an overall standpoint.  Total package; great beer, great ambiance, divey setting, interesting characters, awesome neighborhood, great food from anywhere you want can be brought in, nothing to complain about!
author: Scott W.

description: I came by here for a friend's birthday and the place was full by 10pm on a Saturday night. This dive bar serves 30+ beers and a majority of them are on tap. It had a wide selection of stouts. We managed to secure several bar seats so it was easy to order throughout the night.
author: Edward W.

description:
My favorite part about going here is watching the newbs ask stupid questions to the bartenders, and then getting burned. If you don't know the difference between an ale and a lager, or that there is more than one IPA, don't go here- this place isn't for you. And the bartender will let you know that, but it's totally part of the charm. Hell, I'm usually regarded with contempt when I ask for a bottle list and I still love it. Go here with beer geek friends, order your beers with gusto, and get rowdy. 
Minus one star because it always smells like barf, but what are you gonna do.
author: Lynn M.

description: Local hometown bar feel. Dogs on a leash are welcome!! My husband is still dreaming about his Andrew's Valley Bourbon Barrel Stout. He is looking for it everywhere! Definitely a "Don't Miss"
author: Bethany B.

description:
So many beers.  Like, an overwhelmingly large amount of beers to choose from.  This is a good thing.  The bar tender was very nice and let me try a few out before I picked my poison.  

4 stars because they discontinued my favorite black raspberry mead (I'm so sad), and the bathrooms get pretty raunchy.
author: Brooke P.

description:
Beer heaven.  Over 40 beers on draft--featuring some of the very best micro-brews.  This is where I drink Pliny the Elder AND, on special occasions, the Younger.  This is where I discovered Sculpin (which is even more delicious on tap).  The beer menu is always rotating.

Get yourself a sausage and chips from next door's Rosamunde, and have an epically tasty time at this grungy, perfect, bar.
author: Jessica M.

description: Many beers to choose from, including this great framboise and pomegranate cider for the bitches like me that don't drink beer. Also get the opportunity to grab some sausages from Rosamunde, or the tamale lady that happened to pop in (I guess she's moved over from the Mission).
author: Vivian H.

description:
This is where you go to get good beer. 

You're welcome.
author: Emily D.

description: The Mecca of Beer Selection in SF for draught beers. I brought my 21 year old daughter in for her birthday and the staff treated her like royalty.  This place gets a bad rap on some things that are in reality part of the mystique of this bar.  If you don't like it, don't come back!
author: James A.

description: Six Russian River beers on tap, enough said!  Awesome dive bar. Had a couple glasses of Younger last night. Worth the hype. Try Cable Car if you get the chance, only sold at Toronado & Lost Abbey.
author: Danny G.

description: 2nd bar tonight....Customer Service was great and the bartender was supper friendly. I will be visiting this bar again. I recommend to tourists. Great vibe, if you love beer stop by here.
author: Jackie M.

description: cool bar. i love the decor. the beer selection is awesome, thats what got me here. i would definitely go again.
author: Brendan S.

description:
Great dive bar with an exceptional, almost intimidating selection of beers on tap - they  even have Allagash! 

Like other reviewers have noted - Cash only, and there definitely is an odor - like a closed room with dirty laundry in it, and no one has opened the door or windows for years. No issue with the customer service - bartender's mood is an extension of the bar.
author: Stephen T.

description: Good beer bar atmosphere and friendly staff.  Catering to the beer friendly and the coneseuir.
author: Matthew S.

description:
I give this place 5 stars for just having Pliny the Elder on tap. As you walk down Haight Street you wouldn't tell by the outside of this place how nice it is inside. Such an old school feel to it yet with "hipsters" and locals of all types. It was Gastro-Pub meets Dive Bar. I'll come here again for some brew (Pliny the Elder) when I'm in town. 

FYI parking meters on Haight Street are only an Hour max. So....if you do not want to get a $62 parking ticket ($64 if you pay online) than I suggest you find parking someplace else.
author: Aryan O.

description:
Great beer selection, kind of snobbish bartenders, angry music, prevalent biker subculture.

Gets crowded normally and service may be pretty shitty. But, they let you bring in outside food if you want to eat, so that is pretty chill.
author: Andy J.

description:
From Embarcadero BART stop all the way to Haight, this stop was well deserved and well-needed. They ended up having Pliny the Elder, an IPA PW has been in search of for quite some time now. Im glad he got his fix, I got mine too, it is an extremely good IPA. Niners game was going on which I did not care to see because I, in the midst of my travels forgot to fix my bench on my fantasy team and sat my whole squad basically. I was pissed, too worn out by this time to be mad though. 

We sat and met a few good people, packed as it was everyone was cool, no hostility, just niners fans cheering on the team. Got a seat at the bar fairly quick, only because it was behind the tv, I didn't care. 

It was a punk/Hippy/Hipster feel in this place, but that doesn't clash like it would in the hometown, they all compliment each other perfectly. Excellent squad of breweries and soldier beers to go along with them. Tons of tap handles and cool stickers covered the walls, I believe Deer heads too..? Definitely a good stop. It was the last of the dat I believe too, good memories...
author: Steve L.

description: Came here on a Wednesday afternoon, wasn't too busy - ordered a Pliny without any fuss at the cheapest price I've gotten anywhere. Bartender was actually sort of nice. Thumbs up!
author: Adam C.

description:
Being an immature, perpetual child I love coming here to start off a night that I choose to forget (or maybe a day, maybe a week who fucking knows). All I know is that when I come to Toronado I know I am waking up the next day praying that

1: I have no mystery injuries.
2: My wallet is somewhere close.
3: I have not confessed my love during a drunk dial to one of the 50 crushes I have


All of this means that Toronado is a fantastic place to get drunk. Especially alone and especially once a week.

Minus a star because it always smells like puke, urine and beer in there. Really, I wouldn't have it any other way.


I like getting drunk at Zeitgeist too.

Maybe we will see each other and you can have the honor of carrying me home. I like to get so lit Uber won't even take me.


Ahh the life!
author: James N.

description:
They say the bartenders are assholes.

I say, stop being dumbasses.

If you like beer, and you know what kind you like, ask relevant questions. Don't sit there asking for wine notes, and then expect the grizzly, bearded man to give a fuck about what you're asking. There's 17 other people besides your dumbass trying to get a beer, myself included.

Come here if you love beer. I hate everyone.
author: Ben T.

description:
Yes I heard all the rumors of mean staff and dive bar atmosphere.
Yes I heard about the insane amount of craft beers on tap.
Yes I ventured in.
47 beers on tap to choose from, so Pliney the Elder it was.
Sat by entrance in window and watched the goings on.  
Bartendress was pleasant enough.  Locals seemed fine.  It was the dust bunnies, the mutant dust bunnies, that scared me.  Carpet is never a good sign in a bar.  Lotsa years of ??? accumulation so don't look down or in corners.  Look up at all the old tap handles lining the walls.  Really cool.  And the prices are great for what you are getting!  Stop in and enjoy a pint.  Judge the beer, not the building!
author: Sharon L.

description:
If your looking for a nice quiet place with beautiful decor this place is not for you...If you're looking for an unpretentious place to drink and listen to a juke box,this is the place just for you.

I went on a Sunday afternoon and it was chill. The bartender was cool. It don't get all the bad reviews for the bartenders.

Now here is what really matter's Beer. The beer list was off the charts! I ordered Pliny the elder. The bartender made sure to fill it up to the very top of the pint glass. Also Pliny the elder was $4.50 a pint. You cant beat that. A lot of places would charge 7 or 8 bucks for that. This is the best bar for beer in San Francisco hands down.
author: Marc E.

description: Amazing juke box. Fantastic beer. Down to earth bartender. This is a REAL world bar. Stuart kicks ass. Punk rock/metal environment with a welcoming mentality. San Francisco won me over with this bar alone.
author: Drew C.

description:
I've been to Toronado a number of times and I would say that my favorite part about this place is the hidden-gem aspect: you can get some awesome beer at great prices. I went here once with a friend who supposedly didn't like beer; she was pleasantly surprised by the sour beer I had ordered and proceeded to order the same.

As a woman, it's fun to go here for a laid back atmosphere and be around non-pretentious beer drinkers (that's been my experience, in the five or six times I've been).

I love the fact that you can order sausage from next door and eat it at the bar.

Great value for the price and superb beer.
author: Jen B.

description: Best beer bar in SF.  Yes, it's a dive. That's half the reason to go there.  The beer selection is amazing. And, the sausage place next door has great food, you can even order and pay and have them deliver it to the bar.  One of just a few that I will always hit on a visit to SF.
author: Mike W.

description: the beer selection here is drool-worthy... but everything else is just mediocre. CASH ONLY!
author: Sam D.

description:
Best beer bar in the city, hands down.  

Ambiance:  It's a dive bar in the Lower Height, and it looks like one.  Bathrooms are a bit gross, but hey, a couple of Pliny's and you won't care.  

Service:  Again, dive bar in the Lower Height.  The bartenders are impatient and surly, but that adds to the experience.  Know what you want, approach the bar, and order it.  Pretty simple.  They don't want to chat with you or suggest something fruity for your gal.  They don't care and have other customers to serve.  Seriously, look at the board, figure out what you want to try, and order it.  Those of you bitching about the service, grow a pair.  This doesn't look like your sorority bar in the Marina for a reason.  If you are looking for a specific taste with lemony zest and hints of vanilla: READ THE MENU AND CHOOSE THE ONE THAT SAYS THAT.  Although watching the thin-skinned and the tourists get flustered here is part of the charm.  

Selection:  The reason for coming.  They have such a large selection of IPAs and craft brews that I haven't even made it all the way through.  If you get food from the wiener place nextdoor, they will even bring it over.  Great place to catch a game or just relax on a weekend.
author: Max G.

description: Over hyped beer selection and the beer list on their website is completely inaccurate so don't rely on that....if you do, the bartender will tell you to "go look at the fucking list on the wall" ... Place your order and slam a glass of beer in front of you. Grungy, culty, and a trendy spot if you are into this sort of thing. Super rude staff and Bartender really needs to get laid.
author: Russ Z.

description: A pint of Pliny for $6 - woot!
author: Beatrice W.

description:
I have only met friendly bartenders, and they have a very large selection of craft beers! 
Super cool dive bar with eclectic clientele!! 
Cons: too crowded on the weekends.
author: Rachel M.

description:
Do you like beer?  Yes?  Then you should already know about this place.  Toronado has some amazing beers on tap, many of which you've probably never heard of.  My suggestion is to check it out and try something new.  If the bar isn't crowded (which is rare), the bartenders are happy to help you make a decision.  If you'll only have a moment of their attention, check Untappd for some solid recommendations and be prepared when you finally make it to the front of the queue.

This place is cash only.  They have an ATM at the back of the bar, but there will be a decent fee.  It gets pretty crowded at night, but don't let that turn you off.  There is typically a steady turnover rate so it doesn't take too long to get a table.  And if you are hungry, you can't go wrong with Rosamunde's next door.
author: Michelle K.

description:
Great beer choice!! Enjoyed the stout and the Chimay. Worst bar tenders ever....negated all that I enjoyed from the beers. You make a mistake ordering (I was ordering for six) you will be abused and ridiculed.
My only mistake is that I waved my hand to draw attention which is a cardinal sin at a pub and I accept that fault of mine.
author: Kedar D.

description: Love Toronados beer selections. I am a beer snob and they know there stuff. Its very unpretentious, just sit down and enjoy. However, I would recommend knowing your audience. I once came straight from a sunny park day in the Marina wearing a pink dress, not the attire for Toronado. Yes, it was my fault. The next few times, I will remember my black leather coat and booties :)
author: Leah B.

description: I only come here before I go to Molotov's.  See my Molotov review. But seriously, great beer selection.
author: Michael D.

description:
Craft Beer Central.

This is my favorite place to get beer in the city. I am a huge beer lover and this is a one stop bar with everything you could ever need or want. Don't ask for a bud light here, they dont serve flavored water. Prices are definitely reasonable and it gets even better during happy hour. Great place to hang out with your friends, I've never had a disappointing night here.

Minus one star- Do you smell something funky in here? You're not the only one. Honestly, sometimes this place smells like...a old, wet towel. Good thing is that after a beer or two, you wont even notice it anymore.

Pliny the elder!!!
author: Gary Y.

description:
Okay loyalists, before you get your panties in a bunch let's get one thing straight...  The reason I gave this place ANY stars is for their amazing beer selection.  It is effectively the best draft selection in the city.  The fact that you can bring food in, ie Rosamunde, is nice too.  Kudos to the owners and/or managers for providing such a diverse and eclectic beer selection - provided they are not the same degenerates that work the bar or the door.  

I live two blocks away, and the time between my visits grows after every time I show my face and have a similar experience.  The beer is good, but certainly nowhere near good enough for me to tolerate the rudeness which has become the status quo.   What's worse, the folks that work here think the attitude is "cool" and serves them well.  It's unfortunate, this is a popular neighborhood spot that I would visit more often if they did not treat their customers with such disdain; I have never gotten the sense that my patronage at Toronado is appreciated. 

I grew up in this neighborhood and have lived in close proximity to the Lower Haight for more than two decades.  As a result, I tend to laugh at the pretension that so many tatted up transplants seem to incorporate into their mannerisms.  It's comical to me that I get shoved by a bouncer for picking up a stool to bring to a table to join my friends.  It's hysterical that the bartender feels the need to pick on my girlfriend because she's not a beer expert and does not know what to order.  It's laughable that the ten seconds it took me to find an extra couple bucks in order to tip is met with a sideways stare and a roll of the eyes.  

All in all, this is a place I would go more often if the bartenders and bouncer did not convey a sense of entitlement.  I do not need a side of angry transplant hipster with my beer.
author: Maxwell S.

description:
Awesome beer selection and great prices -- couldn't really ask for more!  Oh wait, it's next door to Rosamunde...you could ask for more!!

The pros:
--Great beer selection.  I've come here a number of times this year and have yet to make a dent in trying out the different types of beer they have on tap.
--The atmosphere.  Down to earth and not pretentious.
--The cost.  $5 a beer!
--It's next door to the sausage place.
--Did I mention good beer?
--Their decoration, though not everyone will find cool, incorporates old tap handles and large beer bottles

The cons:
--Usually busy, so it may take a while for bartenders to notice you
--Loud, so it might require a bit of shouting to carry a conversation
--Cash only
--Counters and tables may sometimes be dirty

I know I'll be back and I recommend any one who likes beer to give this place a try.
author: Carrie L.

description:
Have you seen the beer selection? Oh. My. Wow. I did not know what to do with my life. I think I ended up settling for some blind pig but it was so good...SO GOOD! We enter the bar with our sausages from next door. I think they have a reciprocal arrangement because the guy at Rosamunde's gave us these yellow trays to enjoy our sausages (so delicious btw...review coming soon). So the one guy checks my ID (that's always a perk) and then we find a place at the bar. There is also another room that's a little more quiet...and even a little romantic. Yea, I wasn't about that life. 

A nice gentleman gave up his chair so that our group was able to sit at the festive bar. Super nice! I tried to be super generous and buy him a beer BUT...he already had one and the joint was cash only. Ugh! 

We managed to find some cash and then got our beers. 4 beers for $20! Sounds great to me! It was a great atmosphere and an amazing beer selection that goes perfectly well with the sausages next door. I couldn't have asked for a better Sunday night!
author: Leena B.

description:
This place has a great selection of beers. I wasn't too sure what to order off the menu so the bartender gave me a few suggestions. Me and my group of friends tried: 

Allagash White, Belgian style witbier.
Pliny the Elder, double IPA 
Reality Czech, Czech style pilsner. 

I also have to mention that Rosemunde (my all-time favorite sausage place in the city) is conveniently located next door! Get a sausage from Rosemunde and bring it over to Toronado for a drink to go with it, such a great combination.
author: Elaine N.

description:
They have a nice belgian beer selection along with other rotating taps.

However, depending on the bartender you have, you can either have a great experience or a shitty experience. 

I asked for a taster in which I received a rude reply, "This isn't Baskin Robbins, I'm not getting it for you." Fair enough, that's not the nicest way to put it, but I wasn't going to throw a temper tantrum - it's a dive bar. Testing his knowledge and feigning ignorance, however, I ask, "Is 'White Oak' the beer with brewed with hints of vanilla and coconut?" Ignorant about the beer's taste, he looks at me dumbfounded, grabs a menu and hands it to me. He obviously did not know anything about his beer and had no reason to be rude. If he knew something about the beer and was able to at least tell me about it, then sure, all the more reason to be pretentious. However, this was not the case at all.

Not all of the bartenders are like this. Whereas I was not able to get a single taster, my friend sitting two seats down from me at the bar was able to get two tasters without hassle from a different bartender.

With the amount of belgian beer they serve here, it's probably better to visit Mikkeller bar downtown. If you're not satisfied with that there's City Beer nearby to expand on your options.
author: Dyroza B.

description: I love this place. Great beer but follow the rules. Know the beer list and don't be a square. Just saw five S heads get kicked out for it.
author: Jorge M.

description: Awesome beers. Pliny was as good as billed. Bartender that took care of us was great.
author: Whoopie G.

description:
Come here if you want to have a nice beer, but feel like you aren't worthy of it thanks to the rude staff and equally rude patrons.

Also, good luck trying to have a conversation (the kind of stuff people do when they go out, like at bars) over the angsty heavy metal blasting at ear bleeding volumes.
author: Tristan O.

description:
It's loud. It's crowded. The whole menu is listed on the wall. It's awesome!
Don't expect anything fancy, this is a true beer dive bar made for fans of the hops.  Leave your judgments at the door and just enjoy the crowd and the drinks and try at least a few new things and you'll have a good time. 
It's a beer adventure!
author: Mel H.

description: Toronado is the best beer bar in all of SF (especially for the hop heads). The selection here is unmatched anywhere else. While other bars focus on representing a selection of several local breweries, Toronado is focused on the quality of the beers regardless of their origins. As hops guy, there is no shortage of tasty IPA's to quench my thirst. With a rotating selection of beers, I am always excited and intrigued by new beers on tap.
author: E E.

description:
Great dive bar!  Bartenders all know their beer and were friendly.  The selection is amazing & love that they put the beers in the correct glass!  It's a funky place with taps & beer decor everywhere!  Ended up lucky & got a place at the bar.  Prices were very reasonable and they are dog friendly.  Can't beat that! 

Cash only!
author: Donna W.

description: The first time I heard of the Toronado, I only knew it was a good spot for a newly impassioned Belgium beer drinking baby. I tucked this info in my memory bank and went about my education until I visited the City again. This time it was a destination. I walked in, and must have looked like a sorority girl at a pearl factory! I was cautioned by a local not to ask questions of the bar keep and to be bold, state what I wanted without wavering. I was bold and asked for the bottle list instead, paving my own path and shaking of the dew off a newbie. I sat dumbfounded contemplating the delights under my fingertips till finally I committed to a couple with my partner in crime and boldly ordered and was served without notice making for a quiet victory in my shaking hands. I happily report that the spot of every bit worth the visit and the sausages next door are not to be missed. The hood is great for a walking adventure and a great experience. Sante!
author: Allison I.

description:
Perfection is in the eye of the beholder or perhaps the tongue...  Toronado + Rosamundi's (next door) = perfection for me, my lady and our dog.

I don't know of any other place where I can find amazing local brews (especially Russian River beers) on tap while enjoying a fresh sausage with kraut, and all at such affordable prices.  This place hits all the spots while being very low-key and making us feel welcome but allowing us to enjoy food and drinks next to our dog.

The rudeness was absent from our experience but I could feel the rough edges of the folks who work at this place.  I appreciate being able to have access to such selection of brew at such low prices and assume that working there is not easy or exceptionally high-paying so I can let a lot of rudeness slide.  I didn't really experience any of it but perhaps it is because I was there early in the day (4PM)...  but then again, I can't stand being out at bars late anymore anyway so maybe I can understand the grouchiness;  working late at a bar with too many people beggin for beers would get on anyone's nerves.  

What I like about this bar is that they aren't trying to give you good service; they are serving the best beer in the world at cheap prices and they let you eat their neighbor's food inside, clean up after you and it's all good.  You want a high class bar with wait staff that dotes on you?  Go elsewhere.  

I will be coming back for another sampling when I get the chance. Cheers.
author: Michael B.

description:
Probably one of the diviest of dive bars I've been to so far. If you want tasty beer for a price that won't empty out your wallets, this is the place to be. Tasty equates to Dogfish Head, Lagunitas, and Russian River's Pliney the Elder. For fans of the fruity libations, they have a wonderful pomegranate cider from Two Rivers. I'm no beer connoisseur, but I highly approve of these selections. And for only $4 a pint? Please, beer me. 

The bartender's kind of an ass and lacks a warm personality, but I don't think it's necessary to spark up conversations with him to have a good time here. Just walk up to the counter, grab a pint, and feel free to mingle amongst the strange crowd of old hippies and motor gang roughnecks (and the occasional 90+ lb golden retriever that will nab at any fallen snacks that hit the floor). Or simply enjoy the company you're with! Don't forget your Rosamunde Sausage!
author: Michelle W.

description: Watched the World Cup game there. Wasn't as divey as I had thought but it probably had a different clientele due to the game. Beers were spot on temp wise and they do have Pliny on tap. Awesome happy hour prices as well. Quick unpretentious service. Could see myself spending a lot of time here if I lived nearby. Solid beer bar!
author: Vince S.

description:
Great dive bar with good prices and awesome beer selection.

I always take visitors here after grabbing a sausage from Rosamunde next door of course.

Cash only but they have an ATM.
author: Matt K.

description: We made it a point to check out Toronado, a dive bar in Lower Haight. It's rough around the edges, a bit smelly, but they have a stellar draft selection, and Pliny to go (limit 4 per person). Which makes it awesome in my book.
author: Kellee K.

description:
I like beer, I like dive bars, and I like $5 pints. 

But I don't like indifferent, unfriendly bartenders and staff. I'd rather go somewhere where I can ask the bartender for a recommendation rather than have to google the extensive beer list to see what I might like and how much ABV. 

I would definitely bring my beer nerd visitors here, but otherwise stick to bars with better service.
author: Esther C.

description:
I'm writing this review over a year and a half late. Very good beer selection and as every other reviewer needs to point out, yes it's a dive. Something else that has been discussed to death on these reviews is the service; it's not good. Bartender was a dick to me but I got over it because I figured it was just him. I watched him also insult a customer who immediately left. Then my cousin showed up and was promptly insulted as well. It seems that there's something about this that makes the place "cooler" because the regulars know how to interact and not get berated. Think "beer nazi." Maybe it's trying to be anti-SF. Anyway, if poor service is so awesome, go for it.

 I remember seeing plenty of dogs in there which was pretty cool. I don't know if other reviews mentioned this or not. You can also bring your meal in and eat it there. Good spot.
author: Brian D.

description:
I love Toronado because I f*cking love beer.

The end.
author: Dan K.

description:
This is my bar so you should stay away.

The service sucks, it's filthy, it's disgusting, and the service sucks. And it's filthy...

I love it.

Stay the f* away.
author: Kyle J.

description:
I sure wish we had someplace like this in Stockton. It kills me that I can't visit this place more often. If I lived close by I would definitely be a regular.

Two of my friends and I stopped by for memorial weekend and found some great beer here that are hard to find. The first beer we had to try was the 2010 Lost Abbey Cable Car. I never had Pliny the Elder on tap, so I had to have one to compare it from the bottled ones. They even had Dogfish Head Worldwide which is impossible to find. We ended up buying all 7 bottles that they had left. We ended up trying and buying other beers because it was just too hard to find anywhere else.

The people and staff were great here and I couldn't ask for anything more. There was no trouble from customers as all were just there to have a good time. The workers kept our table clean and kept us entertained and never had us waiting long even though it was jam packed. The beer selection here alone is amazing. 

They don't sell food here, but they do let you take in food from Rosamunde Sausage Grill from next door.
author: Be A.

description: Best beer selection in the city. If you are a good customer that loves beer you will be treated with respect from the bartenders, oh and have cash too. If you are someone who can't make up their mind and ask a million broad questions the bartenders will hate you. If you go in knowing this it makes the experience amazing. I sat at the bar drinking all kinds of beers you can't get anywhere else (or at least not all in one place) and would just laugh at the bartenders and customer interactions. If you are not sure about what you want don't worry about asking the bartender to explain it to you, normally they will let you taste it. Just don't walk in and ask whats a good IPA?
author: Kyle F.

description:
Not that these guys need another review but I thought why not. I love this place. I've lived in the Haight for 6 years and regardless of there prickly edges, the beer is all that I need...that and a sausage from next door. 

The best way to have an amazing experience,

1. Have your money and order ready.
2. I know this seems obvious to some, but do not snap your fingers. 
3. Don't ask them questions, see number 1
4. Be confident, they smell fear
5. Tip really well, this will always get them to come back to you first on the second, third round. If you think "they should earn there tip" you shouldn't drink here. Think of it as tipping for the amazing beer selection.
author: Kelly F.

description: Great dive bar/ beer bar.  Great selection of beers & they let you bring in food from local spots since they do not serve anything here.  Friendly bartender, patrons are all nice regular friendly folks.  The bathrooms are a bit rough, but then again it is a dive bar.  I do love that it is a rock n' roll bar, I didn't hear anything but metal when I was there, which was awfully refreshing.  I am definitely a fan, only downer is cash only.
author: Bryanna P.

description:
Ok, so this may be a lil biased toward the SF beer scene in general so I guess caveat emptor applies.

What the fuck is up with San Francisco and belgian beers? Seriously? All You can get in this town is belgians. Belgian wheats, belgian tripples, belgian everything! Don't even bother trying to get a stout or IPA unless it's some type of belgian. Play to your crowd I guess but Jesus its damn near obscene. I like belgian beer but after visiting SF I think I'm good on it for a few months. 

This Toronado location pales in comparison to the San Diego one. It just didn't have the welcoming feel the other location has. It was like i should have felt privileged to be allowed in this bar. They have less taps than the SD location as well. Though, I'm sure if they had more it would have been filled with more belgian beer. I really don't understand how this place beat out the SD location for a spot on the "Top 100 beer bars in America".
author: Andrew B.

description: Great tap selection and awesome staff. The only drawback is that it's cash only, so be prepared.
author: Brandon M.

description:
