My post-doc tipped me off to the existence of the Toronado, with it's large list of beers from all over. It's been a long time since, but I'm really happy I finally got to drop by and try their wares!

It's such a packed dive bar, with a bouncer at the door, loads of stickers on the wall, and lots of beer memorabilia everywhere. There's a heavy rock ambiance, and the crowd reflects this. There is a decent amount of seating and space, but it can quickly disappear as the sun falls, and the locals rush in for a drink on a Saturday night!

I really enjoyed my German beer. It was dark and slightly sweet. Wasn't there for long, but I'd love to return to try more of their beers. I recognized a few, and was happy they had them. It just proved to me that they have stuff for everyone - beers that the new and experience would enjoy wetting their palates with!
author: Kevin J.

description:
We went here for my boyfriend's birthday and had a great time. Toronado is an awesome dive bar with an extensive draught beer list.

If you're adventurous, order some Underberg from behind the bar!
author: Kelly B.

description:
Hmm...found this place on based on a tour book for, my Canadian nephew in law...I don't know if ill trust Canadians again.lol.jk

We came here expecting 400 beers on tap. I know probably too good to be true but there was a ton of beers!! Real good craft beers too. One of best I've ever seen. The best...well Russian River Pliny the Elder of course!! 

Nothing special besides an excellent beer selection. Service is horrible, but I think that's what garage service means so I can live with it. Cash only, I should have read Yelp before I came! But overall not a bad place, maybe ill come back on a future trip and update my review later.
author: Aaron A.

description: Love the giant selection of draught beers. I mean, they even have Pliny the Elder and two other Russian River brews on tap. That's pretty rare. The space is tiny though, and while I admire how diligently the bartenders work, the people here are rude. You'll also get a contact high from standing around by the jukebox in the back, and I definitely mean you'll be standing. It's standing room only for days. You're pretty damn lucky to find a nearby parking spot, and even more lucky to get a stool. Can't beat the beer selection and pricing though.
author: Danny C.

description: This is a great beer pub with a huge number of world class beers. It's busy; stop whining if you don't have the cajones to belly up and order.  Sours, Belgians, domestic and foreign selections. Yes, Pliny the Elder and Blind Pig (and Pliny the Younger during the February release)! If you are a beer snob you must come here.
author: Louis G.

description:
Until last night, I would have said this is a great place. The beer is good. But last night one of the bartenders was explicitly upset that I was an immigrant, and when confronted, was confused as to what to say.
I would not support a place that allows such behavior.
author: Bob R.

description:
Been coming here since 2007, will continue to return for the Pliny the Elder, great beer selections, and sharing tables with diverse crowd that hangs out here. Rosamunde's next door has some great belly ballast for the pints you will put away.

All the pluses need to be weighed against the minuses. This place could be a friendlier hangout, but has some quirks that keep it from being 100%.

For first timers, know your beers, what you want, and order in the most abbreviated fashion to avoid the Beer Nazi reaction from the help. This can be challenging when they are under the influence. They can switch from totally cool to bizarre hostility at the drop of a hat. See above to lessen odds of them Hulking out on you. (Hasn't happened to me, but I've seen it, and it's not pretty).
As others have noted, the smell can be pretty ripe, not for the faint of heart.
Will get insanely crowded in the evenings, but if you do that mid afternoon beer tourist thing for destination bars, you should do OK.

As another person stated, I've been to dive bars and craft beer bars both, just don't get the hostile attitude projected by some of the bartenders.
author: John B.

description:
Good day San Francisco, 

In today's news we've got some inclement weather on the horizon, the forecast is calling for a Toronado, be prepared for a swirling mess of blonde, amber and dark nectars rushing down the throats of anyone caught in the path of this beast.   

Seriously though, go next door to Rosamunde, order a beer sausage with grilled onions, wait 7 minutes, walk 13 steps to Toronado and wash it down with a delicious beer, don't forget to pat yourself on the back for a job well done.
author: Steve C.

description: We appreciate good beer and are always looking for a decent dive bar. We went here last night curious about Pliny the younger (if it had sold out). The bar was not busy, there were even seats available at the bar itself. I asked the bartender about Pliny and he very rudely responded they didnt have it. I explained why I thought they would but received the same curt response. He didnt even try to recommend a beer that was similar. I don't care if you're a beer snob or just having a bad day, as a member of the service industry I can say, suck it up! I'm sure the beer selection is good, but we aren't coming back.
author: Zara S.

description:
No friiiigggin clue why it's taken me this long to review one of my favorite joints in the Bay.

Allow me to rectify this travesty.

Toronado is one of this city's shining stars. It's loud, it smells like stale beer, your shoes sometimes stick to the floor, the bathrooms just get grosser (and frankly far more interesting) as the years go by and the smart ass backbone of the place is indescribably endearing. 

Their beer roster proudly boasts beers from all over the place, but it's also legit. This is no flash-in-the-pan beer tasting bar. This is a place you come to when you want awesome beer and a laid back vibe and you don't take yourself too seriously. With that said, they are serious about their beers. In fact I have learned a ton about beers here and discovered a variety of beers that are now in my arsenal of faves.

You can't call yourself a local or even an intelligent person unless you've spent some time here. So do you really wanna be "that" guy and miss out on the magic? No, I don't think you do.
author: Stephy S.

description: Ridiculous place! I spilled my beer by accident and I got thrown out for that without even being drunk...
author: Nikos D.

description: This bar in Lower Haight is a local favorite. Most days it's packed inside, full of beer lovers. It's a very small space with seats at the bar and room to stand. They have an incredible list of beer that they serve on a regular basis. When we went it was so crowded that people could barely move around. The bouncer was very helpful and offered to make space for us to enjoy a beer, but the people would have swallowed up my wheelchair. It's a little claustrophobic to be the only one sitting in a room full of standing drunken people! If you beat the rush, you're in for a wide variety of beer selections. The bathroom is completely inaccessible to wheelchairs whether the bar is crowded or not.  It is accessible to get in the front door, but that's about it.
author: Shannon M.

description:
Sometimes I think I'm not into beer, but then I realize that's probably just something I picked up from my skinny girlfriends.  When I have a beer in front of me, I tend to put it in my system.  When I put it in my system, I tend to enjoy it.  This is especially true if the beer is delicious.

I visited Toronado on my trip to San Francisco with Justin C.  We came in the late afternoon to eat Ike's sandwiches and Rosamunde sausages.  We treated the place like a purveyor of picnic tables, and no one cared.  I didn't even interact with Toronado personnel - Justin grabbed us beers from the bar.

We didn't go crazy, as it was 3 o'clock and we were driving to the airport, but we sipped on a couple beers while we ate our lunches.  I liked the clear display of beer options at Toronado, and Justin picked us up a Russian River Damnation and a Lost Abbey.  The Russian River Damnation was a fantastic pale ale that I plan to drink whenever I can, and the Lost Abbey was great as well, a sharper, heavier beer.

I don't know how Toronado is at night, but it had a cool dingy atmosphere when I went.  It wasn't crowded, but it wasn't empty either, and I liked the divey feel of the place.  It was, I would say, unjustifiably dark for the hour, but so it goes.  All the better to hide that beer belly.
author: Steph C.

description:
If you like beer, you will like Toronado. If you absolutely love beer, you will probably like Toronado. 

If you don't even beer, then don't go to Toronado.
author: Victor A.

description:
Ridiculously good beer selection, reasonable priced, cash only

Requisite dive-y atmosphere complete with surly looking barkeep who are all pretty cool, friendly and very knowledgeable about aforementioned beer selection. 

Just another reason to love SF. sigh.
author: Cec D.

description:
Too tell you the truth I barely remember much about this place. So that prob means I had a great time!! Hahaha.

Stopped by Rosamunde to pick up some sausages and then headed over with my friends to Toronado. It was definitely crowded but luckily we were heading in as a group was leaving so we scored a big table! Woo!!! 

Great selection of beers!!! I enjoyed whatever IPA I drank that night for sure. Haha. 
The only con is that it gets EXTREMELY LOUD. My friends and I had to leave after awhile because we were all tired of screaming at each other. 

Great energy. Great beers. What more could you ask for?
author: Vanessa F.

description: Been here a few times and also for Pliny the Younger. Part of what makes a good bar are the kind of people that go there. That said, this place has a good vibe and generally engaging people. It almost has this underground German metal bar feel. As a non-licensed beer snob, they have a great selection of local and nationwide beers, including stuff you can't get in bottles at the store. I don't think there's much imported stuff, but that's fine, because the US has the best beer on the planet. Did I mention the average price for a pint is like $6?
author: Andrew D.

description:
Uncomfortably crowded on weekends and during special events--it's not uncommon to see a line wrapped around the block.  Come on a weekday evening and enjoy the wide variety of craft beer while avoiding the crowds.

If it's not busy, the bartenders are great about helping you choose a beer, but if it's packed, ask questions at your own peril.  (That's why I like to go with Andrei Z.  He is my personal beer-recommender.) Bring cash, and wear shoes you don't mind beer being spilled on.  Take the 6, the 71, or the N-Judah, because quaffing those high ABV delights will sneak up on you.

It's no-frills and it's awesome.
author: Jennie K.

description:
Having heard enough "bad experience" stories such as having a towel thrown in the face or being insulted publicly, the desire to visit this place increased with each subsequent story. Finally I had the chance to visit here after a convoluted walk from Zeitgeist. Of course being the institution, it was packed on a sunny Saturday afternoon. 
Service was good. Selections weren't amazing but at least I got to try some local stuff that weren't available down south, namely some Moonlights, Magnolia, & FreeWheel. I heard they have crazy selections on special events though.
author: Vince S.

description:
Seemingly endless amounts of beer and wall to wall sausage? Nope this isn't a Thursday night frat party, but rather a pretty awesome premise for Toronado in the Haight. 

My buddy brought me here a couple of weeks ago, and from the start Toronado did not disappoint. Any place that rocks one of those half-doors like you'd see on a cottage in the rolling hills of the English countryside (think Jane Eyre except substitute beer for passive-aggressive relationships and feelings) deserves mucho respect.

What makes Toronado great are the contrasts. This bar will take you up and down, back and forth, and leave you somewhere in the middle with a deep seated appreciation for frosty cold ones. On the one hand you've got the quintessential dive bar, but on the other you've got a few state of the art LCD TVs beaming the local sports game (Go Giants!). Then you've got the beautifully ornate tap handles on display vs. the gruffness and harsh lines of the intimidating yet surprisingly cheerful bartender. Finally, you're in the Lower Haight, but the jukebox can and will play all the best hits from the the Motown Era. Smokey Robinson and the Miracles anyone? Yes please :)

Oh, and did I mention the beer? I'd be remiss if I didn't give a shoutout to Westmalle Dubble, my first (and hopefully not last) journey into the wonderful world of Trappist Ales. I'm not much of a beer aficionado, but if I had to compare it to something I'm very familiar with, I'd say Westmalle is kind of like if you took Newcastle and filtered it through a double rainbow while a unicorn was jumping over the top, and maybe a Valkyrie is riding bareback on the unicorn because that would be awesome, right? Yea it's that good, and the glass, nay I say chalice, has a handy guide line on the side so you don't overdo it on the head.

Couple that with the 'go right ahead and bring in outside food' policy, (gotta have your brew with a brat from Rosamunde next door) and ding-ding we have a winner. Toronado, I know you're down in the lower Haight, but I've got nothing but love for you baby.

P.S. minus 1 star for cash only, how am I gonna save up for that power rewards hot tub now?
author: Curtis C.

description:
Tordonado? I think it would be a lot more fun if I were deaf. And being blind wouldn't hurt either. 

Look, this is the kind of place I was born to like. Craft beer. Not very clean. Sausages nearby. But even for me--a Masshole from way back--it's just too loud and too rude.

Pluses:
- There are sausages next door (oh, make no mistake, there are plenty of sausages in the bar as well)
- Many rare beers from Russian River, Deschutes
- Good prices

Minuses:
- Music makes me wish I had been born without ears
- Bartenders treat you like a prison inmate who is asking for a fresh bar of soap; it's like the barkeeps get paid a commission every time a customer cries in their beer
- In case you were wondering, the "current beer" section on their website gets updated every 4-5 years.

Toronado gets accolades, including being the home base for a New York Times article about beer adventures in Northern California, as well as a spot in the top 100 beer bars in the United States. I haven't been to them all yet, but give me a few years and I'll get back to you on how close to the bottom Toronado actually is.
author: Lou S.

description: Great beer selection on tap and competitive prices on pints. I just wish that this place had better acoustics. My friends and I came here on a Thursday night, the place was packed to the gills and it was so loud and echo-y that I couldn't hear the person standing right next to me. It didn't help that they had loud music playing on top of the loud voices. I'm pretty sure the people who frequent this place are slowly going deaf from the high decibels and not even realizing it. This place would definitely benefit from some broadband absorption panels.
author: Casey S.

description: Im not one to write negative reviews but my experience was awful. The female bar tender was extremely rude. I asked her a pretty simple question about the beer and she rudely responded with "i don't know". I asked her another simple question and she replied again with "i don't know". She didnt appear to know anything. Later on that night she was throwing things behind the bar like an angry little brat. The guy at the door was a bit of a jerk too. I left in a pretty bad mood. They need to hire a bartender that knows the difference between beers and has half a brain.
author: K H.

description:
To put it curtly this place has great beer and piss poor bartenders.  They act like they are god, treat you with disrespect and even will laugh at you if they decide they don' t like you.

A group of about 5 friends and I were our for a nice night on a Friday.  We had spent well over $200 on beer here and had been tipping well throughout the night just minding our business.

As the night drew to a close we started going to the bar for water instead of beer.  Supposedly after patronizing the bar all night one of our members forgot to tip a dollar when getting one glass of water.  From that point on the bartender would not serve any of our group water.  

Before knowing this had happened I had nicely asked for water, with a dollar in hand.  The bartender smurked at me and shook her head.  I was dumbfounded that a bartender would refuse her customers water.  I looked at her puzzled and gestured that I even had a dollar in hand and then she told me my friends hadn't paid so she wasn't going to serve me water.  After a couple minutes of arguing the other bar tender knowing full well this was illegal slammed down a water and then asked me to leave.  I did along with all the rest of my friends.

Before leaving they proceeded to tell us they could refuse service to anyone which I completley understand.  I just wansn't aware that rule was applied to paying patrons who were asking for a glass of water at the end of the night.  

I go to bars to be served and respected, and give respect and payment in kind to bartenders.  This bar will never see a dollar of mine again.  In fact I will probably picket it a few times just for shits and giggles and then we can see if  we can't get that bartenders smirk to show itself again.
author: Brian T.

description: Cool beer selection.  Good local beers. Poor service. But still pretty good crowd for a Monday night.
author: Sofía A.

description:
While visiting San Francisco, I had basically hit up all of the breweries/pubs I wanted to, but had some time yet on my last day. I was referred to Toronado by a local at 21st Amendment. If you are a beer lover like me, this is an excellent place to stop for a beer. I met a really great local and we chatted for hours about beer and such.

It's definitely divey and the bartenders and bouncer were slightly rude, so that's where they lose a star.

Side note: This clientele of this place was 80 percent men. Not a problem, just an observation.
author: Beth P.

description: Best bar ever!!!! Great bartenders!!! Totally awesome!!! When in San Fran some visit and get a Pliny!!!
author: Brandie Jane R.

description:
Great place ! 
Good hangout and fun crowd ! 
Service was decent besides gender which was good news for us
author: Chintan S.

description:
This is probably one of the best dive bars I've been to in SF for its selection and ambiance. Just based on this, you should come here to explore some good beers from around the world. If you look at the decor, you will see lots of beer tap handles for lots of different brews--pretty awesome.

I ordered a beer which was dispensed by a Hand Pump however I probably wouldn't get one again because at least when I got it, the beer was too warm for my liking--cold is the way to go.

It's in a good location located next door to a good sausage spot and BBQ joint across the street.

Definite place to go to in the city.
author: Marlon T.

description:
A few things the uninitiated should know about Toronado:

It's located in Lower Haight, so the clientele are a jaunty melange of local tweakers, hippies (past their 'best before' date) and day drinkers. Also, because it was featured on Anthony Bourdain, you'll get to mingle with wide-eyed tourists and Food-Network-watching putzes. Stirring this hodgepodge together in a biker bar aesthetic is Fun. It's usually packed in here, especially if there's a game on the tube, but be not deterred. I generally spend no more time at the bar than is necessary, and head for the quieter room in the back where you might have a conversation with a CFO drug dealer that possibly sexually assaulted a Googler. 

It takes all kinds, as they say.

For lovers of beer: welcome home. They serve a few dozen microbrews (both local and imported) and have at least 100 bottles. There are also a few stouts on nitro. I can't imagine a beer-thusiast getting bored with their offerings. 

Bring cash.

Obligatory Title Pun: TORONADO/why don't you come to your senses? 

Menu Readability: Look up and see a bounty of beer!

Need to mention: You can and should order a sausage from Rosamunde next door and bring it here.

What this place teaches me about myself: I don't distinguish 'day drinking' from 'drinking.'
author: Vivek S.

description: The people who work here are super condescending and inappropriately confrontational. There are lots of great bars on Haight, and there's no point in visiting this one unless you want to get sneered at by an angry little hipster.
author: Lauren M.

description:
SO. MUCH. BEER!!

Came here on a Thursday night and it was pretty packed. Definitely kind of divey, but it had a good, friendly atmosphere. There was a fat load of different beers to try, which was pretty awesome. There was a table open, but I can see this place getting pretty packed on a Friday or Satudray evening. 

I think it would definitely be a "go-to" for me whenever I'm in lower haight. Toronado is to lower haight as Elbo Room is to the mission! I just have to make a trip there :)
author: Jade R.

description:
After the baseball game, we randomly stumble upon this Bar.

We decided to drive over to Haight to check out the scene. Not bad!! I think I found my favorite beer bar in SF!

The two main reasons why I really like Toronado are:
1) SOOOO many selection of beer on tap--pretty much like Yardhouse, without the yardhouse glasses (30 plus selections)

2) They were fairly cheap-- I think each glass was around $3-4, depending what you get. I got my chocolate beer! hahaha It was decent, but not the greatest. 

Plus, with a party of 4, we were able to find tables in the back to sit and chit chat (This was around 12:30pm--everyone was crowding around the bar area). In this seating area, I think you can seat about 15-20people.
author: Jen H.

description: This is the worst bar that I have ever been to. When my fiancé and I walked in we were turned away by the bouncer after he saw my fiances Texas ID he said that dogs weren't allowed in the bar. Keep in mind this was although there was already a big dog inside. It gets worse, I called back a little after 5pm to complain to the manager and the bartender answered. When I told the bartender what happened he said "I don't know what to tell you have a nice day" then hung up.  I will not be coming back or recommending this place to any of our friends.
author: Beatriz E.

description: Classic joint. Encyclopedic selection of beers and accompanying beer nerds. Walls filled with beerahanilia. Always crowded but not impossible to get a drink. A seat maybe, but not a drink. Plus you can get a lovely sausage from Rosmunde next-door.
author: E. W.

description:
Famous beer mecca which deserves the hype - best (though not largest) tap selection I've had the pleasure to experience. The bottle menu is extensive and superb. 

Some of the bartenders are nice, others are very rude. All of them know their beer.

When crowded, it's a drunken raucous mess with the occasional rude bouncer. This isn't my scene, but large quantities of excellent beer builds my tolerance. I prefer the off-hours.

If you really don't know your beer and it's crowded, don't ask the bartender for suggestions or you'll get an attitude: they really are busy. 

I know many negative reviews pan the Toronado for this, but don't walk in and order a Bud. You wouldn't walk into a wine bar and order a 2 buck chuck.

-1 star for rudeness, but this bar is a legend.
author: James R.

description:
Great beer comes with great sacrifice? I'm really torn here because God knows I LOVE craft beer and there's no doubt that this place has one of the best selections around, but I also love having elbow room and my vocal chords in tact by the end of the night. 

It's dirty, loud, and stinky. The guys are pretty cool that work there unless you catch them when they're manstrating.  

It's a tough one.
author: Gloria B.

description:
Tarantado Toronado!  You got me good.

"We don't serve the youth, kiddo."  
Oh flattery will get you no where.
"Next"
Oh, he wasn't trying to flatter me.

I'M NOT A KID!

I was doing cartwheels trying to get the bartenders attention again.  Only attention I got was from a biker.  And she was actually pretty. Anyway. They seemed to serve everyone and would pass over me. They even served someone who looked like she crawled right out of a box.  Fk man what gives?  Excuse me. *waves twamper in air* Excuse me. Sir?  Hi.  Excuse me. *cartwheel* 

I just want a FKIN beer!!!  WAH!  Bartender comes over.  "Why didn't you say so".
Me:  I am gonna kick your a**.  Bartender: Oh I'd like to see you try.  I.D.?  Me:  Here. Gimme a stout.  Bartender:  A stout? Snicker. Sure.  Me: Ok that's it. You and Me. Outside. Right now. Bartender: Ha. I like you.

He likes meeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee
I broke a smile outta the rude dude

Bathroom is a 2 for.  go to pee, take in the stench, end up throwing up too

Toronado: no nonsense.grungy.sticky.smelly.will make u hurl.good for thewaistline.dingy.rude.wastes no time.cash only.bums.dogs.satisfies.douchey.crowded.sausages.from rosamunde next door.not actual man meat.well actually there's plenty of that too.hella beers.no really, hella.dirty patrons.some who showered.bikers.and one that was actually pretty
author: Rho T.

description:
Definitely one of the best tap selections in SF. Especially if you enjoy beers from Russian River Brewing and other belgian style breweries. Parking in lower haight is not too bad in the early evening but this place is easily accessible by public transportation. 

I know this is a dive but it still needs some ventilation. This bar is dog friendly and some days you will have to endure the smell of wet dog. 

They don't serve food but go next door to rosamunde for their famous sausages.
author: Alfred L.

description: great beers, rock music and good vibes. It is everything you want from a dive bar. happy hour takes a dollar off drafts and you can get a bomb sausage from Rosamunde next door and bring it in to enjoy with your brew.
author: Sean K.

description:
Extremely RUDE! I went in there to begin my immersion into the world of beer. It was a slow night so I figured it was a good time to ask questions about various styles. I asked about Belgian wit beers and other beers a beginner might like. The bartender offered me water and kept STARING at my TITS. The bar seems to have a hipster and yuppie infestation problem. 
Needless to say I will not be going back. This place is NOT FEMALE FRIENDLY,go to La Trappe or the Trappist instead.
I'd give this place ZERO STARS if I could.
author: Chloe W.

description:
DON'T come here if you don't like crowded dive bars, surly bartenders and messy bathrooms. DO come here if you love good/rare beer, don't want to spend a ton of money, and want to have a unique experience.
 
And that's pretty much it. Besides the beer. Did I mention the beer? Pliny the elder? Yes.
author: Katie C.

description:
Tons of good beer and a good bartender, what else can you ask for? 

The bar area was busy on a weeknight, but there's a side room with seats that was practically empty. The crowd was mixed but mostly older folks.
author: Eddy B.

description:
I took a shot of Underberg with one of the bartenders once when the previous manfriend (doesn't that sound a lot better/ more respectable than ex?) compensated  the bartender for some bad tippers. I once got scolded by the bartender for not having cash. (after I ordered.. oops). Never making that mistake ever again. I haven't come here for a long time. Great beer on tap for $1 off during happy hour. You can't get a pint of Pliny for $5 anywhere else. It's a miracle! Today I sat with some friends, threw back some beers, and watched the Dodgers sweep the Giants. 

wompwomp. I guess I'll have a Pliny to wash away the sadness.  


Amazing selection, always crowded, know what you want, have cash, and don't dilly dally. Beer lovers unite. If you don't have an open beer palette and only want what you can get everywhere else, this isn't the place for you. So, come here with an open mind, and if you don't know what you want, ask for a suggestion, and take their advice. Also if you order a bunch of beers and they tell you what each is as they hand it to you, LISTEN. Don't expect them to repeat themselves. And don't give them a bad tip for not repeating themselves... Which reminds me never to bring people who will embarrass me here.. I'm glad I didn't know that group! HAH. 

Dog-friendly as long your pooch is bar-friendly and doesn't pop his collar.

I try not to come here on Fridays/Saturdays, which I'm sure are the best nights, but Sunday day-drinking is way better/less crowded. On Fridays, if you don't have a seat, expect to be awkwardly standing/moving around getting out of of the way. Everyday you're shufflin'...
author: Donna H.

description: Great craft beer... However it is cash only, which is fine, but the staff are so rude when taking an order.  When they couldn't hear us they said "speak the f***k up" I was already yelling over the music.  Good beer. Bad service.
author: Alex M.

description:
How not to get gruff service at Toronado:

Don't be an idiot.

The place can get busy, and the bartenders are quick and efficient, so if you slow them down with extended moments of indecision or confusion over the fact that some places in the world don't take credit, you might want to convene with your inner drunk before complaining.

Know what you want. Order it. 

Beer is plentiful, with great varieties on some of the world's best beer, changing constantly on their taps. Prices are low, even when it's not happy hour, so it's a great place for poor folk as well.

I've never had bad service at Toronado. I've never been treated rudely. I've never felt unwelcome in this beer lover's bar.

But then again, I'm not an idiot.
author: Keane L.

description:
The draft beer menu was pretty diverse and I appreciated the unpretentious vibe and polite staff.  It is a divey bar so if you're into that, this is the place for you. 

I was a bit disappointed in my "Brother David's Triple," which was a little flat. I wish I could have enjoyed it to its fullest potential but maybe I just picked the wrong beer.
author: Elise G.

description:
Outstanding beer selection.

No frills, just the most fantastic, extensive selection of craft brews. I came here most recently for the 25th Anniversary Party release of Russian River's T25. Toronado is consistently crowded and busy. Know what you want to order and have cash ready. The bartenders are efficient so if you're not ready, they will move on and you will lose your chance to order. -1 for the bathrooms which are seriously disgusting.

I've also been to the Toronado in San Diego which has a different atmosphere.
author: Ashley K.

description:
My experience at Toronado was good, but not great. We arrived around 8:30pm on a Saturday night to a large and bustling crowd. After eyeballing the beer selections, we decided to go with two of the Russian River offerings that they had on draught. After struggling to get the bartender's attention, we were finally served and squeezed our way to the back room that was mostly standing with a few tables and booths lining the walls. The crowd was a bit obnoxious, but that was to be expected for a Saturday night. We were able to snag a small table and sat there sipping on our beers. Due to the atmosphere and crowd we decided to just leave our Toronado experience to one beer.

I know a lot of other reviews are raving about the beer selection, but I didn't really find it that "wowing". Perhaps I'm just spoiled by Chicago's taphouses, but this experience left a lot to be desired.
author: Megan K.

description: Take it for what it is: an awesome local beer bar. Amazing selection of beers. Be decisive in what you want to drink, don't try to pay with debit/credit, and DO NOT ask for Bud or Coors light. Follow those tips, and you will enjoy!
author: Justin M.

description:
Yep. I definitely missed this place. Went here for the first time a year ago, and finally came back this last weekend to be greeted with a great selection of tasty beers, just in time for Pliny the Younger to make its acquaintance for a limited time! Oh my goodness, was that amazing to my taste buds. Whether it is still there or not, I will always make a visit when I'm in the neighborhood.

The staff, of course, were genuine, honest, and helpful in my decision for my beer choices during times of indecisiveness. Thank you!
author: Maleia M.

description:
This is a dope bar that doesn't claim to be anything but a joint with a bunch of good beers for a very good price in an expensive city.  I fashion myself a very well rounded beer snob and there were many fine selects I had never set eyes on before.  

God bless the Toronado!  I look forward to my next visit.
author: John B.

description: This bar use to be one of my favorite in SF. The beer selection still one of the best in town but the bartenders have become real A holes. They offended my friends and made the night very uncomfortable. Maybe they are due for a change of staff?
author: Jova E.

description: Always have Pliny on tap, and many other great beers. Next door to rosamunde, delicious sausages.
author: Ashley T.

description:
Great selection of beers, gets busy evenings & weekends but can be fun for the beer enthusiasts! Myself included.
Loses one star for notoriously rude bar staff.
author: Kelli G.

description:
Leaving this bar I felt that I had gotten a feel for San Francisco. With a huge selection of both domestic and imported beer on tap, this is an awesome place to drink beer. While they don't have any food, the joining building next door hosts a sausage restaurant--and you can bring the food over to eat in the Toronado.

I was able to watch a 49ers game here and had a great experience cheering for the home team with all the locals.

Check this place out if you're in town, looking for beer, and want to get a feel for the local culture.
author: Frank C.

description:
I was in San Francisco for business and since I'm a beer geek, had to make a trek to this iconic beer bar.  In the Haight/Ashbury area, it was easily accessible via the bus stop not too far from hotel, the Parc 55.  Awesome draft selection!  Very heavy on west coast and northwestern area breweries. 

I went on a Tuesday night around 9pm.  It was busy, but not armpit to armpit crowded.  The bar seating was full and all the tables were taken.  I surveyed the board for about 5 minutes until finally deciding on a Deschutes Obsidian Stout on Nitro.  
Yes, it was May and yes I know stouts are more a winter time beer, but damn it, I'm a girl who likes her stouts no matter what time of year!!  Especially when it is on nitro!   

Pints are $5 - $6, depending on the style of beer.   A seat finally opened up at the bar a few minutes after I ordered my beer.  I sat there taking in the atmosphere and gazing between the two TVs above the bar.  One had the Giants game, the other was the Sharks vs. Kings playoff game.  It's a no-frills kind of place and I like that about Toronado.  Relatively chill and not pretentious.  I got that vibe when I saw the famous picture of Johnny Cash flipping off the camera behind the bar next to the register, reminding patrons that it's a CASH only place.  Don't worry, if you forget to bring enough or don't have any on you at all, they have an ATM in the back.  

I bought a girly Toronado logo t-shirt for $15 to take home as my one of SF souvenirs.  Overall a great experience.  If I had been with a group, I think I would have stayed longer.  Plus I had to work early the next day.  Damn old age...
author: Anneliess D.

description:
"Oh, and you have to go to Toronado.  I mean I've never had a good experience there, but it's such a cool bar, and their beer list is exceptional, you have to go.  But really, they have shitty bartenders and I've never had a good experience there"

With that glowing recommendation from another bartender, we made our way to Toronado on a lazy Sunday afternoon.  We were nursing our hangovers the best way possible - with the hair of the dog - and this place fit the bill perfectly for what the doctor ordered.  A dark dive with killer beer, when we were there we lucked out and they weren't packed.   The bathrooms, while not awesome, weren't nearly as gross as a similar bar would have been in Indiana due to whatever awesome regulation it is that keeps those wonderful toilet seat covers in every bathroom I visited in San Francisco.  Be thankful for those, Californians.  

So yeah, great beer list, cool vibe, not packed, no unnecessary surliness from the bartender (we were also prepared with cash and our order when we approached him) - we had the elusive "good experience".
author: Heather H.

description:
Despite it's somewhat rundown looks and lack of frills, this is a beer snob's paradise. They have an excellent beer selection that is constantly changing and they serve everything in its proper glass. They also let you take outside food into the establishment, which is pretty awesome considering that there's some decent eats. Everyone's favorite seems to be the Rosamunde sausage joint next door.

The only negative thing I can say about this place is its insistence on being a Cash Only establishment.
author: Jeffrey J.

description: I was seeing a local at the time and since this was his neighborhood he suggested this dive bar. It was a weekday in the afternoon but amazingly there were quite a few patrons in the main room and being from out of town I was amazed to see another dog friendly bar.  But since I'm weak sauce I asked the bartender for suggestions and she recommended the pomegranate cider, which was actually pretty tasty but cheap date me could barely make it through a third of the glass and then I started to remember why ciders and me don't always mix well so my date finished the rest in a gulp (he's 6'4 and alcohol hardly affects him) as well as his IPA.   Since the side room was empty he chose to spend time there and let's just say alcohol bad and I'll leave that to your imagination. Check out the interesting décor.
author: Jen K.

description:
Toronado is all about the beer. The ambiance is dreary and the service is gruff. You can get away with that though when you've got a bunch of good beer on tap.

As others have noted, there are a lot of Belgians on tap, like twenty or so. This didn't particularly interest me, as I wanted to try Cali beers, but I still ordered a sour and found it damn good. I was glad I tried it and glad they had it on Tap. 

I also tried a beer from Moonlight Brewing that was damn good and got to learn the backstory about how the brewer used to work for Schlitz. There were a number of other good beers on tap, Big Bear and others from Cali, but I didn't stay long. 

They have a good selection of bottled beers as well and you can buy them to go. As I sat at the bar, some guy came in and bought up all the Pliny the Elder they had. 

I must say, I wish there were as many German beers on tap as Belgians and as many American beers as both. Not sure why the favoritism towards Belgium, but this isn't the end of the world.
author: Clayton A.

description:
The asshole bartender Stu can go!  Picking fights with your own customers is completely out of line.  

Sober up douchebag!
author: JP H.

description: Bartenders aren't very nice. The place smells. Cash only. Very good, cheap beer.
author: Tan P.

description:
We came here at 11:45 am on Friday, 02/15/13 with three others thinking they opened at 11:30 am so they can't be that busy for Pliny the Younger because hey it's Friday, people are working.  Boy was I wrong.  The placed was completely packed with everyone trying to get their hands on Pliny the Younger.  Despite the massive crowd, we accomplished our goal and got Pliny the Younger. 

Some tips regarding Pliny the Younger:

1. Don't bother calling the bar to see if they have Pliny the Younger available.  You would have a better chance at winning the lotto then to have someone pick up during SF beer week.  Besides, it's a dive bar.  I am not going there for their awesome customer service.  I am there because of their awesome selection of draft beers. 

2.  Arrive before the bar opens to increase your chances at getting this beer. The bar opens at 11:30 am every day.  They tapped out of Pliny the Younger for the day in 43 minutes while I was there that day.

3. Everyone is trying to get the attention of the two bartenders. You need to be more vocal about getting their attentions to get the beer.  I mean nicely, not be an ass.  I saw people being nice and patient waiting for the bartenders only to get shafted by other customers who were more vocal and aggressive. 

4. Don't be a dope and order just one for yourself. I have seen others order two at a time for themselves and have done it for myself.  The chances of you going back into that line to get the beer can be difficult. I brought another friend who wasn't that into IPA's and was able to utilize their services and acquired two additional Younger's. 

Bonus - Foo Fighter's All My Life randomly came on during beer consumption. Almost peed my pant and went to heaven. MAJOR bucket list check off. Haha.
author: Sokha S.

description: I brought two sausages here from next door at 11:40AM on a Thursday.  I could not have asked for a better experience.  I've read reviews about the bartenders being a little rough around the edges, but I could not have asked for better service.  This may not be common, but she asked if we wanted to sample anything before we ordered.  We did not take her up on it because we knew exactly what we wanted.  PtE, Blind Pig, Nelson, Duet, etc. on draft.  Who could ask for more?  It was a great vibe.  It was very early so there were only about 10 beer geeks there.  We were all from different walks of life, but came together to discuss and enjoy this incredible beer.  I also was able to get PtE bottles to go.  I can't see how there is a better dive bar than Toronado.
author: Bob B.

description:
Would give zero stars if I could. I had an incredibly awful experience here. Understaffed, and had to wait almost 15 minutes to get a bartender's attention. Once I finally did, the bartender was incredibly rude and arrogant, and started mocking the questions I asked him before eventually telling me to "shut up" and refusing to help me!!! 

I'm really sad because I really love the great selection of beer they have, and I wanted to like this place. I get that the bartenders know a lot about proper beer drinking, but they are so incredibly rude and unpleasant to interact with that I want to say that I will never come back, but actually that's probably what they were aiming for. Instead, I plan on coming back regularly and irritating the bartenders as much as possible each time and not tipping. I should end this review by saying that I've worked as a bartender up until recently, and I know very well what bartenders go through. I have never encountered bartenders this repugnant anywhere.
author: Randy K.

description:
A great craft beer establishment.  I come here every time I'm in San Francisco and am never disappointed.  What I usually do is come here either before or after my other favorite establishment in San Francisco, Zeitgeist, as the two bars are only about a 15 minute walk apart.

As a hop-head if I can walk into a bar see Pliny on the wall and still order something else, that is a very good sign.   Last time I went about a month ago I ordered a Boneyard Nefarious and an El Toro Deuce IPA.  The Nefarious is a strong (10% abv) and well balanced Double IPA that comes in a Tulip glass, despite the light citrus notes I found the carmel maltiness to be a little too dominant. The El Toro Deuce Imperial IPA had a heavy body and I did not enjoy it as much as the Nefarious as it was even more malty and sweet.  Looking back I probably would have been happier getting a Pliny or Blind Pig, but if you don't try something new you won't ever truly know you palette.

Ok back to Toronado as an establishment.  It has your typical craft beer bar decor and there is an extra room in the back with additional seating, where the music is not as loud (as chosen on the jukebox near the rear of the bar).  The bartenders are typically busy so be prepared to say what you want from the board and have your cash in hand (this is a cash only establishment).  You don't come here for the service or conversation with the bartender, you come here for the beer.  That being said my wife and I came here on a week night last time and we were able to ask a few questions about the beers on the board to help us decide what we wanted to order.  

One last tip, go next door to Rosamunde Sausage Grill and get yourself something to pair with your beverage.
author: Charlie M.

description:
The selection at the Toronado is as good as it gets. 
That being said, the service is at the opposite end of the scale. I travel for work, and in turn get to go to a lot of killer beer bars/ ale houses/ brewery's, and tend to have a lot of good experiences, and meet a lot of great people who are passionate about beer. If you like to feel like you're not worthy, or welcome, this is the place for you. I'd rather walk down to someplace like healthy spirits, or city beer store, where there's a huge selection, and I can ask a question, get an answer, and walk away with a smile on my face knowing my business is appreciated. In fact, I'd rather go to some tight pants hipster bar in the mission, and drink PBR's with some pseudo punk kids in a shit hole that smells like puke.
author: Heywood J.

description: If your in the mood for a craft beer and a metal band it's the place to be. There selection is beer is on point and the atmosphere is of a bar. The bathrooms are scary for females but for a group of dudes they will feel right at home. The pomegranate cider was awesome and just the right temperature. Highly recommend this for The craft Beer lover!
author: Brandie T.

description: Yay for the awesome bar tender who made a nice amber ale suggestion (Damnation) and who was also super friendly. Beer prices are definitely decent. A bit more crowded than I'd like but at least it's a pretty cool-diverse crowd.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
The Setting:  Grabbing a couple beers with my brother during March Madness tourney.

The Vibe:  2 Stars - Kind of reminds me of a smaller version of the "Alibi" bar from the TV show Shameless....grimy bathrooms, lots of locals and hipsters with dogs, no real penchant for cleanliness.  But the crowd is pretty friendly.

The Beer:  4.5 Stars - Their stouts and IPA's are top notch, they have Piney the Elder on tap, and my brother the beer enthusiast says it's the best selection at a small local bar that he's ever seen.

The Service:  2.5 Stars - Kind of slow, no waitstaff, and.....they only take cash.  Look, I understand the desire to avoid taxes, this being California, but it's 2013, start accepting plastic and pass the fee along to customers!

The Bottom Line:  A run-down local bar in a great location with superb selection.  Don't dress up for this place...and try 21st Amendment if you wanna upgrade the decor.
author: Kevin S.

description: Lots of beers on tap. A lot of IPAs. Not much information about them. Would have liked to know IBUs or at least alcohol by volume. One of the bartenders was great. He served my friends. The one that served me was rude and not helpful. "Over 90% of our beers are ales". Yeah, I get that. Which ones aren't pale ales? I tried to order the amber ale my friend ordered. Apparently they didn't have any ambers. Yeah, okay. If you like lots of beers, you will like it. If you aren't a beer connoisseur like me, then hope you get the good bartender. Thanks to the gentleman next to me for helping me out. No thanks to the bartender trying to get him to buy me a drink.
author: Ali B.

description: Do I like this place? Yes? Is it great? Not by any stretch of the imagination. They always have a great and diverse selection(they seem to be quite into sours currently). Their beer is never at a good temp and there staff is on the rude side. The San Diego is always cleaner with a better staff.
author: Ryan L.

description: Cognac Barrel Noir from Almanac. Wow! Cool beer house with only micro brews. Hmm - gonna maybe check out the homemade sausage sandwich place next door.
author: Dean T.

description:
Stopped to say hello to a little dog in a sweater on the way in. Took a while to look over the beer list, the bartender was ready for us when we finally made a decision. 

Fun, low-key vibe. Definitely a great beer bar with a lot of different styles to choose from! A nice change from the normal selection we have in the Midwest. My husband was very excited to find Pliny the Elder on draught!
author: Katie B.

description:
Excellent selection of brews. A good variety of choices with stouts & IPAs.
Can't go wrong with a 5 dollar pint of Pliny.

We went around 4-5 PM on a Saturday, and it was pretty packed.
Sort of a dive bar type of feel and can get pretty rowdy-ish but nothing crazy.
author: James H.

description:
I'll have to check this place out again on another night. I went for Pliny night and I fought a rain-soaked crowd of dudes to get me a taste of the beer that had eluded me for a week.

After being cut in front of and pushed a dozen or so times (can't say much for the crowd but this may be A-typical given the event), a sweet lady bartender took pity on my little ponytail bobbing well below the sea-level of tall dudes shoulders and poured me my coveted drink.

After all that we declared pliny the elder way better and headed across the street to mad dogs for another pint and some elbow room. I'll definitely be back since the bartender was kind and they have quite a selection but I'm just over doing bars that crowded when there's so many delicious beers within arms reach on haight street.
author: Nikki M.

description: A perfect spot to grab a beer.  It's a no frills sort of a place.  Service can be a little curt and soup nazish. But you can't beat their beer selection and prices. Russian river and moonlight beers are my favorite.
author: Linda R.

description: Brought a friend here who was visiting from Canada. Yes the place is a bit dark, dank and dirty but the beer selection is bar none. I was able to bring my Rosamunde sausage in to eat from next door, the beer prices are excellent, even better at happy hour. Elder the Pliny complimented my boar sausage just perfectly. Even my friend appreciated it for what it was. Would come back again!
author: Sylvie R.

description: This place is bad.  Just plain bad.  Infested with rodent, and they have a pretentious staff and beer selection.
author: Chris T.

description: Incredible draft list that's regularly updated on their website. Pliny is consistently on tap, as well as a few others from Russian River. You'll find other great breweries like Alpine and Drake's pouring, a few casks, and a binder of bottle purchase options. Not too busy on a weeknight.
author: Tucker K.

description: Grab a sausage next door and wash it down with death and taxes. The bar tenders are dicks. You can tell they really hate their job. Nine times out of ten, when a bartender hates her/his job its cause her/his boss is a insufferable dick. The other ten percent they are just bitter miserable rotten shells of human beings. I'm not sure which problem they are having but they wear it all over their shitty faces. I'd rather black out again at molotov's than compete for that fucking assholes attention to get a drink.
author: Matt H.

description:
Great beer selection, a focus between regional CA beers and European craft beers, although the menu is particularly biased towards IPAs. If you get the beer munchies, you can always get something fast from the restaurants next door (pizza, sausage, burritos) and bring it back inside.

It can get very loud and crowded after 6:00 PM, and it's cash only. However, there's always a good chance to get a table if you stand around for 20 minutes.
author: Edmundo R.

description: Great selection of beer, authentic atmosphere, and close proximity to good sausages!! Be aware though.. It's cash only.
author: Julie M.

description: Great place with an extraordinary selection of beer! The staff is really welcoming and professional and prices are low. Not to loud music. All over a great bar if you are looking for good beer for decent prices!
author: Lars B.

description:
Toronado = the best.

Best prices for an amazing beer selection. The bartenders are awesome and always friendly. The jukebox is continuously playing great music and, besides, when is a jukebox not great? But seriously, it doesn't get much better than this place. The atmosphere, the people, the beer. All fantastic.

Things to keep in mind:
-it's cash only (but there's an ATM in the back)
-no kitchen (but they allow you to bring in food from other places, and there are several quick food stops in the immediate vicinity)

That's it. Just go there!
author: Bridget M.

description: Awesome beer bar! The boys have an EXTENSIVE beer knowledge. We tried the pliny the elder,  it's a fucking great beer! Bar tender gave us samples of other awesome beers. Bouncer was wearing a SLAYER cap, you know you are in the right place!! \m/   \m/
author: James M.

description: Great beer.  Very crowded.  Loved the bar.  A little overwhelming.  Beer selection wonderful.
author: Jill S.

description:
This place cracks me up. I will never forget the hour I spent here. It is something I will always look back and laugh about.

I was in San Fran with my babe and we were visiting some friends. My babe is a beer nerd and was like OMG we have to go to Toronado.

3 of us walk in, 3pm, weekday and grab the last spots at the bar. The bar tender is rough and stern looking. He has very long hair and deep bags under his eyes. He walks over to us, points and says, "What do you want', after only being there 1 min, minute, none of us knew what we wanted. He walks away, nothing else said. We all stare at the big list of beers on hand.

The bar tender comes back, and gives us about 2 seconds to tell him the beer we have chosen. He has no patience for the confused or undecided. He actually told our friend, "I do not have time to talk about beer". She was sorry she even asked him a question. We drink our beers, pay and leave. The bartender doesn't say anything else to us. We still joke about that man to this very day. 

Amazing beer list, great for the knowledgeable beer enthusiasts. Do some research, know what you want to drink. Ignore the rough crowd and smelly bar. This place is classic.

It gets 5 stars for the laughs I have had telling this story to my friends.
author: Sara M.

description: I'm not a huge beer drinker.  I honesty drink wine most of my life, but this is the best place in San Francisco to go get a beer.  Small simple place with a very diverse selection of "GREAT" beers and great prices.  $1 off beers on happy hour!!!
author: Coraly S.

description:
Great tap selection (probably the best in norcal).

Insane amount of barley wine (though this was during beerweek).

Saves me from driving up to Santa Rosa for the younger with less of a line. 

Close to Rickybobby, so I have a place where I can sober up with good food.

I like this place.
author: Marc T.

description: You get one star for being a legend in the craft beer scene and having an excellent beer selection.  You get no stars for your horrible, horrible, horrible service and dirty environment.  The bartenders are rude and could care less about the customer.  And while I understand this is a dive bar, how about having some toilet paper in the bathroom for women.  And how about not giving me attitude when I let the staff know about the lack of toilet paper.  There are awesome beer bars with awesome service popping up all over the city and pretty soon people will get fed up with the crappy service here and start drinking Pliny in a more welcoming place.  Get with the times Toronado.
author: Derek H.

description:
Geek craft beer valhalla.

A perfectly divey bar with a good amount of seating, Toronado is a 100% winner in my book.  Coming from NJ, I wanted to try some of the best beers I can't get back east, and Toronado delivered in spades.  With the best of Russian River and other breweries available on draft for $6-7, plus a sizable bottle list, this bar wins.

Like many craft beer bars, this was a predominantly male crowd, which was fine for watching the NBA Playoffs on their televisions while classic rock played on in the background.  I made some friends, talked sports and beer, and just had a good time.  

So whether you're a tourist or a local, if you love good beer Toronado needs to be a stop when you visit SF.
author: Steve B.

description: Crowded and noisy place, but nice atmosphere, Excellent beer selection on tap. Try Pliny the Elder if you like IPA style. Stop by this place if you are in the area.
author: Fer S.

description:
A beer lover's nirvana in the heart of San Francisco. An huge and excellently curated tap list with helpful servers who can help you choose the best beer suited to your taste. A large and often changing chalkboard lists all of the brews on tap, but ask the bartender for help when you get lost in the sheer volume of beer names. 

The place has a funky and unpretentious decor, with large tables for sitting and chatting with friends. But let's be real... the main attraction is the incredible selection of Beers served on tap and in bottles, with rare and interesting selections from all over the world. It's also one of the few spots in SF that gets Russian River's epic Pliny the Younger when it's released once a year. 

Toronado has earned its reputation as one of the best beer bars in the Bay Area.
author: Seth G.

description: Bartender is very rude and forward about gratuity. There are other places near by you can attend,
author: Andrea S.

description: Huge beer selection. HUGE. I love coming here for a few brews then heading next door for artisan sausage. It's the  bomb dot com.
author: Margaret S.

description: Great hipster-ish divey beer bar. I was very lucky when I came here to meet an old friend for a drink on a wednesday and they were tapping a keg on Pliney the younger. We got to drink  some pliney without the 8 hour wait! awesome! but really, I'm a big fan of this place.
author: Aaron S.

description:
For a while this was my go to, neighborhood place. Due to some publicity it's become far too crowded to even hold a conversation. 

The beer selection is still enough to make Toronado a must see destination for any beer lover visting the area but I recommend coming here early, around 5-8 pm, and then heading to another bar before the beer tour buses start to roll in. That is not an exaggeration, it actually happens. 

I'm not giving this place 3-stars because of some hipster, it was so much cooler before it was big mentality. It's still A-ok because of the selection but half of the experience at a beer bar is being able to have a good conversation with your friends. Right now you can't do that at Toronado.
author: Amy L.

description:
Somehow, I've managed to completely overlook reviewing this place. It's exactly as good as the other million reviews here say it is, so I'll keep it short and sweet and just provide some Toronado-related tips and tricks:

- Most beers are $4-$6, most on the lower end of that, but note that even though everything appears to be the same price, the glass sizes are not at all consistent, so that's kind of how they can afford to sell you a portion of Angel's Share for $5.
- Disregard any reviews that have to do with service. If this place improved their service the beer would become more expensive. It is fine the way it is.
- The table situation may look really daunting, but there is a lot of turnover. Just be patient and you will get something.

Hooray, Toronado!
author: Josh K.

description: This place has a great election of beer. While the bartender was a bit short tempered (can you blame him?), he gave great beer recommendations. The place is packed shoulder-to-shoulder and their is loud punk music playing in the background, but oddly that is exactly what you want after arriving. Bring cash, but this place does not accept plastic.
author: Luis P.

description: Amazing beer selection. Friendly bartenders. Great music, reasonable prices. I can chill here all day.
author: Melody D.

description: Grungy and very haight, but the beer selection is great. This is a rock/metal bar (they played Slayer) but the crowd is well behaved. Metal fans just look scary. Also had a crazy weird bottle selection. You can bring food from Rosamunde next door.
author: Will D.

description: Beer selection is awesome here, music is great, bartenders are pieces of shit. Still worth a visit because really, you're not there to talk to the bartender - but who asks someone to stop table drumming during Pantera. For real? $4 barley wine & tap selection makes up for it but god damn what up hostile (pun intended.)
author: Melissa L.

description:
I wouldn't be exaggerating if I said perhaps our last trip to SF was solely to visit Toronado. Once my craft beer obsessed husband showed me, his craft beer obsessed wife, the draft and bottle list, our eyes lit up. When an friends art show happened to be coming up in the city, we didn't hesitate. It also happeed to be SF beer week the weekend we decided to hit up the city. Although we came in at the tail end of it, we still got to see a decent amount of great stuff.

When we first arrived, the place was packed. Well, what we thought at the time was packed. There were no free tables or bar stools. The draft list was wiped out. And it was barley wine day. We almost felt like bolting. But, we decided to stick it out and ordered a beer while standing. Once I finished my Belgian and my husband his Pliny the Elder, a bar stool opened up and we snagged it. Now we were able to be in the mix and talk with the bar tenders better (which is part of the experience in my opinion.) I noticed a large amount of Russian River taps and couldn't help but hide the excitement on my face. Without saying a word, the bartender had to let me down. That was all from Russian River night, none of those beers were available. Needless to say I was bummed. He showed me the bottle list which has a few impressive vintage bottles, but ringing in at about 50 bucks a pop I hesitated. I ordered something else and went on enjoying my time. Shortly, a small glass appeared in front of me and a smiling bartender. He (and who I am assuming the owner?) pulled a 750 ml Russian River Temptation batch 4 out of the cellar, opened it up, and split it between us. I was floored. To share such an expensive and rare beer solely to cheer up a sour fan was incredible to me. I thanked them and savored every sip. The beer was remarkable, by the way. 

By the time our other friends joined us and a few more brews had been downed, the place was even fuller than I could have imagined. Every inch of space was full. My head was swimming and my belly was full. 

If you have any interest in beer or craft beer, this is your mecca. We sat and digested every little tap and picture and memento on the walls and were astounded at all the rare items they have and have had. If only I lived closer....
author: Sheena M.

description: My favorite bar. You'll hate it. Stay away.
author: Jack J.

description: An amazing array of beer and a cool vibe.  It's a mix between hipster and grunge.  It's relaxed, the beers aren't very expensive, and they carry some really unusual and interesting breweries.  They open around 1130am so come here to get an eye opener.
author: Rebecca H.

description: So much beer! The selection is insane! Absolutely loved Blind pig, Valar morgulis, Wet'n wild.
author: Eva T.

description: What a freakin' shit hole. Piss and vomit permeate the air, bearded fucktards at every turn. What else is there to say, I really enjoyed this place. World class beer, great music, fun people. It's a beer bar and that's all it is. A must visit for any self respecting beer dork. I'll be back every time I visit the City.
author: David B.

description: Would be a 1-star if the beer selection wasn't so solid.  WORST service ever!  I don't write reviews often, but this bar tender was the most pretentious a-hole.  He knows he can be a jerk bc the beers are so highly sought after.  Bring cash and don't ask any questions.  Be aware that you can order half pours, because he will definitely not offer this information voluntarily.
author: Jesse S.

description:
Went here last Saturday and experienced the best on-tap beer of my life.  
We travel all around the coast and world to enjoy the best beers/pours, and the female bar tender here was the most experienced Beer-Aficionado I have ever met, she was more than knowledgeable, she was like a hot walking beer bible.  
By the 2nd pint I was hoping she would adopt me.  Seriously.  
Best dive-bar experience overall, ever.
author: Vanessa A.

description: Place as been my Heaven since the 90's, BUT stop franchising out to other cities - San Diego and Seattle. The other locations are ruining what makes the Toronado great - excellent beer, badass bartenders, divey, dirty, punk/rockabilly jukebox on volume 11. These new ones are just yuppie bistro feeling beer bars. There are enough of those in Seattle and San Diego. Lets lower the quality in your franchises and turn the music UP!
author: Lupolo K.

description: SF institution PERIOD. Best Beer selection in the city bar none. I've been drinking here for 20 years, I'm so glad its still around and hasn't changed too much.
author: c.t. d.

description: This is absolutely the worst experience I have ever had. I've been to bars all over the world and this place has the worst customer service anywhere. For no reason whatsoever, I was shown the door. I was shocked. I had about $50 which they did not let me take. I called the police and told them what happened but they said it is my word against theirs. They said I could take them to small claims but it probably wouldn't do any good. This place is not safe. San Francisco has so many nice places. Skip this place. If I could give the help in this place negative stars, I would.
author: Bupinder D.

description: The selection is unique and the prices are good. It's a good atmosphere and a very diverse crowd which is great! Also we got to enjoy our brats from next door here so it made the bar all the better!
author: Sierra M.

description: Great selection of beers to choose from.  I was able to grab a seat at their bar and had some good conversations with a few of the bartenders.  Love this place!
author: joe k.

description: Wow. Was watching the Giants game and saw a guy minding his own business get choked by a super drunk, older guy. The bouncer did NOTHING - apparently the attacker was a regular. Not cool at all. Never going back to this place.
author: Rachael B.

description:
Dirty, dive-y, and perfect.

Simple bar, amazing tap selection, and they even have happy hour.

I ended up here on a Monday morning during the holidays. This was our first stop on what was to become the best day of drinking in SF of my life. Pliny the Elder on tap for $3.50? Shut up. No way. Russian River's Pliny & Blind Pig first thing in the morning calls for absolute perfection.

Oh, and cash only folks. Get used to it. You're paying next to nothing for an impeccable beer selection.
author: Shanna B.

description: My favorite local hole in the wall spot.  The bartenders will remember you and are all super friendly.  They also let you bring in pizza or sausages from next door.
author: Lenni R.

description:
The first of many bars we hit up on my friend's 21st birthday, probably the only one I remember vividly and was impressed by.

Firstly, the sausage place next door (whose name escapes me) was terrific, right down to the New York get-your-food-and-get-the-hell-out attitude. We were then directed to take our sausages next door to a divey bar called Toronado.

We had a great time there with our beers and brats. Everyone there looked like they were from out of town. Standing room only, but we managed to grab a table and hover over that for a little while. The beer selection made me swoon, but I was careful not to hit the floor since my feet were sticking to it. I guess that gives the place character. Anyway, it was impossible to judge the staff on their service since the place was just full of twentysomethings and other lost souls, crowding the bar and creating that loud, roar-like TGI Friday's ambience. Again, character.

The bathroom was in horrifyingly bad condition, I refused to let my female friends use it, so keep that in mind. Other than that, nice little shady-looking bar with a good selection. And if you're like me and my friends, it's a great starting point for a bar hop.
author: Kyle B.

description: This is my favorite bar and with much reason. I've been coming here for a good several years. The last time I totally spilled a beer and felt like a shit head but they were super loving and wonderful. Treat the bartenders well and they will return more than the favor. The bartenders have great beer knowledge and are more than willing to share it with you. Be kind. You'll meet some great sf locals here.
author: Katie A.

description: I absolutely love this beer only/cash only bar. It's the oldest bar in San Francisco and it is TOTALLY worth it! Barley Wine Fest = Awesomeness.
author: Christopher J.

description:
When the Toronado in San Diego opened up, all I heard was "this is cool and all... but it's nothing compared to the OG Toronado in San Francisco." Because it seemed that Toronado numero dos had nothing on The T on Haight, I naturally had to stop in and see for myself. Maybe it's like the first time I had rye bread, sauerkraut or Bud heavy as a 12 year old (didn't like it at first... but grew on me over time), but I wasn't blown out of the water.

Sure, it has a cool dive feel and it's been around for 22 years, but I feel like Toronado in SD has a better vibe, more eclectic crowd and a better selection of beers. Unless there was a hidden menu or something, the draft selections on their beer board was about half the size of one in SD. 

Another thing that bugged me was the mood of the bartenders. I know they could care less what I think of them (which is part of the problem), but it just sucks when you ask a simple question, and the staff looks at you like you've got dick growing out of your forehead. C'mon, not everyone was born sipping Pliny the Elder out of their mom's teet... so cut some slack, huh?

I'll definitely be back, as I truly did enjoy myself... just didn't quite live up to my expectations off the bat. I'm sure that'll change as I get more acquainted with my new local Toronado.
author: Ruggy J.

description:
I am not a person that gives out ones.  I am making an exception due to how RUDE the bartenders were here.  We were done with the football game at candlestick and came over here to grab a couple beers.  Their selection is decent even for my friend from Seattle who is a beer snob.  

I came in with a PBR (leftover from the game and probably something i should not have done).  The bartender rips it out of my hand from behind and spashes it EVERYWHERE and over the other patrons.  All you have to do is ASK POLITELY to get rid of it and not be a total turd.  Kicked us all out.  We went across the street and had beer that was comprable and actually NICE BARTENDERS that know how to say please/thank you.

Toronado, you are NOT the only pony in town for great beer, get over it... you and your douchy bartenders!
author: Curtis C.

description:
You had me at "Double Bastard".

Toronado is a beer aficionado's dream. They have so many hard-to-find brews on tap from awesome breweries such as Stone, Port (oh Pizza Port in San Diego, how I miss thee), Russian River.... the list goes on and on! Ever try a sour beer? I never have, until last night. Looking for the hoppiest IPA you can find? You can find it here [Make bitter beer face here]. What's also awesome is that each pint (or smaller if you get some of the very strong brews) are generally around $4-4.50, which is cheaper than getting crappy mass-produced beers at most bars. Awesome!

Okay so the place is a bit divey, but I think that's part of the appeal of this place. You go there to sample and appreciate beer, and have a good time with your friends. No nice decor, dj, or lighting effects necessary!
author: Kazu O.

description: YUUUUS u have the Younger n all the greatest beers! I love the taps on the wall n when I run out of homebrew, u always have my back. Your crew is real awesome n u show the best games!
author: Alicia W.

description: Extremely unfriendly barmen. Looks like he hates his job and especially tourists! He was super inpatient with my friends and ruined our day. He was speaking to me like I am an idiot. Maybe I am not the smartest person and my accent is not perfect, but still it doesn't give you rights to treat me like shit. This is my last time in this place!
author: Maria O.

description:
This place probably sucks for anyone who is not a white male, or for anyone that enjoys diversity. When I entered the bar, I couldn't help but notice that everyone looked the same-all white men in their thirties with a grungy motorcycle look (which i'll grant is a good look but it was very noticeable to my female friend and I that we were the only females in that crowd). 

The bartender pretended that my friend and I (both female - and we were the only females there) did not exist despite that the bar was not too busy. We asked a man sitting at the bar to order drinks for us to see whether we were being ignored b/c we were women, and he was able to get the bartender's attention pretty much immediately, and without really trying. That was very disappointing to us, and especially to my friend who is very into beer and who had been looking forward to checking out the bar for a while.

Next, the bouncer, who had already ID'd us at the door, specifically came into the bar to find me and ID'd me again. I am 28 (turning 29 next month) and do not look like I'm under 21. However, I am half Asian and I can't help but wonder, being the only Asian in the bar, whether I was targeted because of it. I left immediately after.

I told my friend about the experience and he told me that he had gone to the same bar last summer with his friend who is Mexican. The bouncer told the Mexican friend that he didn't like him because he looked "sketchy." They immediately left.

Bottom line: This place has a great beer selection, but a pervasive sexist and racist atmosphere. Just consider that before you step in and support it with your hard-earned money.
author: Mia M.

description: Beer list = great. Bitch behind the bar = not so great. Her attitude was so bad it made the beer taste bad. 5th time in, worst service ever. I guess since we weren't local it was OK to treat us poorly.
author: Grayson D.

description:
I love toronado... Best beer at the best prices. The staff administer tough love; get that order fast cause everyone is waitin'. There twice a week! 
More metal on the Juke please.
author: Gregory C.

description:
In my opinion, here is what to expect when visiting this well known Haight pub. The Toronado is not a dive, it is just a dump. It doesn't deserve to be classified as a dive; it doesn't have the character or historical legacy of a real dive bar. Granted, it does serve good beer, if they actually have it. There is an odor there I have never experienced in any other pub, hard to describe, something between a dirty diaper and halitosis. Dress accordingly, as you will carry this aroma with you after you leave. 
The staff is hit or miss from hour to hour, day to day.The women bar keeps are generally funny and helpful, even with their apparent attitude. The men tap pullers are in a class of their own; they give the frequently encountered Haight-ful sullen, pretentious and mediocre customer service new meaning.  If it wasn't in the Haight, this place would only survive in Cleveland or Los Angeles. Regardless, I continue to return, just to enjoy a draft of Pliny the Elder and to remind myself how low a standard a bar can reach and still survive, if it's in the right location.
author: a.c. g.

description:
***Good***
Best draught beer selection in SF (Zeitgeist is probably larger, but def. not as quality). Also, has a sausage place in cahoots with it next door that (non-vegetarian) people really seem to enjoy.

***Bad***
Cash-only, lame. Usually crowded, and moderately dirty (but alas, such is a beer dive)

***Recommendation***
Ask the bartender, peruse their bottle list, and go during off hours so you can grab a stool.
author: Nick K.

description:
This place is beer-lovers heaven,

Don't s:
- Order stella, budlight, Miller, etc, etc...
- Said the music is too loud
- Try to engage in a learning experience about beer with the bartenders

Do s
- Open mind to try many different types of beer
- Check out their seasonal specials
- Read the board listing the beers
- Try one of their many hand pump beers
- Engage in a conversation with the Tamale Lady

Cheers!
author: Juan Camilo R.

description: I love Dive bars this place has decent drinks I usually end up at other bars due to it being crowded but when it's not over crowded definitely recommend checking it out.
author: Nirea S.

description: Awesome beers. And decently priced. Fun place. But can't the bartenders lighten up a bit? I know they are going for the whole "dive bar asshole" vibe, but sometimes a smile or two can make drinking a good beer more enjoyable. Anyway, you rock for the beers, but just because you are able to be an ass and still get repeat customers doesn't mean you should be.
author: Brian S.

description: Awesome selection of beer if you can yell loud enough at the bar keep
author: Fatty A.

description: An awesome place with a colorful bunch of People. The pleasant staff was helpful choosing Great Beer. We will definately come back to try one of the many beers you can choose from.
author: Carlo B.

description:
Outstanding beer selection. Good vibe for drinking, early and often. Plenty of room to talk with your group or someone else's. Sticky floor? I don't care. Crowded tables? No problem. Would I go again? Sure, though not my first choice on the block.

Empties and bricks strewn about? A bit surprising. They come with the territory at any popular bar, but after an hour? Um, I don't think you're doing it right.

Disgusting bathroom. I wouldn't recommend Toronado to any women with a small bladder. I've smelled few places worse, most notably in 2003, in an area of rural China where they didn't have modern conveniences....like electricity.
author: Mike H.

description:
What can I say about Toronado that 1233 previous reviews haven't covered?

1.  Not only do they have Pliny on Tap but they also have Blind Pig and Damnation
