Afterwards... headed over for some pizza as the Rosamunde Sausage Grill was closed.  Stood out on the haight eating some pizza with the buddies... good bonding and a great fricken night.
author: Vien C.

description:
Beers, Sausages, and a cool vibe..

One of the chill spots to grab a drink in SF. With Rosamunde Sausages next door, it is a perfect snack with the beer. They have a great staff knowledgeable of all their beers. The selection and price is awesome. The price is usually $6 - $8 depending on what you get. Usually foreign imports or rare strong beers are $8... 

Excellent spot to enjoy a giants game. Good local crowds and fun loving beer enthusiast enjoying the good selections.  

TIP:: Try to go during happy hour it is usually $1 to $2 off.
author: kent c.

description:
I love hitting up a drinking spot at 2pm on a Thursday, finding it full and Slayer going full blast on the jukebox. That alone would be worth of a five star review but it gets even better. The beer selection is as good as anywhere on earth and you can bring your outside food to eat along your beer.

Bring cash!
author: Jon K.

description:
Wonderful beer bar in the Haight. This is a tiny spot and it gets pretty cramped during the peak hours, but it's definitely my favorite place for beer in San Francisco. Good variety and very large list of superb beers with prices that are stellar for this city. You'll never find a beer on tap that doesn't impress you -- if you don't enjoy a beer that you get, it's probably because you're just not a fan of that style in general.

Some of the other reviews complain about the bartenders being rude, but I haven't had that problem. I have noticed one or two times when the bartender has snapped at someone else at the bar who was doing some minor but agreeably obnoxious thing (I think the guy was waving at the bar tender for a long time... just obnoxious enough for  the reaction to maybe be justified but just minor enough for it to maybe be unjustified). In general though it's far from being a visit to the Soup Nazi, and after 6 - 10 visits I never had any issues with the service. I would even say most of the bartenders are friendly... in their own unique way.

The only thing keeping this place from getting five stars from me is that it is dive-y enough inside for it to actually detract from the experience. In short, try not to get wedged near one of the bathrooms, and plan to stand for at least 75% of the time unless you go during slow times.
author: Josh M.

description:
You want beer? Come here.  Great selection, decent amount of space, and great drunk-food on either side of this place.  at around $5 a pint, the prices are good too!

The bathrooms stop this place for getting 5 stars...they are disgusting and the stench does ruin that area of the bar.
author: Laura P.

description:
OK, it's a little on the seedy side, situated in the Haight Asbury neighborhood of SF.  But, in terms of beer selection and quality, it is the west coast analog to The Gingerman.  Be advised that the bartenders have very little patience for indecision.  Know what you want *before* walking up to place an order.  Also, do not, under any circumstance, make the mistake of ordering a mass-produced beer.  You try to order a Bud (no they don't have it), and you mind wind up on the curb.  Hell, they'll look funny at you for ordering a Sam Adams or Sierra Nevada.

No food is served here, but you can bring in stuff from either Rosemunde's (right next door) or the nearby pizza joint.  We always get the awesome gourmet sausage sandwiches from Rosemunde's.  You go place your order, come back to the bar, they bang on the common wall to notify you that the sandwich is ready.
author: Bryce B.

description:
Huge-ass beer selection and delicious drunk food next door (that you can even bring inside to sit and eat, genius!)

-1 for the bathroom though. It seriously takes courage and breathholding skillz to survive one of those.

CASH ONLY.
author: Lisa W.

description:
Beers before a concert
hit the Toronado!

I've never been much of a bar connoisseur other than hitting the cool trendy spots to hang out looking trendy in flouncy tops and black cocktail dresses.  But as I've gotten older, I've been spending more time hitting dive bars with friends rather than making the appearance at my usual fave haunts (Redwood Room, Ozuma, Americano, W...) and I like to hang out in my t-shirt/jeans combo nowadays.

Toronado echoes this sentiment and the locals that occupy reflect the relaxed and happy people who keep their pints filled and the conversations flowing.  Apparently, this is the spot for all sorts of beers.....in fact, I felt bad about leaving a 1/3 of my Belgian $10 beer (good thing W and M were too happy to oblige in finishing it) but I'm not much of a beer drinker.  Yes, I admit, I'm more of a hard liquor kind of a gal.

During our course of beer consumption, we ordered and brought in dogs from Rosamunde's located next door and the place filled up quite quickly.  After my first several sips, my cheeks began to feel warm.  And having W as a literal backup to my sudden challenge with the Belgian, afforded me enough elbow room to lean on.

Cool bartenders, neat bar and great selection of beers.  I'd say this calls for major stars!
author: Miika M.

description: What is more perfect than a bar with just beer and tons of it.  Toronado has been around for a while and it sticks with what it knows best.  I love how they have so many different beer options and that it rotates all the time.  I've found some great beers here and never been disappointed.
author: Blake B.

description:
Reviewing Toronado is like reviewing The Godfather. Some people (smart people) will absolutely love it, some people (complete idiots, or prissy bitches) will absolutely loathe it. Then there will be the people who love all the wrong things about it and hate all the good things Coppola did. 

Well I'm going to try and be smart and love all the right things about Toronado. It is a dive. The place smells like bad Rosamunde Sausages and spilled PBR. The bartenders get impatient with you if you're a retard and will pretend not to hear you. And the crowd is definitely a mix of Haight stoners and old craft brew geeks. And the bathroom reeks of vomit and urine. But what is redeeming out of all of this? The tap list.

My boyfriend and I got to try the new Nectar Ales Black Xantus recipe, and felt so ballsy that we made crazy black and tans with Russian River's Blind Pig. I know they don't separate but blending the two tasted like heaven. Not many places offer great enough beer worth blending.

We had just come back from City Beer with a bottle of Midnight Sun's TREAT Imperial Chocolate Porter; lo and behold, Toronado had it on tap and it was amazing. Not often can we buy a bottle rated 99 on ratebeer and find it on tap in the same city.

I'm 100% behind Toronado. I'm sure it smells more the later it gets, but if you have enough of their amazing tap list, I'm sure you won't mind. What's there to hate about Toronado when you have Rosamunde next door, 10%+ beers on tap, and a lively if not slightly amusing clientele?

Word to the wise: Bring cash, and don't be surprised if you find someone lighting up their pipe outside.
author: Ana F.

description:
If you want to enjoy a beer and not get punched in the face by the bouncer, DO NOT go to Toronado. 

The Lower Haight crowd is not the rowdiest in my experience, but somehow last night turned into a shitshow Jersey Shore sequence. 

10 minutes before closing time, the staff started with the harassing. These men were a disgruntled bunch. Understandably, they wanted everyone out by closing--yelling at people to shut up and finish their drinks, a little dramatic. 

I will never understand how it happened, but somehow, the bouncer decided it was his duty to drag a guy out of the bar, get him on the ground, and start punching him in the face. what?!?!?!!?! The "last call" warning I'm more accustomed to involves turning up the lights, not assault. 

So to the toronado staff: Get your diva--tude out of lower haight and go find an mtv show to audition for. YOU SUCK.

Beer selection is good and all but the risk of being punched in the face, not worth it. Time to take those Rosamunde Sausages to Noc Noc instead.
author: Amanda R.

description: I keep coming back for the attentive service & Pliny the Elder on tap. Can't go wrong with either.
author: K K.

description:
Named after the classic automobile, this is no ordinary dive. It's exclusively a beer-oriented hole in the wall of Haight, and the answer to many prayers. During beer week I was lucky enough to drink Russian River's "Pliny The Younger," which sold out fast. I had New Belgium's sour red ale called "Love" (actually incredible) and a few other tasty rarities.

On any given night, this beer mecca boasts around 45 draughts, and tons more bottled selection.  Fairly inexpensive considering the quality and variety.

Go here and learn what real beer is all about.
author: David D.

description:
Is there a better duo or symbiotic relationship (yes I did just use that term) than Tornado and Rosamunde? Toronado is a beer lover's heaven and what better than to go next door to Rosamunde order some awesome sausages and eat them while drinking great beer! 
+10 for the barleywine festival madness that takes place during SF Beer Week. 5 Stars all the way
author: Mike K.

description:
We were recently in SF for the day and decided to recreate Anthony Bourdain's Layover San Francisco.  So we decided to stop in here and give it a pint, or 2.....

Total dive bar in the heart of the Haight.  A huge selection of beers on tap at reasonable prices.   I'm jealous that I don't have a local pub like this near home.

Another plus, the smell of sausages cooking on the grill next door at Rosamunde's.
author: Stewart B.

description:
The beer selection was great, and I loved the decor, but as other reviewers have noted, the staff need to refine their shtick.  You're working in a fucking trendy bar frequented by hipsters, not a biker gang clubhouse.  

The irony of this place is that, for a joint that markets its extensive beer selection, you *might* expect the bartender to offer some guidance or recommendations.  The place was virtually empty when I went in (a Sunday night), and I asked the bartender for something "amber or dark and not too hoppy".  He gruffly responds, "well do you want amber or dark?"  I say, "oh, you can pick."  His response:  "no, YOU have to pick."  

Thanks, that's helpful!  I mean, I could understand if the bar was three people deep at the wood and I asked, "Can I have a highball?"  But c'mon, the place was empty.

I just don't get this whole "asshole chic" where it's somehow cool to be a douche.
author: A S.

description:
Great beer selection.  I always judge an establishment by how many of their beers I haven't had before.  On this current trip, I was loving this place since I hadn't had about 60% of the beers listed.  I had the Monkfish Trippel and the Green Lakes Ale by Deschutes, amongst other beverages.  Both were pretty darn tasty.  It is also nice being able to bring in food from other places next door.
The bar could use a little bit of a makeover; it has that quintessential "dive-bar" feel.  The one in San Diego is much cleaner.
author: Cole M.

description:
I highly recommend NOT coming to this average beer joint if you:
1. Don't look like a dirty hairy hippy/biker
2. Plan on looking at the list of beers for more than 5 seconds before ordering
3. See that the bartender is "overwhelmed" with orders
4. Don't enjoy being demeaned by bitter old bartenders
5. Don't think the lingering stench of spilt beer and bowel movements is appealing
6. Don't have cash
7. Don't like to tip bartenders who insult you
8. Don't care for, now get this oxymoron, elitist, self-important hippy bartenders that judge you by your appearance

In short, this place would be great if they had even ACCEPTABLE, AVERAGE service, but unfortunately for them, they have the rudest bartenders and general customer service I've ever experienced. My experience at this place tops the often rude (but impersonal--they don't actually insult you) service from Chinese establishments (and I'm Chinese!). 

I normally don't want throw food or drinks at the person serving me, but when I went there, I wanted to dump the stout over the idiot bartender's head, throw the glass at his head, then throw my cash in his face. 

As for the beer selection--it's nothing you couldn't find elsewhere in SF or even BevMo for that matter. Save your money for the awesome hookah lounge down the street, Kan Zaman.
author: J C.

description: Best beer bar in the city. Get a sausage at Rosamunde and bring it here. Great times guaranteed.
author: Amanda K.

description:
The Soup Nazis of beer. If you don't order "correctly", you won't be served properly, or served at all.

I went here twice on my recent trip to SF, both in the afternoon around 4-5pm. The place apparently stays busy at all hours with regulars.
The first visit was uneventful. My friend ordered one round for us. We drank the round and left. It was a quality German hefeweizen. One extra star.

I returned a second time with a different friend who loves beer. After I looked at the beer list and made a decision, I got the attention of the bartender. I was standing behind a row of seated customers, so I moved to the end of the bar so as not to shout over their heads. (it's loud in there)
When I got to the end and tried to order, the bartender yells, "are you gonna stand over here or stand over there!?" I was caught off guard by this, thinking I could stand wherever I wanted within earshot. I glanced around to see regular patrons cracking smiles, as I'm sure they're used to tourists receiving a hard time. Well, enjoy the show! 
Since I'd now forgotten the name of my selection, I said "my friend wants to taste something." My friend leaned in and said he wanted to sample "Pliny the Elder". The bartender brings over the sample glass then promptly gets out from behind the bar and walks off. The other bartender follows suit.
..... !!

I never got to order anything, but at least my friend got to taste his.
We decided to leave when a couple minutes passed and it was obvious we weren't going to be served.

Speaking on their selection, they do have rare and local beers, but I've seen way better selection at bars in Austin (Draught House). Exclusivity doesn't make beer any tastier for me, sorry.
   I didn't recognize but two or three names out of their entire beer list, and if I'd asked the bartender questions to guide me, he most likely wouldn't have helped because I'm not a regular or I don't already know everything there is to know about beer. 

 If being belittled or berated for beer is your thing, this is the place for you.
author: Mike L.

description: I currently live in San Diego and have never been to the Toronado down here.  I enjoyed the sardine-like atmosphere at the SF original on a rainy day.  Game 6 of the NLCS 2010 to be exact.  Instantly I was confronted by the bartenders' sass, which was good.  Their convo broke me out of my ho-hum, 'the weather sucks' attitude.  I started off with North Coast Old 38 Stout and followed up with Russian River Consecration and Allagash White.  It must have been happy hour because the pints of stout and white were three dollars.  The Consecration was six.  After some friends arrived, we headed across the street to another bar with more televisions.  Other than the lack of teevees during the playoffs, I loved the place.
author: Darren S.

description:
the perfect bar for beer enthusiasts !  no joke.    never have i seen a list like that at the prices unimaginably low.   No BS barkeeps, rockin music.. people just mellowing the hell out. 

cant wait to go back everytime when i'm in town.  fuk-a-Monk!
author: Armenoid B.

description:
LOL
Love this place, sure brings the truck driver in me to play.
There are pieces of toilet paper scattered on the floor, an average of five chicks at any given moment (they don't usually stay long unlike me), the guy at door has a super poker face but will tell you his whole life story if you lit a cigarette next to him (the short one with the cane and a black hoodie-I think it's his uniform, never saw him wear anything else).
The beer selection is just Muah! (all the other adjectives are taken by all the other reviews. I'm just leaving an interjection).
author: Bea L.

description:
I will preface this review with the fact I was dragged here by my boyfriend who is a beer geek.  I only ordered a Red Bull due to the fact they had a terrible selection of ciders (1 cider total) & I do not like beer.

The Staff.
There were 2 bartenders, both female, one was the middle-aged owner's wife & the other was a younger girl.  The "nice" words that come to mind about them include "disgruntled" "bitter" "crotchety" "rude" "distasteful" etc.  The only two words that could truly describe them start with a "B" (the girl) and a "C" (the owner's wife)

We got all but one drink from the owner's wife.  She made rude comments about most of the customers (some to their face and some after they left), insulted me for being young, and charged people she didn't like the looks of substantially more than others.  
She also was on a high horse, going on about how they invented draft beer, are the best bar in America, are best friends with every brewery on the west coast, are super famous, etc...  

The Bathroom.
This is the 2nd worst bathroom I have ever been to (the first being Pyramid Brewery, see my review).
It was the size of a telephone booth, with rude comments all over the walls, smelled like an outhouse, and there was urine all over the place.  Perhaps they should put a port o potty outside--it would be a vast improvement.
author: Sally L.

description:
Even though I know the consequences (beer belly), I'm more of a beer guy than hard liquor. For a person like me, this place is a great place to come by, have a beer, and hangout. While it can take very long to grab a beer, it gives you time to decide which of the many options of beer to choose from. Once you decide, compete for the bartender's attention with the other folks trying to buy beer. If you finally do get a chance to order, it'll be served in its particular cup/glass/mug for you to enjoy with your friends.

Overall, this is basically a bar that goes straight to the point. Nothing flashy or chic about it, just a great place to have a beer and hangout.

Oh yeah! This place is cash only! Bonus points to you if you brought your sausage from next door to eat with your beer.
author: Jamie M.

description:
My favorite place to grab beer in this part of town.  Huge selection from all over the place and all served in the correct silly special glasses. As it is a bit of a beer snob place and it's in SF it's understandable bartender might be a little snooty.  And there was an asshole bartender there, who refused to give more than one word answers describing the beers.  For someone who can afford to sample all the beers, cool, but for those of us on a little budget it's nice to know what we're getting.  It's one thing if it's busy but if they're sipping their beer right next to you you'd think they might be down to discuss it a bit?

So in summary amazing place but why do they employ at least sometimes jack ass bar tenders to work on slow nights who won't discuss the dozens of beers and is an ass to customers who don't know him besides.  So  unless I want a specialty beer i'd go somewhere else now cause normal beer is cheaper other spots around especially during happy hour. all in all great place for the occasional specialty beer
author: Matthew M.

description:
This place rocks just as much as the sausages next door.  There is nothing better than picking out a delicious and unique beer and enjoying a sausage to go with it.  I am a big fan of specialty beer places in SF, and was pleasantly surprised when I tried Toronado this weekend for the first time.  This is a beer lovers paradise.  I was not disappointed with either the on-tap or bottled beer selection.  It was very thought out and luckily I was very thirsty... two nights in a row.  

Some folks call this place a dive bar, but with the specialty and high end beers I don't feel as though it fits into that category.  If it were a dive bar then you'd have drank Miller High Life or Coors Light- not a Quadrupole from Belgium or a micro-brew from Timbuktu.

I have to give this place 4 stars for one reason and one reason alone... they don't accept credit cards.  I hate carrying around cash or having to pull out a whole bunch to order some of Toronado's fancy beers.  What year is it anyway?  Maybe next time I will bring a checkbook to see if that is a valid form of payment.   Add credit card and I will gladly add a STAR!

I would love to recommend some beers for you to try but don't want them to be all gone before I can get back there ;)
author: Ryan S.

description: Terse orders, pints deeper than they seem lead to needing pockets as deep as Bourdain and a back room session at the bean-shaped table adds up to what I could do every day for ever. No matter the throngs & no matter the even bigger weekend throngs, they believe in beer & they serve it straight forward. From neighborly sessions with regulars to the dervish of a man who orders the Duvel magnum, "two glasses," & shares it with his new best friends, we should be proud that this Best Beer Bar in the World is right here, and there's no pretense in how you prefer your pints.
author: Jon A.

description:
This is probably my favorite beer bar in SF. The best selection of beers and amazing prices. The staff may not be overtly friendly, but they're always been willing to field any questions I have about new beers and give me a taste. What else could you want? 

Go to place for Russian River beers (or any local Norcal beers) as well as a standout Belgium selection. Even got to taste the elusive Pliny the Younger during beer week last year. And definitely check out the Barleywine Festival - cannot be beat. Be prepared to go early, stake out a space/placemat, and sample some crazy strong beers. 

And of course, being able to bring in outside food - so great - especially when there are so many great options closeby.
author: Julie L.

description: Stopped by here real quick after a friend's recommendation. Great selection, great prices, no frills. Got exactly what I came for (Pliny the elder on tap!) and left satisfied. Will definitely come back when I'm in town.
author: Cecelia S.

description:
I may be a little biased since I met my boyfriend here 6 months ago but I'd like to think that despite that I'd still love Toronado. This is an epic spot for beer lovers; they have ridiculous amounts of beer on tap, most of which I've never heard of. 

One of the cool things about Toronado is that you can grab food from one of the multitude of restaurants in the neighborhood and then plop down at their bar and have a beer with it. I always see people scarfing down on grub at one of their many semi-spacious tables. 

P.S. Rosamunde Sausage Grill is right next door and it's a must-try. Burgers on Tues. are AMAZING.
author: Julia N.

description:
Found this place on Yelp when I went to San Fran with my boyfriend.

This bar has a great live atmosphere and the beer selection is incredible. So many to choose from.

There is not a lot of seating and this place always seemed to be packed.


The only downfall is there is not a lot of street parking and parking on the streets is kinda expensive if you plan to stay awhile.

We even went to another bar after this one and came back b/c the atmosphere was perfect.

Highly recommend
author: Carina P.

description:
I love Toronado. They have an awesome beer selection that changes regularly, and the prices are great! Even better, $1 off beers during happy hour, too. And you can bring in food to eat while you drink, my favorite options are Rosamunde next door, Memphis Minnie's across the street, or Ali Baba's shawerma a couple doors down.

Some whiners bitch about the bartenders. It's pretty simple: if you're patient, and nice to them, they'll be nice to you.
author: Teo W.

description:
I'm not much of a beer person. (dodges tomatoes and eggs) Wait! Wait! Let me explain!

Anyways, I'm not much of a beer person, but even I managed to find a beer here that I love! Pomegranate cider, mm mm delicious! So, even if you're not much of a beer drinker, have no fear, they'll find you something you can enjoy. If you are a beer drinker, well, caution to you my friend, for your beer belly will grow large and round if you visit this place too much.
author: Rachel H.

description: I can't believe a place with such bad customer service is still in business. Go here only if you want to be treated like a complete jerk. I accidentally spilled a beer on my gf- the bartender offered to replace my beer but I was helping dry off my lady. When we were situated, I asked the bartender about the beer, but he said I "had ignored him when [he] offered it and now the offer is expired." Blown away by this response, I told him I was busy helping my gf and wasn't ready to order another beer - but now I was. He said I was "so drunk" that I spilled beer all over the place and that I "should have the balls to buy [my] gf another drink." After this, I made my way out and was 1. Called a "self entitled little prick" by the bartender on the way out and 2. Literally PUSHED out the door by the bouncer.  What a joke. If anyone acts "entitled" it is the bartender at Toronado. What a joke.
author: Cameron S.

description:
fucking old washed up beer snobs in their 40s running this bar !!! rudest bar tenders ive ever has the displeasure of ordering a drink from .. not only do they ignore you if you dont look up to par ... once they do finally take your order .. you get some remark that makes you want to smack a bitch open handed !!!!!1 
I dont care that you have beer from Siberia !!! go fuck yourself with that bottle !!!
author: Micah W.

description:
I am a brewery girl myself, I wavered between 3 and 4 stars here because the beer selection absolutely rocks, huge selection of winter seasonals which I haven't tried. However, bring your loud voice with you to talk over the whole bar, and I unfortunately had to use those bathrooms--bad,so very bad. (beware- of -seat- herpes bad)
Luckily we had our tour guide buddy to warn us not to ask the bartenders anything except for your order. They bite
need a beer, this is a good place
need the rest: atmosphere, room, cleanliness. that is elsewhere (Magnolia?)
author: Breezy M.

description: A sausage fest with a side of Pliny. What more can a chick ask for?  Service is always great despite the crowd. Parking is a bitch....and they only take cash. Yet, Pliny! Good vibe. Well worth it! Cheers!
author: Shi T.

description:
Terrible RUDE hideous service

I came here once and asked for a Hefeweizen beer. The bartender aggressively asked "which one" and I said "what have you got" and then he unintelligibly mumbles 4-5 kinds. I couldn't understand a word. When I asked him to repeat, he aggressively shouted the names at me. If it was not because my mate had already paid for his own beer, I would have left right there. 

I came again yesterday, to give it another try. We were ID'd at the door. The guy was extremely rude. Then we go to the bar, and the bartender ignores us for like 5 minutes. This time I did leave before getting a beer, and instead went somewhere else.

Never again.

They have a huge selection of beer. That's the only positive thing. Other than that, it's a loud, smelly, dark place, with some really unpleasant service. 

Go somewhere else, the area is full of nice cafés and bars.
author: Leon S K.

description:
Great beer selection. It is a relatively cheap beer selection for what they serve. It's a good place to grab a beer with friends. Being able to bring in food from the surrounding area is also a plus. 

It would get 5 stars, but too many other people also like it and the crowds can be a bit much on weekend nights.
author: Jeff L.

description:
On my first visit to Toronado I couldn't get over the stench of spilled beer and. . .well, let me not spoil your appetite.

But maybe that first time was a fluke because recently I returned and no stench. And really good Hefeweizen. And Hoegaarden too. 

I sense that I'm not quite rough and tumble enough to fit in here at night, but at lunchtime, I do okay.
author: Miriam W.

description:
Great beer selection. The husband loved that. But the service was below par. 

Made eye contact with the Bartender & he ignored us. Got service from the other, no problem. Asked the 1st bartender a question & again got ignored. Not sure what his problem was. But definately  not recommending this place to Anyone, Ever.
author: Susy G.

description:
I know I know people are going to hate me. This place is only OK in my opinion. I mean yes there is a large beer selection and yes the drinks are relatively cheap. But it's cash only, the beer selection is large but doesn't always have something that wows me, no bar games (pool, darts .. nothing), has surly bartenders and is overall cramped. Such spaces don't appeal too much to me. I won't ever turn down a trip going here as I guess there is something to be said about the experience of it. But I still can't say it's my favorite bar. I still remember the one time I asked what's new and what would you recommend, I was told, "They are all good now what do you want?" WTF? 

I have come here for the Barley Wine Festival now two years in a row and I have to say, that that is my favorite time to come. It is an experience then. The beer selection is at that point great and has such a wide range that it does wow me at some point. There is no time to chit chat at such a point but at the same time I have never experienced shoving so many people into such a cramped space. Sort of gives me the thrill of being at a concert except with no live music and distributing large amounts of alcohol.
author: Greg G.

description:
Have I seriously never reviewed Toronado?  WTF?

To be completely honest, I probably don't have anything to say that hasn't been said before.  They have a ridiculous rotating selection (40 taps?), including many unique and hard-to-get offerings, so if you're going here, you should really go out of your way to try something you haven't had before.  Also, try the hand-pump casks if you haven't; that's some damn tasty shit.

Now, it must be said that Toronado is not Bourbon & Branch.  Fantastic beer selection aside, there are some divey aspects to the place.  First, cash only.  Second, don't flag down the 'tender until you either know what you want or are prepared to provide him or her with useful information about what kind of beer you're interested in.  They're happy to help you decide if you give them something to go on, but as many have learned over the years, they will not stand there & wait for ten minutes while you hem & haw about it & ask for descriptions & tastes of half the menu.  There's just too many people behind you who know what they want.

Finally, I would be greatly remiss not to mention Rosamunde's next door, who has some of the finest sausage on offer in the city.  A unique spot that attracts an interesting and varied crowd, but for certain, an SF experience not to be missed. :)
author: Angela B.

description:
My Favorite Beverages:  
- Lindemans Framboise 
- Two Rivers Pomegranate Cider 
- Dogfish Head Festina Pesche 
- Dogfish Head Punkin 

If you are a beer lover, you must come here.
author: Mariel F.

description:
best beer selection.

music can be loud, but it's part of the charm.

next door: Rosemundes sausage, also a perk.
author: Stephanie F.

description: Great beer selection. They get Pliny the Younger here in Feb. Almost comically surly bartenders. That being said you are at a dive bar people, not a fancy cocktail lounge. Don't knock it for the service or the atmosphere. Go to Maven. You'll be happier there.
author: Eric W.

description: If I could  go zero stars I would. Rainy day, San Francisco, wanted to play darts, got to this dump, no dart board, even though that's what it claimed it was. Day bartender asked "what do you want to play darts for?". Lousy overpriced beer, and a smartass day bartender who was totally insulting. What a dump, don't waste your time. Also it smells it here.
author: RJ J.

description:
I get the allure of this place- especially for beer lovers. For those of us that don't, however, consider ourselves experts in all things beer, this place can be a bit of a bummer. Once you finally get the attention of the bartender, you're likely to get a short, rude response such as "can you NOT read the menu?" should you ask a question such as "I prefer a dark IPA, what do you recommend?"
Aside from that, I'd also like to share that we had a friend visiting from Austria and we were all crowded around a standing table. The place was PACKED and there were a lot of little pushes and shoves going on. BUT- the BARTENDER came up behind my friend, shouted "MOVE!" which took us all by surprise- then proceeded to grab his arm and SHOVE him into our group of friends. Just a guy, standing there minding his own business chatting with friends gets MANHANDLED by this bartender. He wasn't causing any kind of trouble whatsoever.Not even joking. We were shocked and we left within minutes. 
I can get good beer almost anywhere- I'll never come back here for it.
author: Megan B.

description:
Cash only.  You'll probably have to shark a seat.  Make sure someone hasn't tied their dog to it, and that it doesn't smell like barf.  If you're not put off by these things, you might be in for a fantastic beer-drinking experience

As my husband put it, it's just one of those places that you either get or don't get. It's a cheap neighborhood bar with no table service, grumpy bartenders, and an amazing beer list. You can bring outside food - many people had sausages from the place next door  - and you can bring your dog. You can go there if you're a tourist, but it's pretty clear that the bartenders would prefer that you didn't.
author: Elizabeth E.

description:
The old ugly bitter asshole bartenders ruin this place.  Don't waste your time.  Stay away.
Assholes-Assholes-Assholes-Assholes!!!!!!!!
author: David C.

description:
Perfect haven for beer lovers or anyone looking to escape from reality for a bit. 

Bring cash, Be nice, and Grab some eats over at Rosamundes. 

Get there by 5ish to grab a seat, and a couple pints before happy hour is over. ($1 off pints)

Definitely ask the bartenders for advice on choosing a beer from their amazingly wide selection, these people know beer. 

I LOVE the Russian River brews. 

Yes I'll keep coming back for more, even if I do get a big ol' beer belly!

TIP WELL and you shall be rewarded :)
No joke, they bought us a round!!!
author: Elizabeth W.

description:
I wandered in here after bay to breakers, it was crowded, but it was tolerable. There was a doorman keeping the completely wasted people out, which was nice because people were still tripping into me.

I like the ambiance of this place, super casual, lots of beer, encourages drinking. Can't really compete with that!
author: Analisa S.

description:
This place is FUN!! Their beer selection is prime.

It can be very difficult to get inside and order a beer when it's busy, but that comes with the territory of high demand... c'est la vie.

Sometimes it smells bad and is full of creepy old men, and the bathrooms are GROSS.  But, I can easily brush that aside, because it is pretty much a dive-bar, and every time I have come to Toronado, I have had a GREAT time and been surrounded by happy people.
author: Dubby D.

description:
This is my favorite dive bar in SF.  This a place for beer drinkers who are there for only one reason: to drink.  There's no food, no fancy bar, the decorations are old beer signs, bottles, and bumper stickers stuck to everything.  And chances are the rock or metal will be playing so loud you won't bother trying to make a conversation.

However, the beer selection on tap is terrific!  They also have an even better selection of bottles, but you have to ask for the list.  I would give this a five star ranking in the category of Dive Bars, but I just don't believe that a Dive Bar can earn that fifth yelp star.  So, sadly, I have to give it 4 stars.

Tips: (1) it's CASH only.  (2) bring a sausage from next door.
author: Bill W.

description:
If the lower haight's not your local watering hole, here are a few pointers:

*don't come here & expect to have a decent conversation- intermittently played random metal songs will make sure that you can't hear what the person next to you is saying
*cash only folks- don't expect to start a bar tap on your $4 death & taxes
* this is not a good date spot. I repeat, this is not a good date spot
* it smells in here, if you don't care..  more power to ya

Yes the beer list is great, but I still think Monk's Kettle has a superior selection!
author: Chrissy L.

description:
I have to say, I find Toronado's recent 5 star reviews extremely suspicious. 

I live in the neighborhood and work as a bartender so believe me that I was really hoping Toronado's would be my local bar. 

Never in my life have a been so turned off by a bar's negative atmosphere. Not even a good beer selection, pleasant company or kick-ass sausages from Rosamunde next door can light the way through the dark cloud of nastiness strewn by the bartenders. You just don't want to line the pockets of those people or the management that continues to hire these people. 

I'm a friendly, chill person, so you can believe it took a lot for me to write this. Each time myself and many friends went to this bar we chose to give them the benefit of the doubt and approached it blank slate. And routinely, without fail, we met with piss poor attitudes of the waitstaff. A helping side of RUDE is what you'll be served here. And maybe you like that if you are into S&M and  stuff.

You know, I get being bummed out when you are at work sometimes. But bringing it to paying customers also looking for a break from the difficulties of normal life is just completely thoughtless. Am I the only person that hopes for thinkers in this country? I think we can balance having a good time with some thought.

So I choose not -  
and better I do so I don't dilute the type of company that enjoys that atmosphere. After all misery loves company.

I'd even suggest to tour book companies to remove this bar from its listings. I'd never want San Francisco or America to be portrayed in this way.

Given the fantastic selection of bars in this town I'd suggest going somewhere else.
author: Jackie G.

description: My favorite bar of all time. They always have tony of good beers on tap and steady supply of Pliny the Elder. Can't go wrong with this place
author: David W.

description: I absolutely love this dive bar!  Another place that has a great selection of hard to find craft beer.  I really enjoy the location and ambiance.  The inside is very cool and has an area close to the bar that is lively and busy and a more private area around the corner that has enclosed booths.  I really enjoy the more private area so I can actually hear myself talk.  They always have blind pig and pliney on tap, which is always a plus.  They seem to switch their boards up frequently so you can try new and different beers on a frequent basis.
author: Lauren M.

description:
here's the drill

1) you get a sausage from rosamunde

2) head over to next door to toronado for a drink (yum, death and taxes)

3) enjoy both at the same time while admiring the collection of beer taps handles and chatting it up with your friends, the bartenders and those drunk dudes at the end of the bar.

4) optional: head over to three twins ice cream for dessert - assuming you don't have dessert at home ;) ;)
author: Arlene H.

description:
05.29.10

Toronado.  It's just something you have to feel for yourself.  SF as SF can be.

The Tamale Lady gave me the invitation to her birthday party when she waltzed in.  Though I don't think I'll be cool enough to attend.

Tons of rare beers on draft.  Definitely helps if you're a beer connoisseur, which I am definitely not.  It's like a foreign language.  You piece together the one word that you vaguely recognize and then hope for the best.

I stayed safe with the amber ale.  My friends dared venture into the stouts.  We tried the peach ale.  We tried the blonde.  They were all good.

Cash only, definitely a bummer.  Plenty of shady ATMs down the block, though.
author: Jenny L.

description: I love beer, I really do. I also love a salty bartender, but one who is salty in a kind way. What I don't love are dickhead bartenders giving me attitude when I have done nothing but sit down and had some laughs with my friends. You are bartenders at a place with a lot of beer, you don't work at the Queen's palace. Loosen up and try being a decent human being. I will never come back and will tell everyone I know to avoid at all cost.
author: Sheila B.

description: I only started drinking beer about 8 months ago. My first night in San Francisco, my friend brought me here. He lives about 5 blocks away. They have a large beer selection and Tad was working. He asked what kind of beer I liked and then suggested Russian River Damnation, which was good. I also had Green Flash Russian Red Rye (not for sure if this is the exact name). That was pretty good as well. Honest, you go in here, know what you want and pay up or the bartenders will get annoyed with you. It's a bar, not a five star restaurant. Make sure you've got cash on you. Have some beers, perhaps a shot of Underberg, and stumble home.
author: Melissa A.

description:
Toronado Management:You always had it right... you kept it simple and  focused on the beer love. 

I have patronized your bar for many many years... and have watched with amusement as the bar changed over the years... but I can't hold my tongue any longer... these tools you have serving.... you have GOT to do something about the bartenders. They are offensive and rude to your customers!!! You have hired a bunch of idiots. Really.
author: Nomad I.

description:
i don't understand the yelp complaints about the bartenders. Mayeb if you don't act like an ass you won't get treated as one? I asked about a couple beers i hadn't heard of, and received answers and recommendations from the bartender! wow. imagine that.

armed with some sausages from next door, we closed this placed down. 'cause that's how we live! well, when we are on vacation. usually i'm in bed by 10:30... 

for the beer selection and bartenders - 5 stars, haters.
author: D. M.

description: 5 stars minus .5 for the fucking wretched stench, and .5 for scraggly ass patrons who need a god damn shower.
author: Rich L.

description: Came here before our dinner reservation at NOPA to check out the place. It is as divey as it can get. It does show the sports game on the only TV in the place, so that's a plus. The drinks on their menu are between $5-$6, with lots of options. Service is fast. Limited seating, especially if you're here with a group. This one douchebag took up a whole table by himself, when there were single seats at the bar. There's a whole back room to hang out. It's actually pretty easy to miss if you're not specifically looking for it. There's plenty of other options around if the place isn't to your liking or becomes too packed.
author: Phan H.

description:
You either feel welcome or not at this place -- and you will know if you belong right away.

If you can pass the test (its your own test) then you will have access to the best beer collection in Northern California all on TAP and FRESH.

Some bars may have a ton of beer taps but guess what that keg has been sittin for weeks waiting to be finished.  At Toronado they go through kegs like water, so you know whatever you order will be fresh.

I've read the reviews about walking in looking like a corporate stiff and being barked at but that's a bunch of bull; I've walked in with shorts and flip flops to full on coat and tie and I've been served with no attitude.

Show respect to the bar staff and they will pour you a generous pint.

Cheers!
author: G R.

description:
I love beer.  So I wanted to love the Toronado.  The beer menu left nothing to complain about - more things on tap than I've seen pretty much ever, and it changes all the time.  And prices are quite reasonable, especially early in the afternoon when draught beers are discounted.  The place pretty much reeks like a dirty frat house, but I feel like that's part of the experience - it's a bar, after all.

Toronado lost a star from me, though, because the bartender was such an ass.  I understand you get the same questions all day long from a bunch of folks who don't know enough about beer to know all the things on your very extensive menu, and this is no doubt tiresome.  But at 3pm on a slow afternoon, don't bite someone's head off for asking a couple questions.
author: Amanda M.

description:
I had great beer here!  The had Pliny the Elder, one of the tastier beers I've had.  

Come here for the beer, but don't expect to find a place to sit.  It's pretty crowded at night.  Come with cash!  They don't take plastic.
author: Spenser C.

description: Five words: Pliny the Elder on tap.  Really, what more could you want?  Oh, an entire board full of wonderfully delicious craft brews?  Well, look no further, because Toronado has that, too!  Can't ever get enough of divey beer bars like this.  The only reason it's not getting a five is because I could barely move, which only upsets me because it leads to spilled beer more often than not, and I simply cannot handle that kind of alcohol abuse.
author: Chelsea A.

description:
Someone please offer that hag of a bartender a job elsewhere.

Preferably at a chuck wagon.

She is profusely bigoted and a vile woman in general. 

Just scroll down to the plentiful reviews that excoriate her. 

She is a disgrace to this otherwise fine establishment.
author: Bridgetta R.

description:
Incredible beer selection, good prices, unbelievably disgusting bathrooms, ridiculously crowded.

Sounds like a decent beer bar to me.
author: DH H.

description:
EDIT:  What I love about Yelp.  When you read absent-minded and downright idiotic reviews from people like Danny G (above) you can always click on their profile and be vindicated that yep, this guy has no taste whatsoever.  

Everyone who lives near this block is lucky.  I have to reserve half-days everytime I come up because I know I'll be spending maybe 3 hours sipping as many pints as I can and then another 1 hour going back and forth from Rosamunde's for sausages next door.

Singlehandedly one of the best selections of beers both on tap and in bottles, in the entire bay area.  Order something you haven't heard of.  I recommend trying at least 2 beers on tap (make at least 1 from Russian River brewing) and ordering a bottle of some delicious Belgium ale.  

This is the kind of place where if I lived nearby, I'd be sporting MAJOR beer belly easily within a few weeks.  And you know what?  It'd be totally worth it.
author: M K.

description: Fun rowdy place to have a beer. They have good Hefeweizen thats really tasty. People at the Bar are funny and friendly. The only icky part is the bathrooms, they need to do something about cleaning them a few times during a busy evening. It was disgusting, with piss and vomit everywhere, hose that fucker out if need be. Put a drain hole in the floor and just hose it and tip some bug killer down the loo.
author: Madrone H.

description: GO HERE. they literally know more about beers than any bar I have ever been to. they have to have had over 1000 beers come through their door (evidenced by the amount of taps on their walls) and they know about almost every single beer they have on tap. the husband and wife team are super friendly and usually can be found at the bar conversing with the customers. this is frankly just a super cool dive bar and nothing more. which is exactly what you want after a long trounce around town.
author: Dr. Chim R.

description: My husband and I stopped here on our California honeymoon beer trip. It was one of the  "must stop"  places on our list. we heard mixed reviews so weren't sure what to expect. The tap list was amazing. Even better then we anticipated. One of the complaints about this place was poor service. We had great service. The server was super nice. He talked to us for a while and offered advice on the beers. If we didn't have so many places on our list of beer stops, we would have totally went back.
author: Cara I.

description: Wow. so many beers, so many loud metal heads. Good selection, jarring vibe. I thought the place was three times as big with the noise going on. They were playing really loud and fast punk music, which would have been fine a few notches lower. Did I say great selection? Every table we tried was sticky. So i just cleaned one
author: Shannon D.

description:
This is my first-ever Yelp review. In fact, I created an account specifically to comment on all the passive-agressive whining I see here, not to mention all the victim-cards being played. I've been going to Toronado off and on since it opened in 1987, which is about 20 years before Yelp became popular. I have personally witnessed a few of the interactions which resulted in 1-star reviews here, and in each and every case, the reviewer would have you believe that they were not in any way at fault, let alone acting like jackasses or douchebags (or douchebagettes™). In fact, I usually make it a point to look on Yelp to see the rather entertaining and predictable "I was just quietly drinking my beer when the doorman beat me up" stories the day after some incident.

Someone whining that they had an open PBR they brought in off the street snatched from their hand? LOL!!! The girl who whined that she got carded "just for sitting at a table"? LOL!! And the people who play the tired, well-worn race card saying "it's mostly white people in there" or implying that white people (whatever that means) somehow get better service? LOL!!! The fact of the matter is that I don't think I've seen a more ethnically diverse crowd in any bar in SF. Please put down the crack pipe...

Here's an example of fantasy vs reality. A month ago I was sitting at the bar near the  front corner. Two young ladies were sitting off to the left a bit. One of them curiously goes to the middle of the bar to order and returns to her seat at the bar (turns out she left no tip). When they finish those beers, the second girl goes to the middle of the bar, also leaves no tip, and the bartender rather calmly and in a friendly tone said "gratuities are accepted". One girl starts making a scene about how the bartender was "yelling at her and pounding his fist on the bar demanding a tip", and he was basically laughing at her utter absurdity and pointing out that he was actually being quite polite and conversational - which is true, I was right there! Finally she played the "poor college student" card, at which point he said "you could buy a 6-pack and drink at home if you're that poor".  I actually laughingly told the girl closest to me: "Be sure to 'Yelp' about how much this place sucks"...Sure enough, another one-star review the next day (3/26/12). LOLOL!!

Why am I leaving one star? Because Toronado basically sucks! It's racist! "Ghetto doorman" (talk about racist, LOL) might beat you up! They'll rudely card you for "just sitting there"! They will rudely confiscate booze you sneak in! They will make you leave after last call even though you still have beer in your glass! Oh, the humanity!!!
author: David B.

description: Great atmosphere. Great beer selection. Great restaurants nearby. Only negative to this place are the semi-rude bartenders. A little attitude is worth it though.
author: Christopher W.

description:
This is among the best bars in the country when you average in beer selection, price, vibe, and the good times i've had there while in SF.
Happy hour prices are head shakingly low...and the No Cal beers there can't be beat. This is in my top 5 nationally.
author: Matt T.

description: I might just be resonating the same theme as other reviews but they have a great beer selection. I always a appreciate a place who carries belgians. Definitely your neighborhood dive bar. Be warned, there is an old "scoorge"-like man bartender, just know what you want and don't ask too many questions, he has no patience. Other than that, they have good happy prices and it was fun with our big group to sit in the back. I ran over and grabbed a DELICIOUS sausage at rosamunde. You can order a sausage and bring in back to the bar, great partnership!
author: Rose N.

description: Definitely a local spot on Haight that may not be tourist friendly. It's cash only with a bouncer that looks like he's fine to tell you to just keep it moving if he's in that kind of mood. The crowd was a mix because good beer draws everybody, and it was definitely crowded. Not sure I got the true vibe since I went around 4:00 on a Monday. But I liked it enough to try it again. Definitely a great mix of IPA's and a couple of Hefeweizens for you wheat lovers like me :-)
author: Channa P.

description:
Oh Toronado how you complete me. Your essence, your badass vibe, and your massive selection of microbrews alone have made a fan outta me. 

Tough, tattooed bartenders who are super cool and friendly. Great prices. Cash only. Awesome policy which allows patrons to bring in Rosamunde sausages or Mythic pizza from next door. You can't beat that.

I wish this bar remained a neighborhood dive and didn't get so packed on the weekends, but life ain't perfect. I still take my out of town friends here and they all do the same exact thing - stand below the giant menu looking bewildered, impressed, and thirsty while trying to decide on their first beer.

I can't wait to go back. It's been..2 months! Toronado is hands down one of my favorite bars and hang out spots in the city.
author: Patty L.

description:
A fat asshole bartender with a ridiculous hairdo who was pissed off that the Renaissance Faire wasn't until spring decided to take it out on everyone who wanted to order a beer but didn't know exactly what they wanted.  In short, the fat hobbit beer nazi yelled at some nice couple next to me that wanted beer advice and then snarkily told me (on the day that New Belgium was having an event at the Toranado during beer fest) that they didn't have any New Belgium products and he was pissed to have to serve it because "its not popular in San Francisco."  Um, yeah, Fat Frodo, that's why every freaking bar in SF carries New Belgium's Fat Tire on tap. 

A bar full of people not enjoying themselves despite drinking really good  beer.  Nary a laugh from any table but ours in the hour we were there.

Fuck that.  Fuck the Toronado.  Stay home and drink yourself to death with antifreeze and you'll have a better experience.

Oh yeah: Best Beer Selection in town MY ASS.  Try Church Key, La Trappe and/or the Alembic.....

....that is, unless you have a masochistic Frodo fetish.
author: Michael H.

description: This place smells weird and not in a good way. But the beer selection was quite impressive. So will I go back? Absolutely!
author: J C.

description:
This is a "Manly-man's" bar.

Come here in the afternoons where the crowds consist of mainly locals and there's always a space on the bar to order up a beer.
author: Lisa R.

description: Toronado is one of my favorite bars anywhere, and in particular a beer snob bar.  It feels like a couple places in Amsterdam that I like to go for good beer.  They have a great selection of drafts that are constantly rotating, and the staff is quick to pour a pint if slightly gruff.  The atmosphere is lively and while slightly snobbish and local-centric, not uninviting.
author: Dave N.

description: Place is great, been here many times, but this review was from last night.  I was asked my ID like EFFIN three times.  Once at  the door.. fine... But same dude asked me again twice in the span of one hour while in the bar.  STOOOOOPID!   I dont even look close to being under age.  My friend too was asked... he has grey hair coming out of his nose! ....   I understand that they might of had issues in the pass, but CMON!  BE REALISTIC! Are they just doing this to piss people off???????!!!!!
author: Demanding T.

description: High quality beer bar. The selection is high class and unique. The bartender's recommendations were excellent, though it took a while to get his attention. Seems like cranky bartenders are a standard in these style of places. Good music, nice atmosphere. Get a sausage from Rosamunde next door and bring it in!
author: D C.

description:
I LOVE THIS BAR.

Toronado smells like pee and beer-- the way a dive bar should smell. The place is relatively clean-- I never have to hold my breath when I'm in the bathroom, so that's a plus. BTW-- there's another bathroom in the back room too.

The staff is on point- they're not ignoring you, they're taking orders in the order that people came up to the bar. They know their beers--- if you give them what you normally like, they will suggest something that you will love. 

The beer is cheap and they are ALWAYS changing their menu. There are usually a few hand pumped beers. It's a good way to get to know your microbrews.

If you're hungry, they don't serve food, so grab food from one of their neighbors and let them know you'll be eating it at Toronado. I suggest the sausage place next door--- sausages and beer, you can't go wrong!

The people that come into this place are usually super-cool. A lot of San Diegans hang out here, which makes it feel even more like home :)
author: Mar A.

description:
People usually describe me as friendly, helpful, patient, and optimistic... 

The bartenders at Toronado, however, think I'm rude, condescending, and snobby. I know, because they actually told me. (extra star for honest feelings-sharing)

But I don't believe them because it was: 
Friendly of me to buy a round or two for my friends...
Helpful of me to ferry the Rosamunde sausages back to the table
Patient of me to suffer through ordering a second round

and I'm still optimistic that I'll feel the same way that other people feel about this place.... someday....
author: Razoo D.

description:
Great beer, great environment.

One caveat: this place is a relic, and you need to know what you're getting into with the menu. If it is your first time going, have an idea of what kind of beer you are in the mood for, the draft menu on the wall isn't 'user friendly' at all if you don't know a ton about beer. And while most of us would like to think we do, we don't.  If you can't find something on the wall, just ask the what they have on tap that you shouldn't miss.
author: Trent R.

description:
Although not a brew pub this place carries a lot of craft beers on tap; if my home was in staggering distance I would have made the attempt to sample ALL of them.

The place gets quite crowded so be prepared to have fun conversations with your fellow drunkards.
author: vinh t.

description:
Toronado (I always accidentally call it Turbinado) has tons of beers on tap (duh) but they're really reasonably priced, and you can sample a couple before you pick one!

Bartenders are very nice, and the place just has overall good vibes. You can bring food in from next door, and although it can get pretty loud, it's a great place to bring friends.
author: Alyssa G.

description:
I am ever so grateful to my PDS for taking me here years back and then I am even more grateful to be able to share this place with my fellow beer lover Jeff V. 

If you appreciate some fine stouts, ales from around the world, lagers and damn good pints...just go here. Don't even waste your time, this place is great. I recommend knowing what you want to drink before you go in, the bartender has been the same every time I have been there and he really doesn't have any patience. 

Cheers, seriously CHEERS!
author: Christa A.

description: Incredibly rude staff. We will never return. When asked "What IPA do you recommend?" Got "read the board". As soon as we finished our drinks we were told to order more or get the hell out.
author: Carolyn P.

description: Cool little dive bar in the height they have a good beer selection and nice tables to sit and chat with friends. I would give it more stars but the staff is not very friendly at all.
author: Michael W.

description:
When did Toronado become such a pickup scene?

I've always seen it as a good pub to try an obscure pint of beer,  and that's the reasoning behind the last couple of visits for my roommate and I. 

I still haven't quite mastered the ability to choose a quality beer there (usually I choose the one with the funniest name and it winds up tasting like armpit) so I wind up grimacing as I wash down something unsavory. I then resign myself to the fact that I will probably just be boring and live off of Anchor Steam for the rest of my Toronado days.

However, upon visiting the joint on Saturday night, we were approached by no less than four men interested in the charms of my lovely roommate. (Apparently I give off a "I'mtakenleavemealone" vibe.)

Actually, wait.

I've changed my mind. This is a good thing. The men who have hit on her have all been attractive in the grungy hipster sort of way, and have taken her on lovely dates around the city. I don't miss being single, and these aren't my types of guys as it is, but oh man, if I had a thing for smart beer-drinking men with beards, Toronado would be heaven.
author: Devon S.

description:
************PLEASE READ******************

Toronado is plagued by under-trained, unprofessional and barbaric personnel.  Barbaric is usually not a term I'd use to describe the staff at friendly neighborhood pub, but when they physically man-handle their customers, I think the term is all too fitting.

My friends and I were having a conversation around drinks at Toronado when suddenly the bartender starts yelling at our table across the room because our designated driver was resting at the table.  Of course, after such a rude disturbance we were all alert.  The bouncer then proceeded to come to our table and demand that we leave immediately.  When we civilly tried to understand why we were being ejected, the bouncer aggressively jerked one of us from his chair and forcefully charged the another person out.  I believe this is assault and am investigating legal recourse.     

With that said, I truly do hope that this place cleans up its act, but I believe it's important to raise awareness of their deplorable business practices.  I honestly believe we were unfairly profiled and harassed.  Future customers beware...no beer is worth this type of awful service.

***********************************************
author: E M.

description:
Hate to say it, but I choose my city's Toronado (SD) over the original.  It's true.  SD"s Toronado is the classy lady you take home to the family who can give a mean bj, that's how awesome she is.  The OG Toronado is way skankier; she still gives good head, but she's not much to look at and she also smells of piss.  And that ain't a good thang.

Whenever I go visit my brother in NoCal, we try to hit Toronado up.  It is a vastly different experience from the one in SD.  The last time I went a couple of weeks ago, I tried the Valley Brew Red and the Iron Springs Epiphany Amber, both delish.  Rosamunde's was awesome and we went on a Tuesday, so my brother got their fantastic cheeseburger (they only serve it on Tuesdays).  Watched some kick-ass World Cup and the servers have always been chill towards me; I've never felt any attitude like I've heard others mention.

Still, it is way more divey, cramped, smelly, etc.  Still an awesome beer bar, but SD's got better.  I personally would rather go to Zeitgeist in SF than Toronado since they have plentiful outdoor seating.
author: Brendan Jude L.

description:
This place is awesome if you love beer and don't mind noise.  They have an extensive beer menu and loads of beer on tap, more than any other place I can think of in the city. 

They get bonus points for not minding if you bring in outside food, in fact there is a really good hot dog place next door and everyone usually see a ton people at the bar eating one. 

I cant say much else, other than this is simply an awesome dive bar.
author: Amir K.

description:
Toranado without Rosamunde would be like day without night, Haight without Ashbury, per without fect.

The setup is simple: a beer bar - just a bar and some tables with stools and lots and lots of beer. I think you can get other drinks, but why would you?

The process is simple:
+ order your favorite beer (or experiment a little)
+ go next door to the Rosamunde Sausage Grill and order a sausage
+ return to the bar and wait 6 or 7 minutes - enjoying your libation 
+ return to Rosamunde and specify your sandwich dressing and pay
+ return with said item to Toranodo and enjoy your feast
+ order another beer

This place is cool. It's not trying to be anything but what it is. I know its a damn dive bar and I gave it 5 stars: A) That's what I thought when I was there and B) I'm easy to impress.
author: J T.

description: The hype is right... this place has it going on.  They have a great selection of taps and rare brews that should satisfy any beer snob.  The vibe inside is eclectic, with some interesting old beer posters, tap publls and you just might meet some new friends and share your opinions on the different brews.
author: Dan M.

description: If there is one thing I find truly blissful and indulgent in life, it's an old, dirty, colorful dive bar--even better if dogs are allowed-- and this one I'd heard was iconic. I think I found more selection of beers here than any other place in my couple of visits, and some I definitely hadn't been able to find in majority of bars in Colorado, my beer-obsessed homeland. I could have stayed here and watched games for hours.
author: Lauren C.

description:
This place doesn't have any good beers like Coors Light, Miller Genuine Draft, Budweiser, or Pabst. I mean, come on dude, what the hell?!

JUST KIDDING, OBVIOUSLY!!!!

Well, they really don't have those beers but THAT'S A GOOD THING. Toronado is a beer drinkers bar. No hard liquor or wussy beers sold here. Bartenders are awesome and don't take any sh!t. Know what you want to order before you get asked. Don't ask for suggestions either - well unless you go there a lot and you're familiar with the folks who work there. Shot out to Stu.

Besides the gigantic selection of quality micro-brews, this place has a sweet deal with nearby restaurants. You can buy food and bring it into the bar. Plus the Tamale Lady comes by a lot. Some yuppie places don't allow that. This is anti-yuppie.

So if you're in the mood for a real Frisco beer bar, go here.
author: Mike B.

description: I was really skeptical based on all the reviews of terrible service but I am very pleased to say that the bartender was hella awesome. The beers on draught, EPIC!! The wet dream of every beer lover. A must visit fo sho.
author: Reese F.

description: I love this bar. I really do.  But this place needs to be closed for a day and thoroughly cleaned. I am far from being a clean freak, but the place stinks.
author: Anya Z.

description:
I was told there are only three really great beer bars in SF and this is one of them. And after a week of plenty of wine and dive bar well drinks, I was really craving a nice pint. (Hm...I fear this review begins to sound like the ramblings of an alcoholic!)  

Me and two of my mates grabbed a spot at the bar. Stu was bartending and completely good-humored about our oft off-colored convos...also a good sport about us calling him "Stu-ey." 

I was looking to try a local beer and Stu gave me a taste of Damnation: guess I'm going to hell 'cause I loved it!

Good music, good crowd, great service. Caveat? The bathrooms. C'mon SF! My lips to Gods' ears; every single bar restroom I've visited in your otherwise amazing city was like half the size of a closet and covered in piss. Do all your men pee while jumping around to the Cha Cha Slide or something??
author: Christina G.

description:
I'm leaving one star because I don't have the option to leave negative stars.  What a shithole this place is.

We have a bar like this in Denver called the Falling Rock.  The selection is better and it isn't served with a side of gigantic asshole.  The bartender (and I'm a bartender) was extremely proud of himself and took it upon himself to tell me what I could and couldn't do with my camera.

I understand the whole attitude thing to a point but you'd think this guy was a local celeb the way he treated people.  Honestly, there's no reason to go around treating people like trash and then expect a tip when all is said and done.  I still tipped because I wouldn't be able to live with myself if I didn't.  However, upon calming down I should have left my beer on the bar and gave the tip "go fuck yourself".

After reading the reviews, I can tell you this.  These are not bartenders.  They are a bunch of monkey's that sling beer to an eager crowd that thinks this is a "dive"  This is not a dive and those aren't bartenders.  What a load of shit.
author: Brian G.

description: Best draft selection in the city. Old school crowd. Great place to avoid the yuppies downtown.
author: Benjamin B.

description:
Wow!  Did you see that girl?  What an amazing pair of pints she's carrying if you know what I mean!

Really.  Beer.  This place has an amazing set of taps including several hand pulled taps.  

Hand pulled.  Beer taps.

They really know their beer, and the prices are great.

As for the girl, she's too busy making out with some hipster to notice I'm checking out her pints.  

Maybe I'll grab one and she won't notice.
author: Theron L.

description:
+: awesome beer selection
+: barley wine festival (come early and prepared)

-: overcrowded, avoid weekend nights

will come back for next year's barley wine festival and possibly a few times in between.
author: Tammy T.

description:
Awesome selection of beer. I enjoyed Pliny the Elder from Russian River (great beer if you like IPAs).

The bars itself feels pretty divey, but there is a good crowd of people and it's pretty laid back.
author: Ben B.

description:
Disgusting, filthy, dark bar. 
Needless to say, i had an amazing time in there watching a World Cup game with my fiance and a bunch of guys, stuffed in the back room with barely any standing room let. Super great beer selection that will keep everyone happy.
author: Lisa K.

description: beer snob jizz fest, blah blah, blah, beer selection, blah blah blah, great, good for you. Fine bar, just annoying stuck up attitude from everyone, its just beer, relax hipster, dont have to correct me, im gonna be ok
author: Peter S.

description: Dive bar in the Lower Haight  = YES PLEASE!  This came recommended to me by a bartender at another pub I visited, and did not disappoint. Brought home a souvenir t-shirt for the boyfriend. Will def be back if (when) I come back to San Fran.
author: Alison Q.

description:
Beer lovers rejoice!  Any place that once had Pliny the Younger (a seasonal triple IPA from the Russian River Brewing Co)  on tap gets 5 stars in my book.

Ok, so it's cash only, the bartender was so surly that I was scared to look him in the eye, let alone ask questions about the beer, and it is usually insanely crowded (even at 4 o'clock in the afternoon).

But did I mention they had Pliny the Younger...on tap?!  Their beer selection is phenomenal, especially considering the prices. Plus they have cask ales, which are a pretty unusual offering.  They also have coasters that double as seat-savers (the backside says Gone to Pee) when you have to use the restroom. Brilliant AND hilarious.

Having Rosamunde's next door only makes everything better.  Fantastic beer + spicy lamb sausage=awesomeness.
author: Sara D.

description:
This place is just OK. My friends like it a lot but I'm not sold. Probably great if you like trying different beers (they have like 40), but its usually really overcrowded. You can bring food in which is cool, and I believe theres even a tamale lady that comes around. 

Heads up: they ONLY serve beer, and only take cash
author: Darren O.

description:
Brought here by a friend who promised to show me great beer in SF and I was not disappointed. We spent *hours* here.

Great beers, updated regularly, served by a bartender who could be mistaken for surly, but actually just expects you to know what you're doing, and is therefore... efficient with his words. No food to speak of *in* the bar, but the sausage shop attached to it is aces, and the owners clearly have an understanding.

Try something you haven't had before. Don't tell me you've probably had them all, I've had a lot of beers, too, and I promise you'll still find something new. If it's quiet, talk to the staff, they know everything.
author: Johnathan N.

description: Great beer selection but all the bar tenders are super snobby. At ease soldiers, you work at a bar.
author: Ben H.

description:
Officially now one of my favorite bars...anywhere...

Stopped in on a work (shhh!) trip to sample some west coast brews and was not disappointed.  We stopped in around 4 which was perfect as the bar wasn't crowded at all.  We were also pleasantly surprised to find that everything was a buck off for happy hour.  I mean, seriously, I would have paid twice as much as the regular price just to sample some of these legendary beers!  

There were three or four Russian Rivers on tap and also two or three of the NorCal cult favorite Moonlight.  I found the bartender to be extremely helpful in helping me make the most of my 30 minutes at the bar.  

I can't express to anyone how great this place is and anyone visiting San Francisco, especially if you're not from the west coast, should make it a must-stop.  Oh, and try to sausage spot next door...grab a sandwich and eat it at Toronado's!
author: Perry H.

description: This place is panic-attack-inducingly crowded, and the bartenders are straight up jerky. Good beer list, OK, but it's 2012! Craft beer is everywhere, and there are a lot of places where you and your friends can drink Deschutes and Russian River  without having to worry about being squashed by 282394904 aspiring beer geeks or harangued by a gross John Waters moustache. Not worth it!
author: Julia N.

description:
This place fucking rocks.
I love beer.
My friends love beer.
There's nothing but beer here.
(Also thanks to Toronado for making my birthday completely memorable...and totally forgotten)
author: Lauren S.

description: A dive bar.  Very good beer selection.  Craft beer.  No crap on tap, as the saying goes.  They don't sell food, but you can order from the place next door.  I'm not a sausage, hot dog fan, but,  my husband ordered the sausage with habanero. They delivered it to us at the bar, and it was good.  Fresh bed, good sausage, tasty. Even better, the craft beer selection was very good.  Toronado is a beer bar.  A GOOD beer bar.  If you're looking for food and a Bud Light, do not stop here.
author: Denise C.

description:
During SF Beer this place is CRAZY crowded.  I was practically sitting on someone else's lap!!!  Until of course they opened up a secret back room.  I KNOW RIGHT an entire section with tables and chairs and what not, too bad you still have to goto the main bar area to order a drink

Bring lots of cash & don't be scared to double fist beers.  You don't know how long it'll be till you get your next one.
author: Danny T.

description:
Toronado is definitely a Mecca of sorts for us beer guzzlers.  I was impressed with both the selection of beer as well as the moderate prices. The night I went it was rather packed, and according to a friend it was nothing compared to the crowds that show up to the barley wine festival.

The bartenders were friendly, and although available seats were nearly impossible to find, we managed to find a sweet spot at the bar. Drinking good beer and talking about Horror B-Movies with the bartender was a solid way to start a Saturday night. The crowd was also a nice change from the types that many San Francisco bars tend to attract.

Only criticism is that the bathroom was one of the most horrendous I've ever seen. I don't know why people even bother going to it  at all, since it appears that people will just piss where they stand once they shut the door behind them anyway. Seriously, don't touch anything.

But a nightmare of a restroom will not stop me from returning for a couple of pints. I do recall favoring Death & Taxes, particularly. I also encourage going for the happy hour to enjoy the discounted prices and plenty of seating.
author: Katie S.

description:
Don't all beer drinkers have a little bit of beer snob in them? I know I do. I'll take a tall glass of craft beer over Bud or Miller any day-- which is why Toronado rules-- if we're talking on a strictly beer only basis. 

Ok, so Toronado may have jerk bartenders-- but in all honesty, did you really come to Toronado to hangout with the bartenders? I sure didn't. I came here on the last night in SF with my bf and we were in the neighborhood, thirsty for some beer. It was an unusually slow night there and we were able to grab a table close to the front of the bar. I know that Toronado is a mecca for beer variety but I lamed out and only drank Anchor Steam. Not the best beer on the roster, I'll admit, but it's not bad. Had I not eaten such a large dinner previously, I probably would've stuck around and drank more. 

Overall, it was a pretty uneventful night there-- not a great place for people-watching, just beer-guzzling. We hung out there for about two rounds and dipped. I would definitely come back here to see what they've added to the rotating list of beers on tap.
author: Laura L.

description:
I am currently a waiter, and I used to work at a beer bar very similar to Tornado with many unique beers. Tornado has a fantastic section at reasonable prices.

I have been in the early afternoon many times and had a wonderful experience-- the bartenders were happy to suggest a beer and pour something new.

The last time I went was on a weekday. The bar was full, but not two people deep like on a weekend. I asked the bartender what kind of Bitter Ales they had. I had had a really nice Bitter there a few months earlier, but couldn't remember the name. I had seen on the menu that they had Twist of Fate from Moonlight Brewery, but I was hoping to try something new. The response was "are you kidding me?" with a gesture to the large board that lists all the beers (but not the style of beer). I just want to know why bartenders like to be jerks for no apparent reason. 

5 stars for beer selection
-3 stars for jerks
author: Cody W.

description:
My first attempt to go to Toronado was during SF Beer Week in 2009 for the Barleywine Festival.  Big mistake.  The crowds were out the door and Rachel F. and I opted to head over to Mad Dog In The Fog.

Second attempt wasn't until more recently with Andrei Z.  It was a busy night but enough room to stand near the bar.  This place is dive-y, no doubt.
