I probably don't fit the mold of the regular but I definitely enjoyed their selection of beer.  The great thing about Toronado is the fact that they have so many beers on tap for reasonable prices.  The bartenders were friendly enough and we enjoyed our drinks.  That being said, it was very loud in there so conversation between a group would most likely lead to a slight yelling match.  It also stank of piss near the bathrooms but for some, that may just be a part of their charm.  

I'll no doubt end up back at Toronado but cheap beer prices only goes so far in my book.  I'd much rather have a comfortable place to enjoy said beer and pay a bit extra.  If you feel the same, check out City Beer Store.
author: Melanie N.

description:
Sorry Toronado, but I'm downgrading you from a 5 to a 2, based on your crappy attitude.  I know you're busy, but that doesn't mean that you can be a bitch to my brother when he asks you "What IPA do you recommend?"  Look, just say "I don't know," or pick one at random for all I care, but don't say "Can you read?  No seriously, can you read?"

I understand the concept of a soup-Nazi, but the fact that you pull a lever over a glass for 5 seconds and hand it to me doesn't make you God's gift to the world.
author: Corey C.

description: One of the coolest pour houses in the country! The mix of their selection of drafts and being in the heart of one of the coolest streets in America (THE HAIGHT) makes this place a must stop in for anyone who visits SF and loves a great selection of freshly poured beer!
author: Anuj P.

description:
[Girl walks up to bar, orders 4 beers coming out to $21 bucks, leaves bartender a dollar tip] 

Bartender: [gives her the dollar back] No fuck that, that's like a 25 cent per beer tip. 

[Us sitting at the bar, laughing at the absurdity and of said girl and balls of said bartender] 

I must say I quite enjoy this place. Good for hanging out with friends and having some great beers (Russian River wdupp!) without killing your wallet. Got pretty crowded on Saturday night, but we showed up early and three of us were able to snag seats at the bar. Love that you can bring in food to snack on. 

Honestly, the bartenders aren't that bad, just know what you want, speak up when you order, and tip reasonably. 

Oh, and to her credit (or urging by her friends), she found two more bucks and left a three dollar tip. Confused girl, thank you for providing us with some quality entertainment for the evening.
author: Penson L.

description:
I'll try to keep this brief as 100 Yelpers have already said what I am going to.

This is the best beer bar I have ever been to. It is the best beer bar anywhere in the Bay Area. 50+ incredible craft brews on tap, with another 50+ bottled in the cellar. You will never run out of brews here that will blow you away... This is THE BAR for good beers and lots of 'em in The City. Go during the day for a laid back experience eating delicious Rosamunde Sausage and brews, go at night for a more crowded dive bar drinking experience. 

The only problem is that some weekend nights bunches of trendy yuppie douchebags calling each other 'Bro' invade the place as they stand in everyone's way with their chests puffed out and heads leaned back, being a royal buzzkill. Anyway, the bartenders are great guys and very knowledgeable (Tony's the man) It's hilarious watching them give shit to morons who come in and try to order some crap like MGD, Bud, or euro macros like Stella and Pilsner Urquell. Get a clue.
Go to Toronado. Experience what some really great brews taste like, you certainly won't be disappointed. (Pliny The Elder... Yum)
author: Aaron J.

description:
The beer selection here is as amazing as the sausage selection next door.  Both places are divey and cheap.  Love it.

However, don't try the pomegranate cider.  My friend and I both ordered it, independent of each other, and we both didn't like it.  It was way too sweet.
author: Jeanne L.

description: Awesome pub, though no food.  The sausage place next door is an excellent companion.  Legendary beer selection, give it a visit if you can.
author: Patrick S.

description:
Best beer selection in the Bay Area, hands down.

I tried to count how many taps there were the first time I was there, and it's something like 44 or so, not to mention about 4 more on hand pump, which hardly any bars in this country have.  Worth trying one if you're there.

So, yeah...nearly 50 A-level brews...about half or so are regional, like Russian River and Bear Republic, but I remember seeing a Dogfish Head Palo up there once, among others.  Really well-balanced selection...from pilsners to IPAs to Tripels - everything I had there over the course of about 2 years was absolutely fantastic.

The Cash Only policy ends up providing light entertainment by way of watching all the squares pull out their Amex cards, only to have that deer-in-the-headlights/Norma Desmond gaze after the bartender shows them a picture of Johnny Cash flipping them the bird. ;)

Oh, and as mentioned, you can grab eats from Rosamunde (which is right next door) if you're hungry.
author: Bryan M.

description:
Pros: 
-Good selection of unique beers on tap that you wouldn't normally find at other establishments. Good place for beer snobs and people open to trying new things.
-There usually always people here during the night and it's a happening place on weekends.
-Typical hipster joint.
-It's connected to the restaurant next door so you can order food while inside the bar, that's pretty cool.

If you've been to Haight before ignore below the comments and maybe add two stars, because these is expected every where you go and you're probably accustomed general attitude of the area.

Cons: 
-Cash only.
-Ridiculously loud music, which you can't really hear everyone around you is shouting.
-The interior area isn't very big and it's pretty much standing room only on the weekends.
-Gets ridiculously crowded at night/weekends.
-Disgusting bathroom. Expect urine/feces to be everywhere!
-Pretentious vibe from most of the staff, bartenders especially. It's the hip thing now I guess instead of offering good services or educating your customers.

TIp: When ordering beer, know exactly what you want well ahead of time otherwise the bartenders will be dicks about it, hell if you take longer than 5 seconds to give them a tip, they'll give you that look like you're wasting their time. I was confused at some points I wasn't sure if I was the customer or if he was the customer. I ordered an item and the beer was all out, however the beer tap wasn't covered so to me it looked like it was available and all signs indicated that it was. Bartender looked at me like I asked him the dumbest question in the world before saying they were all out and moving onto the next customer. I then had to wait many minutes before I got serviced. Which was unfortunate because had he been a better bartender and covered the beer tap or scratched it off their list of beers like any semi decent bartender would have done, I would have ordered a beer that wasn't tapped out. It's stuff like this that rubs me the wrong way.

All in all I've experience much better dive bars and really aside from beer selection there's little reason I'd come here at least at peak times. The Toronado in San Diego was a far more positive experience and way less trashy.
author: Naramie N.

description:
Our friends took us to this place to see what all the rage was about.  For beer selection I give them 4 stars, but for seating availability I give them a 2.  But the fact that this place was packed on a Tuesday night really is to their credit - they must be doing something right, but that being said, I don't like to stand and drink my beer in a crowded corridor.  So sorry, I'm givin' ya 3 baby.

So parking was a nightmare, SF, what of it, I know...  I'm guessing they had about 25 beers on tap, tons of bottles, and even some ciders.  Giants game was on, of course, and evidently you're allowed to bring in food from the neighboring restaurants.  

Bring your sharpie so you can write some random shit on the wall in the bathroom.  I was hard to pee straight while reading all the random stuff written on the wall.

If I knew I had a place to sit, I'd go back, if not, I'd steer clear.
author: Terran O.

description:
The Toronado on Haight?  Freaking kewl place to go for beer!  50 taps or some number?  They have 3-4 beers on hand pump!  If you love beer and live within 500 miles of the Toronado, then you suck if you don't Beer Pilgrimage to this Beer Mecca!

Prepare thee for the snarly beer tender and protector of the gates.  As if to timid you are, you are  than not worthy of the blessed fermentations contained here-in.
author: Moses M.

description:
Great beer, friendly barstaff with stellar beer recommendations and whom are hobbyist brewers, lots of tables, beer, beer for cheap, fantastic cheap beer. 

Specifically, flemish sours, cask beer, Russian River, Sierra Nevada, Dogfish Head, Chimay...beer far and wide. A beer for all seasons.
author: Alan F.

description:
I have been to Toronado several times and it has never been a pleasant experience. The last time I was there sealed the deal: never again will I set foot in that inhospitable, pretentious stink hole of a bar. 

If you want to get barked at by the bartender and served flat beer, this is the place for you. 

The bartenders think they're god's gift to beer. Do you really expect a tip after you belittle and talk down to your customer multiple times in a matter of seconds???

Want a wide selection of microbrews? Go to Zeitgeist. 

Want a couple of great brews on tap *and* a sausage? Go to Gestalt.

Want overgrown man-children spewing contemptuous beer snobbery at you? Go to Toronodo.  

Once again, the Mission hands the Lower Haight its bratty ass.
author: Umami C.

description:
Smells like a dive bar, which makes it feel a little more like home. The beer selection is quite overwhelming, in a good way. It's a great chance to try out a bunch of new beers.

As I said in my other review, pair this with a couple of Rosamunde sausages and you've got yourself a happy tummy.
author: Kim L.

description: Decent beer selection, interesting atmosphere, unlikeable staff/service. Coming from the PNW, I've patroned many bars, breweries, and brewpubs. This place, compared to the vast majority of those, was disappointing. The bartender behind the counter was a total douche. I waited in line for a little over ten minutes and several times he skipped over me to take orders from guys around me (yeah, it was noticeable). When he finally looked my way, I literally glanced at their tap list for two seconds to make sure I remembered my order (since it had been SO long) and he turned away and helped yet another dude. This had me so frustrated that when he looked at me again and I vocalized my order, I made the mistake of saying lambic instead of framboise (because framboises aren't lambics or anything) and the dude looked at me and was like "Which one? Actually, I don't think we have any" and just sort of stared at me as I frantically searched the damn beer list again to see where I'd gone wrong. When I realized my mistake and corrected myself, the guy had this smirk on his face (AKA, he knew EXACTLY what I meant, especially since there was only ONE framboise/lambic on the menu) and continued to stand there. Needless to say, by the time I got my beer and headed back to my table, I was ready to go. Did my friend and I enjoy the beer we got? Yes. Would I come here again? Probably not. I'm sorry I'm not a 6'4'' burly dude with full sleeves (enter sarcasm here)... but last time I checked, money is money, regardless of who is laying it down.
author: Heather M.

description: Nasty place. The attitude on the staff stinks to holy hell and while their selection of beer is exquisite they frankly don't clean the taps and don't know how to serve. The bartenders are a barrier to a better world of great beer and one day that will catch up to Toronado. If you want great beer with proper service, go to the Amsterdam Cafe.
author: Christian A.

description:
Once you get past the mad droves of hipsters at this 5-star dive bar, any beer lover will be in awe of the inspirational selection of beer on draft and in bottles.  And if you wonder if they have ever carried your favorite, just take a look at the 1000's of draft handles adorning the walls.  Its almost a beer museum for the great, micro (and sometime macro) brews of the world.  If you don't like those views, the hipsters do also provide entertaining people watching.

And if you're unlucky enough to be the sober driver, you'll feel a little bit better when you grab a taste of the Cock & Bull extra strong Ginger beer $2.50 - nicely placed in a bottle so you feel a little more included and a little less inclined to worry if your car is still going to be there when your drunken group finally decides to call it a night.
author: Tracee E.

description:
Fuck yes.

My boys took here for my bachelor party, the beer selection is awesome. The music playing that night was awesome too, all kinds of weird stuff that just ISN'T played on any radio. Nick Cave, Misfits, Alice Cooper, Sabbath, cool shit. 

Only drawback was that it was very noisy. VERY noisy. Shouting to my friends/family got old real quick. Plus it was packed, and there were 13 of us in the group. Not group friendly.
author: Patrick S.

description:
Love the beers.  H-A-T-E the attitude.  Therefore, we won't be back.  Understood & accepted that this place, it's rude bartenders, and incredibly up-their-own-arse, neanderthal weekend bouncers, will survive without our business.  Which is perfect, because after the way we were treated the last time we were there (incidentally, that was already a "let's give it another chance" situation, since we had a curious out-of-town-er in tow), I wouldn't spit on it to help it out if it were on fire.  I've lived in this neighborhood for 9 years now, and this place still puzzles me.  Go on the weekdays, and you can probably spot some non-snarling staff.  But come the weekend, prepare to be treated like absolute crap.  After all these years, I still can't praise this hallowed institution for anything.  Want the beer selection?  Plenty of other places in the city have admirable lists... take your money elsewhere.

2 stars ONLY for the occasional tolerable experience over weekdays, and being located next to Rosamunde.
author: Vandana N.

description:
It's a goddamn shame I haven't reviewed this place yet. 

Here is the run down, plain and simple.

Great bar with good beer. A great place to explore and educate yourself in the amazing subject of fine beers. You will not be finding PBR or MGD here. 

This place is also great if u happen to be in the Lower Haight and need a mid day beer. YUM.
author: Brittany D.

description:
Beer?  They've got it, and boy do they have variety!

Decor is simple, old-school bar, nice wood everywhere.
Comfy seats/stools.
Great friendly (snarky) bartenders.
Decent prices!
author: Fannie S.

description:
Finally got a chance to come back here on a normal night.  Not that much different than the barley wine festival really.  A little less crowded.  Still really loud.  Great unrecognizable selection of beer (nothing I'd ever heard of and all very pricey).

**********************************************************************
I heard Toronado has a great beer selection, but unfortunately I went during the barley wine festival.  So instead of beer we got to try tasters of barley wine.  This also meant instead of the mellow bar we expected to hang out at, it was crowded and loud.  This did not deter most of us from having a great time (especially as we snagged a table) but was probably not an indication of how the bar normally is.
author: Jean K.

description:
It gets 5 stars for the beer selection and Rosamunde collaboration.  Unless you are a beer enthusiast you probably only know about a quarter to half the beers on the menu so close your eyes and point.  If that's not your style, I suggest getting 1/2 frambois and 1/2 white belgian like beer (hoegarden but I don't believe they have that anymore so ask hoegarden-esque please).  We've also ordered the magnum, when you're about 6 beers deep it always sounds like a good idea, in today's economy, not so much.

To the sausage!!  Rosamunde will let you order your sausage to go-next door.  They'll give you a nifty yellow basket and send you on your way.  Come early if you want a seat with your weiner.  Oh and bring your moola, both are cash only.
author: Kristin Marie S.

description:
This is a hole in the wall bar with GREAT taps that you probably won't find anywhere else.  There are always interesting patrons at this place willing to talk to anyone, including me.  Based on the location, I always find myself wondering who is tripping or who is a secret member of the Weather Underground.

I rarely remember leaving this place every time I go
author: Jay A.

description: Favorite spot for some Pliny! Hard to come with a group larger than about 4 people as table and standing room are both limited.
author: Lillian S.

description: Perfect place to order a great beer at a reasonable price.  Learn the bar's etiquette before entering, it will make for a more pleasurable experience. (Google, toronado thrillist rules)
author: Trista B.

description:
Seems silly to "review" or "Yelp" the Toronado (the T). However, I must. I've been a loyal customer since my first visit, late in 1992. I am a beer fiend, beer snob, and beer reviewer and appreciate tops in the ales categories. The T has it all for your beer snobs (and no -- Miller, Bud, Beck's, Heinie, Corona, are NOT real beers -- those are lite beers for people who hate beer).

The T also has a fine Belgian Ale specialty going on. I've enjoyed special daze here including the wet-hopped IPA day (40+ IPAs!). No food is served here so bring in BBQ or sausages from food places on the block.

Heavy Metal and Hard Rock music is featured on the jukebox and lots of HD Sports on the TV above the bar. Very low turnover in Bartenders here -- thanks Dave Keene for running the BEST Beer Bar on the West Coast. 547 Haight will never go away, CHEERS! to you mad men and to those who still read my graffiti "e.g., Elvis Lives" after 15+ years here. Whatever.
author: Ken P.

description: Spouting with sours, saisons, collaborations, thoughtfully imported lagers, this dive makes its thumbprint by what it offers for the price, atmosphere, and location.
author: Shannon M.

description:
Great beer selection, and what used to be great prices, now moderate, as they have raised the prices a buck pretty much across the board.

They don't clean their lines out much; you can taste it in the Pliny: it tastes better out of the bottle... which isn't how it should necessarily be...

Rosamunde's next door is awesome for sausages.

So why 2 stars? Fucking ASSHOLE bartenders! Not all of 'em... there's a couple nice women... 1 mellow guy... 1 tatted-up bro... and 1 shit-stain motherfucker who was just rude and nasty beyond belief. 

Also, it gets too crowded and insanely noisy, and the clientele is sometimes lacking.
author: Dr. A.

description:
I come here pretty much every time I'm in the city.  The on-tap selection is phenomenal, I can always find something to suit my mood.  I dare you to be adventurous and try something you've never heard of.

So what if the bartender isn't the friendliest guy on the planet, he knows his stuff.  I've always gotten served exactly what I asked for and he helped me out when I couldn't remember the name of what I wanted.  Don't kid yourself, you're there for the beer not to be coddled.
author: Kristin K.

description:
If you like clean, perfect, upscale places, this is not for you.
If you like beer and the smell of stale beer, this is your place.  
Awesome beer selection, knowledgeable bartenders (Jennifer rocks), and Rosamundes next door.  And I pretty much have never failed to sit next to a friendly person to talk to.
author: Linda B.

description: This bar is noisy, dim, smells of beer and funk, and is a beer lover's paradise! Also rosamunde sausage grill is next door; grab a sausage and bring it to the bar.
author: Chris H.

description: It's a bit crowded, but if you just need a drink and it's a small group- come here! Great beers, get a pliny. Bartenders give hefty portions and aren't afraid to get a bit messy. It's not the best environment to learn about beers, moreso just to try them and see it in action. It smells like a nasty hipster bar in here, but when you get beyond that you are golden. The owners are GREAT- a couple that throw benefits for cancer research and other important issues each year. They are lovely and I will support them any chance I get.
author: Nathan O.

description: Cash only FYI.  They have so many beers its hard to choose.  the bartender was really nice and helped me pick out a good drink. he even let me taste a little before i got it.  that was unexpected!  it looks kind of scary so i thought everyone would be mean ha ha.  it gets hot in the back room area
author: M C.

description:
I really shouldn't be reviewing Toronado.  I drink wine.  But there I was, in a beer dive on Lower Haight.  I should have hated it, right?

Toronado is a dive.  Let me emphasize that.  Toronado is a dive.  There are some reviews that mention it, and others that call Toronado the 'best beer bar in America'.  Maybe the latter is true from a purely most-beer-for-your-buck standpoint, or even on the basis of its impressive menu of drafts that is guaranteed to challenge even the most dedicated of beer drinkers.  I happen to think that ambiance counts for something, so I wouldn't give Toronado such a heavy crown.  It is unquestionably, certifiably, in-every-way a dive.  PLEASE know that going in.

Now that we've established that point, I will give Toronado its due.  The list of brews is amazing.  Totally impressive.  Phenomenal even.  They range from every corner of the planet and cover an array of tastes and styles.  Even me, someone who knows very little about beer and couldn't stomach an entire pint of Guinness if I was standing in front of St. James Gate, found some yummy drafts that I really enjoyed.  

The staff is friendly to boot.  They didn't laugh at me when I admitted my ignorance and inside helped me select a refreshing pomegranate cider that was different and enjoyable and drinkable.  And cheap!  Every pint on the list is $4 to $6.  Just make sure you bring dolla-dolla bills y'all, this place is cash only.  

While I might not run back there as soon as I'm next in town, I would gladly recommend to others and would return with beer-loving friends for the adventure, quirkiness, and experience of it all.
author: CB M.

description: I stand corrected. When it's not that hot and humid outside, Toronado  doesn't smell too much like ass. They were out of Westmalle to my disappointment but there was still a great selection of beers to complement a lazy Saturday afternoon of happy hour heavy drinking and light conversation. Pair this with a mandatory Rosamunde hot dog, and you're all set.
author: Jon L.

description: This place is a beer lover's dream.  They have a crap ton of quality beers on tap.  But it's kind of a crowded sausage fest, and they only take cash.
author: Matthew P.

description:
The Toronado isn't fancy, just good tunes, great beer and good people. You can find craft beers in here that are difficult, if not impossible to find anywhere else. It gets crowded quickly, but share a table with someone and make new friends over great beer. 

The juke box was decent, the staff was OK. Just don't pull out a camera like a tourist, or your going to get flipped off and hassled. But it is worth it. The staff knows their beers, nothing but great beer, and never any BS macrobeers. Love this place. I'll visit every time I am in town.
author: Chris N.

description:
I just added a star to this place after my experience last night. Toronado is everything I could want and more. Here are the three reasons why I fell more deeply in love last night:

1) The door guy is so badass he doesn't even talk. He just grunts at you and that is your cue to hand over your license. He also makes helpful hand gestures if you don't catch on quickly enough.

2) The graffiti in the bathroom is hilarious and witty. Much better than your average high school crap. For example, "Fucktard is a shitbird." This is my new mantra. 
Also worth mentioning, "Fuck burning man. - your mom"

3) Urine has a peculiar consistency when it pools and sits on a concrete floor. As I was trying to figure out how to pee without soaking the hem of my pants, I actually slipped in a slick puddle of urine, and gently pulled a muscle trying not to eat shit. Keeps a girl on her toes.

We met two random people by asking them what beer they were drinking. Rather than describing it, they let us taste, then they joined us at our table and we all became bff through the magical friendship power of booze. We took turns buying rounds, never getting the same beer twice, so after a few hours we had tried almost half the menu. It's the first time I've ever ordered drinks family-style. I don't remember leaving the bar, but I know that I was very happy.
author: Merrilee T.

description: Great bar. Awesome brews. Act like you know what you're doing and things run smoother.
author: Dustin O.

description:
This loser place deserves NO stars!

Anyone who actually likes this place must be one of the following:

A. utterly naive
B. too lazy to venture beyond the neighborhood
C. unaware of what good service is about
D. a fool

Don't go here UNLESS you enjoy being ridiculed, avoided, smirked at, ignored, or mocked.

One afternoon I ventured in here and simply asked:  "Can you recommend a good lager?"

The greasy fat f*ck "bartender" barked......"Only women and first time visitors would order a lager!"

Wow, just how stupid and unknowledgeable is this high school dropout??

Lagers are amongst the "champagnes" of beers, they are difficult to perfect; not at all like all the trendy, hoppy, skunky ales which have become all the rage.

Not only does this loser know NOTHING about customer service, but he's a fat f*ck with long hair who should be forced by management to take a course on beer.

As I stared at this fool, I wondered if he was more unhappy about pouring beer in a stink hole for a living, or that he is greasy and retarded.

In any case, I will never return to this dark, skanky, pretentious "beer hall" full of fools who cough up the cash so they can be a part of a local "institution".

No thanks.
author: Scott T.

description: Toronado has a thoroughly diverse beer menu and a very helpful and patient staff for the indecisive. I hadn't been in the place a minute when I was asked if I needed help or had questions. This is definitely a great place to grab a beer in Lower Haight.
author: Brett B.

description:
Don't get me wrong - I'm a dive bar girl at heart, and I can really appreciate the mean selection of beers that they have going on here.  What I can't understand is the bitch who works behind the counter and thinks she's better than me because of my less-than-perfect pronunciation of "Franziskaner."  EXCUUUUSE ME, your holy bartenderness.  Her attitude didn't stop there - she was so rude to my boyfriend when he tried to order something off the confusing menu, and made us feel stupid.  What's worse was that the beer that he ordered tasted like a brewed dirty sock.  I was really conflicted when we gave her a $2 tip for our lousy beers served with a side of BITCH.

We will never return here, and good luck to the rest of you who do.
author: Kira K.

description:
I've been here a couple times, including last Friday night.  I love the beer selection here.  It's huge.  It's got your local beers and your international beers.  It's always has whatever I'm in the mood for.  Also great is the fact they mythic pizza and Rosamunde are nearby.  If you find you need a little food to sop up the beer sloshing in your stomach you are set.

I don't particularly like the layout of the bar, lack of seating, or unfriendly bartenders (This is the only place I've ever had a bartender roll his eyes at me).  That being said, if my friends suggest trip to this place I will happily oblige, but I am not going to go out of my way to go here.

BONUS TIP: Rosamunde & Mythic Pizza are both next door.  So you're one of those people that needs some tasty, greasy food to soak up all the beer sloshing around in your stomach at Midnight you're all set.
author: Lara O.

description: Turning 21 while living in the Lower Haight one block from Toronado this summer was the best introduction to proper dive bars that I could have possibly received. My best advice would be to go during the week, and try as many random kinds of beer as possible, since the options are vast. A great place to go with friends (just get there early!)
author: Eliza D.

description:
I love beer so of course I would love this bar! Great selection of various beers from around the world!

Warning: Be ready to order when the bartender comes around. You must know what you want. None of this "What do you recommend" nonsense. Just pick something from the menu.

CASH ONLY
author: Jenn S.

description: Great dive bar feel with incredible craft beer selection AND Pliny the Elder on tap for $5 a pint....what more could you ask for?  Yes, it can take a little work to get the bartenders attention, but once you do they take care of you and I experience none of the attitude the other reviewers mentioned....but then again I am from Brooklyn where everyone has an attitude so maybe I am less sensitive.  Plus how can anyone complain when pints of world class beers are $5 (did I mention Pliny the Elder?).  Yes, I was a bit starstruck since I can't get anything Russian River in NYC, but have to say it was hard to find it anywhere in SF either.  Btw, I went with the Pliny, Blind Pig, and Damnation all while watching the World Cup (Greece vs Costa Rica).....I could care less about watching live sports but somehow the combination of the dive bar feel, excellent beer, and really low key beer made it a great experience all around. Will definitely be going back.
author: Jonathan H.

description:
Um, yes. That's all. 

(But the place is not at all welcoming, so I'm withholding that fifth star.)
author: Kyle M.

description: Toronado is a divey bar with a great beer selection.  It can be loud and crowded, but that's just part of the package.
author: Dan W.

description:
Best beer selection of any bar in San Francisco, hands down. Don't go in here expecting to order any macro beers. The beer selection here even makes beers like Sierra, Racer 5, Anchor Steam, and other craft brews seem like mainstream beers (don't worry, they do carry Sierra, Racer, and Anchor... possibly the most mainstream of all beers on their menu). Expect to find all the limited release and seasonals from these "big" craft breweries on tap here, as well as dozens and dozens more breweries you've probably never heard of.

Menu usually consists of a rotating menu of beers, with about half that are always there.

They also have handpumps, including my favorite beer, Twist of Fate, which always seems ot be on tap!

This is a no frills, grungy bar that to the passer-by may seem like a shitty dive. But beware, it does usually get packed inside, even on weeknights. 

Tiny inside, jukebox with a pretty good selection of classic rock, metal, and hardcore... no shitty Top 40 hip-hop/R&B/pop either.

Fun place to chill out and grab beers, or to start the night off before you head out to the shitty club to grind it up to bad music and bad beer.

If you like beer, come here. If you don't like beer, still come here. There HAS to be at least a few beer styles you've never tried that you might actually like.
author: Alpo H.

description:
Headed here after reading reviews and am glad that I did.

They had a great selection of all types of beer: Micros, Belgian, German, bottled or draft, and the prices were not insanely high (I've seen lower for sure). 

We bought slices of pizza next door and brought them in to eat while we had our beer. Ended up getting a couple of rounds on tap and then moving to the St. Bernardus Xmas Ale in the bottle. I was a little surprised that they didn't have the ABT 12, but I wasn't going to complain.

Other than the fact that the bartender was somewhat of a curmudgeon, it was a good experience overall.
author: Ryan W.

description:
I can get down with a nice glass of wine but at the end of the day I am a beer girl, and this place has it all. They have a wide range of beers on tap that you won't find at your typical bar. I'd suggest going on the early side because when we went at 9:30 p.m. it was already packed and difficult to find a place to stand without getting the occasional elbow. You can check out their current listing of beers at:  http://www.toronado.com/draft.htm 

Again it is cash only and beers run about $5 - $6 a piece but worth every penny.
author: Jessica P.

description: Walked into this place knowing it was the local spot for craft beer lovers. Hubby ordered his Pliny the Elder and I started with a hard cider on tap. We were craving some sour beer but the only good/decent thing on tap was Cuvee de Jacobins which you can pick up almost anywhere. We wanted something really delicious. We sat at the bar and my husband mentioned Cable Car to me...the bartender heard us and said "we have it." It was $40 well spent. We drank that amazing beer which we deemed the mythical beer because it came out of nowhere...suddenly we turn over the bottle and realize it was named after Toronado and says something along the lines of "here you are at 547 Haight St..." We are pretty drunk by this point and trip out a little like proper beer nerds :) The night ended very blurry but we were cabbing it, so no worries.
author: Brittany R.

description:
Tornados!
What a great place for a beer. Can't beat the selection on tap or the bottle menu. Grab a sausage at Rosemands next door and you're set.  It's in the Haight so you should know what to expect!! Cheers!
author: john h.

description: Great place for a variety of beers and ales to taste. The neighborhood provides plenty of eateries so they can focus on the brews.
author: Billy C.

description:
Well, we finally made it to Toronado on our most recent trip to San Francisco.  Definitely heard mixed reviews about this place, especially from our local friend, who tried to steer us away from the place, but he broke down and decided to join us.  Maybe he figured that we could see for ourselves.  

While they do have a decent draft beer list and 50 taps, I was not blown away.  I was told later that they also have an extensive bottle list.  Either way, they had several local beers, sours (for the wife) and a good variety on the draft list that we did not even look at a bottle list.  Overall, the place was busy with most tables and the bar full, but we were lucky to get a table by the window on Haight street.  The tricky thing here seems to be the ordering process and /or interaction with the bartender. 

So I take one for the team and approach the bar to order for all 3 of us.  The bartender kinds of looks at me funny, but gives a quick nod to indicate "what do you want" and I ordered.  A few seconds later, I pay the man plus tip and now I got 3 beers  and 2 hands so I have to make 2 trips.  When I go back to pick up the third beer, a guy at the bar starts talking to me like he knows me, but quickly he realizes that he has mistaken me for someone else.  So then I start to wonder why the bartender looked at me funny.  Do I look like a regular?  Am I dressed funny?  Do I have spinach stuck between my teeth?  I mean the bartender looked at me up and down before taking my order, so I am not sure what gives.  I guess that was just my experience at Toronado.  Second round went a little more smooth with the same bartender.  All in all, I liked my experience here and would return with a group of people, if for no other reason than to explore more of the area of Haight street.
author: Andre B.

description:
This place is so kick back and chill. I love that they have over 40 different selections of beer on tap. And all of them are fairly well priced. So many different options to choose from, that even though there are some people who hate beer and the thought of beer, it's totally ok.

I recommend the Pomegranate Cider (it's not too sweet, but still tasty) or the Framboise (totally sweet and raspberry flavored). Always a plus with me. :)
author: Nicolas H.

description:
I'm strongly tempted to write something scathing so you will all go somewhere else and it won't be so d----ed crowded when I feel like walking down the street for a pint. :-)  But the truth is that the Toronado is hard to beat if you love beer.  They have dozens on tap, all types and from everyplace from Belgium to Berkeley, including 3 or 4 cask ales at any given time.  If you can't manage to spot something you like on the long list of draught beers (look up as you come in), or on the list of specials and non-alcoholic choices on the chalkboard (look behind the bar near the front), ask to see the bottle list.  They've got quite a few interesting items.

Just don't ask for one of those ubiquitous domestic lagers or attempt to pay with plastic. You will be frowned down.  (There's an ATM in the back.)

If you lack much experience with beers other than the aforesaid lagers, you can ask the bartender or any of the regulars.  Most will be happy to offer advice on the various beers and ales on offer.

Toronado doesn't serve food, but until 10 pm  you can get sausages from Rosamunde Sausage Grill next door (q.v.) and bring them in to eat with your beer.  Just tell the person at the grill "it's for next door" and come back for it in a few minutes.

Several times a year there are special events, such as the Barleywine Festival.  If you're a beer snob, you won't want to miss these.

Caveats:  Street parking in this neighborhood is hellaciously difficult.  The duration of vacancy of a legal parking space is measured in seconds.  Take a cab or the Muni or spend half an hour cruising for parking.  As the Toronado's reputation has grown, so have the crowds.  Since the bar opens at midday, the afternoons or Sunday evenings are best for a less crowded experience. You'll feel like a sardine on Friday or Saturday nights.  When it's crowded, it can take a while to be served.  Be patient and stand your ground.  Eventually someone will see you and wait on you.  The better you tip, the sooner you'll get your second round.  IDs are scrupulously checked here, either by the bartenders during the day or the person at the door after 9pm.  Have it out.
author: Charlie G.

description:
I wanted to surprise my hubby with a good place to grab a beer and struck gold when I found this place. The beer selection is awesome and the bar staff knows to recommend a good brew that you would like. I used to go to the Monk's Kettle but they are just too expensive and the bar area is just too tiny. So when I walked into this place, it was perfect.

It's not a lounge; it's a place where you can grab a great beer, where you can unwind without worrying about your looks, and not have to pay an arm an a leg for a good brew. Oh, and don't be lame and ask for a Bud or Miller Lite. Instead walk on the wild side and order something you never had. You'll like it.
author: Yelena K.

description:
Awesome place. While this may be classified as a dive bar, the beer selection is far too diverse and well-priced to think of it as such. They must have over 40 beers on tap, and unlike your traditional dive bar, the music doesn't consist of Journey, Rick Springfield, or Madonna. It's much more hardcore metal and deep alternative/punk tracks. The floors and bathrooms are however, quite reminiscent of a dive bar's...

I'm holding back on the last star because it's a cash only establishment, which in my opinion, is a bit lame
author: Carter G.

description: Great beer selection, no B.S. kind of bar. I did not feel unwelcome here and the staff weren't rude to me and my friends... actually they were pretty cool. However, I would suggest knowing what you want when you go up to the bar to order.
author: Alison B.

description:
On my recent trip to San Francisco, my husband and I finally made it out to Toronado. We arrived on a busy Saturday night and like any other popular bar, it was difficult to make your way up to the bar to order a drink. 

We ordered our beers and definitely enjoyed them but my only regret was that we didn't save our visit for a lazy Saturday afternoon where we could sit at one of the tables to enjoy a few brews. I would come back though since they had a great selection of Belgian and wheat beers on tap. That's good enough for me!
author: Cathy S.

description:
If you have a passion for beer and enjoy drinking it in great, kind of dive bar types of places, definately make a stop here. 
Their beer selection is unbeatable.
author: Christopher V.

description:
Toronado has the best rotating selection of beers in the bay area. I used to know the beers were great and took the less-than-friendly bartenders as a necessary evil, but their man Stewart has all the love. He's friendly, personable and efficient.

Thank you Stewart!
author: Casey D.

description: Great place to grab some beers!  There was a game on when we arrived on a Sunday afternoon, so it was a bit crowded.  We stood for a while before grabbing seats at the bar.  Had the Obsidian Nitro Stout, which was as creamy and delicious as it sounds.  Check it out!
author: Cy C.

description:
Okay, okay! I've been on quite the hiatus. As a fellow yelper friend has mentioned, I go through phases. When I'm yelping, I'm yelping with a vengenence and I recall all of the great memories from all these awesome places I've visited with friends and family.

Some time ago, I went to the Toronado with the Bestie and a few other friends. The bar staff was incredibly sweet! Selection is awesome (well, being a non-drinker, there's an incredible amount to choose from). Although fun and lively, it can get a bit on the crowded side on a Saturday night but good times!  Again, I'm not a beer drinker but the Belgium beers I tried were killer.  I also love the fact that they have a 15 course beer tasting (would that be considered a flight or just a quick way to get loaded)! Anyway, a great place to go with friends but don't try and bring a date here for some intimate conversation.
author: Dorothy S.

description: Beer. Nothing but glorious beer. Lots of selection, no food served, but a couple of neighboring options to carry in. Bartender was on the ball and the vibe was divey and local but still friendly. Worth a visit if you have the time and are in the area.
author: Craig L.

description:
$3 Russian River Damnation!?!??! SHUT THE %$@# UP!

So I went to Toronado for the first time last week with a buddy after hearing about it from a beer geek friend of mine. We went mid-day on a Tuesday and the place was lively. I could not believe the selection of awesome beers and just about jumped out of my pants when he charged me $3 for a beer. When I get a beer by my place in South Beach I typically pay $6-$8 a beer, so this was huge for me!

For my second beer i wanted to try something different so I asked the bartender for a recommendation. At first he was kind of stand offish and told me "they're all good, just pick something". After I mentioned I wanted to try something and told him others I like, he steered me a bit which was appreciated.

I DEFINITELY found my new beer geek home!!
author: Vernon L.

description:
My boyfriend and I are regulars at the Toronado in San Diego, so I was really excited to check out the original, San Francisco location. As a girl, I often feel conspicuous when I visit a bar alone, but I had a great experience. I chatted with an adorable gay couple for quite a while, then I chatted a bit with the bartender (who was the owner/manager) about the San Diego location. I bought an "SF Toronado" tee-shirt for my boyfriend. The bartender was so helpful in advising the correct size and style. Sadly, they didn't have any girl's tees. I would have LOVED an "SF Toronado" tee to wear to our location. The bartender gave me a patch as a consolation prize which was nice. 

The rest of the review is pretty much on par with my thoughts on San Diego's location. The beer is out of this world. They get an A+ for selection, quality, taste, and for not having any crap on tap. 

I never have problems with the service in San Diego and, as I indicated earlier, it was outstanding here as well. Even if it was horrible, I'd come here anyway. If I got punched in the face by the bartender every time I ordered, the pint would make up for it. 

I'm sure the food is outstanding here as well. This is one of my favorite places to eat in San Diego.
author: Alely W.

description: They have what beer advocate.com rates as the best IPA in the world, Russian River's Pliny the Elder, in tap for only 6 bucks. I'm sold on this place what a deal and a rare beer to serve. A+ on the tap selection and prices, but it is crowded and loud.
author: Sean W.

description:
Yes, you may have a great big beer selection, but so do other bars like Monks Kettle that are much more deserving of my money.

You guys are such a**holes. Really. I don't know how you survive? I've lived here 9 years and have yet to have a good experience here.  Then again, if I was a middle aged guy with longish greasy hair serving beer for a living I'd probably be mad at the world too.

You guys suck. Again.
author: Katie M.

description: Sweet dim place for a couple of beers that you've never heard of. Plenty of seating and there's even a little side room tucked into the back. We had the Blind Pig, Carnavale Saison, and something else that had the afterthump of something smoky burning in your throat. Not the worst sensation, but it wakes you up. Really clean for a beer pub and no stickiness anywhere.
author: Kevin L.

description: Dirty, loud, smells funny, the help is surly, and they haven't cleaned their tap lines since 1998 before going to rehab for a meth addiction. I love this place. And their most redeeming feature is being located right next to to some of the best food in SF. Yeah, they'll let you eat it there. It's really a locals hangout so just be aware they are naturally suspicious of anyone without a tattoo, shaved head, long hair, nose bones, missing teeth, facial ticks, or smelling like cannabis. Just sit quietly for a hour or so and they'll start warm up to you, maybe.
author: Brian J.

description: Death metal and great beer on tap and in bottle makes me a happy man.  Yes the bartenders can be "rude" but what do you expect walking into a bar like this and asking for Coor's Light (which they don't serve).  I've never had a problem here, love this place, and will be a lifelong patron.
author: Eric H.

description:
Was there for a beerweek event. Packed to capacity. Got to have the fabled "Pliny the Younger" !! Totally awesome. Bartenders with attitude but was expected. Awesome selection of beers from the list..but didnt try anything besides the beerweek specials :)
Wud go back in a heartbeat !
author: Deepak K.

description:
Great beer bar, super old school, huge selection.  A SF institution.
Place can be a a bit dumpy at times but thats part of the charm.  The haight would not be the same without it.
author: Roberta W.

description: YEs! If you suck at life you will have bad customer service. If you are a reasonable person and know what you want to drink this is a good bar, a bar that will take you far in life. I am so glad this place exists and that Princess and the crew will unflinchingly tell douche bags to go fuck themselves when they wait in line to drool and fumble when finally asked what is they want from the taps. KEEP IT REAL
author: Luz R.

description: Just moved from Florida. was trying to find my local neighborhood craft beer place and I think i've found the one! heard it's SF's original craft beer bar. awesome selection of brews and a very friendly staff. looking forward to happy hour!
author: Jason P.

description:
This is a decent bar with lots of beer selection. Nonetheless, make sure you know what you're ordering before you approach the bar, otherwise, the bartenders won't even glance your way.

It's also pretty hard to fight seats - my advice, just wait around and stand near a table with empty glasses. Or, better yet, make friends!

I would say that this is a great place for a chill night of drinking or bar hopping. No crazy endeavors here (sorry).
author: Christina C.

description:
It's a bit murky, a bit smelly, a lot loudy, and gosh darn it, I liked it.
How nice to have as impressive a selection that Toronado has, and feel like a neighborhood bar, just hanging with some friends. 

Not a hint of CBDs in sight. (CBD = cougers and douche bags)
Our service was swift, and the majority of our gang was clearly not local, but we do smile and act nice. 

Beer is served at a good temperature to bring out the best aroma and flavor - not freezing cold to numb the taste buds of dire piss water that passes as beer at sports bars.

But...the bathroom. I have to complain about that. Someone scrawled graffiti of "OXNARD RULES" just above the toilet.  They need to get rid of that. Misleading.
author: Lemonjelly L.

description:
We arrived for the event, problem is, there was none. I'm not sure who got it wrong, Urban Daddy or the Toronado.

To quote the email I received from Urban Daddy: 
"BrewDog's Sink the Bismarck, available for tasting this Sunday, 5-7pm, The Jug Shop, and this Monday, 6-10pm, The Toronado"  
"They only made 100 bottles of this monster ale, which means that Sunday's and Monday's BrewDog tastings are your only opportunities to drink it."

Sounded like an official event to me. And we were most excited to sample this quadruple IPA. We arrived to a packed house around 6:30pm, the bar was crammed with people. I'm thinking it must be a hot event. We make our way to the bar.

The female bartender had no clue what I was talking about. The male bartender was too busy to help her out. She pulled off 2 shot glasses of foam from one of the taps and slung them on the bar in front of me as she walked away.

I got the male bartenders attention and explained what we were there for, he quickly spouted off sizes and prices (which I couldn't catch above the din) and condescendingly explained that they don't do formal tastings, you have to buy (one of the sizes of beers I still had yet to catch) yada yada. Then walked away. 

I would have gladly bought 2 pints of said IPA, but was so put off by the experience up to that point, it wasn't worth me flagging one of them down again and hoping they got it right. Which makes me realize why I don't go to hip bars anymore. I'm too damn old. and I got a man at home. who also loves to drink beer. at home. Thanks for being such a trooper on this failed beer run, G. 

So who was wrong, Urban Daddy or Toronado? Or was it a third party, me? Either way next time I see one of these "events", I'm calling ahead to confirm.
author: Carnley P.

description: Been here a couples of times now. Great selection and good prices at a no frills dive bar. I totally don't fit in here, but I love this place. They care only about serving great beer at reasonable prices. I mean who gets Allagash all the way over here?! Not to mention other beers you wouldn't expect. Bartenders are nice, unpretentious, and definitely not hipsters who discovered some craft beer. Note: cash only.
author: Puneet S.

description: now i get to appreciate a great selection of craft beers! always crowded but a "go-to" place for great selection of good beers! makes it a happy "happy hour" place
author: Donna A.

description:
While the decor was nice and the beer selection above average, we found this place a bit dark, dank, and smelly, and this was at at 1pm on a Sunday.  They have one tiny TV that was tuned to the World Cup, but nobody seemed to be paying attention.  There were no 'young people' that were swarming the other pubs in the lower haights, so if you are looking for a quieter more traditional pub, Toronado might be your spot.   

Cash Only
author: T. M. B.

description:
I've been here many, many times. Never had a bad experience.

PROs:
+ Great bartenders.
+ SO MANY beers!
+ Grab a table and have a great time.
+ Sausage place next door.

CONs:
- It's TIGHT in there. Squeezing by people to the restroom is not terribly difficult, but on the off-chance that you spill someone's beer - you will be sad. ]:
author: Dalton C.

description:
For all those who have never been to the Toronado just remember this...

It's only Beer (and 1 cider), and it's not beer you'll see on a commercial during the playoffs.  If you have no idea where to begin don't worry. Just look the bar tender straight in the eyes and ask for something similar to what beer you do like, or possibly a suggestion from them.  DO NOT ASK "WHAT IS YOUR FAVORITE BEER?" This question will get you crap service, and rightfully so.  The bar is all about locals but even they understand that it's reputation brings in people from all over.     Don't be intimidated and you'll be fine. 

If all else fails order a Pliny... and like it.

MNW for Life.
author: Collin S.

description:
what's to say about toronado honestly... ?

do you like beer?
do you like trying new beer?
do you like having a place to hang out to drink said beer?
do you like sausages and/or tamales?

if you answered Yes to any of the above questions, just go.  grab a sausage from Rosamunde next door or wait for the tamale lady to swing through.  have some food, have some beer and don't even worry about it.

bring cash.
author: Lauren P.

description:
Hipsters unite! Gosh I haven't been to a dive bar in a while and when I came here I felt like I was in North Carolina again.

I also felt cool being with all these lower haight folks.

Anyways, their beer is cool. I tried everything that ended with a "tion" and just thought it was a fun thing to do.

One issue is seating as we had about 8 people

Great thing is you can bring food from outside restaurants. We picked up a few hotdogs from Rosamunde and they were delicious...

CASH ONLY
author: Eric A.

description: This place is disgustingly dirty. Awesome wide selection of beers on tap. friendly security guard staff. reasonable cheap 5 dollar beers.
author: Shakei D.

description:
I went there to hang out with my ladylover friend and it was fun, I got drunk after two beers, I was interacting with "normal" people (this does not include Tom) for a change or atleast it felt like I did.

In this review I can't say too much about Toronado, I was here two hours daytime inside a dark room with a group of people.
It was fun, they have a good beer selection, but being located in lower haight I'm sure there will be a lot of dogholes hanging around here night time.


For now Toronado is a drunk during daytime memory.
author: cecilia k.

description: Great beer list, good music, fine location - this was going to be my daily beer place.  That changed abruptly when I reminded the bar guy that I paid with a twenty, not a ten, and was exposed to a vile torrent of abuse that made even hardened regulars perk up.  I remained calm, waited for the correct change, finished my pint (no longer so enjoyable) and left, never to return.
author: Thor T.

description: As always.......the perfect beer bar!  I've been coming here for years now, and nothing has changed except the ever changing beer list.  Don't come here if you are looking for a bud light......only really great craft brew on tap......and generally difficult to find craft brews.  Probably my top beer spot in the US (if not the top two), and always make it a point to stop in here for a few each time I'm in the city.  The sausage shop next door is unreal.....and you can bring the food back to the bar.
author: Daryl T.

description: VERY crowded on the weekends...   But well, i didn't expect different for any bar in the haight on a friday night...   Average drinks, average service, average decor= average rating...
author: Phoenix D.

description: amazing draft selection.. place is a little dirty but I think that's the charm of it. I would definitely go back.
author: Justin S.

description: First time coming here, the other night. What you'll get flummoxed with immediately is the number of drinks they have on tap! I mean jesus christ, must have been 30-40?!? At any rate, you know what you're coming here for, wine. No stupid. Get with the program. You order yourself a beer. And if you want to man up, you order yourself the darkest, heaviest and most alcoholic inducing rage of a potion they have on tap. I had several dark bears, but was too hammered to remember the first one. Last couple were Destushe, so I believe...I'll say one thing, they need to do something about the DJ or lack of one. That repeating skipping cd isn't a good look especially when it's heavy death metal that comes outta nowhere. Scared the crap out of me. Had to come down one star because of cash only. On another note, glad I found a cab that night...
author: Michael C.

description:
This is my first time posting at yelp.  I'm sad to say my experience at Toronado drove me to place this post.

I live in the neighborhood, have been going to Toronado for a long time but after getting rude treatment at by the brunette bartender, I won't be back.

I work hard and I don't need to be treated with disrespect when I'm trying to unwind after day's work.

I went next door to noc-noc and was informed that the bartender is the owner's girlfriend or something like that.  Well, Mr. Toronado, if you read this, you should probably have a talk with your lady because based on the recent posts here, it doesn't sound like i'm the only one with this experience.
author: Chendo O.

description:
Love dive bars. Love churlish bartenders, dark places on sunny Saturday afternoons, lots on tap. Really love dive bars that are dog-friendly, as the Toronado tends to think it is. But it isn't. 
Don't like dive bars that don't offer water to bar dogs...and who get mad when I ask for some water for my dog. And who tell me that "I'm doing all of you a favor by letting your dog in here." Dude, you are either running a dog-friendly bar or not. Please don't use my friendly (& thirsty)  pup to try and establish your alpha dominance as Assistant Manager..or whatever you may be ( you know who you are Mr Snarky Dark Facial Hair) . Too many good K-9 welcoming dives in SF to go back to this one. Over and out. Or as my dog would say " this ain't a butt worth sniffin'.
author: Macy M.

description:
The place was crowded and packed.  I thought the beer selection was decent.  There wasn't a lot but there was a list.  The bartenders didn't seem all too friendly and helpful when I was there so that was why I gave this place three stars. 

I did like the fact that we could bring in our sausages from Rosamunde Sausage Grill next door to eat and enjoy our beers. 

The environment seems just like a local dive bar, packed and crowded with locals.
author: Stephanie H.

description: BEER, BEER, BEER!! Oh and Best Weiners you can bring in from next door Rosamunde! What more can you ask for?
author: Karen T.

description: This place is awesome!!! I live in Downtown L.A. and I would make the drive up to San Francisco just to come here. There are beers here that are incredibly hard to find all under one roof. The Crowd is Relaxed, and so is the ambience. Beers are reasonably priced 4+ but you cant go wrong with any of them. Overall one of my favorite places. OH! a word of advice. CASH ONLY!!!
author: L H.

description:
What to add that hasn't been said?  You either love the place, or it irritates you.  I happen to be in the love camp.

Pay attention to their selection of large bottles.  You can find a list of everything they have in their fridge on their website, and sometimes there's a rare gem, like a 9 Liter bottle of Belgian Ale.  9 Liters comes in a really damn big bottle, and that sucker pops its cork like a firecracker.  Keeping in mind that many Belgian beers bottle condition, it's not surprising that the bigger the bottle, the better the taste.  Mmmm.
author: Jay M.

description:
Everything I love about Toronado I love in concept.  Yay, for the concept.  

But...at some point hipsters decided it was cool when people are rude to them and Toronado is the coolest place in the world if you are a hipster. 

But...they know they need more staff and yet they don't hire.  Every time I see 1 bartender (who really only has to pour beer) with a line of 20 I want to storm out.  It can take half and hour to get a beer.  

But...their huge selection of beer loses its appeal when you take a chance on something new and are SERIOUSLY disappointed (it's gonna be half hour for another beer). Maybe if they weren't understaffed or so incredibly rude you could get some feedback in advance.  As it is, I rely on the opinions of the hipsters around me for picking out beer, and I am learning that they are over fond of drinking thick glasses of syrup that seem originally intended for use over pancakes.  

But let's hear it for the concept.  I do love the concept.  Maybe someday I'll walk in when it's near empty and learn about some of the unusual beers from a bartender who isn't a dick. On that day, I'll reconsider.  For now, I've had better...a lot better.
author: Luke M.

description:
Amazing amazing amazing - there is nothing i would change about this place...probably the most famous beer bar in the country and well worth every bit of hype. 

loud, cheap in your face and full of the best beer in the world - oh and you can bring awesome sausages from next door inside now.
author: Ben B.

description:
Lindeman's Lambic on tap?! SAUSAGES next door that you can bring inside and enjoy with your beer?!

Excuse me while I go hump the bench now...
author: Courtney S.

description:
Came here for the first time for a friends birthday and I'm"m glad I did. Warning though leave your calorie counting at the door because if you're drinking here it's going to be beer. 
They have such a large selection of beer and  it is always changing it can kind of be a bit over whelming. But being the beer lover and the girl that I am I choose my first one on the coolness of its name. It was a great IPA (sorry yelpers cant remember the name). But there is sure to be a beer for everyone there.
One knock on this place I would say is the bartenders aren't there to help you decide or give you advice but they are quick with their service. 
Great place to start the night or just hang out with a good group. Don't forget your trip to Toronado is not complete without eating a sausage from next door, remember the no calorie counting.
author: Corynne O.

description: Came in midday when they were not crowded at all. Didn't order a drink since I am (very visibly) pregnant.  Was told in a very bitchy and aggressive manner that I had to order a drink because I was taking up a table and they were trying to run a business. I'd have been more than willing to order a nonalcoholic drink if I had been asked nicely, but the attitude of the bartender was unbelievable. I was shaking. I hope to never return to this place. I'm a huge beer geek, but the draft list was not anywhere near impressive enough to make up for the horrible service and attitude. We were informed that they were the best beer bar in America, but I've been to quite a few that had a better selection... minus the terrible service.
author: Megan S.

description:
3.5 stars

I've finally found a place in SF that has Murphy's Stout, on tap.  That said, it tasted nothing like what I had in New Zealand, but hey - better available than not.

Of course, it had to be a dive bar, though this place is nowhere near as "divey" as others.  One bartender was really sweet (female) and another one (male) gave a new definition to "aloof" and rather curt.  I'm not sure what the big deal is about taking separate orders - God forbid you order two beers, and should order 2 more 5 minutes later.....

Toronado carries an impressive selection of beer.  It's not up there w/ Monk's Kettle, but more extensive than Zeitgeist, which are my other two favorite beer joints.  On a Friday night, it was quite crowded but not "CRAZY" like Monk's Kettle would be, which is a good thing.

On this evening, I was with three men.  My most memorable moment was when one bold, cougarly woman approached them, and struck up a conversation.  We never could figure out what she was talking about  (or who she was hitting on - - all of them?) but after her second approach to our group, I commented, "Wow, you boys are chick magnets!"  My friend's funny retort:  "THAT WAS NO CHICK, my friend!"  It's definitely a mixed crowd here.

All in all, while I would go to Toronado again, it didn't mark a special place in my heart like my other two favorites did.  Factor in the fact that it's all "cash only" - and it bring itself down a notch on my rating scale.  

People are here to have fun - - let 'em open tabs!
author: Grace K.

description: My Favorite place in SF , Bring cash , make any selection and you cant go wrong. Lots of food nearby , YOU should come by during the day on TUESDAY's to get the burger next door @ ROSAMUNDE ,
author: Charles S.

description:
Come in...Drink, order a sausage from next door and talk a little shit about your favorite band or sports team.... And it doesn't even have to be  in that order!

Look Toronado to quote a good friend of mines..."Warms my cold heart".
Yes it really does. For starters the beer menu makes you feel classy, grimy, and drunk...All at once

And I mean the fact that you can bring food in is a plus... Especially being right next door to Rosemunde. Beer,Brats, Baseball... You follow the 3 B's right?
Next you got some chill ass bartenders...You'll hear me say this a lot because I'm a Bay Area native.... (Ain't too many of us in SF. Trust me I know and people tell me.) Now the bartenders I'm sure some aren't from here but they have a hospitality about them that says...."I love the bay and all that dwells here"  Ok it's more like "Hey WTF you drinkin & Thanks for coming in. LOVE IT!

Next the people and the atmosphere.... It's lower haight, It sits between the Marina and the mission. It's the middle olive branch. I'm not a hipster nor Marina type or hater of those either. I'm the bay area type...But I do have friends who are from both factions. (don't pick a side....Just rep the bay) I do drink with both factions.

The stuff dies at the door. For the most part even the guy with the waxed eyebrows and dragon on the back of his shirt can be friends with guy who looks like he stole his little sister pair of skinny jeans. And girls who wish they were harder than the girl who looks tougher than them, can laugh together at the Skinny Jean guy and Big collar Dragon shirt guy together...

It's Harmony baby! And together they can get drunk together, eat sausages together and even yes enjoy the Giants game on the tube together.

So WTF doing go to have drink at Toronado's. Luv that place, good vibe, hella good beer (not drinks. A drink is a soda) good bartenders good area....

Toronado holding  it down it since.... I dunno just go drink. Order the anything from the Russian river brewery...That shit will get you drunk
author: M P.

description:
My mainstay brewpub in the Lower Haight. Two of my all time favorites are on draught daily - Moonlight's Reality Czech (an outstanding pilsner I have not seen anywhere else) and Russian River's Pliny the Elder.

The leader-board style rotating draught/cask menu speaks directly towards their attitude towards the beer stock: it's what's great, right now, and if the "great" part ever changes it'll be gone tomorrow. If any pub in the city is going to receive a limited release of something rare/exotic/seasonal/small-batch (from the likes of Lost Abbey, etc), Toronado is guaranteed to be in on the action. These guys just know and love beer on a higher level.
author: Alex B.

description:
Oh, let me sing an ode to Maresdous... *strums guitar badly*

Wait, wait, don't let my terrible ode scare you away.

Actually, I was weak.  I had the pomegranate cider, but I'm a sucker for cider.  I did have a few sip of my friend's Maresdous, which was excellent!  

If you like good, quality brews and Belgian Beer, it's a good dive-y place to hit.  It's crowded, noisy, the bartenders are so not there to kiss your butt, and I loved it.  When I'm in SF, I'm going back here.  Srsly.

The only con is that the bathrooms are unisex, so it can get pretty... dirty by the end of the night.  

Seriously dudes, what is up with leaving the toilet seat up?  It's an effin bar- you'll skeeve out a poor drunk girl when she almost falls into the toilet due to the seat being up.  Can'tya do the ladies a favor and put. the. seat. down?

I'm familiar with the location in San Diego, so I had to make my way to Toronado's in San Fran when I was up there.  The SD location is new and nice- this location feels like home base (which it is).

*raises beer chalice*

Long live Toronado's.  Also, the sausage place next door is effin awesome.  Get their beer sausage- greasy and will kill your workout for the next few days- but TDF.  Tee Dee Eff (I have a review up for the sausage place as well)!
author: Ikoi H.

description: Worst bartender experience i've had in my eight years of living in San Francisco. I was politely sitting at the bar with some friends when I was told I would have to leave the bar if I wasn't drinking. I told him I was there with friends, didn't want to drink and had to drive. He said he didn't care and that I had to leave the bar if I wasn't going to drink. Blew my mind. The douche with the beard behind the bar is by far the biggest dick I've encountered in a bar in SF.
author: Steve C.

description:
The beer selection is fantastic! Can't say much more about that except that we're definitely going back to try more beer!

We watched Game 1 of the world series there (GO GIANTS) and the atmosphere and service was great!

Could use more TVs and a bit more seating in that back room.
author: Stephanie V.

description:
Expansive draft beer selection. They have everything from Russian River Brewing Co's Pliny the Elder to Dogfish Head Palo Santo. 

I think it's great that they carry a lot of local NorCal beers. 

Bravo for my humongous Radeberger costing only 4 bucks. 

It was super crowded when I went - not sure it's really my kind of thing, but if you're looking for something rowdy and a good beer to go along with it, Toronado is a good pick. 

Doorman was a huge dickhead, although he was ripping a new one for a guy who brought in his own PBR. I have to say, it was pretty hilarious.
author: Alli J.

description:
When I first got into craft, this was my beer destination of choice. I'd go up several times a month and make an event of it, drinking the great, constantly rotating stuff that they had on tap. 

After about August 2009, the tap turnover and variety has diminished. Now, I'm not saying the selection is bad at all; any place where you are guaranteed to find Russian River and Moonlight beers (without driving to Santa Rosa) is a big plus in my book. But they rarely have any significant turnover, and their selection has fallen behind other premier beer bars in the Bay Area. 

What hurts this place the most is the surly, obnoxious bartenders. But enough has been said on them. I figure if I want to deal with a long wait and get treated like shit, I'll go to the DMV. 

Despite this, the bar is always packed. 

In short: great value, especially for a bar in the city, but the bartenders tend to be complete jerks. I used to be a big fan of the place, but now I go there maybe twice a year.
author: Mikkel T.

description: If I could give less than one star I would. I am a big supporter of dive bars and hardworking bartenders. I've worked in the service industry. I know what to expect...when I walked into Toronado, I expected a good time. I had 7 people with me and I was the designated driver. I jumped in line first and told the bartender that I would be ordering  beers for everyone, but that first I'd like a water since I am designated driver. She promptly told me "I don't have time for water. You're not even a paying customer. Do you not even see what I'm dealing with here?" It's literally Monday night. May 20th. There weren't even 15 people in this bar. She doesn't have time to get me a water? I (along with my 7 beer-loving friends) walked next door to noc-noc and racked up a $225 tab. So I sincerely hope whoever owns this bar sees this review and rips this lady-bartender a new one. I've never been so disrespected in a bar in my life...and that's saying A LOT.
author: Melanie M.

description:
It's crowded, it's loud, it's crowded, it's cash only, it's crowded, it's great!

I don't like beer. It doesn't go well with my taste buds and doesn't go down smoothly for me. But my friend suggested I try Lindemans Framboise - a raspberry beer, light like a cider. It was awesome! Like drinking fruit juice. Very smooth. I would totally get it again! and again... and again.. It's so easy to drink! :D

Also sipped on a few other beers just to try them out.. and man, the KICK, the bitter BITE that beer gives me makes me scrunch my face. Sorry, I'm just a complete and total beer noob. I do not mean to offend - I am still learning! 

Next time I visit the Toronado, I know what I'm getting! 

Anyone else have some great suggestions for newbie beer drinkers?
author: Christine C.

description:
This place was pretty cool!  The beer selection was kick a***, but since I am not a huge beer drinker I got myself a girlie lambic, but it was pretty delicious which worked for me.  
The bartenders seemed pretty helpful when it comes to asking what type of beer one should get and the prices were pretty reasonable.  
It does get super crowded and loud though, which for me isn't a bad thing since the crowd was pretty cool and everyone was kind of different.  
Since they don't serve food they allow people to go next door to the sausage or pizza joint to get food and bring it in, which is always nice, oh and if I could give it a half a star more I would for the tamale lady that came in!
author: Rebecca D.

description:
***CASH ONLY***

The selection and quality of beer is great, especially at the price.  Why drink a Newcastle for $6 elsewhere when you could get something and more interesting for the same price or less?  It should also be noted that Toronado is one of the few bars in town that serve cask ale.  For cask ale devotees, it is hard to order anything else.

They'll get a 5th star when they let you ask the bartenders questions about the beer.
author: Suo L.

description:
I had to SIGN UP for yelp I felt so strongly about how bad a time we had at this place.

DO NOT COME HERE!

Walked in and sat down at a table with my girlfriend.  Asked her what she wanted and while she looked the beer list on the wall i went up to the bar and ordered one for myself.  We were waiting for 4 more friends, and hadn't been there for but 4 minutes tops... and one of the bar tenders came up to the table and angrily barked at us.

"DO YOU KNOW WHAT KIND OF BAR THIS IS!?  YOU MUST ORDER BEER TO SIT HERE!  YOU NEED TO ORDER RIGHT NOW OR GET OUT."

Caught us completely off-guard.  I... assuming he mistakenly thought we had been lounging there for awhile... tried to calmly mutter that we had just stepped in the door, she was about to select one, and our friends were on the way.  Didn't even come close to getting a word or 2 out... and he just went completely off ranting at us very very angrily.

It was was pretty bizarre.   I considered talking to the manager, but figured they wouldn't care, so we left... never to return again.

REALLY. HORRIBLE. EXPERIENCE.
author: P G.

description: Great beer selection, awesome dive bar atmosphere, and wonderfully surly staff.  Had Pliny the Elder, Ballast Point Dorado, and Rodenbach Grand Cru, among other things.  Met some great, friendly regulars and split a Russian River T25 with them.  Be sure you get a tamale from the Tamale Lady when she comes by!
author: Alex O.

description:
This place is a beer-lover's paradise.  It's so good, I'm not sure what else to write about it.  I guess if you love beer and you are in SF- this is where you should be.  Killer selection and awesome staff. 
CASH ONLY 

A++++

cheers
author: Collin C.

description:
I'm torn on how to rate this place.  Their beer selection is good.  Their nostalgic beer advert collection adds character and a chance to use foreign language skills, but in my opinion just about everything else detracts from the place.  Maybe it's just not my scene or something, but it seemed you had to look somewhat like Kurt Cobain, fancy Bettie Page or trying to maintain your fraternity years to 'fit in' in this place.  I found the music too loud to have a conversation with friends over some 'intelligent' beer, while I saw many knuckle looking heads there to drink imported beer for its intoxicating effect rather than it's savory flavor and effects.  American breweries make 'ice' beer for a reason, it's for you guys!  

I've spent quite a lot of time in Belgium, in the young bars and pubs where the beer is just as strong or stronger, yet you can hear everything being said and people literally aren't pointlessly screaming.    So I'd have to say place gets a bad rating from me based on the crowd I've sen there the few times I've been there.  Which is such a shame...
author: Matt R.

description:
Really excited to have been to this legendary establishment! It's totally different from the one in my neck of the woods! As soon as you walk in you're greeted with a very divey atmosphere. You're in a bar, and they won't let you forget it! Cash only! Antlers and deer heads, tons of Belgian beer paraphernalia line the walls. Poorly lit, with a metal bar top. It seems like they just went to a junk yard and threw this place together in a day.

I was slightly worried, because I had been warned about the service here, so I didn't really know what to expect. Our bartender was an older guy with a pony tail and terrible breath, didn't catch his name. He wasn't a dick, but I can see why people might not like the service they'd get there. He seemed very knowledgeable about the beer he served and seemed slightly nazi like about the glassware. Sort of odd, because it almost seemed like if he was out of the glassware he might not even give you the beer. I remember joking with a friend of mine that I was going to drink a Cantillon out of the bottle here, and he said that I would get kicked out if I did something like that. I completely understand what he means now.

The most impressive thing to me is that they store their bottles at the proper temperature. I've never seen that done before and it was a very nice surprise.

The selection here isn't really as great at I figured it would be, but if you're an average beer lover you'll enjoy this place considerably. They cover all their bases.
author: Benjamin F.

description:
Yeah yeah, good location.  Yeah yeah, over 50 beers on tap.  Yeah yeah, cash only.

You know what gets a giant No No?  The attitude, dirty looks and shoulder bump from the guy at the door when he had to get a mop to clean up the beer I accidentally spilled.
