There is ample seating and standing room, although it can get nasty crowded on the weekends.  I love that they let you bring food in and even clean up the trash afterwards. Brownie points. However, the bathrooms are a dive bar nast-fest, but what do you expect....Also, can't beat the prices!
author: Skye W.

description: Smelly hellhole with lousy service- unless you're a local why would anyone want to be here?
author: Mark D.

description:
I absolutely love this place.  I love the grungy feel, the loud volume, and one of the best selection of beers on tap in the state.  If you don't act like a total douche, then the surly bartenders will take care of you.  In fact, I'm fully entertained every time I go here because inevitably someone acts like a dumbass and gets a verbal reprimand by the house staff.

Prices are excellent, service is good, and they serve delicious, rare, craft beers.  The only complaint is that they only take cash, which is either cool or completely archaic. 

Either way, I will be back...hopefully soon.
author: Josh M.

description: Ugh. Tried to go to Toronado last night but the place smelled so heavily of vomit that we had to leave. Too bad -- the beer selection, crowd, and everything else is pretty great.  But couldn't get past the smell.
author: Jen R.

description: I love this place, but you have really like beer and come here knowing what you want. This place isn't about customer service, so don't bother the bartender with questions or ask for recommendations. The best thing is that right next door is an amazing sausage place! There's nothing better than sausage and beer! Yummy! Best bar in town!
author: Monica A.

description: Beer! Lots and lots of good beer! Go there if you like beer! Good jukebox with a place to set your beer on top of.
author: H K.

description:
People in San Francisco seem to take their drinking more seriously than people where I'm from do. This is evidenced by the existence of places like the Toronado, which I love, but whose beer menu is intimidating enough that I always make my husband order for me. 

The Toronado serves up fine Belgian and local beers to the masses who flock there. I've never been there at night (I'm always ending up there in the late afternoon), but it's been busy every time I've been. It's nice and keeps the feel bustling and energetic, but it's not the best bar for standing. Anyway, if you want to get accidentally drunk on beer with a 2-digit alcohol content, I recommend the Toronado. It's got a low bullshit factor and a nice feel, and they play good music. Extra bonus is that you can get a vegan sausage from Rosamunde next door and bring it in to eat while you drink.
author: Jordan P.

description:
a home run for beer drinkers who know a little more than average about brewing. 

Don't go in and ask "what do you have on draft" or you'll feel like you're being dismissed as an amateur. Its OK not to know but don't show weakness or you'll get dismissed quickly. 

if you are an IPA or a Belgian (all sorts) drinker you'll find this place heaven. enjoy high quality brews at inexpensive prices in a down and dirty environment. But don't think the place is nasty, it isn't. The bathrooms are clean (awesome graffiti work just based on the volume alone in a small space) and the place is well kept even if a little yeasty smelling. The bartenders know their stuff and they will respect your indecision on what you want if you come to the party with a little knowledge on what your looking for ... "what can you recommend in a double IPA" is a fair question, but "do you have something like Bud Light?" isn't going to get you too far. 

wine and spirit drinkers - don't bother. this place is all about the beer and its #1 in the city for the good beer experience in an interesting and low key environment. 

Bring food in from any one of the good joints around and enjoy the color, flavor and friendly atmosphere of a great beer bar, 

Long live the Toronado! 

Woof
author: JX C.

description:
What can be said about this place that hasn't already been said a thousand times? The beer selection is absolutely insane; I've gone in two days in a row and found that my current beer of choice that I had picked up the day before had been switched out.  There's never a time when one looks at the board and wonders when something new will catch the eye.

The staff can be assholes but I find it hilarious and never take anything they say seriously.  It's a bar with an atmosphere and service that isn't too shabby.  It's nothing outrageously amazing, but the drinks speak for themselves in this kind of place.

Toronado makes me wish I lived in a bigger city.  I make up for it by coming here whenever I'm in SF, even if it's on Christmas day.
author: Jeff C.

description:
wow. what a damn fine selection of beers. I was a bit put off by the smell of beer when I first entered, however I soon got over the smell when I sipped on barley wine. I wasn't sure what barley wine was, but I am sure that it's easy to go from sober to drunk in 2.2...where was the in between tipsy, I'm having fun stage? Clearly not possible..but oh so tasty! 

I read the yelp reviews before going saying that the bartenders weren't helpful and the place kept the yuppies out. Perhaps I went on an off night, cause they let me in and were helpful! cheers to the uber friendly bartenders who let a few yuppies in the joint, hey, we like beer too.
author: Natalie C.

description:
Best beer selection at a bar in the city.  Thats the reason to come here. 
I think they have like 50 on tap.

Been here a dozen times, but would come here more if it wasn't always so crowded .. and it sometimes smells like .. a bar that hasn't been cleaned in a while.  

Bonus points for being cool with Rosamunde sausage grill next door.
author: chad n.

description:
Ugly. Dirty. Loud.

And the best damn selection of beer on tap I've ever seen. Keeps me coming back for more. That and the fact that Rosamunde sausage grill is right next door. And you can bring your foor into the bar....Mmm, beer and sausage!!!
author: Margo M.

description:
So last Friday my buddy calls me up and tells me that a few friends are meeting up at 'TorOnado' for a few beers.  I've never heard of it (I'm new to town so that doesn't mean much).

What my ears pick up is the word tornado being pronounced like avocado and I immediately start groaning and whining about having to go to a place that is SO pretentious that they had to 'elevate' the pronunciation of their trailer-bane namesake.

If you've been to Toronado then you can imagine my relief when I got to the front of the bar and saw that 
a. there really was an extra 'O' in the name and that really IS how you pronounce it and 
b. the bar itself is far from the pretentious pomp-romp that I had been dreading.

Basically, Toronado is a beer drinkers bar.  They have collected beers and ales from around the globe and while it can get a little pricey (up to 12 dollars a pint if memory serves) they are offering a great opportunity to tour through Europe from the comfort of your bar stool.

It's also worth mentioning that the bartender (Johnny) was really friendly and chatty and at one point after he'd forgotten to bring me my drink he just put it on the house.  The only reason I'm leaving that last star off is that I'm a bit anti-hipster and there were just a few too many black haired fashion victims trying to discuss something 'significant' for my taste, but I'll definitely be going here again.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
Great beer selection but some of the biggest pricks in the City work there. Ever since the owner's girlfriend or wife, whatever the unlucky bastard calls her, took over, most of the staff has turned over. She is one of the nastiest people I've ever met in the City (I'm pretty sure she's from Jersey). I usually peer in through the door, if she's there, I keep walking and head for the Geist.

The only two people that remain working there from the old days are the grouchiest guys that I know (we'll call them Captain and Tennille). Luckily for me, they're both friends of mine for almost 2 decades or I'd probably walk right out like I do when I see the owners other half.

Anyway, there are some great people that work and/or hangout there. Tad (short guy w/long hair& glasses) is one of the nicest guys you'll meet, and Johnny Davis (Tues afternoon shift) is probably the coolest bartender in the City (has won numerous awards for this) and is a part owner of the currently burned down bar Benders.

One word to the wise, if the Captain (fat guy that waddles around) or Tennile (Howard Stern/Joey Ramone Lookalike) are working, treat them as you would the Soup Nazi. Do not approach the bar unless you have your order ready and by no means do it holding cash in your hand for them to see. When and only when you are formally acknowledged, order the beer and wait for them to state what you owe. Don't try to be friendly with them. If they make small talk with you (which they won't), then you can talk, otherwise just shut your snapper.

The night crew is different, but not many real neighborhood regulars go there at night. It's mostly a beer geek or Marina type crowd. The real crew can be found there at Johnny's shift from 11:30am-4pm on Tuesdays.
author: Hank S.

description:
Not bad, but I was a little disappointed.  Everyone had raved about the vast selection of beers--and there are indeed a lot of them--but I saw very little variety.  The menu is dominated by IPAs, my least favorite type of beer.  Can't a girl get something dark and not too hoppy without resorting to the obvious Guinness or the pricey chocolate stout?    

I appreciate this bar's proximity to Rosamunde, but I doubt I'll ever stop in without a sausage in hand.
author: Karin H.

description:
Wow... this is how a dive bar should be. Sometimes I get lazy and end up getting stuck in the bermuda trian...I mean the Marina (trust me, I didn't move to that area by choice). When I finally do make it out to other neighborhoods, I remember why I liked this city in the first place. But I digress...

Toronado = good beer, good people, good conversation... good.
(minus one star for the unisex bathrooms. seriously, guys, please try a bit harder to aim)
author: Sarah P.

description:
BEEEEEER!

Go get a Rosamunde sausage next door, grab a bitter ale, and just try to find a place to stand in this wonderful bar-o-plenty! Oh and don't try to order anything you have ever heard of before... because unless it is unique, they don't serve it here.

Beer snobs, apply within!
author: K. C.

description:
This place is for beer nerds. When I first came in this place I didn't even know what the beers they had on the wall were. 

I've been going here for a few years now and I know a little bit more but still barely know anything about the beers there.

It is very hard to get a seat because it is so crowded. 

I like the fact that Rosamunde and Mythic are right next door. 

My friend really likes this place and he's pretty much the only reason I go unless I'm in the area and want a beer.
author: Dan M.

description:
worth fighting for a table here.  Great jukebox too.
I dont even drink and I love it!
author: rani s.

description:
waited at the bar for my rosamunde burger.  ordered two pliny the elders. bartender couldn't break a $50, said to come back in a bit, enjoy the beer for now... hour later, i paid for the beers, one beer on the house for being honest.

see how that works?  8D
author: Ethan L.

description:
So much drama in these reviews.
If you argue with a doorman about leaving at closing, and then grab him, chances are you aren't going to like what happens to you.

I find that if I am respectful to the staff, they are to me.  I also see how they react to people with attitude.  

They have great beer and it's a fun place to hang out with friends, in my opinion.  The jerks who post nasty personal messages about bartenders being "old" "fat" "ugly" and worse should stay away from my favorite bar.
author: Danielle T.

description: Great Beer selection. I loved the variety of Domestic and foreign Brews. Will go again. Cash only, so be prepared if you are like me and typically use debit card
author: Stephen C.

description: I didn't understand why my friends kept saying to go here. I'd say "why?" and they'd answer "it's really cool" or "it's interesting" or "it's just a good divey bar". Then I got there, looked at the list of beers, and suddenly realized what makes Toronado so special- there are literally dozens of beer ON TAP! I've never been to a bar with so many draught choices! Of course the down side of so much choice is having to make some difficult decisions, fortunately it's hard to go wrong in this instance. The prices are average/decent, but the bartenders were a bit on the surly side, although I was there on a really busy night and the place was packed so I can't blame them. If you're a beer lover with a few hours to spare you MUST check this bar out!
author: Jennifer D.

description: I work at a beer bar in Chicago so whenever I'm traveling I'm always in search of good beer and ideally something I can't get at home.  Toronado was the answer.  I've heard a few of my regulars talk about this place so I had to hit it up.  Awesome selection, knowledgeable staff and... RUSSIAN RIVER!!!  I know that's nothing new for you guys in CA but seeing as we can't get it back home it sure is a treat.  I'll definitely be back whenever I'm in San Fran.
author: Neil R.

description:
Amazing place, has such a different feel than the San Diego Tornado because it has sooo much character. There's just something about old bars. The beer selection was equally as impressive of course! You can run next door and get a sausage on soft, fresh bread with grilled onions aaaaand peppers. (And bring that bad boy back to the bar with ya!)

Atmosphere is relaxed, casual, and the bartenders are great to talk to, I'd come here alone. Maybe I will. Tonight!
author: Jessica C.

description: This place is an amazing contribution to San Francisco!  I have gone here many times and it is the best atmosphere to drink in.  A menu that carries all microbreweries and that has a delightful selection of local breweries.  Definitely a beer lover's haven.
author: Francesca H.

description: I'll keep it short and simple. It's all been said before, but I'll add this. Don't let the sad realization that you are not the center of the universe affect your feelings toward this place.  Here's a pro-tip. Tip.
author: Nick K.

description:
Let me begin by saying I love dive bars. I thought I would love this place.
I will never go back to this shit hole.
I waited about 10 minutes for "Jen" (I think her name is) to acknowledge my presence. 
There were not any customers waiting, that bitch was stuffing her face with pizza behind the bar (which is not kosher under ServSafe standards).
Jen had taken so long to serve me that I had forgotten which beer my boyfriend wanted by the time she got to me. (That's bad)
I ordered my beer, turned to ask my boyfriend what he wanted, and by the time I turned back around, Jen had taken back the beer she poured for me.  She told me she was not going to serve me, adding,   "you are in the city now, little girl, get your shit together or go back to the country. If you can't figure out how to behave in a bar, you are not going to get served". 
I don't know where that bitch gets off proscribing standards of bar behavior ...  She sure as hell does not know how to tend the bar... (She doesn't even make drinks! She pours beers!)
I have travelled in four continents and never had any problems ordering a beer anywhere else, even where I was unfamiliar with the local language.  
II have worked in the service industry and can understand when people ask stupid questions and waste time, but that bitch was completely unjustified. 
If it's a dive bar, the bartender is supposed to compensate for the shitty décor and foul smells. This bar has no redeeming qualities. Mr. Tornado, that girlfriend/wife of yours is going to cost you your business.
author: L B.

description: Coming from London, I wasn't expecting much in the way of beer selection here in San Francisco. However, after going to Toronado I have to say I'm pretty impressed. Yes we had to wait for somewhere to sit at 3pm on a Monday, but after we were sitting it was quite nice. The bartender was awesome.
author: Sarah F.

description:
The people in this city have been blasted by the cold for so long, that they don't care if the door is open all the time. If coming here, bring a thick coat!
The half door tests your coordination - if you can't get in then you've had too much already.
author: Ed R.

description:
If you are a Belgian beer fanatic, this is the place to go. I have yet to find another place in the SFBA with a Belgian collection that is even close. 

And by Belgians, I DO NO mean Stella. Why the hell would you pay import price for Stella when it tastes JUST LIKE BUD??? Friends don't let friends drink Stella.

Unless you are the shoot-from-the-hip type, this place is best enjoyed if you have a beer snob friend along that can recommend stuff for you.

BTW, at one point they had Cantillon on tap. That is mega points, folks. If you know your Belgian you know how big of a deal that is.
author: Ben L.

description:
First review - had to give it to Toronado, one of my favorite bars (and believe me, I've visited plenty in this city). 
Beer - sweet nectar of the gods. Toronado has plenty to choose from. So much so that it can be a bit overwhelming. Do you stick with your favorites or do you venture out and try something new? Tough call. But alas, it's beer, so how can you go wrong?
Friday night after work? Grab a sausage next door from Rosamunde, take a seat at the bar and drink to the weekend.
author: Jill W.

description:
Seriously, this place has a wall of tappers.

It's often packed, so you have to vie for tables and seating, but the selection of beer is worth the effort.

Also, they let you get sausages from next door and eat them in the bar.
author: James D.

description:
There are not too many places in SF where you can start off the evening with a light German pilsner, move your way up to a local amber, try a hand pumped English porter and finish with a barley wine. In fact, I can't think of any other place other than Toronado. Major points for this alone. I suppose any place that has over 30 taps is begging for a good review from beer lovers and in a way its deserved but it also depends on the selection of beer and this place has a great one.

There are also not too many places that you can order food from next door and bring it in. Now honestly this is pretty cool but it really just means that Rosemunde's is just the de facto kitchen for Toronado. That being said, there's nothing that goes better with a beer than a brat. 

It can get a bit loud in here but that should give you hope that there are still drinkers of quality beer. The stickers all over every surface give this place a punk rock vibe although I've never had any problems with "punk" bartenders, they've always been nice to me.
author: Nicholas B.

description:
Toronado is nothing if not a beer destination -- if you know anything about craft beer, get ready to be blown away.  They have a great happy hour, reasonable prices, and kickass food options next door.  Unfortunately they painted over the occasionally brilliant and always entertaining bathroom graffiti.

As for the service, it would be one thing if being ignored for 15 minutes was part of the Toronado package, but it's not -- a couple of the regular bartenders are attentive and occasionallly -- gasp -- nice.  Schizophrenic is better than uniformly surly, though.

So yeah, great beer, great place to show off to your out of town friends, but I'll take City Beer Store.
author: S P.

description:
I appreciate a place that stands out.  Toronado is San Francisco's beer place.  It goes well beyond the usual Anchor Steam-Sierra Nevada-Red Hook-Pilsner Urquell-Stella Artois-Bass-Guinness song and dance.

BUT, and this is a big butt, this place has the obnoxious "regulars" syndrome.  My friends and I were standing behind this regular at the bar, and he kept on hinting--more and more forcefully---that there were tables in the back where we could sit.  And then he started making this hilarious joke about how the bartender needed to put a watercooler in the middle of the floor so we stand around it.  To you, kind sir, I truly apologize for having a job and I don't have the time to sit on my lard ass and come up with such fine barbs.

And ultimately, I just can't booze THAT seriously.  Though it does get you drunk ... yes, there's always that.
author: Paul K.

description:
We came here on a night where there were a lot of douchy Marina nights. One of them even came up to us and proceeded to latch on to us after we  went to another place, back to my friend's place, and even had the nerve to assume that we'd drive him and his drunk friend home (when it was totally the other way).

But that's not Toronado's fault, just the Marina's. Haha. Lot's of beer choices at fair prices. Before coming here, I swore off beer after drinking way too much of it in Europe. It was really really hard to not hop over the bar, and chug from the tap. OK, I ended up caving in, I didn't jump over the bar, but I did order a beer and man it was great (its was also Oktoberfest,). Wish the sausage place next door was open so I could truly relive my Eastern European days. Alas, it wasn't, but I did have a tasty beer, but sadly in the presence of that douchy tool guy.

Parking blows though, but its definitely worth checking out.
author: Rocky K.

description:
You know its going to be a place that *knows* their beer if they don't even have any hard liquor. These guys totally do know beer for sure - good recommendations all night. Nice collection of bumper stickers plastered everywhere which really enhances the dive bar experience - nothing makes you feel more white trash than looking at satan bumper stickers.

Try the "Prior 8" - yeah, it costs a little more, but it is soooo tasty.
author: Sean C.

description:
I went here for their 20th anniversary party. It was stupid crowded. It was loud. I still got my beer right away, made new friends, and for the love of all that is sacred and holy, the beer. I almost panicked trying to decide what beers to get, because I knew if I had all the ones I wanted, I was going to end up in the hospital. 
I'm going to be back in the bay area in two weeks, and am I heading straight to the Toronado!
author: Rabbit M.

description: Great beer selection, cool atmosphere...reason for two stars....COMPLETE AND UTTER SHITTY SERVICE. Male bartender complete asshole and security act like assholes. Love the beers but the service will keep me away
author: Michelle S.

description: This may be the OG location and the San Diego location may be a franchise but the SF crew should take some customer service classes from the SD staff. The bartenders at this location are some holier than thou dicks who think they're doing you a favor for pouring you a beer.
author: Ivonne C.

description: Toronado has a notoriously surly staff, and it is often too packed for comfort.  On the other hand, the beer selection is great, the graffiti is amusing, and sausages from Rosamunde are welcome.
author: Eric L.

description: Great rotating beer selection. Definitely on the no-frills side for bathrooms. It can get super crowded and fighting for a chance to order a beer is a competitive sport. It's worth the fight though, the beer selection is excellent and the staff know their beer. The pleasantly buxom blonde bartender is wonderful.
author: Hurston P.

description:
Love the beer selection (sometimes TOO much to decide...I want it all), love the beer lovers there, love the atmosphere, love the next door's sausage availability, and plan on going during the day so you don't have to elbow yourself through to the bar.  Plenty of sitting during the day. 
Cheers...prost.....salud....enjoy!
author: Jacqueline A.

description: new years eve with my wife, lots of great beers consumed, great conversation with people at the bar and cool bartenders, plus a jukebox  with some classic stuff on it
author: Cassandra C.

description: As some others have probably said, this is a beer drinker's paradise.  So many unique and rare brews on tap, and many more by the bottle.  The bartenders are very friendly and knowledgeable, with only a hint of pretentiousness.  The evening I went the Oscars were on, and the crowd became extremely emotional when Jeff Bridges (or His Dudeness, if you're not into that whole brevity thing) won Best Actor.  Everyone tore into Big Lebowski quotes which was very entertaining.  But I digress, come for the beer, stay for the company.  Warning, there's no food...boo hoo....
author: Jesse R.

description: Jennifer is the bomb!  How can I find here schedule so I only go when she's there?  They should post it on the web site with the beers!
author: T. Weldon R.

description:
This place is always packed. Even on a Monday night at midnight! (I guess that would technically be Tuesday) Seating can be tricky when so many people are there.

The selection of beer is amazing. I like to go in a just pick one at random.

The prices on beer do have a wide range but you will always find one for yourself.

I live near the one in San Diego and they are different. The one in San Diego is clean and neat while the on in San Francisco has that nice dive bar feeling to it with stickers and old beer tap handles along the walls.
author: Brent B.

description: Its a great place, small, crowdy but fun. Very old style looking. But you will get zillions of option for beers. If you are beer fan this place is must to go
author: Anji D.

description: Great beer selection and atmosphere.  I am knocking off a star because the bartenders are not always the friendliest people.  We have had a couple of bad experiences.  But nevertheless I keep going back.  The sausages next door are amazing.
author: Vanessa R.

description: We went on a Saturday and stayed from 8-12. The night started a little weirdly when the lady bartender barked at us for arranging bar stools in a way that violated fire department codes. But once she got that out of her system, everything was fine. I'm not a beer drinker but the boys love the Pliney there. Overall we had a great night that ended with pics and spilled drinks. All the random shit on the walls also kept us entertained during those spacey drunk silences. The bouncers are really nice. BIG WARNING though: the bathrooms are some of the worst I've ever seen. Avoid them at all costs if possible.
author: Esperanza A.

description:
The Toronado has by far the best beer selection in our fair city.  It also has by far the craziest bartender.  Because of you, [black-haired wife of the owner who works infrequently but is always there when I come in] I must subtract one star. A word of advice to new visitors: just make your order and try not to ask questions or say anything else. 

But crazy lady notwithstanding, be shocked by their outstanding selection of beers- especially in the Belgian, German, and local microbrews.  I would recommend any local or visitor stop by for the microbrews alone; just do not, under any circumstances, order coors, miller, or bud.  Death awaits you.
author: EDW L.

description:
This place rocks. the first time I went in there it there was Miles on the jukebox and I looked up to see a selection of beers like no other.  Well ok there are other places that have lots of beers but lots of great local and import beers on tap.  Also they have a belgian beer month April that kicks ass.  And the correct glass to service a wheat beer or saison or whatever your pleasure. not to mention the big hoegarten bucket. Plus a great room. Feels homey and comfortable.  

Since then I go there on a pretty regualar basis cause the beers the music and the crowd.   Good bartenders and everyone there knows thier beers. To boot there is a great sausage place next door and they have the menu in the bar and allow you to take your food in.  

The most comfortable beer joint for me.
lastly,  they have a poster that says Zappa for president.  what more can you ask for?
author: Bucky W.

description:
If you want to watch me drink as much beer as my body can handle, take me here.

Seriously, I've been going here for as long as I can remember. The first time I was taken here by my friends was maybe 1997-1998, and the place hasn't changed at all. The beer selection changes all the time, but theres always at least 5-6 different kinds I want to have per night.

You can get Sausage from the place next door (Rosamunde) till about 10pm usually, and I reccomend doing so because its a tasty combo.
author: Tom S.

description:
The Steam taste the best here & Johnny's the man. 
If beer be your dinner - go no further.
author: M E.

description:
Whenever I think of this place, I think of that episode of "Roseanne" in which Dan and Roseanne go out of town with DJ for the night and Becky and her stupid friend get drunk. They mix a bunch of booze from the Connor Liquor cabinet and call them "tornadoes." They get super drunk and have really bad hangovers the next day.

"Becky...."
"Yeah?"
"The room is spinning!"
"Yeah! Isn't it great!"
author: Jackie I.

description:
Amazing gift of the world's best beers on tap, not sure what tough guy bar tenders have to do with Belgian sensibilities, it's the lamest thing about this place. Sit in back though and you might be able to have a conversation in spite of the blaring muscle-car rock. 

Molotov's across the street is way tougher than Toronado anyway, no need to blast out patrons, they know they're bad asses without striking the pose. Only liquor on lower haight too. Molotov's rules but they're missing the mad Belgian beers.
author: J D.

description:
Such an amazing selection of beer. Turned me onto my current favorite, 1554, although the last couple times they've been out and made me cry. 
The bartenders are the best when it's slower. Then they can actually pay you some attention, talk to you about the beers and even let you try out the goods.
author: Jessica R.

description:
You cannot deny that Toronado has an impressive collection of taps being displayed on its walls, or that the bathroom graffiti is comprehensive.  

The bartender gave me a free miniature bottle of something one time, and in the aftermath I was compelled me to seek refuge in the bathroom while I refunded the mystery liquid.  Goodwill has its downsides.
author: Sam M.

description:
I'm a freakin' beer snob now.  How did this happen?  
Now that I am officially a beer snob, I'm authorized to recommend this place if you're in the mood for an awesome belgian beer.  Plus, you can bring in a nice meal from the sausage place next door.  

I'm also a cheap date, which means I'm also authorized to recommend the sausage/beer combination to all you guys who have cheap dates and need to get a little creative.
author: Cindy L.

description:
I've been here at least a half dozen times.  A difficult place to review.  One is tugged in either direction by both the awesome and terrible aspects, so it's a matter of what is most important to you and how much you can put up with for the good things.

I'll get the bad parts out of the way first so I don't have to end on a sour note.

The bathrooms rival many gas station bathrooms in repugnance.  Seriously, they are the single worst thing about this joint.  We're talking *puddles* of urine on the floor, literally.  To be a woman and have to use the loo here would be about 10 times worse.  I'm a guy, and am not usually easy to offend with stuff like this, but man, the bathrooms are awful, especially the later into the night it gets.

The other big negative is of course the staff.  They have a reputation for being surly, and it's well-earned.  About the best you can hope for is silent indifference.  These are not happy, cheery folks...think NYC, not Austin.  In fact, if you feign inferiority, know exactly what you want, have the cash ready to go, and don't ask questions, you will get much better service the next time.  They seem to know they have one of the best beer selections in the country, and perhaps the arrogance derives from that.  It sucks, but whaddya gonna do?

Which brings us to the good stuff.  It's what you came here for: the beer.  They've got the goods, no doubt.  It's easily one of the best in the country for beer nerds.  Certainly not THE best, but among the top 10 probably, top 20 definitely.  Serious artisanal stuff from Belgium, a ton of west coast micros and even some random German and British stuff on tap, and all in good condition (no damned frosted mugs here!).  They don't mess around with much pedestrian junk, though of course it's not ALL good.  But the owner knows his stuff...it holds up to scrutiny from the most active beer hounds in the country (beer people come here from all over the world, in fact).

Another very cool aspect is that although they don't offer any food, you can BYOF from anywhere you want.  Lots of folks go next door to the sausage place, which is indeed quite tasty, but there's burritos and Indian food nearby too.  Heck, bring your own sandwich from home if you want.  This is a killer policy IMHO, because you can enjoy the beer you want AND the food you want, instead of being limited to the food they might have offered.  Falling Rock in Denver really needs to consider this option.

While you have to deal with the dodgy staff in order to get a glass in front of you, play it cool and you'll probably do fine...ever since I figured out how to behave here, I've never had any problem.  And it's worth it for the beer they're offering.
author: Ernest C.

description:
My Rosamunde review says:

"To go, for here, or next door?

Always next door."

Enough said. 

(But not on a Friday or Saturday night)
author: Joe D.

description:
If you are a beer lover, this is your bar. You can always find something you'll like that you've never tried before for $5 or less. 

The crowd here is, unfortunately, hit or miss. Sometimes it's great and mostly keeps to itself. Other times, it's full of douchebags who seem to take great delight at shoulder-charging you as they pace back and forth. I recommend coming late (near midnight) and staying until last call. You'll get a place to sit much easier and the beer comes much faster.
author: Ryan R.

description:
Average bar; average selection for being known for having a good selection (I've seen a lot better on average in Seattle).

Get the drift?  Just AVERAGE!  

I have to throw my Seattle pretentiousness out there on beers!

I would definitely come back though.
author: Justin C.

description:
Best selection of beer in town!
One of the best prices for beer in town, especially during happy-hour!
Best selection of crazy-ass stickers I've ever seen!
Optimal location, right next to the Rosamunde sausage grill.
Excellent selections available in the jukebox.
Most of the bartenders are pricks, but we all love them for it!
I wouldn't change a thing here, it's perfect!
author: Stephen B.

description:
Ah, the simplicity of Tornado - you're winning the ways of my heart. 

A myriad selection of beer on tap and a relaxed atmosphere to just chat it up and enjoy the company of others who enjoy beer. What more could you ask for?
author: Anthony S.

description:
That is a boat load of good beer on tap. 

The let us bring in pizza from Mythic next door, which made for an awesome combo.
author: Keith P.

description: Hooray for cask beers at Toronado.  This place rocks.  I am particularly enamored with the patina of this local bar that attracts a wide variety customers because of ther excellent beer selection.  Happy hour is long and well worth the trip for a start on an early afternoon session!
author: Jimbowicz J.

description: Cute bar and I loved being able to eat my sausage from Rosamunde inside and pair it with a nice beer. I tried the "Pliny the Elder" and the Pomegranate Cider. Each beer was only $5 each and came in a huge glass! Very reasonable prices here and the beer selection is original and vast. Nice dive bar for groups or just to chill out for a bit.
author: Lauren S.

description: Stupendous beer selection and extremely reasonable prices. 5 stars!!
author: Emily W.

description:
Toronado has a fairly acceptable list of beers, however, the shticky, bitchy attitude delivered by the dark-haired, hag-of-a-bartender was completely unacceptable. 

I stood first in line at the empty bar, waiting for approximately 5 minutes as she finished washing glasses and ranting about "how goddamn long I've been working here...and back on the East Coast..." when I finally said, "Excuse me, do you mind if I order a beer?" She immediately yelled back at me, "Ohhhh, wait, let me drop everything just to help YOU! You are interrupting me!"

I get the deal about being short with customers in an effort to foster some kind of edgy vibe at this alleged "dive bar", but treating polite, patient customers with such hatred isn't very productive - particularly when it's your customers that give you your paycheck. 

I won't be back here again. There are a lot of other joints that serve the same beers minus the idiocy.
author: Julie D.

description: Wish there was a place like this in my home town (LA). Great selection of craft brews, I've never seen more than 2 Russian River taps at any bar and they had 5. Try the Dogfish Head & Sierra Nevada collaboration called Life & Limb before it's gone. The atmosphere is straight dive, and the prices are the best I've seen anywhere, with most pints at $4-5 ($1 off during happy hour). I also loved that just about every song i heard playing out of the jukebox was from the nineties.
author: Milton V.

description: Terrible service.  When we asked for a recommendation the bartender gave us the most disgusted look and said "i don't drink beer."  Awesome.  It is like being at a steakhouse and having your server tell you he doesn't eat meat.  I will say the crowd was cool.  But I couldn't get over the staff.
author: Roberta J.

description: Why have I not written a review of this place before?  The beer selection is kind of epic, there's always something new you'll see/find in the decor, and seems like it's always at or over capacity.  Easy access to sausages from next door to help tamp down the alcohol.  Service can be slow when it's busy, as is even being able to belly up to the bar.  I've always met some interesting people here, if I didn't happen to bring along interesting people myself.
author: Andy B.

description: I'm always amazed that there seems to be a unlimited supply of new beer bars for me to stumble across and still be excited over. Toronado is one of them. Perhaps my love for this place is that it is equidistant from both my house and our dear friends. But really, I love the reasonably priced beer and the jaw dropping selection. This is the kind of place I'd enjoy having as my go-to bar to meet up with friends and play card games, yet despite all it's attractiveness, I don't end up hear nearly as often as I would imagine.
author: Allyson S.

description: A cool bar with a very side selection of good beer, I esp. love Damnation! The bartenders are always really nice, and even offered me a taster first, which is always helpful. The downside is that it gets super packed and it can be quite hard to find any seating. But hey, if you want to try some good beer, check it out!
author: Sonya D.

description:
ATTITUDE, ATTITUDE, AND ATTITUDE!! I'm a native San Franciscan, have gone to Toronado a handful of times, and not once have I had an enjoyable experience. Today was the last straw! Yet again, I was confronted with another "bartender" with attitude. I'll never return, and I didn't leave the fat, insecure loser a tip either! 

The customer next to me politely asked the "bartender" to suggest a Christmas beer, to which the greasy F's said, "I would NEVER suggest any, I don't drink any Christmas beers". I asked the "bartender" to recommend a lager, to which he replied, "Only women and people who have never been here order a lager". 

Alright, so this fool thinks that the awesome lagers so prevalent in Germany, Holland, and Mexico are shitty?? Yeah, he's an expert alright. This place embodies all the funk and attitude that SF is known for, but additionally, the beers are flat and not cold. You idiots who consider this a "good place" simply because they have a large selection of beers, clearly need to get out into the real world. You can have this place, and the wannabe "bartenders" with huge insecurity complexes. never again!
author: Clay W.

description: Great selection of beers, quick service, mellow crowd for a Saturday night. Reasonable prices. Def worth a stop. Quick walk from Church Station
author: Corvus C.

description: The beer is good, but not nearly good enough to justify how phenomenally rude the staff is. You run a bar, guys, not a prison yard.
author: Isaac S.

description:
i will find great beers elsewhere.

I will admit that you have a great selection of beer, and your location is choice.  you used to be one of my favorites in the city.

well, those days are over.  i am not sure if i have ever been offended as badly by anyone in the service industry.  after 45 minutes of waiting for a beer, the bartender finally gave me a look.  I told her my order, she started to pour the beer, stopped, and stated that i didn't belong in her bar.  then she proceeded to ask the others at the bar right next to me, if they would want to drink with a person like me around.  whoa!  that's no way to treat a few times a month kind of patron.

maybe you are just having a bad day.  maybe you are fighting off some junior high angst or something?  i don't get it, and, honestly, i don't care.  i waited patiently.  i asked nicely.  i mean, what else could i have done?

what i do know... the bartender, a long haired brunette who claimed to be the owner (though i doubt the owner of a bar would irrationally disrespect a loyal customer).  she needs to get her act together.  while Toronado has had a great run, your customers are the reason that happened.

well, today... you lost a customer.
author: yelpster m.

description: Love this place. It is a total man cave. The jukebox has nothing worth singing to on it and you'd better not dress too girly or you will just look weird (people think you are trolling even if you aren't). It is a fun place to go with a small group of friends and enjoy a beer and a chat. Seating isn't always easy. if you are hungry there are yummy sausages next door. All in all one of my favorite places in SF.
author: Kristina H.

description:
Any beer you can think of and then some, and they encourage you to bring a sausage over from Rosemunde.   The crowd can be kinda rough and tumble in a Lower Haight sort of way, and the bartenders can serve up a helping of surly along with your beer, but hey, anything less would be out of character in this hipster play.

Oh, and for the love of God and all things holy, DO NOT ask for a suggestion from the bartenders...know what you want or get to the back of the line. 

Did I mention the sausage?
author: Tony A.

description:
I went here for a blind date.  This girl kept giving me the eye at the end of the bar so I thought, 'Thats GOTTA be the girl'.  Whoops, sorry Heather.  You are very pretty regardless.

Yelp ruined this bar for me.  It would have been exciting to see the bartenders yell at the poor tourist next to me who asked for a local brew had I not seen it coming.  But it seemed forced.  Like Dick's Last Resort in San Antonio.  Pure theatrics.

And the music is just really really bad.
author: Philip M.

description:
Beer, beer, and more BEER!!!  
This is one of the best beer bars ever.  Don't worry about the surly bartenders, just be capable of deciphering the beer board then order a beer and you'll walk away happy.  Toronado has the best selection of Belgians and European beers on tap.  I prefer to stick to the brews made on this side of the pond with a strong hop influence.  Bring in your sausage from next door and you've got yourself a complete meal. Like any beer bar, the clientele is socio-economically diverse with a very heavy male dominance.  Don't come here for the atmosphere because Toronado is all about the beer.
author: Roman d.

description:
I'm not really bothered by the musty dank smell, and I've never really encountered an unbearably gross bathroom either (not clean, but nothing surprising). Yes, at certain times the hipsters and their fixie bikes abound, but none of this has ever kept me away.  

Perhaps it's because whenever I walk into Toronado, I'm focused on quaffing the tasty brews and enjoying the people watching. I even think the bartenders are kind of nice, in that whole, "super-dirty angry old man" kind of way. Its not the kind of place that you can expect clean floors and happy service, but you can expect to see some interesting people, and exquisite beverages. This bar should be fully enjoyed for what it is... a dirty dive that knows its brews.
author: Cheryl J.

description:
When I moved back to SF after living in Chicago for 8 years, a friend/neighbor who owns a great bourbon bar in Chicago (Delilah's if you care)  told me and the Mister that  the only place we should bother going to drink was the Toronado. He knew us well as the Toronado is like a dream come true. The crowds can get thick there at night and on weekends, but it's heavenly in the afternoon when the bar is emptyish. It's a beer-lovers dream come true.

Their offerings are many and well-chosen. It's remarkable that you can get so many great beers in one bar. And the bartenders will guide you well - I can't tell you how many fantastic beers I've had there simply due to the bartenders caring enough to make sure I know what sorts of special kegs have come in recently. I read some of the other yelp reviews - and maybe some of the bartenders can be a bit surly at first, but if you act like a civilized person, tip well and are interested in what you're drinking, you will be rewarded with some of the best beer guides around.  

And what's the most perfect neighbor a bar like the Toronado could have? Yup, a sausage shop. Go next door, buy a mouth-watering sausage, bring it back to the bar and enjoy one of the best drink+food combos possible.
author: laila p.

description:
Toronado is, hands-down, my favorite place to drink in the city. In addition to the impressive selection of beer on tap and in bottles, I like the no-BS, non-sceney vibe here. Just a solid place to have some great beers. People have noted that the bartenders can be a bit surly at times, and while this is sometimes true, from what I've seen it usually happens when they have to deal with self-important patrons who frantically wave twenty dollar bills at them in an attempt to get faster service on a crowded Friday night (c'mon kids, be patient, make eye contact and wait your turn like everyone else). I've generally had pretty good experiences with the tenders here.

Kudos for their Oktoberfest night (with free Rosamunde sausages and oom-pah band), the annual Barleywine Festival (preceded as always by a huge greasy breakfast at Kate's), the great jukebox, and all the specialty beer nights they host. Oh, and the quality and quantity of the graffiti in those grimy bathrooms is a sight to behold, especially when freshly applied by two people walking out together smelling of weed and sex. You just don't find that kind of charm at the Bubble Lounge or Jade. Gotta love Toronado.
author: Collin S.

description: Hoppy beers, sausages, surly yet friendly bartenders,  and more beer.  The only bar that I really like to hang out in on a regular basis and it doesn't even have a pool table.
author: Erikake Z.

description: Visited this joint b/c of the many great reviews on its beer selection (primarily Pliny the Elder which isn't readily available).  I wasn't disappointed: the beer selection is truly excellent, and the prices decent.  It's a great dive bar with only one flaw: some of the bartenders are simply rude, and generally pissed off.  No idea why, but the attitude from one in particular just had us walking out of the joint.  I've seen all sorts of reasons for this on Yelp, but can't account for it as none of the patrons seemed overly angry or demanding.  So, go for the beer, but don't go looking for any validation.  :)
author: Chris M.

description: I went to Toronado after searching for 'Cheap Beer' on Google. They were the number 1 result, however, their beer is far from cheap. I am sure it is tasty but, I did not drink any due to the misadvertised price.
author: Mike S.

description:
The Toronado has a great atmosophere and is probably my favorite place for good beer in the city. Its laid back and I've been able to start up some good conversation with people each time I've been there. 

The beer: Tons of it and lots of hard to find brews rather than just filling the taps with the most standard styles for good microbreweries. Always have some Russian River on tap and usually some Dogfish Head. Rodenbach on tap and a big selection of bottles including a number of different types of Geuze... delicious sour belgian lambic. 

Cash only - thats a big drawback. It can also be a bit expensive. I paid $9.00 for a small glass of Rodenbach - back on the east coast I go to a dive bar that has if for about $6. Bottles are also a bit expensive - Geuze starts out at about $15 a bottle. But you can take bottles to go!

Its what I like in a bar. Good beer, served in the appropriate glassware, bartenders know about the beer, its got a divy feel, and did I mention an incredible selection of beer?
author: Jonathan P.

description:
I used to enjoy Toronado but I went on a Tuesday night and decided never to go back.  Yes:  they have beer, and a wide variety.  But so do a lot of other places in the city, and I'm willing to pay a dollar or two extra to get a better atmosphere and just basic levels of respect from the bartenders.

I am the last person who would want to write a "I had a bad experience" when sometimes those reviews are so subjective.  However, I was really surprised when the bartender refused to serve me because she thought I was too "yuppie" for the bar.  Never mind that I (used to be) a regular patron, and have enjoyed the place for about a year.  When I told the bartender I was a regular, she said I could take my "yuppie attitude" some place else.  

I don't know about you, but refusing to serve someone based on how they look is pretty 20th Century.  

Look, Toronado isn't hurting for business, so they can afford (at the moment) to be rude to people because there's some other person right behind them who wants a beer.  I'm sure the bartenders are reveling in their moments of glory right now, to treat their paying customers like dirt and see some other sap right behind them.  

Not me. 

Enjoy your moment Toronado.  I have decided you're no longer worth it.
author: Inder C.

description:
I love all the rookies who rate this place one star (or negative stars if it were possible).  If you are cool, then you will be loved.  This is the case for 99% of the people at the Toronado.  If you're acting like an a-hole, then prepare to be respectfully called out.  If you continue to be an a-hole, then prepare to be respectfully excused from the bar.  

Don't be an a-hole and you will have a fantastic time.  Simple as that.  Rookies beware - many of the beers at the Toronado are stronger than what you are used to and if you fail to moderate, that little a-hole in you could rear its ugly head and you could find yourself manufacturing your own bad situation.  

The Toronado is a Mecca for beer lovers.  The beer list is constantly changing to feature all of tastiest, freshest beers from around the world with a special focus on local micros and Belgians.  You will find rare, limited distribution beers on tap at the Toronado on a regular basis.  It is no wonder why brewers and beer aficionados from around the world make a special point to stop by the Toronado to have a beer.

So fear not.  Just be cool and you will a fantastic time at the Toronado.
author: David C.

description:
This has a TON of cool beers (lots of CA breweries) on tap.  It even has framboise (so what if it's a total girly drink) and I can drink that all night long (okay, and probably get a splitting headache).

It's pretty small and I usually go on a weekend afternoon so there aren't that many people and service is okay.  I don't really care about service anyways. It's a bar. You're eventually gonna get drunk, even if you have to wait a couple minutes longer than you think you should.
author: soy y.

description:
Came in with 2 buddies--one had already gotten her beer from the bar and was ordering up 2 more for us, but the bartender lady said no service without the rest of our IDs--which is fine.  But she followed girlfriend to our table to demand our IDs and while we were rummaging through our purses to find our wallets, she kept screaming and screaming repeatedly that she was going to lose her liquor license and become homeless.  

Left without even a sip of that beer and don't care to ever step into Toronado's again.
author: Christin B.

description:
The perfect night for me includes Toronado and the sausage place next door.
-EXCELLENT beer selection 
-very reasonable prices
-plenty of seating
-knowledgeable bartenders that are willing to help and will give samples
-great crowd
-awesome happy hour
author: Katy D.

description: This place is awesome!. I love beer and this place will give anybody their fix for it. They had a lot of options. Their prices were also very reasonable and the bar staff was very friendly. I was able to try lost abbey serpent double stout and Angel's share both were under $5 each! if you love beer you definitely have to check this place out.
author: Tony G.

description:
I took two East Coast beer snobs to this place and they are itching to come back. They were pleased with their choices (which unfortunately I don't remember). I had never tried mead before but saw it on the menu and thought "Well why the hell not?" It was soooo good, a little sweet and hot. I will say that I regret not getting a beer, but since I live in the South Bay I'm sure I'll be back at some point.

If you like dimly lit dive bars, this is your place. It was busy at 3 in the afternoon on a Saturday, and I remember that it was quite dim inside.

I would definitely come back here again, and next time I would get some great beer.
author: Audrey K.

description: I've been going to this place since I moved to the city 15 years ago.  But I haven't been back in the last three. What does that say? Not much, except that I've left the neighborhood. So, lots of beers, and if you like it cold and branch out and it comes back luke warm, well... these dudes don't care about anything as much as they care about the temperature their beer is served, except for maybe their latest or next tattoo, and if you don't like it you can get the hell out!
author: Joe F.

description: This is where I tried the Angel's Share by The Lost Abbey.  That was about as good as any alcohol - beer, wine, hard liquor - that I've ever had in my life.
author: Ernest S.

description: Beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer for days... which both explains and almost makes up for the frat-house smell.
author: Stephanie P.

description: Great beer selection but no sampling allowed. Not even one sample. Not even when they're not that busy.... I would rather go somewhere with fewer beers and a more customer focused attitude!
author: Darren S.

description: Finally got a chance to try this place.  I now understand the hype.  It's a very cool and hip bar with a great beer selection.  I am always very excited when I walk into a bar and most of the beers on tap are new to me.  The prices were very reasonable and the bartenders were friendly.  This place got really crowded, but we were lucky enough to be able to get a table in the back.  I will definitely be coming back.
author: Aaron L.

description: Beer on tap galore!! Its quite nice that they post the beer prices so there aren't any surprises when its time to pay for your beer. Happy hour is nice as well with $1 off beers. Parking is of course difficult, but if youre looking to take your tastebuds on a beer-drinking adventure its definateley worth the few circles around the block. A better music selection in the juke would be a plus but nonetheless I love this place.. i want to go back!
author: Cena V.

description: Gosh I miss this place. Such a nice welcoming feeling. Everyone is happy. I mean come on you get to eat your sausages and drink your favorite beer. YUMM!! I heard there is a Toronado in SD that I have yet to experience. I like the idea of food + beer right next to each other. Also the sausages are so delicious! Spicy + Tasty. This was my spot for school group meet ups. This place is in my list of places I need to go back and revisit. Def check this place out. Take your friends and get ur beer & sausage.
author: Berenice D.

description:
I don't really like the beer.  The beer is bad, and I know beer.  Oh god, do I KNOW BEER!  No budweiser select or natty ice?  What are they thinking?

  All the pretty different glasses they serve the beer in, though...  Those damn glasses, I keep ordering more and more shitty beer just to study how it pairs with the fabulous glassware...  Why can I not stop going back to this place?
author: Ashby U.

description:
For hardcore beer-lovers only. Selections are seasonal, so be prepared to rely on some staples for the times you walk in and most of the selections aren't your kinda pint.

The bar is loud, with a great jukebox and a busy vibe. It's a pain in the ass to get a seat most of the time, and the clientele ranges from punky to fratty depending on when you go. 

Prices are pretty reasonable and the service is fine. I'd give 'em 3 stars, but the last time I was there, they were stocked with gorgeous Belgians that I'd never heard of prior, which is totally worth an extra star in my book.

One of these days, I'm gonna get a squad of people together and try their nine-liter, $200 beer...
author: Ash A.

description:
Amazing beer selection. Or get some friends and order a 5 liter bottle! Yes!
They also have special festivals (barley wine) - a great way to try new drinks, but it can get pricey.
Just don't expect to have a heart to heart with a friend while you are here. Their music is obnoxiously loud, it's hard to even think. An up side to this is if you are having a bad date - impossible to continue boring conversations, but a good way to get another drink in your belly before meeting up with friends.
author: Maria L.

description: Came here a few months ago for Beer Week.  OMG...what a great place.  Greatest selection I have ever seen.  If they have it on tap, try the Lagunita's Gnarlywine.
author: Cindy B.

description: Coming in here for a beer is like going to your cousin Ned's trailer and having him tell you you aren't classy enough to stay. The place is a total shit hole, but a shit hole with standards. If you do not meet the Toronado standards of beer worship, and if you are not willing to push through a crowd of pseudo counterculture beer obsessed freaks who would choose their frosty mug over the cure for cancer, you might as well just hang your head and trek on down to Ned's. Sadly Ned's doesn't have the stellar selection of unique beers that so many people are willing to be abused to get a piece of. Unfortunately neither do other bars in town so, I too, help perpetuate the circle of abuse. But I never bring Ned.
author: Drue C.

description: some douche-stain came in here when i was on my last visit to the bay and was snapping his fingers at the bartender.  bartender comes over and asks what he wanted, pours the beer and then says "i don't want your money, you can drink the beer, get the fuck out, and i never want to see you in here again".  freakin sweet, i think this style should be adapted by all bars to weed out all the idiots who think they're the king shit.  and as always, a killer beer menu and awesome music on the box.
author: Sean L.

description: Best beer selection in the entire city. Great food on either side you can bring in. Knowledgeable staff. If you don't like the music, oh well, drink more.
author: Bryan E.

description: Great place. My favorite bar in the city. Almost my favorite bar ever. Love the beer selection. Friendly bartenders and never really have to wait to get a pint. I love the beer selection. I consider myself a beer snob and sometimes they have something I've never heard of. Not much else to say, my five stars says it all.
author: Wes K.

description:
I love beer. So do you. Toronado stocks only the best and most interesting beers. From local brews to amazing Belgians you won't find any crap on tap. My only minor gripe is with the attitude behind the bar. Sometimes I don't mind. It can be kind of endearing in a weird, masochistic kinda way. Other times, I'm all like, dam, I'm a flippin' regular, throw me an effin' bone here.

Go during the day. No problem getting a stool, $1 off draft
author: Dylan M.

description:
My guy friends frequent this bar at least once a week.  Unfortunately for me it is less than that but my first experience had me wishing I lived closer.  

We grabbed the corner booth in the back, much to the envy of many people there, and proceeded to drink Damnation...big bottles of Damnation.  Certainly not a money saver but for the novelty, why not.  Other than that it's a great beer bar with an amazing selection and great atmosphere.  Conversations with randoms always boost a night.  

Definitely a place that you wanna keep to yourself but it would be a shame to not share it with others.
author: Mollie C.

description: For several years I've been going back and forth about the Toronado.  Does the oustanding beer selection outweigh the asshole attitude that pervades the staff?  Last week I decided it does not.  It was a very busy night, as usual, and there was but one surly bartender who glowered at everyone who dared order a beer.  It was much too long to wait to be glowered at.  I've had it with the Toronado, there's other places in this city with a solid beer selection, and where they are actually nice to their clientele.
author: Andrew N.

description: Wow, how packed does this place get on a friday night?! Massive selection of custom beers, huge crowds, it makes you feel like you are at THE spot in the City! If you want to party and drink, get here!
author: Haz O.

description:
After hearing so many good things about this place, I was thoroughly disappointed.

Showed up on an early Friday afternoon when there weren't many people in the bar. Stood at the bar waiting to be acknowledged for a good 10 minutes plus when no other customers were being served. Once I was finally acknowledged, the bartender proceeded to hassle me for not ordering the fourth person in my group a beer, but she was not ready and wanted to pay on her own, guess the bartender didn't think about that did he?

There is only one tiny TV in the place and you can only see it if you are in the front side of the bar. Lot's of micro brews which is great, but if you are looking for a standard beer you've come to the wrong place.

Conclusion: Waiting for 10 minutes in an empty bar only to get harassed by a loser of a bartender in a poor set-up is no place for me and I will not be going back anytime soon.

The ONLY good thing is that you can order some amazing sausages next door... but that is a different review now isn't it?
author: Daniel C.

description: A great place to find "one off" beers in San Francisco. They always have an amazing line up of beers.
author: Andrew H.

description:
any place i can watch a douche-tastic boy get straight told by an awesome bartender gets 5 stars.
also, the tamale lady has been spotted here. **bonus points**
amazing Pomegranate Cider i cant find anywhere else, and i think they put heroin in, since I'm always itching for a pint: **super-mega bonus points**
its amazing.
Grab a sausage next door, go sit at the bar and strike up a conversation. Most of the staff is friendly enough(unless you pop you collar(s) )and are freaking hilarious.
go.
now.
DO IT.
author: Lacey W.

description: Don't even ponder ordering a wine spritzer here...they'll show you the door.   I'm not really a beer drinker, but when in fucking Rome...So we drank Death and Taxes, followed by Chimay, and then some pomegranate cider...accompanied by good conversation about social consciousness and other such nonsense.  This very unassuming dive has enough neatly scribed proverbs on the bathroom wall to make your urination all the more pleasant.  The walls are a lovely shade of vomit mint too.  You'll leave enlightened.
author: Mc Matty b.

description:
the selection is great, although most Belgium beers don't taste as good on tap. 

but the staff Sucks donkey butter. I mean asses through and through.

I get trapped there waiting for the delicious Rosemonde's sausage from next store. I rather wait in the gutter then go to toronado again.
author: Ryan D.

description: I'm a wine guy tried and true. In fact, I'm not much of a beer guy at all. But this place is for every beer drinker - every beer drinker! It's for the aficionados or a dabbler like myself. If you come here and don't find a beer you like then that's a major FAIL on your part.
author: Jerry S.

description:
I don't know a lot about beer but this place sure has lots of it. Unfortunately, I don't drink beer and they didn't have wine. Minus one point. Don't give me shit. They still get 4 stars.
Like I said: I don't know a lot about beer. But I do know a lot about boys. And there are A LOT of boys here. Not bad looking ones either. Of course, it was wall-to-wall Yelpers, and we all know the male Yelpers represent some of the finest specimens of the male species. But the non-Yelpers were damn good looking too. I may have even gotten a number or two. MAY have. 
So, if you like beer and/or cute, beer-swilling boys, a night at the Toronado will probably work out in your favor. 
Even if you don't like beer but you DO like cute boys, this could be a fine place to faux-sip that Chimay, chat one up, and then relocate to a bar that serves alcohol you can both drink...
**Big points for having two CLEAN bathrooms and nice enough bartenders.
author: Autumn K.

description: This is a dirty bar in the Haight. Not my style, but I agree it's perfect to warm up with some beer especially if you're into the surrounding 80's rock hits coming right into your ears from every direction with an over amplified volume. Also I wonder about the rest room where those typical jokes can be found on the wall, does this style has it's own name like 'art deco' or is there any agency who can decorate your rest room in this fashion ordered by the owner of the pub or is this just the very natural evolution of those places, controlled by some mysterious common consciousness of drunken people, the collective wisdom of the masses which makes those interiors so similar all around the world?
author: Tamas K.

description: I only went to the Toronado once. I was annoyed that they didn't serve PBR a Portland staple.  But they get five stars since on that one visit I met my darling wife. We flirted and threw torn up coasters at each other all the while drinking crappy expensive beer.
author: Michael B.

description:
Good:  Great selection of beers and a cool hot dog place next door where you can order hot dogs and bring it into the bar.

Bad:  Bartender was rude/not friendly and the place is cash only

This is a definitely a divey bar and not really my type of crowd but I enjoyed my first experience here.
author: Stephanie N.

description: While I enjoyed the large selection of beers on tap, and the pub-like atmosphere, the place was a bit too crowded for my taste. Luckily my group, after standing for twenty minutes in an odd corner, was able to get a table. There was an odd smell eminating from the back of the bar. Also there seemed to be a large number of "serious couples" hanging out on the benches.
author: Laura P.

description: I had my BFF here visiting from Sonoma and he was insistent that he wanted to come here. It's a bit of a trek from my house, but, when you live in the Excelsior, what isn't? We went in and ordered a Chimay for him and asked the female bartender what she would recommend for me. I was leaning toward the Allagash White, but, she sent me over one that was just perfect. (I can't remember what it was, but it ended with -erger.) For whatever reason, she was super attentive toward my male companion and was slinging us a free beer every other round or so. I was also happy to see that they had a great list of non-alcoholic drinks to be had. The people seemed nice, that staff was attentive and cool plus the jukebox made my evening. As they say on e-bay, A++ would do business again.
author: Jessica R.

description: I love the beer selection, but I dislike the atmosphere a whole lot.  If they have cleaner bathrooms and a beer garden I could bump this rating up by a star or two.  I would rather go to Mad Dog in the Fog.
author: T-Bone L.

description: Beer lovers dream bar. Although, you may want to use a bathroom across the street. Not sure they have ever been cleaned. eek! Fantastic beers, great events (Barleywine festival!!!) If you love beer and you have never been to Toronado there might be something wrong with you. Try Edelweisse made by Schneider on tap. Delicious! Don't worry about the not so friendly staff, they'll get you what you want and you'll love every sip!
author: Nikki T.

description: I always find myself mesmerized by the number of beer choices (and men).  I critique their labels (and looks). It is endless.  Guys & brew = casual atmo. Some call it a dive. I call it magic.
author: Nicole L.

description: Outstanding selection of craft beers, many hard-to-find on tap.  The bartender was fast and helpful. The place is small, crowded and noisy, and could use a good cleanup; layers of grime abound. The clientele is divided among some pleasant people having a good time (often with sausage in hand) and a few rather obnoxious regulars.
author: Karen S.

description: amazing selection of beer on tap, some really special things here, this place is just the right amount of dirty, and the right amount of closeness to Rosamunde sausage which is a win. The bartender could be a little less of an ass but other than that its all good.
author: Jared Z.

description: The worst bartenders in San Francisco! Besides the great beer selection, the bartenders create an unfriendly, uncomfortable enviroment for locals and randoms alike.  Won't go back
author: Ryan M.

description: I went here with a buddy of mine and we were both instant fans. The bartender was chill, there was room to sit down, the decor was interesting, good music was playing.. pretty much everything you could ask for that night. the beer menu is great and it takes a few minutes to take it all in and decide what your first beer will be. notice I say first, because once you get here you will probably stay for a while!
author: Brandon R.

description: Stinky bathroom, rude bartender, ugly room, good Belgian beer. Luckily good Belgian beer can be found elsewhere, and that's where I'll go.
author: Belmont M.

description: You couldn't drag me here again.  Ordering at the bar was like pulling teeth.  Some bartenders are knowledgeable and competent -- the ones here are neither -- they're just saucy.
author: Tim G.

description:
i absolutely love this place. the only reason they don't get 5 stars is cause i swear sometimes a specific bartender makes me wait on purpose. though maybe that should merit 5 stars, since the underlying beer snob attitude is part of what makes this the best bar in my neighborhood. 

oh and i must mention that the ultimate beer festival: the barley wine festival, falls on the weekend of my birthday, and it always makes for a fun time.

salud!
author: Norma ..

description: Best beer selection in town.  The service may seem gruff and mean, but that's just because the bartenders really do hate you and would rather see you go to another bar.  This keeps the yuppies out.
author: matthew w.

description:
Talk about HYPE! This is soooooooo overrated.

I'm giving 2 stars for the well-rounded beer lineup, but the service here is probably the ABSOLUTE WORST I've ever experienced in my entire life. I'm really wavering between 1 and 2 stars, but they do have a good beer lineup including some that you'd be hard-pressed to find anyplace else, although they did not have some key styles I wanted. No Biere de Garde in bottles or on tap. No Flanders Red in bottles or on tap, not even Duchess de Bourgogne. The board listing the draught options was nearly half empty. Maybe this was due to it being Saturday during SF Beer Week, I dont know, but I expected more from the famous Toronado.

Other than the beer offerings, there is no other redeeming quality about this establishment. A bathroom that doesn't require a Hazmat suit to enter would be nice, or how about being able to actually converse with the person sitting next to you without getting a sore throat from yelling over the obnoxious juke box. I wont even get into the gads of smokers (yuck, smoking is NOT cool) polluting the air since they are allowed to smoke right in front of the half door to the bar. Even if these things weren't an issue, the service is so severely awful, it ruins everything.

I know my beers. I know them well, yet the bartender - after completely ignoring me for a good 20 minutes despite many instances of eye contact - acted like he'd rather drink a pint of vomit then spend 1 minute taking my order. He went back and offered to help the guys adjacent to me twice before I finally had to wave at him to say that I was next. Was this gender discrimination? Maybe girls cannot possibly know enough about beer to get served before all the guys had been taken care of? Then when I did get his attention he acted like it was MY fault that he did not have anything to offer in the styles I requested. Jesus Christ, it's not like I ordered a Bud Light and wanted it split into 2 glasses and garnished with a lime wedge. I settled on 2 beers from the board, and he got my order WRONG, bringing me two of the same beers. The guy sitting next to me offered to buy the duplicate beer since that's what he wanted. Do you think the bartender made any effort to bring me the other beer I ordered? Oh HEEEEEELLLLLL NO! He was done with me, ripping the 20 dollar bill out my hand and then slamming my change down at the bar and storming away for good. Worst service I've ever experienced. There is no reason to ever treat your patrons this way, EVER.

Side note: I just happened to be here with 2 of my friends from a very highly-acclaimed, award-winning microbrewery, who were in town for some SF Beer Week events, one of which is the brewery owner (although we did not make this known - shouldn't have to). Our experience was certainly not good PR for Toronado. I think we all agreed that we'd probably not go back there, at least not the one in San Francisco. The San Diego Toronado is much better, at least the bartenders give a shit. I will still proudly wear my San Diego Toronado shirt. Even if I had wanted to buy a SF Toronado shirt, I couldn't, because the bartender was too busy working on earning his BIGGEST ASSHOLE BARTENDER title to sell me any merch.

Next time I'm in SF and want a good beer lineup, I'll go to City Beer Store on Folsom where they have an excellent selection and the people are cool and nice.
author: Seana D.

description:
beer mecca of the bay area!  hands down!  the selection is grade A. be ready, know what you want and have a great time. 

grab a sausage next door and eat it in the bar. 

get there early, cause it fills up with, which is the downside. a beer person's place. please, please..dont ask..."what is good"...if you do, please leave.
author: Mauri L.

description: Beer selection is amazing. Gets a point knocked off for slight beer snobbery from the wait staff and it being crowded all the time.
author: Terika B.

description: Iconic dive bar with an intense selection of beers. Insanely delicious belgians, microbrews, and PBR. It's crowded, but a fun scene.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
For a place known for its beer, this place doesn't have tons. 80% of them can be bought at any corner store in the Lower Haight (or anywhere else in the city, for that matter). I guess that's a testament to San Francisco's love affair with its own elitism - "If you're a beer snob, you'll LOVE this place!!!". I've been to small town places with hundreds on tap, so I found it strange that there weren't that many, and not many local beers either, at least at the time. They do occasionally have seasonal menus (Belgian Beer Month, The Barley Wine Festival, etc). Delicious.

Still, it's a good selection of beer for a night out - around 40 beers is nothing to complain about. I always have a lot of fun there, too. Snag a table if you can and keep it all night. It gets loud and crowded, and if you're drunk it's even better. A pretty good place. And the sausages next door are an even cooler thing. So, it's not beer heaven, but it's a damn fine bar with no-nonsense bartenders (they're not the kind to get cute with you) and good drinks.
author: Anthony O.

description:
hipster douchebag bar.  seriously folks, you don't have to try so hard.

it's like a the Haight version of a  marina wine bar for people that like wearing black and take themselves way to seriously.
author: John H.

description: Easiest 5 stars ever given. I love The Toronado. Their selection, prices, and crowd rule. Beer nerd paradise right here folks, it doesn't get any better than this. And don't miss their special events. I went to a 5 course Belgian inspired beer dinner there recently and it pretty much blew my mind.
author: Brian C.

description:
I am not a beer drinker--there I finally said it!  Having limited my alcoholic beverages to wine and sweet cocktails--my beer tasting at the Toronado broadened my deprived palate to now include beer (and my growing knowledge of it).  A good friend invited me to the annual Toronado Barley wine festival - bringing me back full circle--to how closely beer has been appreciated, elevated with toasts, names and  what memorable moments they carry.

It has been a couple of years since my Dad's first deployment to the Middle East, but the memory of family and friends gathered together drinking San Miguel beer (a pale pilsen lager so well suited for the buffet style of "pulutan" filipino soul food) eclipsed the worries and angst that generally accompanied such sending-off parties.  Food was also a way to unite because sharing a meal was giving another sense to remember the time together.  Yes I remember them all--fried lumpias, dry adobo wings, sisig, empandas, grilled Bangus (milkfish) relleno, deep fried pork knuckles with a spicy vinaigrette sauce,  and of course pancit!!!
