As a farewell gesture- a toast to my Dad's safe return included my the first time tasting beer--yup JUST ONE sip of it!    A bitter sweet moment- bitter because of how it tasted and sweet because I still remember my Dad's glistening eyes and approving smile.  It would be another year until we would all see my Dad again and celebrate his much anticipated return, with lechon that time around!

So on an invitation from a seasoned  Barley wine festival goer, I found myself at the Toronado- where people of all types- young and old, students and teachers, workers and the financially secure, women and men enjoying their glass of brew laden with mystical wishes that only plain water and honey could make .   The beer was no longer bitter, it seemed to have 'grown' with a delicious and distinct taste.  Like wine, its complex bouquet left trails of orchard fruits plump succulent plums, pears and even melons from the flights of beer as they made their way to the eager tasters.  Glasses filled with colors of vibrant warm sunshine to glowing ember of sunset, each crowned with foams that peak off the brim or just slight like a layer of melting snow,  nestled on the frosted glass.  I saw them all at the Toronado- a deserving destination for anyone with a beer story to tell.

The highlight of my visit- was tasting  about 12 different varieties (and I was just having sips--from each one of course)!  One that stood out in taste was Sisyphus The boondock from Texas.  I was struck by the name  adding to the mystery of how zymurgists intertwine labor of love with the fruit of their harvest.   Perhaps these ideas mirror life's sisyphusean cycle , just like one early evening at the Toronado ...

PS.  Now that I have access to a home brewing accoutrements- I shall name my first brew- Verre de l'Eau Vivant.  And that's not the Biere talking ;-) hmmm or maybe wait and taste it first!

PSPS.  Rosamunde is just next door with sausage pulutan sandwiches :-)
author: Arissa C.

description: So, main problem is, I like hard-a, not beer.  But, second to that, the place is sometimes so packed it's hard to move around and have a conversation with friends.  On the plus side, they sell some great ginger beer for the non-drinkers and for the beer lovers, everything they could ever desire.  I love the fact you can bring in whatever food from the neighborhood you want, and there are so many good take out places around.
author: Cara J.

description: One of my favorite places in San Francisco. A friend of mine took me in there the first time I visited San Francisco and I've been going back ever sense. Good beer selection with even better atmosphere. Make sure you don't where a Man U jersey and for god sakes do not order a cosmo!!!
author: Robert H.

description: It was only recently that I was introduced to this gem an establishment. It's a great spot to stop in grab a few beers and a few more and a few more...Well you get the idea...It's my kind of a place loud and filled with beer.
author: Todd E.

description: I'm a fan. I've learned how to appreciate beer this year and this is where I like to try out different stuff. But the Pliney the Elder by Russian River is the shit. Be careful with the double IPA! Eat something with your delicious beer. Perhaps a brat from Rosamunde's next door? Maybe pizza from Mythic or bbq down the street. Whatever it is, be sure to get there early, grab your beer and food, and get a table. As the night wears on, it becomes a little tight inside. If some little skinny tarte tries to check your id, smack her. She doesn't work there and somehow she thinks its funny to check out incoming people's ids.
author: Grace V.

description: I want to like this place more. I really do. I love the beer selection and the sausages next door. I don't love the bathrooms, the unhappy crowd, the excessive noise, and long waits to sample the beer selection. :(
author: Elsa M.

description: Music is just unbearable!! Lady (owner) is not a nice bartender, place is always too crowded and uncomfortable. Beer is good but it takes forever to order anything.
author: Mosquito L.

description:
i need to hit  toronado a bit more often. great beer selection and the bar keeps are just the most helpful bunch in the whole city. you know the kind, free tastings till you find the beer that tastes the best and how your day was, the family treating you okay, don't worry my brother your wife should be back home any day now. 

okay that is a bunch of hooey shit. except for the great beer selection. toronado truly has a fantastic selection of ale's. the atmosphere of the place is just right. and there is a fine group of people there that just might talk with you. maybe. hasn't happened to me but it might.

i did notice a bit of beer snobbery when i was in there. but when i go in toronado it is all about me (and whoever is with me) and some great suds.  so i usually just say fuck their snobbery. 

go now and drink lots of the great beer they have.

p.s. it will be weeks before the wife shows up.
author: roger b.

description: People love this place, especially with a sausage from next door, but many of my friends, myself included, experienced a bit of beer snobbery. If you don't know the difference between a La Moneuse Winter 2001 and an Oude Kriek, you might get a little attitude from the bartender.
author: Philip M.

description: This place is in no way a dive bar.  Anyplace that is snooty about budweiser etc. is not a dive bar.  Staff has attitude.  Clientele biding time till next Supersuckers show by talking about previous Supersuckers shows.
author: Ed B.

description: Yes, the beer selection is top notch, but did you know they also serve hot mead? Order a glass and feel like a viking. Because you're worth it.
author: Steve S.

description: Okay, so just this morning a I received a six pack of Westvleteren (2 each of 6 8 12). Yes, that's right, I dropped $89 on a six pack of beer. Based on this one fact, I bet you can guess what I think of Toronado. Amazing. And hey, I've never noticed the bartenders to be surly, just adept at handling simpletons. There is one huge and glaring problem though, with Toronado, while I do hate to criticize... it must be said. I'm sorry, but Toronado... you just aren't close enough to my house. Dammit!
author: Ben M.

description:
If you're a beer geek, this is a MUST VISIT.  Incredible selection of beers, appropriately dive-y atmosphere, and fairly cool vibe.

My Casey Jones DIPA pulled from the engine definitely goes into the "Awesome Beers I've Had" archive.  DH in a dither of indecision faced with the board of his dreams.  He managed to pull it together and try several.

It was Tuesday, hamburger day at Rosamunde next door.  HOWEVER, when I went next door to order, I was told they were out.  (Oh, but it seems if you are young and hip, they are NOT out of hamburgers after all, since they were still serving them to tattooed hipsters).  I ordered duck and wild boar sausages.  Meh.  I would have preferred a Vienna beef.

A great place to hang out and while away an afternoon.  Or an evening.  Or the rest of your life.
author: Mary B.

description: i get it toronado, you're a cool place to grab a beer. but honestly i hate having to scream to the person sitting across from me. turn it down a tad please, my bf already says i'm loosing my hearing :) brought some out of state friends here last night, and her hubby loved it. everyone tried 3 different beers each which was fun so we all got a tasting of 12 beers
author: Abigail W.

description:
If you are not a beer snob, go elsewhere.   If you are with a friend who doesnt like beer, go elsewhere, as there is Nothing else.  
Interior doesnt have a whole lot of atmosphere.
And its dirty as hell.
If you dont believe me, go, and look at the deer head literally dripping with cobwebby dustiness.  No, its not wearing grey mascara, thats years of dust accumulated over its eyes.  
Gross.  

My friends enjoyed the vast arrays of beer.

If I ever get dragged here again, I will be sure to bring my own booze, as well as a feather duster to help these guys out.
author: Christophe B.

description: Packed.  Loud.  Hard to make an order.  Hard to find a seat.  But where else can you get 10 great beers no one else in town serves on a Monday and 10 different great beers no one else in town serves on a Tuesday?  Toronado is it, so far as I know.  This is where the great beer is in SF, and everyone seems to be in on the secret.  It's not a scene though, no matter how much the occasional well- or ill- groomed group of kids might try.  If you're not picky about your beers, don't bother.  Beer is the only reason to come here.
author: Brian D.

description:
This place was awesome several years ago, but two recent trips there
have proven that the bartender actually thinks he is better than god never mind the peons who come in and actually ask for a beer recommendation. 
I really didn't think it was possible to make beer snobby, but apparently I was wrong.
author: ej k.

description:
good beer selection (of course). got a tasty, light peachy beer. happy. 

however, i'm not a dive bar type, because i am a diva and very particular. 

:-)
author: sarah i.

description:
Hmm, it is so hard for me to review Toronado because I am not a beer fan. But if I were, I think this place would be great- it's like the cheeseboard of beers, so many choices it could be stressful. Located in the lower Haight, this hard core dive bar is filled with hipsters, hippies, and hipster-hippies (and no doubt some people who transcend any classification whatsoever ) completely at one with their myriad brewed creations. Oh it's dirty. And it's loud too. Oh and there's barely anywhere to sit and the bathrooms are filled with interesting yet entertaining graffiti. But that is indeed part of the charm. You come here to drink beer, and that is what you get. Not much else to distract your beer drinking bliss. I think there is one cider on the menu, which I tried and it was pretty good. So if you come here knowing all this, you won't be let down. Toronado does a good job at serving beer. Period.
Quick update: I was at Toronado last night and brought in a bag of cherries. The guy checking IDs at the door told me that if he saw cherry pits on the floor that he was going to hunt me down later that night and make me memorize the phone book. Scary threat- make sure not to leave cherry pits on the floor!
author: Kate A.
Lety M.

description:
toronado deserves 4 stars by itself. with rosamunde sausage, it's 5 stars all the way. this place used to intimidate the shit out me with its abundance of beer selection. i remember the time the beer nazi snarled and barked at me when i ordered a stella. it went something like this:

me: hi, do you have stella?
the beer nazi: we don't have stella!
me: um, what do you have?
the beer nazi: read the damn wall!

that was wholly intimidating. he was like the soup nazi with bad hair. Over the years, i did find my favorite beer (radeberger) and am now quite happy whenever i savor my rosamunde sausage at toronado.
author: frisco j.

description: Love this bar.  Sure, it's a scene after 10pm or so.  So go early, grab a sausage next door, find a table and enjoy a beer, or 2 or 5.  They have plenty to choose from-- probably the best selection in the city.  The bartenders are great-- as loud and crazy as it gets in there, you can list of 5 different beers and they'll hear you and remember your order.  I was impressed.  Happy hour means half priced beers (I think-- in any event, they were cheap).
author: Kristin P.

description: I like this place but you better know what you want because the bartenders are anything BUT friendly unless they know you. I guess they have a love/hate relationship with Rosamunde grill next door because they have to deal with the crumbs and food baskets and napkins and shit because people eat like slobs and dont clean up after themselves. But the grill next door keeps this place rocking during the day, especially on Tuesdays becasue they do burger Tuesday next door...and it is one of the best burgers ever, trust. So back to the bar, and the beer. I love bars and I like beer so I dont ever know what to order, I just wish the bartenders were more friendly...it seems most of the beers here are strong and hoppy and I have had a hard time finding the perfect brew.
author: James S.

description:
thanks, toronado, you gave
me what i so sorely needed
and so badly wanted. beer.
author: Brittany L.

description: 5 stars for the amazing beer selection.  3 stars cause it's always crowded and I've never managed to get out of there without having beer spilled on me (by myself of someone else).
author: Melissa Y.

description: This  place used to be cool.  Now it's too yuppy/hipster for me.  I can don't mind the rude bartenders, because that's tradition.  What I do mind is the rude clientele.  I don't think I ever want to go back.
author: A R.

description: ghetto fabulous "gourmet" dive bar....seriously...crazee variety of beru...from top notch chimay to standard....beru heaven....dive look, without the dive prices.....
author: Hen A.

description: OK- as a beer drinking tourist from out of town this bar was a PERFECT place to get a chance to sample a bunch of west coast microbrews.  I was honest with the bartender that I was from Chicago and didn't know the beers very well, and he was totally cool about making pointers and letting me sample, etc.  So five stars from this tourist for a spot with a great selection of beer, decent crowd, and patient staff.
author: Mark S.

description: For me, Toronado is strictly a daytime place to bring your Rosamunde sausage to, and drink an awesome beer. Their beer selection is absolutely outstanding. Many rare brews from all around the world that change often. Unfortunately, at night, the place fills up, and has super bright fluorescent style lighting. Service is always a bit slow, and the barkeeps aren't the most friendly, but it's worth it to enjoy a really good beer or two in the afternoon.
author: Crystal R.

description: I can't find anything bad to say about this place other than that it's too busy.  Totally a local crowd.  Great beer selection.  Friendly bartenders.  Great beer selection.  And they have a lot of beers.
author: ben y.

description: I love beer but I'm not geeky or snobby about it. I don't really need to know the special organic mountain grown ingredients or need to have it in the correct bar ware. But I'm glad there are people who care about that shit. I go to Toronado under a couple of circumstances...one, to take visiting beer geeks (next stop Zeitgeist) and when I'm looking to duck grocery shopping, laundry and other adult type stuff I have to do. I play a little game at Toronado. Since I don't want to get yelled at by the bartenders, if I don't know what I want when they come to take my order I just bark out some unknown from the board. I've discovered some new tastes that way. It's all about the board, people!
author: Pam D.

description: Huge, fantastic beer section is what they are all about and they do it right.  Get some sausage from next door.
author: Kayser K.

description: Best beer selection I've ever seen. I'm not much of a beer fan and I can always find something I like. Lots of attitude but I can live with that. Just have your shit together and you'll do fine.
author: patrick g.

description: Now this is a proper beer bar. Always an excellent and eclectic selection on tap, bartenders that know their beer, and a beer-loving crowd.  You won't get your MGD or Bud or whatever swill the unwashed masses drink, but you will get your Chimay, your Delirium Tremens, and your He'Brew Jewbelation.
author: Eugene F.

description:
I would give this place 5 stars because of the amazing beer selection, but it gets 3 because many times when I go there (and it's a lot... I consider this my neighborhood dive bar) I end up having a miserable time because of their miserable bartenders... especially the guy who looks like Jerry Springer joined an 80's hair band. If you go, expect rude bartenders who purposefully take their time serving you, say rude comments about wanting to see your girlfriend in a wet t-shirt, and basically act like your presence in their bar is the bane of their existence.

And why do we tip these people again?
author: C C.

description: European beer connoisseur's heaven.  I couldn't even figure out what was going on with the menu board here at first, too complex and too many funky European words.  I'm not a huge beer fan, and tried the pomegranate cider instead, which was a refreshing change from the more typical apple ciders, and very tasty. Huge variety of beers on tap.  The stickers and junk all over the walls are pretty fun to look at.  Terrific energy here; the place seems always to be jam packed with patrons having fun and watching baseball games.
author: Rick H.

description: I love the extensive and unique beer selection. I got way drunker than expected, but that's what tends to happen when drinking good, quality beer. I wish there was a little more info on the style of the beers, instead of just where they come from, but I'll try any of them at least once, so it wasn't a problem.
author: Jennie H.

description: Can you say, "Aryan Nation?" Do we really need to have a white supremacist beer elitist bar in S.F.? Wir gehen zum Gothikfestival!
author: Eva W.

description: Extensive draft beer selection, laid back attitude, and big enough not to feel cramped.
author: Gloria J.

description: I love this place for the vast beer selection.  It's always a little crowded because it's pop but it's worth the trek!
author: Kerry P.

description: I do love the Toronado and its wall full of wonderful beer choices, but there is no excuse to be so fucking mean to someone who is giving you money.
author: Maria D.

description:
came here during happy hour with a girlfriend. we ordered two 22 oz weiss beers, found a couple of stools, and admired the extensive sticker collection on the wall in front of us.

Mixed in between the crude joke stickers, the tattoo advertisements, and the little article taped to the wall about a pot growing granny, I found this little itty bitty baby pink bunny rabbit sticker. it just sat there, smiling back at me while I drank my beer. 

Eventually, we finished our beers, passed our bar stools on to another set of patrons, and on the way out the door, I'm pretty sure the pink bunny winked at me.
author: Melissa J.

description: Like beer?  Want beer?  Go to Toronado. 'Nuff said.
author: Anya B.

description: Amazing beer selection and duck sausage next door.
author: James D.

description: I was expecting beer snobbery and a somewhat gruff attitude where unless you're a seasoned regular, you're nobody...what I found was the complete opposite.  A chill atmosphere, friendly dudes hanging around on a sunday afternoon, people doing crosswords, guys watching NCAA, and loads of great beer.  Run next door for Rosamunde sausages, made to order.  Being a regular has got to start somewhere I guess, and I'm happily on my way.
author: sunny d.

description: If you like beer (I brew it) then you'll love this place.  Endless selection of good microbrews on tap and a big list of import beer if you're in the mood for something different.  The Toronado is also situated between a pizza by-the-slice place and a sausage-in-a-bun place for when you get the munchies...
author: Matt B.

description: Can you say  "Tin can with a millions sardines crammed in - that's the Tornado !" I absolutely love this place, however, I've stopped going on the weekends because of the lack of elbow room. The beers are always top notch and the price is right. The bathroom always smells like someone just took a toke and I think it makes for the best air freshener.  The BBQ place across the street makes some good brisket that can be brought inside to enjoy with the beer. The best thing about this place has got the be the festivals. They get unique beers and sell them cheap !! The Barlywine festival in February is worth waiting a year for - see you there !!
author: bart b.

description: This place draws a diverse crowd and for good reason. They have an excellent selection of beers. They even carry Pliny the Younger when it's in season (which I highly recommend trying especially if you are into IPAs). The bar tenders were attentive and helpful in recommending beers. Just be forewarned that they do get a little crowded and it's cash only.
author: Priyam D.

description: The only bad thing about Toronado is that it smells like old beer alll the time. The menu is great. You can usually fit a group. I even saw I woman throw a beer on the ground yelling "you'll never steal my soul!". Toronado is always a good time.
author: Bam H.

description: Gee whiz, this bar sure is swell. Not only does it have an amazing selection of brews, but they also serve up a mean (vegan) hot dog next door that I was able to feast on whilst drinking my beer in the bar. As an added bonus, my friends and I met some awesome people that played silly made up games with various currency, such as who can spin their coin the longest. In conclusion, great selection, great crowd,great service. Thanks Toronado for making my Monday night super terrific.
author: reina t.

description: This bar is way better than the Toronado bar in my hood here in North Park San Diego.  I think I had the friendliest bartender in my entire life.  She even remembered to top off my beer after I had already finished it.  Not big on the Belgium beers but luckily they had Murphy's Stout on tap.
author: harrito a.

description: Its hard to compare this dive to any other place. It has a unparalleled beer selection that changes everyday. This was the first bar that I went to in SF and was pleasantly surprised by the bartender who apologized to me for how long it took him to get my order. I was expecting the opposite given that I was told that waitstaff tend to be impatient beer snobs. I liked that I could bring a sausage from Rosamunde into the bar. Sure, this place smelled like vomit and sewage, but you're there for the cheap beer and experience, not for the ambiance.
author: Michael H.

description: I don't know why I love this place so much, but goddamn, every day, every time I walk by, there's a party inside. Wednesday at 2pm? Yep. Monday at 9 pm? Yes. Fridays and Saturdays? These suckers draw all the competition away. I only give them four stars because a lot of the patrons, I've noticed, are rough and gruff looking men aged 30+. Where are the chicas?
author: Garen T.

description:
With loud "contemporary hair metal" blasting through the half open dutch door, I walked cautiously into Toronado. I was relieved to find that the fraternal twin of the guy who used to sit next to me in calculus class was there, and his twin, and his twin. Basically, everyone in there was completely non-threatening.  

I stood among these friendly looking patrons and took in the impressive beer menu.  I barely heard the pounding double bass pedal as I thought about the delicious beverage I was about to consume. I chose the Point Reyes Porter, since I was in the mood for some malt and I was sentimental from a recent hike up there. My beer was delicious with a strong coffee flavor and served slightly colder than room temperature, as is appropriate for a stout.

The bartenders weren't what I would call friendly, but were totally efficient and served my beer from a hand pump within about 30 seconds of approaching the bar, which was very crowded. 

While their facade may suggest they don't give a sh@* and just want to party, they give themselves away by serving their beer just right: the right glass, the right pump, the right temp.  

Overall, if I don't have a headache and I want delicious beer, I will come back to Toronado, and I will be psyched for another glass of deliciousness.
author: Lina C.

description: Love the fact that there is a place you can go and learn about beer in this city the same way you learn about wine....Not too mention, the sausage place next store is awesome.
author: sean b.

description: I will add my voice to the chorus of praise for Toronado. I'm an avowed beer purist [e.g. snob] and anyplace offer the depth and range that Toronado does is simply my kind of place. Yes, service can be slow on busy nights but take the time that you're waiting for one of their splendid brews and strike up a conversation with the person at the next stool. I did and had some great discussions and to go along with those grand ales!
author: Miles I.

description:
i've never felt so good before and after blacking out

thanks alot belgians

thank you VERY much barleywine festival

I think you tasted good

I can't quite recall
author: Chris R.

description: There is no maybe about it....love this place, BUT..if Elvira is working.....run away! Trust me, you will know her when you see her...The best way to ruin some amazing beer ( and sausage from next door) is to have a bitter bartender. Luckily she has great co workers!
author: Susan S.

description:
Like many other reviewers, I am conflicted about the T. 
I celebrated my 33rd birthday there, yet there are nights when I cannot abide the place. 
Yes, the bathrooms are gnarly (but not as bad as Zeitgeist's), and yes the bartenders are surly. I sometimes think they're not surly ENOUGH, though, because all the clueless fucking Chads and Kimmies keep showing up, asking for their Bud Lights and Appletinis anyway. 
The first time I ever set foot in the place, when I was visiting from Seattle, the bartender rolled his eyes at me when I asked him what style a particular unfamiliar local microbrew was, and then condescendingly explained what an IPA was, I got a little annoyed, but that happens lots of places because the concept that there are women who actually KNOW and LOVE beer is still a new one to alot of guys and they assume you are clueless. 
I don't even try to go there during any of the fests except the Wet Hops one, because I hate being squeezed in with a million people. 
On the flipside, when I had my birthday there, the bartenders (Paul?) came over and sweetly asked for a slice of cake too, and wished me a happy birthday and it was all peachy. And when a dozen beer-geek friends and I held a beer & cheese tasting there once,  taking up pretty much all of the back room, they were nice as pie to us all and came over to grub some cheese with us. 
I'm not a regular there (because it's not close enough to home), but I find that if you don't act like a choad and actually know what you want to drink and don't ask dumb questions, they treat you well and hook you up.
So I guess that the T is sort of like an old friend who is really smart and fun but a raging PMS-y bitch at times. You love her, and she sometimes pisses you off.  But you never give up on her, and look forward to seeing her again. :)
Oh, and proximity to an array of sausages from Rosamunde makes up for a multitude of sins.
author: Melissa L.

description:
whaaat?  i write a review for the sausage place next door and totally forget to do one for Toronado?  where IS my head.  

first of all, i love how it's called a dive bar.  it's like any place that doesn't sell $15 martinis is a dive bar in this town.  well, i've always liked Toronado.  as long as i've been able to drink LEGALLY (i celebrated my 21st birthday at Toronado over a decade ago), i've been coming to this place.  i remember it being a welcome oasis from the craziness of the lower haight shenanigans.   their selection of beers was unprecedented back then, and is still probably the best in town today.  and if you REALLY like beer, they have the best and looongest happy hour in town - most beers are $2.50 from 11:30a-6p.

i did take a hiatus from Tornado when i was on my "vodka-only" kick, partly because i'm russian but mostly b/c vodka has no known allergens and the sulfites in beer and wine was wreaking havoc on my bod (i'm much better now, thanks!).  but now that i'm back drinking the hops and it's in my hood, we've become re-acquainted.

and i love the hee-haw split door.  hmmm, just got me some thirsty...
author: Suzanne A.

description: I have come to love this bar. Not only because once they gave me an extra Snake Bite (Guinness and cider) just because.So much beer, so little time!
author: Veronica B.

description:
This is definitely one of the best beer bars in the country, but due to the spectacular selection, it's also often packed, loud, and you will often get some grief from the bartenders.  For the uninitiated or baffled, here's some free advice for maximizing your enjoyment of Toronado.  Note: I have learned most of these the hard way.  I know this is long, but I don't want you to make the rookie mistakes I made.

* If you mispronounce the name of a beer, no matter how obscure, expect that the bartender will correct you.  Don't be offended, but make a mental note for next time, or, better yet, offer a simple apology and reorder with the proper pronunciation this time around.

* If one or more of the beers you order turns out to be at the opposite end of the bar DO NOT under any circumstances leave your original location.  You may think this is a helpful way to reduce the trek of the bartender or your own wait, but it will only serve to annoy the bartender and may lead to you being chewed out, which will, in the end, delay your drink.  Again, I learned this the hard way.  However, the same bartender who bitched at me for this on one occasion gave me a free drink for some minor mistake I can no longer even remember on another.  The moral: despite what you may read here, most of the bartenders are actually really, really cool, but you can't be too sensitive.

* If you see someone (often, in my experience, the guy with dreads) washing glasses, restocking glasses, gathering empty baskets to take next door to Rosamunde, doing any number of other tasks, shooting the shit with his friends/customers, watching TV., or doing anything else behind the bar other than asking you what he can get for you, DO NOT attempt to order a drink from him.  He is the elusive and fascinating creature know to imbibologists as the barback.  He is not a bartender or server, and he is certainly not going to get you a fucking drink.  I know you and your friends have been waiting a long goddamn time.  I know what he's doing may not seem as important to you as the procurement of drinks for you and your friends, and you may, in some cases, be right.  But, that is, as they say, the way it is.  The actual bartenders of the establishment may be in the bathroom, changing out kegs, at their granddad's funeral, or nowhere in the hemisphere.  You can't order beer from the barback.  Sorry.  However, the barback is a really cool guy, and if you're lucky, you CAN talk sports, beer, local history, or any other pertinent topic with the barback.

* Sometimes it seems impossibly crowded by the bar, but there are still places to sit in the back.

* As at a lot of places, the best times to drink here are during unconventional drinking hours (before 5).  Here, it's doubly true, because everything is $1 off, which means great beers are $3 a pint!  This includes Saturdays and Sundays.

* My favorite bartenders are the Irish guy and the lady with long, dark hair.

* Cash only!  If, like me, you don't like paying ATM fees, go to Walgreen's just on the other side of Fillmore and choose "debit" with "cash back? yes" so you can spend that $2-3 on something you actually need.  Trust me, if you think long enough, there is something you need at Walgreen's.  Chapstick?  Gum?

* In general, be patient and don't be a dick and you'll have a great time and get to drink some great beer.
author: Joshua B.

description: Beer, is one the great pleasures in life, and this place has a the best selection, although not the cleanest or friendliest spot, they got what you're looking for so, you just overlook what they lack, and with the sausage place next door what better way to spend the afternoon.
author: JIll H.

description:
one star down, cause i am not a beer fan.
but this is a GREAT place... oh now i feel guilty about the one star down... it's not their fault i don't like beer.  (it's beers' fault)

ALL BEER, ALL THE TIME!

the reason i feel like my review is still worth reading even though i don't like beer: my boyf is a beer snob.  (i like to say beero, like wino, but beer.) by beer snob i mean, he LIVES at the russian river brewery.  seriously.  all our friends work there, and live there.

pliny, younger or elder is two thumbs up. (i will drink pliny, because it gets to the point.  i don't like alcohol that muddles about.  get me drunk!)

delicious micro-brews in a great relaxed kick-back setting. extra-ordinary selection, incredible really. even for a non-beer drinker, i am always entertained by trying others brews they took a chance on, and reading the names of the hoppy concoctions.

usually i head across the street to molotov's (sailor jerry!) and we all flit about around the two.  great place to all go out and enjoy whatever your specialty is.  they also allow you to bring food in, so grab a sausage or a pizza and find the perfect beer to match it.

mandatory bathroom talk:
(esp since it's a beer place, lots of pee happening)
the bathroom here is GROSS (if i was a guy i wouldn't think so, but then again if i was a guy i wouldn't think it was dirty to pee on your mom either), head across to molotov's to pee, girls.  their bathroom is actually really clean, wonderful, and it's only for girls.
author: Ge O.

description: Cool place. It's known for its beer selection, which is good. There are other places in the city that may have a little better, but Toronodo's has a lot of character. The walls are covered in stickers from bars and breweries across the country including a number from my home town, Milwaukee, Wisconsin. The crowd is a mix, but mostly your typical san francisco - sort of yuppie and indie at once. Weekends it can get a little too packed and they keep the bar stools out, which means its really difficult to push you way in and get a drink. That would be my only real complaint about Toronado.
author: Zac w.

description: I enjoyed all the draft beer I drank and the selection is massive but I did not enjoy the attitude of one of the three bartenders.  I am glad you have a bar tending gig, its fun, I understand it is stressful working a crowded bar and getting everyone their drink but its not cool to treat people poorly.  For this they get four stars instead of five.  Sorry guys but that one bartender was just mean; the other two were cool.
author: Benjamin R.

description: You just used to be better.  The beer selection is unbeatable as are the beer events.  But crap all mighty, the last few times I have come in I have to beg to get a beer. Maybe I am not the hippest looking chic in the box but whatever, I just want  a beer not some hag behind the bar who has to yell at me some story about how the distributor for Paulaner screwed her over one time and gave all the Paulaner to the Lucky. Get over it lady, it was like 12 years go and Paulaner is one the BEST effin beers ever made.
author: Erin M.

description: I went for the first time a week ago and loved it.  I had a Belgian bar in Chicago that I loved (Hopleaf).  I think Toronado will become one of my usual spots.
author: Rick A.

description:
The Toronado my first beer bar love.  In 2001 I started drinking "real beer" and while in the city for a Sigur Ros show my fleece clad hippie friend suggested that we go to the Toronado before the show so that's exactly what we did.   I had heard a lot about this place, and I had seen the ads in the Beer Celebrator magazine, so I was picturing something big and elaborate.  I was way off.  This place is a hole in the wall dive bar and I love it.
   This place is a dirty grimy watering hole with tons of great craft brews on tap along with a stellar bottle selection.  This place is no nonsense, it is all about the beer (like me).  They do not serve food but they will gladly let you bring in outside food, and the San Francisco Tamale lady cruises through there in the evening.  
   I have read reviews saying that the service was less than benevolent but I have never had any problems.  Maybe its because I grew up going to the city almost every weekend as a kid and just got used to that pompus San Francisco attitude so it doesn't bug me.  I have actually been there during a slow day when a guy went in and ordered a Bud Light.  I thought the bartender was going to throw some beer snob attitude at him, and instead he was cool and offered the customer something light.
    Anyhow I have now been to a bunch of great beer bars all over the country but for whatever reason the Toronado just feels like home to me.  I have a dream of one day buying a booth at the Toronado and retiring there.  
   Even though she's dirty, dusty, and grimy, the Toronado is my first love when it comes to beer bars, and if you know me that is up there with my love of your girlfriend.
author: That Guy G.

description: Awesome bar! Great beer selection for a great price!!! Only complaint was that the bathrooms were disgusting and the place was pretty cramped.
author: Elizabeth R.

description: A whole buttload of beers all in one place! This place was so much cooler than I remembered. I didn't really know what I was doing, just picking out beer names that sounded tough or manly like El Torro or the Denogginizer. Perfect for the conneisseur or the amateur looking to try new things in a fun, dive bar setting. Some of the bartenders can be asses depending on when you go, so watch out.
author: Michael E.

description:
My favorite bar, anywhere.

Great selection, great selection...did I mention they have a great selection?  I love reading the frequently-updated graffiti in the bathroom, although they painted over the dude with the afro, that made me kind of sad...i liked that one.  Amusing: saw some sort of tirade on the bathroom wall about how you'd have to be a complete moron to "find a bar on a website" (referencing yelp).  I like that I am writing about that on yelp, I feel like that person would really hate that.  Hah, gotcha!

A couple reviews here have said the bartenders are less-than-awesome, I beg to differ.  I think they are fan-freaking-tastic, especially when Stuart calls people "bloody fucking idiots" to their faces when they can't remember which beer was which that he set down in front of them and specifically said which was which a mere 7 seconds earlier.  That's not rude, it's character :)  Plus, the idiot should have been paying attention. The people that write bad reviews about them are probably the same people that stand at the bar shouting "Excuse me!" "Hey! Can I get a drink?!"  and then roll their eyes when it takes more than 4 seconds for them to have a beer in hand.  Jesus H. Christ people, watch them, they're busting their asses and they'll get to you.  There is a system.  They work their way from one side of the bar to the other.  You are not special. Wait your turn like the rest of us, asshat.

Ahem, back to the awesome-ness of Toronado:  I also like that they are totally cool with your bringing food from other places in and eating it there (grab a slice of Mystic to go with your pint. yum).  

Bring cash--that's all they take.
author: Courtney N.

description: It's a bitch going to dinner with 10 different people who all want different things, and damn the Lower Haight for giving us so many options.  Thank heavens for Toronado.  We split up, got all of our food, and sat down in the back room to a huge variety of cuisine and had the pleasure of an even wider variety of beers to choose from.
author: Eric E.

description: I'll give them props for an excellent beer selection.  Otherwise, the bartenders can be a bit rude, seating difficult, and the bathrooms are really disgusting.  If they cleaned the bathrooms more and got rid of the attitude, they would get a whole lot more stars from me.
author: Kate B.

description: What more can I say that 98 others haven't but damn!!!  Chimay on tap!!!!  And if that doesn't work they have dozens of other beers for your taste.  Great place to grab a bunch of friends and hang out.  When we were there they were jumping all night and blasting 80's music, I almost got nostalgic for acid washed jeans.  Almost.  Then reality kicked in and ordered two more pints of Chimay to erase those brain cells!  Oh yeah, no food but some good places to grab a bite right around here and they're friendly about bringing it in.
author: Rob M.

description: I went here two days in a row and the service just kept sucking. It took forever to get my beers but damn they were tasty when I finally got them.
author: Penelope C.

description: Great deals on Budweiser and ice cold Miller Lite.
author: Brandyn B.

description: I think my favorite part about this place is that each beer has its own price, which is nice because it gives the beer somewhat of a quality rating. The selection is huge so if you don't know what to get pick one with the name you like the best. You can't be intimidated by the selection...pick one and go with it...if you mess up there is a whole list waiting for you to try.
author: Annie M.

description: Not a damn thing wrong with this bar except that it's so far from my house.  They had thirty or so Christmas beers last time I was there, awesome!  I've only been here for afternoon drinks, a great time for a beer bar.
author: Jimmy C.

description: I'm a fan of the Toronado, definitely. Beer selection is incredible, they have special brews during the holidays. Something for all palates.The weekends the place can be super packed and sometimes the jukebox is cranked to volumes well above screaming level, but that's only to weed out the meek. Sign language and/or being deaf helps.
author: Eddie C.

description: This dive has the most beer offerings of any dive bar I've ever been into making it one of the most highly valued treasures of any dive/beer lover.  Me like.
author: Shaina P.

description: Toronado is undoubtedly a great place to buy a beer. They always have a great selection and because of their status they usually will have a beer that you can't get anywhere else in the west. If you have a chance you should stop by Rosamunde next door for a sausage and bring it over to Toronado to have with your beer. The only problem with this place is the bartenders can be absolute jerks. And their is no reason why they should act like that but this place seems to be just as famous for the jerks behind the bar. If they lose the attitude they would get five stars.
author: Sasha V.

description:
seriously a sausage party and coincidentally there's a sausage joint next door that you can bring in and eat at this bar...but the smell kept me from wanting to eat in there! 
if you want anything other than beer - tough luck - there's cider but do you want to be that odd pansy drinking cider when everyone else is drinking a beer? Yeah...yeah..next time I'll drink a beer!
author: Alexis D.

description: One of the greatest selections of beer I have ever seen in this city. I could spend hours tasting, especially since there is a great sausage place next door. Too bad the bartenders are pricks. Come on, guys. I know you're major beer snobs who overcharge and if a customer mispronounces a label you roll your eyes, but your bar is cramped and smells like piss. What's there to be snobby for?
author: Joe G.

description: Hoegaarden, Johnny, and my sewing group girls. No better after work combination.
author: Beth W.

description: I love beer.  This place is perfect.   There are tons of places to sit, enjoy a couple pints and chill with friends.  Unfortunately, you have to warn people before taking them there, you don't want to get stuck with anyone whining about the fact that they only serve beer.  Frankly, I commend them, although it does tend to get a little busy on the weekends, oh and tip well, the staff is really cool.
author: Kristin N.

description:
I love beer. I am glad I dont live in this area because at these prices I would become a full fledge drunk. I would drop out of school and focus primarily from avoiding liver failure and trying every beer known to mankind!

Maybe its because I am use to the bro scene in north orange county with its L.A prices for drinks but Toronado is what every bar should be. I love the fact that they dont serve mix drinks and only except cash. Credit cards take a portion of the profits and people really shouldnt be buying boos with credit....

What other place can you spend $60 and buy rounds for friends for what seemed forever.......Keep those 4 and 5's on your menu toronado!
author: marty m.

description: They don't need my review, but still gotta give my two cents....best bar in the world. Period.
author: Deraj D.

description: The beer selection here is great, and you can bring the best sausages in from next door.  I had to go here for years before the service warmed up a bit.  The bathrooms are disgusting, yes.  But it is my favorite place to go for beer.  Wonderful beer from all over the world and a lot of wonderful things from Belgium ON TAP!  It's beautiful.  Get a sausage from Rosamunde's next door.
author: Fredricko B.

description: It is like dying and going to heaven even though you are a sinner
author: tim s.

description:
If you like beer....I mean good beer (not Bud, Miller, Coors, Heinekin, Becks, Corona, etc) the Toronado is like one of the 12 wonders of the world.  I discovered this place about 3 years ago and have been about 100 times since.  Recently I have become a Dad, so it makes it a bit tougher to get up there (I live in San Mateo).  As for the beer...about 50 or so taps at all times with all very good American craft beer, or specialty beers from all over the world (mostly Belgium).  They do not serve any traditional macro (mass produced beers).  The most macro you will find there is Sierra Nevada and Anchor Steam (both perfectly good beers).  They also have a menu of about 100 different bottles as well.  All the beers are served in the appropriate style glassware and they do NOT chill their pint glasses!  Happy hour is a dollar off most beers every day from 11:30am until I think around 4pm.  They have special beer events there from time to time with guest brewers giving lectures and serving their beers as well as special weeks and or months dedicated to a certain style of beer (April, I believe is Belgian Beer month, while the Barleywine Fest is held in February).  

As for the service and the food.  There is no food served at the bar itself.  However, they will let you bring in outside food.  They have a wonderful sausage place next door called Rosamunde.  They even make some of the best burgers in town on Tuesday's only.  There is a pizza place on the other side which is OK and a tremendous BBQ place accross the street called Memphis Minnie's.

The main style of the bar is a typical dive bar.  I wouldn't say it's dirty, but it isn't quite clean.  I've never seen any rats or anything, or food laying around on the floor, but it does have a dirty vibe to it.  It's quite dark inside with 3 graffiti laden bathrooms (which are quite fun to read while you do your business).  They have about 6 tables with stools in the main room plus a bar with about seatng for 15-20.  Plus they have a small even darker attahed room with another 4 large booths with tables.  The bar is decorated with classic brewarania material (lots of metal signs and lots of magnum empty bottles, plus a huge assortment of tap handles above the bar.  There is a jukebox by the restrooms with a very ecclectic assortment of music...mostly metal and heavy stuff.  They place gets loud...very loud, unless you are there in the early opening hours of the day.  The best time to come if you want to get a table and have some sort of peace and relaxation would be between 11:30am and about 3pm any day during the week.

The service is...well....all depends on your attitude.  If you come in acting like a smart ass, drunk or a very stuck up think you know everything type of person, you are likely to get the tradtional Toronado treatment (which is sometimes rude, brash or worser).  If you are a normal every day person..especially with a good sense of humor, you will really understand this place.  It all depends who the bartender is.  There are some that are really nice and a few that are pieces of work. The best story I have is of a yuppie couple that came in and sat at a table.  The woman speaks up and asks if the bartender can come and bus her table (they last lazy customer apparently didn't dump his food basket).  Well, the bartender tosses a wet rag, hits her in the face with it and tells her to go knock yourself out.  So, the service can be a bit iffy at times to say the least.  The staff, however, is quite knowledgable about beer and will probably lead you in the right direction if you have a question about beer.  The one important thing to remember is that it is cash only...I believe they have an ATM in the bar, if not there are several ones on the block. Parking is also quite tricky.  If you come early you have a better chance of getting a spot close by, if not right in front of the bar.  If you come later or on weekends, you will find yourself walking a few block from your parking space.  To sum things up....if you really enjoy good beer, you will leave here quite satisfied.  

A few regualrs on tap

Russian River Pliny the Elder
Russian River Blind Pig
Moonlight Reality Czech
Moonlight Death and Taxes
Moonlight Twist of Fate
Anchor Steam
Anchor Liberty
Sierra Nevada Pale Ale
Duvel
Aventinus
Radeberger
Hoegaarden
plus several others

Enjoy!
author: Chris S.

description: Excellent beer selection and very low key atmosphere - the kind of place where you and a bunch of friends can camp out for hours at a time.  Quality eats nearby which you can bring inside while drinking till your hearts content.  Don't be afraid of the slightly bitchy bar staff - they just need you to assert yourself.
author: Joel M.

description: Love the selection of beers here. They have a great variety of white belgians which are hard to find in this city.
author: Stephanie I.

description: This is the first bar I went to when I was in San Francisco & I happily return here time and time again for the great beer, people-watching, git-yer-own-food-from-somewheres-else style service, music, and overall entertainment value. As I hear it says on 1 of the bathroom wall's: Am I that drunk, or did Howard Stern just serve me a beer?
author: Todd F.

description: Deserving of all its kudos for being among the best beer bars in town. Impressive selection scrawled on the walls at decent prices, you'll wish there was a sampler platter so you could have a go at all the offerings. Good prices and gets crowded, but not too bad. The bartenders, with their wealth of knowledge on everything hoppy, malty and any combination thereof, may make you feel out of your element if you don't know much about beer, but go with a beer-savvy bud and you'll be fine.
author: Tara R.

description: I just feel so darn rock-n-roll in here...Lucky 13 wishes it was this cool.
author: L W.

description: The best dive bar in all San Francisco.  The wait staff can be a little surly, the stench a little strong and the bathroom more than a little dirty.  However the beer selection is awesome, the prices are right and the combination of Mythic Pizza and the sausage place next door can't be beat.
author: John G.

description: Two words: Beer Mecca.  The ambience screams divey beer bar, and the bartenders know they don't need your business and show it in there attitude.  I think those two features only add to the charm.  Add in a happy hour that starts at 11:30am and a great sausage grill next door, and you have an all day event.
author: Newton C.

description: One of the best selections of beers-on-tap in SF.  But other than that,  there's not much that separates Toronado and the rest of the divey-joints in the lower Haight.
author: Andrew E.

description: I am not a beer drinker.  never have been and probably never will.  don't believe in the whole "its an acquired taste" thing.  why should i have to acquire a liking for something?  if i don't like it, i don't like it.  anyways, i went here for a going away party and man, they had two beers that i loved!  Lindemans Framboise and Peche.  In other words, they have GIRL BEER!  So, they get 5 stars from me!  Yay!
author: Dominique T.

description: Go next door and get a beer sausage - Beer with a beer sausage! Just good clean fun and they have three bathrooms... never a line!
author: Louisa P.

description: LOOOVE.  Had a Double IPA and A Russian Imperial Stout here and I want to go back and try every single beer they have.  The study room heaven for my beer education.
author: sarah C.

description: My Favorite location in the Haight. Always full with serious beer drinkers, and fun people. Lots of chilled out professionals as well as a chilled out college crowd make it into here. The age range here is from a mellow 22 to a sprightly 110. Can a get a bit packed during soccer matches or weekend nights.
author: Nikhil B.

description: amazing beer selection, smells like my old frat house (so nostalgic in a way, but also a bit gross), totally casual (which is an imperative for a bar for me) . . . but the bartenders have such attitude. I just don't understand why they carry such attitude when we take good care of them. so what if i am not wearing a black hoody and happen to stumble in there after work with my button down, come on. atleast be nice.
author: Bowen P.

description: Yeah, it's a hipster bar, but I'm ok with that!  It's a sweet place with awesome local beers. I've only been when it's filled with people standing and talking, but I'm ok with that too.
author: Maia B.

description: THE best beer selection. The bartender was super informative and knowledgeable. He let us try out a lot of beer before we decided on which ones to stick with. We also tried the hops. Man. It was gross but it steadied the buzz just like he said it would. Gets crowded.
author: Rosavida C.

description: Great beer at great prices!  Unfortunately I am going to miss their annual barleywine festival which is this Saturday 2/18.  I am going to have to make it next year.  I can only expect drunken spectacle Saturday.  One of my favorites, Speakeasy Double Daddy, is served perfectly!
author: Timmy C.

description:
Well, I'm a big beer explorer. I like seeking out underdogs from the micro brew and craft set. I generally prefer dives over the foo-foo - I'm into good brew over ambiance any day.  So when I heard that this bar had a great selection along with a cool little sausage joint next-door I wanted to like it---I really wanted to.  
The beer was excellent with an eclectic mix.  But the service seems to cater to a just-out-of-jail / "who the F-R-U to be standin' in my bar" kind of mindset.  I've been there three times and have had problems with the bartenders twice.  They just can't seem to wait to pull the "cut-off" card.  LOL - I've had that pulled on me twice and I can seriously say that I've never had that happen before.  Anyway, the selection isn't THAT grand for you to have to contend with the prime-time crowds (yes, I've been on and off prime-time here) and the staff who act like they stopped taking their medication a couple of weeks before.  At heart I'm still for the dives that have good beer without the 'tude....and there are plenty in this city.  So unless you just thrive on hassles, my vote is that it just ain't worth it.
author: Adam F.

description: one of the coolest dive bars because they have so many beers, they have a nice little jukebox if you like rock, and they have tvs to watch the sports games! right by a great hot dog place too
author: trevor l.

description: Like good beer? Go to the Toronado. Nearly every beer they have is an excellent example of the style. It's a dive bar, so don't go there expecting luxury or ass kissing.  They also have a great jukebox.  I love it. They also have menus for the sausage restaurant next door which is also awesome. Go next door, order your food. Go back to the Toronado and drink a beer, or part of a beer, then go back and grab your order and bring it back to the Toronado.
author: Derek S.

description: This is one of the most overhyped bars in the city.  It's crowded even on weekdays and the extensive beer selection is cool but not impressive as people make it out to be.  A good number of the beers on tap are extreme American brews which have about as much nuance as Bush foreign policy circa 2002.  The bar lost a couple stars today because of the bad service I had.  The bartender started by IDing me in a curt, impolite manner, and then shouted at me immediately after I walked away from the bar to get tip change from my friend.  I think he realized he'd made a mistake after I brought it over and told him, but the poor guy was too embarassed to make eye contact with me when I brought the empty glass over to say thank you.  Bartenders should have social skills.
author: Charles C.

description: I will commend them for their awesome beer selection. Hands down, one of the best beer selections in the city. The problem is the staff and the smell. The staff are complete @$$bags (with the exception of the bouncer - big bearded dude) and the back of the bar has the most phallic vomit smell I have ever come across.
author: Anthony D.

description: Hands down, the best bar for beer in San Francisco.  A vast selection of imported and micro brews populate the great number of taps at the Toronado.  Also, their list of bottled beers is impressive too, plus you can get those to go.  The Toronado does a great job of hosting a great many events throughout the year, The Belgian Beer Fest and other soirees which include the world-renowned barley wine festival or a brewery's latest concoctions and so forth.  Grab a sausage next door at Rosemunde and pair it up with a delicious brew at The Toronado.  The only downside, some beers will go quickly, and not make their next appearance until the brewery sends more.  If you're content with drinking, Miller, Heineken or Corona, this is not the bar for you.  Well-crafted Belgian brews, hearty IPAs and those hard-to-find suds are what you'll discover at The Toronado.
author: DamnGringo X.

description:
this place is good for the beer selection. that's it.  it has room for you to drink your goddamn beer & do your thing & if it's crowded then you may have to hold on for a minute. until they can get to you.

it's not a dive bar, it's not a haight bar, it's just a plain old beer bar with the best selection of beers i've managed to stumble across in SF w/ bartenders who get the job done but aren't going to rub your back to get your tip.

go have a beer & relax @ toronado's.
author: Lawrence K.

description: Public transit is public transit.  Lets not forget it.  Its uncomplicated, so why does the local crazy have to act up or the bus driver yell at those who don't put their dollars in correctly?  The same can be said of the Toronado.  They offer something wonderful...a wide medley of beers that, like public transit in this beautiful city, can take me to new places I've never been.  However, nowhere is there that service with a smile (well, if you get the mean lady bartender).  If you are new to their system, you suffer and look the fool.  If you happen to get the nice guy...it can make your trip through the vast landscape of beers a pleasure, a journey to remember.  Good job but don't get too cocky ^_^
author: Scott N.

description: I thought I've seen all the bad services out there, but this recent experience at Toronado has got to be the worst of the worst. The staffs at this joint will physically man-handle their patrons for absolutely no reason at all. My friends and I were enjoying our time and beers on a regular weeknight. The thing was we were not drunk, nor rowdy, nor disturbing anyone else. But were approached by the staff telling us to get the F*** out, just because we finished our drinks 5 minutes ago. We tried to reason with them and ask why we are being asked to leave, that's when things escalated. They started yelling at us and making a big scene. One of the staff even threw a coaster at my friend, as he was yelling at us to tell us to leave, then he proceeded to grab my friend and pushed him to the wall. Needless to say, they were acting more like THUGS than bartenders and bouncers. From what I have read in other reviews, seems like their rudeness is well documented. I hope the owner of this place gets some new and better staffs, because these guys are the worst of the worst. You can't expect to run a long term profitable business if you rely solely on your beers and allow your customers be treated this awfully.
author: Brandon Z.

description: One of my favorite bars in the city!!  Good atmosphere, tons of beers to choose from (something for everyone), interesting patrons, decent prices.
author: Christina D.

description: Great beer selection and prices.  It would be great if they took a credit card so I wouldn't have to keep running back to the atm machine
author: Paul W.

description: Great beer selection, the best I've seen in the city, although my experience is limited. This place seems like it's always pretty crowded, with good reason. I like nothing better than walking into a bar and being dumbfounded by their number of great beer choices. Mad Dog in the Fog across the street comes in a close second to this place in my book, even though it's cleaner and classier.
author: Matt F.

description: BEER! The best there is, what a selection! This is a great place to spend an afternoon and watch the world go by.
author: April M.

description: This place has beers I haven't seen since I was in Belgium. I was stoked to stumble upon it one night by sheer luck. Taking one star off for the at-times attitudinal bartender. Ya never know when he's having an off night!
author: Yodel A.

description: Although the bartenders are somewhat rude...the beer makes up for it....they got DOGFISH! The only f ing place in SF...that is ridic. I love it. If you are looking for high percentage brews...def! it's the place.
author: Anita C.

description: When I moved to San Francisco, I had a huge decision to make about where to live.  A coworker suggested Hayes Valley, and my first pass through, I thought, "Wow, this looks like a cool neighborhood, but they need a BAR, a good BEER BAR."  I had all but dismissed the neighborhood, and then I found Toronado just a few blocks away.  I was intimidated at first, even as a somewhat seasoned beer taster with a palate for a diverse range of beers.  With a selection like this, it's hard to know where to begin.  In the end, Tad made some great suggestions, and I had an awesome time.  The biggest downside to the place is that getting a seat at the bar can be extremely difficult, but I can fault them for being popular.  I highly recommend this bar to anyone looking to escape an Anchor / Fat Tire / Speakeasy rut.
author: Andy G.

description: It seems to be a bartender here, you need to be surly, grouchy, foul-tempered and ugly.  I don't get it.
author: julie t.

description:
wow. ummmm..

BEER MUCH???

Let me just say.. if you aren't a frequent beer drinker.. plan your drink as soon beforehand cuz you've got about 2 seconds to order before the bartender leaves ya there. 

But.. I've never seen that much beer ANYWHERE other than the liquor store down the street.

huge selection.. its a little smelly and uh.. male dominated.. but its not bad. Unless you get stuck sitting next to that creep of an old man who hits on you while talking about barley and hops.. bleh.

i may be back..
author: Diana R.

description: I walked in here, and I get flashbacks to where I went to high school.  It smells like Syracuse.  Its a fair bit cleaner than Syracuse, but it's a dive bar.  It is what it is.  Not my thing at all though.  Good to eat your food from Rosamunde here though.
author: Nessie V.

description:
beer, beer, beer, beer, beer,beer,beer,beer, i love beer!!

minus one star cause it's always crowded.

i'm not the only san franciscan who loves beer.
****

addendum:  I am in love with White Knuckle.  Order a pint.  It's like Racer 5 with a sweeter kick!
author: Jen I.

description: they had pliny the elder on tap the last time i was there.  what more do you want?
author: ari b.

description: The beer selection here is amazing. Granted I don't know too much about beer brands, just being there makes me feel I've seen much.
author: Ryo S.

description: For sheer selection of quality beers, this place can't be beat. The atmosphere is nothing special (and the musc can be a litle loud and overbearing), but the mind boggling assortment of beers makes this place worth a stop. The sausage place next door is excellent too. Don't make the mistake my wife did and ask for a Budweiser here, or you will be subjected to some serious derision.
author: Brian H.

description: Hands down, the best selection of Belgium beer. Loud. Gritty. Walking distance from J-Church. What else do you want, besides a domestic can?
author: paul c.

description: Best Bar eva!!! Always have a great hoppy IPA on tap and hundreds of beers to choose from (no joke!). Try the Piny-excellent!
author: Razel F.

description:
I have yet to visit Toronado however I will give it 3 stars based on the  fact that all my friends love this place therefor are celebrating a friend's birthday here tonight. Wish me luck, I shall report back with a review soon!

-------------- 2 days later ----------------

I had to give myself a full day to think of what I would write here.....

Toronado is an intense bar. Intense only because once you enter you are bound to get drunk. This place only serves beer and wine however the beer they have here is no joke. They have about one million (not really but emphasizing) beers on tap. I made my way up to the bar and decided to order two beers at once since it seemed  there was a long wait. I order two Magnolia's Proving Ground IPA and the bartender looked and me and asked if I have had this before, I said yes and he handed me my beers with a look of "I warned you" on his face. I chugged the first beer in 5 minutes and began on my second.
      Meanwhile my friends all began drinking and after trying multiple beers they found what is called the Denogonizer (sp?) which is about 12% alcohol content. Next thing I know everyone is feeling more chatty, people leave so we move in on a table there was about 10 of us in our party. Drink. drink. drink. go pee. drink. drink .drink. go pee again. ew there is puke in the bathroom, dont care go pee anyway. drink. drink. 

It was quite the night in the end my boyfriend grabbed another girls boobs, took a bite out of a clove of garlic and upon arriving home proceeded to project his vomit into our kitchen sink.


good times.
author: Amanda M.

description: Best dive beer bar in town.  Great selections both in bottle and on tap.  Not beer snobs at all - they just know good beer.  No lame bitchy girls and no poser bud/miller/coors drinkers.  Giddy up!
author: Doreen D.

description: This is my favorite spot ever. They've got an amazing selection of craft beer, and that's about it. They do have a few non-alcoholic choices and sometimes a little wine- but don't be the guy who orders wine at Toronado. No liquor and no shitty beer helps keep the crowd here pretty down to earth- you won't have to suffer as many fools as you might elsewhere. Like many other bars in SF, Toronado is cash only, so there's an ATM in the back. The beer list is easy to read so you can take your time deciding what to order without having to crowd the bar squinting at handles. I love the bartenders. They're very no-nonsense, but not surly, and give this place so much personality. They will not hesitate to send you elsewhere if you try to order Budweiser (which indicates that you are an idiot for failing to see that it's not on their 12'x4' menu) or fail to observe very basic bar etiquette (regardless of where you are, don't snap at your bartender to get their attention). Toronado does one thing and does it perfectly.
author: Shoshanna C.

description: It's Friday at 4:37 p.m., and I will be within the beer-filled quarters of Toronado within the hour, and for that reason I would give them 6 stars right now if I could.
author: Saskia v.

description: Great beer on tap or in a bottle.  Can sometimes be a little crowded but that is only a problem when you bring a sausage over from Rosamundi's.  Almost too many beers to choose from but is that really a problem?   Bartenders will clown you for asking dumb questions.  I didn't know what beer I wanted and he made a suggestion.  His suggestion had 9.0 alcohol and I said that was a little much.  He responded with...a little help here if you can't tell I'm kind of busy.
author: Tim G.

description: Oh Tornado's...My first Hand Pumped Beer ever! Love the Vibe in this place. People don't take any guff and that's the way it should be. Not to mention they have an amazing Beer list also. If your stomach is a growling they're great little spots to fill it up all over the place. A classic SF landmark to say the least. Let's just say if you haven't been to Tornado's you haven't had the full SF experience. Cheers!!!
author: Timbo G.

description:
My favorite place where the service staff is rude.

To me it's all part of the romance of Toronado.

They're one big beautiful co-op of beer highlighting local brews and wonderful belgian beers.

This was the place that taught me I know nothing about beer.

Need a recommendation than ask a local at the bar.

If Alice Waters began a beer bar it would be Toranado
author: Brian J.

description: Amazing place.  Amazing beers.  Great events (e.g., barley wine festivals).  I try not to let the gruff service bother me.  This place, Rosamunde in hand or not, is the jewel of the Lower Haight.   Bonus tip:  Try to make it for an early weekday beer and save $1 on your pour.
author: Jeff A.

description: Huge selection of beer on tap, lots of local and craft brews. Really who cares about service. I walk up to the bar, they hand me beer, I enjoy it. Works for me!  If you want to go try a lot of good draft beers from CA give it a try.
author: Jon T.

description:
a great list of beers here, so definitely bring your drinking stomach, and you might wanna stretch out your liver before hand.

anyway, this place is almost always a veritable sausage-fest, but it does have 2 other things going for it.... (more) sausages @ rosamunde next door and pizza on the other side; after the pit stops you can go back for another round.
author: archi-nerd l.

description: One of the best beer bars I've ever been too.  Wow.  I can't say enough about this place.  I love the barkeeps.  Word to the wise, know the beer you want to order before you step up to the bar or you might feel slighted when they move on to the next punter.
author: Nate M.

description:
All the great bars in the Haight and you want to waste your time on this crowded dive where the bartender is a complete asshole?  Don't bother.

A surly bartender I can handle.  But the bald bartender with the god complex threatened me -- just for asking a question!  I had friends visiting from London.  One wasn't a beer drinker and some other customer ordered what sounded like a merlot.  So I was trying to ask the bartender if they actually did have wine.

My conversation went something like this:

Me: "Hey can I ask you a quick question?"

Bartender: (Mumbles something unintelligible)

Me: "Sorry, what was that?"

Bartender: "I said I'm fuckin' busy, you prick!"

Me: "What the -- excuse me, there's no need for that.  Don't talk to me that way."

Bartender: "I'll talk to you any way I want you fuckin' prick, or I'll come over there and fucking kick your ass.  I told you I was fuckin' busy."

Me: "I said don't talk to me that way.  I just had a simple question."

The bartender pulls my full glass of beer out of my hand, throws $4 at me (I paid $15 for the round of drinks, including tip) and tells me to leave.  I said I would leave when I got the rest of the money for the round back.

Bartender: "I will come over there and beat your ass if you don't get out of here right now."

Apparently this bartender is known for his issues, and the owner doesn't fire him?  A sarcastic bartender can add some ambiance to a dive bar.  But I'd prefer to have my beer without threats from complete douchebags whose only validation is in being worshiped by people ordering beer.

Don't bother with this place.  There are half a dozen bars right nearby where the bartender isn't insecure about the size of his penis.
author: Tom W.

description: This place has such a good selection on tap that I'd be hard pressed to dive into the even larger bottle selection.  Bartenders can be a bit gruff when it gets busy, just know what you want before he gets to you.
author: John C.

description:
Gawd this place sucks! Yes, they have a delicious beer list, but it would help if the bartenders actually cared more about the beer they served (and their customers!) than putting out a hostile hipper-than-thou attitude. They need to lose the belligerent and sneer-y obnoxiousness.

And you know what, there are lots of places in the city with beer lists just as good, and without the crap. If Toronado can't be bothered they might just as well serve Bud Light.
author: David W.

description:
some people are good people. some people are very good people. and some people are just the best people you know. 

when one of the best people in the universe is not only getting older, but also has managed to find someone who loves her enough for all of eternity (yep. mawidge--think princess bride "...mawidge is what brings us together"), what else is there to do? 

you must get them drunk, buy them shit, and embarrass the frak outta them. 

so we started at toronado. and tho i don't remember many details from that evening, this is now on the top of my list of great bars. so many good beers, and not enough time. i'd've happily skipped dinner, and just sampled more beers, but there's always next time.

we turned this place into a robot-vs-pirate adult-entertainment chuckie cheese. (yeah, we were those ppl. sorry. we did clean up after ourselves, so hope no one minded our foolishness.) extra plus to the drunk lady who enjoyed the vibraduck waaay too much, and bought red velvets for the table...
author: eliza w.

description: I love going to Rosamundes and enjoying my sausage here with a beer. I think it needs an update though. Always seems pretty old and dirty.
author: Adrienne G.

description: Great beer selections and I love grabbing the delicious Rosamunde sausages from the next door while enjoying a pint, but the bartenders who work there kinda dic** (or at best, aloof / disinterested in the customer service department).   You really need to know exactly what you want since they never seem to answer any of your questions (i.e. one bartender said "Everything here is good." great, thanks, that really helps.)
author: Yuko K.

description: Wow for the massive choices of beer. Took us a good 5 min to ponder over just what to drink. The place itself is just a regular beer pub type- nothing fancy, a little bit stinky (from the dried beer probably on the floor). Don't forget to grab the sausage next door before coming here.
author: T H.

description:
if i lived in SF i would be here everyday! but i try to make it out once to twice a month... day time happy hour is the best...

I LOVE this place... they have the best beer, and the staff rules hehe I know many people don't agree, but hey they don't put up with bull shit.

THey ALways have the beeessst beeer ever on tap.  They have a great bottle list, but I am an IPA head and all the beer I want is on draft.  If you go here during one of their festivals, you will definitely have to stand.. hehe its a small place.  
if your hungry walk up or down the street and grab something to go, b/c they are cool with you munching in there.  Its really cool of them, but hey the more substance you have in your tummy the more beer you can consume, well their beer.  DOn't ask for a budweiser here... the best advice i can give
author: Minette M.

description: great beer, usually crowded
author: Michael E.

description: In my recent amount of free time I made a visit here in the middle of the day during the week. I was quite shocked at how many people drink during lunch on a work day. Definitely on the list of dive bars but nice scene. Completely unpretentious which is a nice change. Dogs were allowed. Beers were plentiful and cheap. Ambiance was comical. And yes, there was definitely the faint smell of marijuana drifting in from somewhere. Go on a Tuesday and it is super packed with those ordering hamburgers from the sausage shop next door. Hopefully I can make it again before I move.
author: Heather L.

description: The Toronado is one of my favorite beer bars in the world, and I've been to quite a few.  I had an opportunity to have a few beers there last night.  The selection is great, and while I generally stick to CA beers such as Russian River Damnation, I ordered a Schneider Weiss to pair with a delicious sausage sandwich I purchased next door.  It's cash-only, so hit the ATM beforehand.
author: Scott B.

description: Beer bar + dive bar = heaven. Come early, stay late. It doesn't matter. Toronado is the best. End of story. (Just be sure to bring enough cash to avoid paying the evil ATM fees at their machine.)
author: Jessica R.

description: Best beer bar in SF.  I lived a few blocks away and overall Lower Haight is a great place to hang out.  Good selection (ask for the bottle menu if you're ready to get after some 750ml bottles), great dive atmosphere and good prices (especially during happy hour).  Also, awesome sausages next door.  Attended the 2009 barley wine festival here and along with the help of my three trusty companions we sampled every beer...the gauntlet has been thrown!
author: Mario N.

description: Local dive bar favorite. Excellent selection of beers. Wonderful friends. And pizza next door. What more could you want?
author: Sue Y.

description: Epic, the West Coast beer nirvana.  Esp. for special events, you will find beers here that you won't find anywhere else (except the brewery) and if they are on tap, they are normal prices.  All the rare Russian River and Lost Abbey beers.  Classic dive bar.  A few jackass bartenders and a few awesome ones.  There is nothing left to say about this place.  If you love beer, come here.
author: Nik E.

description:
This is my favorite bar in the city to hang out..

To the reviewers who say the bar attendants are "gruff", they can be because of their incredibly great beer selection at incredibly low prices.  You get some of the worlds best beers for the same price you pay for bud-lite at most other bars.  So, they can be choosy who they serve because true beer lovers will always come back.  Also, if you wanted a superbly decorated bar, then you would pay at least double or triple their current prices.  

To the people who complain about the "decor", for one, I actually like the cozy casual neighborhood pub like feeling.  I like listening to hard rock as compared to the cheesy house trance music at every other bar in the city.
