As for the smell, those who smell "urine" are most likely smelling spilled beer strongly hopped.  I love IPAs and am a total hop head.  When I have strong IPAs at my house, the next morning the garbage smells like cat urine and I have to throw it out.  I say this, because the bathrooms at the Toronado are usually very clean.

I would give it 6-7 stars if I could for having Underberg's for 2-bucks and of course for Rosamunde's.

The only drawback for me is being able to walk out of this place in a straight line.  Most of the beers are very strong.  Luckily I can take the train here and not drive.
author: Chris C.

description: If you've been living in SF and haven't been here, you must really hate good beer.  You'll never run out of a new fantastic beer to try.  They even carry those half-yard of ale glasses with the round bottom and wooden stand!
author: Rego S.

description: What a delightfully trashy looking dive bar.  The beer selection was fabulous, not a bad beer on the board, and we somehow stumbled onto a fabulous special that kept our tab under $15.  I would recommend this place to anyone who loves beer and isn't too hoity-toity about it.
author: Jeff H.

description: When I don't answer my door, just go to Toronado. You will most likely find me there. Especially around the hours of four to six. There's nothing like a Muerguez sausage and a Chico Estate from Sierra Nevada or a Czech Pils. It's great how every Wednesday they have a guest brewer in or a special brewery night for the locals. Jenny and her man do a great job on the rotation of local beers. They have tons of specialty bottles as well. All of the employees are great at what they do and work themselves a ton. Like damn racehorses! They have an extensive Belgian and microbrews list to choose from.  Always a great place to rock out to some Metallica and have a one of a kind beer poured from Stew!
author: monika l.

description:
as Homer would say mmmmmmmmmmm  BEER.  pretty much all you need to know about this place......but a few tips to the wise

-Wall o' beer menu with alcohol percentage taped to the taps (& prices)
-Cash only
-If you're going to order - be ready with your whole order, the bartenders will not wait for you
-You will not get through the full list in one night, let alone a weekend
-Are you dressed up?  Not advised
-Do you want water?  I don't think they serve that

prost!
author: Mabelle A.

description: Consistently fascinating beer selection that rotates all the time, and 4 hand-pump casks, which is the only way to have beer if you get the chance.  Often absurdly crowded though.  A plus that it's adjacent to some damn good sausage.
author: Don H.

description: An excellent beer bar off of Haight Street serving up some of the world's greatest beers. One of the best beer bars in the country.
author: Anonymous P.

description: The best beer pub in the West  period.  Attitude or whatever you want to call it aside, if you like Belgian or great hand crafted brews there is no better place. Go to the sausage place next door, drop something into their jukebox, and let the the cool selections and ambiance take  you away. One of a kind.
author: Jim S.

description: It's like the Baskin-Robbins of beer. So many flavors to choose from, so little time. And they keep switching up the menu so you have to keep coming back for more. Definitely a Lower Haight must-see.
author: Natalie T.

description: I'm craving a boont amber or pliney the elder as I type. I love this place, I'd give it a 5 except for 2 reasons...the bathrooms reek (I guess what goes in must come out) and that one of the bartenders (I won't mention who) is a real jerk about allowing dogs. None of the other bartenders give me a hard time when I bring in my dog for a pint. Regardless, I think I'm a regular.
author: Leslie T.

description: Great beer selection at decent prices!  Plus you can bring in sausages from next door.  It doesn't get better!
author: Tammy S.

description: Any bar that has Slayer on the juke box has to be cool!  Great selection of beers..!  Love it..
author: David S.

description: Run 'yer self next door and get a sausage grillin', run back, order a beer and find a table, then run back and get your sausage...and that's all you need for a perfect Sunday.
author: Mark D.

description: good local dive bar for Lower Haight residents.  I was fearful of the crowds and surly staff from the Yelp reviews but we lucked out on a quiet Saturday night. Honestly just come here with a good crowd and order a Maredsous,  you'll be fine.
author: Jasmine T.

description:
if you drink bud, coors, pabst, heniken,  or any other piss beer because you enjoy them, you need to try out this place & expand your horizons/taste buds. their selection is intense. trying to decide on a beer here is like trying to find someone good to make out with after a few beers. you want something enjoyable that's good on your palate- not too wet, not too dry & at the same time will create enough goodness for seconds or thirds. though since most of the beers don't really have a description it's hard to figure out what would be satisfying. 

side note for the girls: 
there are some cute guys here. a little something for everyone. i mean everyone, trust me. so bring your best wing & a $5 for a pint.
author: Madhu D.

description: My favorite spot for a lunch time beer.  Love it with a sausage from next door.  Delicious!
author: Shawn H.

description: Very good selection of beers from all over the world, prices seem pretty low for what you get. They are really cool about you bringing outside food in. Even for a bar, it gets a little loud at times due to its narrow space.
author: Mick F.

description: I went here yesterday and had beers and watched the end of the afternoon football games.  The beers we had were $2.50/pint and we could sit and watch the game without people yelling at us.  They have a huge selection and it was a good way to spend a Sunday afternoon.  I'm a yuppie (but i wasn't dressed like one) and no one told me to get out.  And this guy had a huge golden retriever with him and I like when places let you bring your dog in a bar.  It did smell like puke in there though.
author: Steven M.

description: There is nothing better than a casual evening stroll in the neighborhood and stumbling upon one of their events.  My first unexpected encounter was last winter when unknowingly my friends and I walked into the Barley Wine Fest.  I had been living in the neighborhood for a couple months and did not know the secret extra room.  I thought I had hit the Mother Fucking Mother Lode.  Forty some barley wines on tap in addition to all the regulars drafts.  And then a couple months ago, again, having absolutely no idea of the events already in full swing, walked into what was in essence my wet dream... IPA Fest.  Learned how to play washers in the secret room and got wasted.  Great spot during during the week too.  Sometimes I hit the sausage up, if you know what I mean.  Maybe throw some junes on the juke.  Moonlight brews to the face.  No comparison.
author: Katie M.

description: A beer lover's heaven. Get a sausage next door and enjoy.
author: Blue G.

description: Heck yeah! Tons of beers on tap for your pleasure. The have so many that your head will start spinning, but the cure is but a pint glass away. The have hard to find styles of beers like bock and porters and every choice is sure to delight the inner alcoholic in every one of us. I think this place lacks ambiance, but all bars start to look the same after you down a few. The sticky floor and bare bones look is helped along by the friendly efficient staff and the kick ass Rosamunde's next door. I would huddle my little mass outside the door like a bum just to have the privilege of spooning these two SF institutions.
author: Stacy T.

description: Obviously a great selection of beer. Not the cleanest place- quite dirty in fact.  Not very spacious- good luck getting a seat or even a table to stand around if it's busy. Cash only- very annoying almost all of the time. Service takes their sweet time and boy, you'd better not call them on it. I made a joke when I was carded (I'm really close to 26), but willingly handed over my id, only to be bitched out about how if I'm not prepared to show idea I should " get out of the effen bar," so that about sums it up. The prices are right though, and after enjoying $18 pitchers at Kezar's a $3 pint sounded DAMN GOOD.
author: Jenni D.

description: Noah and Kyle and I were here on a Sunday noon, part of the lunch excursion to Rosamunde. I'm a sucker for variety, and I latched right having seen the huge number of beers on tap. What's that? Happy hour beers are like $2.50/pint? As if I needed a reason to drink at lunch.
author: Brian S.

description:
There are 450 reviews. Nothing I say here will be novel.

Just putting it out there that this is a great bar with great beer and chill bartenders.  If you're looking to meet someone new for whatever, this may not be the best place. Better for just hanging out with your friends.
author: Nick J.

description: Beer lover's heaven. They always have a strong showing of Belgian beers on tap, and not just the run of the mill stuff you see everywhere. If you're a devotee, Toronado even devotes 1 month each year to nothing but Belgian beer. The sheer number of beers on tap is staggering, many regional micro-brews are represented. Packed to the gills on weekend nights, good luck getting the bartender's attention (there is never more than one working). Try happy hour for the best deals on pints (though pricing is good any time). And yes, the bartenders bite, so don't be a wanker and 1) request Budweiser, 2) try to use a credit card, or 3) complain about the service. If you can rember all that, you are sure to enjoy many fine brews.
author: Pickled_Herring

description: I love this place. The crowd is very friendly and you have a great selection of beers. It kinda sucks that they don't take credit there but I can make that sacrifice. I haven't been able to find anywhere in the city that served Lindeman's Framboise until I went here. They have a big Belgian selection along with German stuff. I think it's neat too how they keep their taps from many years in the past all around the bar. It's also a bonus that you can eat your Rosamunde there while drinking.
author: Nir B.

description:
if you live in the bay area and you like good beer you need to be here.

this is one of my favorite bars ever and if i lived closer (and still drank a lot of beer) i think i would be here daily. it is easily the best beer bar in the city and is next to one of the best damn greasy food places in the city (rosamunde).  the fact that they let you bring rosamundes sausages into the bar means that you are drinking great beer and eating damn good food, and if you have friends, you are doing it with them. this summarizes happiness for me.

i do not understand how the bartenders at this place get a bad rap. i have been here many times and have never had a problem with the bartenders.  if you know what you want, have cash in hand, and order your drinks there will be no problems.  if you really do not know what to order ask the bartender.  they work at a beer bar, presumably (at least partly) because the like beer.  they will not bite your head off. if they have time they will even discuss what kind of flavors you like and if you are a fan of hoppy beer or wheat beer or heavy beers they will help you decide what to order. i can guarantee that you will not be disappointed. if you are disappointed then you probably dont like beer.

the bottom line is that this place serves great beer. if you enjoy beer and live anywhere in the bay area you need to make your way over here. do not be intimidated by the reviews stating the bartenders are rude. they are not rude if you are a respectful bar patron.

oh yea and if you show up early enough in the day (at least on fridays) you get a buck off a beer. not too shabby.
author: Jason B.

description:
bartender: "What do you want?" 

me: "i'm not sure, what's your favorite?" 

bartender: "something sour and expensive, now what do you want!" 

i ended up just winging it and had a few good beers, haven't been back tho.
author: Ellie S.

description: One of the few pubs in town with a ultra wide range of top shelf beers all on tap.
author: Robert M.

description: BEER GALORE!  This is a perfect spot to enjoy a variety of beer in a casual lower haight atmosphere.
author: Sarah D.

description: The best selection of unique beers I've seen so far in San Francisco. Parking is a bitch, but its worth it once you pass through the saloon style half door and enter hop heaven...You probably shouldn't drive anyway, as many of the beers are high in alcohol content and tend to sneak up on you
author: Nicolas H.

description: Best beer selection in Northern California.  Bartenders are A-HOLES, but ya gotta kinda love it.
author: Max M.

description: I like beer.  I like snooty beers.  I like local crowds, and bartenders that give respect where it's due.  Toronado is getting mighty crowded on the weekends, but stop by during the week for some education on the quality beers of the world.  Bring a sausage over from Rosmunde next door.
author: K M.

description:
99 bottles of beer on the wall,
99 bottles of beer, 
you take one down....

This is a beer lovers, beer geeks paradise. Especially if you love your Belgian imports. I was in Belgium -back-in-the-day- and caught up in one of those silly, drunken, nationalistic discussions. An American travel partner said something about "Budweiser" (mort!). Everything turned into a beer beatdown with tours of abbeys and late nights in pubs. We swiftly learned that Duvel was the "Champagne of Beers," not MGD as our commercial infused "here's to good times" brainwashing had taught us. Toronado is Belgium Jr. 

They've got Kriek, Duvel, Rochefort Trappist amongst others by the bottle. Hoegaarden, Apricot Lambic and a variety of selections on tap. The Barley Wine Festival is a must!!

Ambiance is grungeillectual.
author: Johnny C.

description: How can you not love this place when you see the huge number of beers on tap!  The ambiance that surrounds this place is a completely relaxed atmosphere and the smell of sausages brought in from next door gives this place the A+!  Plus when you need a cold one at lunch, how can you beat variety and $2.50/pint?
author: Chris C.

description: Barley wine, beer, sausages, communal tables, and friendly people.  It reminds me of the German Tourist Club in Marin, only in a decrepit building in the middle of the city.  Different, but the same.
author: Charles W.

description: Feeling like a beer? Toronado has a ridiculous selection on tap, both foreign and domestic. I had several excellent Belgian brews and a really great German unfiltered wheat beer. Each one came in a unique glass, often supplied by the beer's manufacturer. Need more reason to go? Have I mentioned that said great beers are generally priced between $4 and $6 per glass? Or that Rosamunde Sausage Grill (http://www.yelp.com/biz/rosamunde-sausage-grill-san-francisco) is right next door and you're more than welcome to bring food into Toronado? Enough? Yeah I thought so, enjoy!
author: Will A.

description:
so im not original in loving this place. but it took this bright eyed beer lover to a die hard microbrew loving, ipa drinking, if you cant handle the not so nice service screw you, theres no better way to spend an afternoon/evening/morning than at  toronado lover. my fav drinkin spot in the city. 

i know ill be trying to find an nyc replacement, and im sure i will fail. my fav beer: pliny the elder. go on and judge me beer snobs, id do the same.
author: Geetika A.

description: So much beer on tap, it's ridiculous. After drinking, go to Mythic next door and get a slice of pizza. You'll feel better.
author: Randall T.

description: There is...so...much...beer HERE! It's almost overwhelming. It overwhelms the bartenders on a daily basis probably, because they certainly act like it does. Anyway, really good beers, really rude bartenders. Whatever, reminds me of Zeitgeist on a smaller scale with more beers and no beer garden, although they do open the next door for the Barleywine festival, which should be happening in a couple of months. But that stuff is toxic so try not to drink too much of it if you can, I saw this girl nearly faceplant in front of Mythic one time during that weekend. WOW! That shit is strong. Anyway, Toronado has a ton of 'tude, but if you can handle it, the beers are all good! And some of them are hand pumped for the added bonus!
author: Gina R.

description:
Great spot to grab a fancy schmancy beer.  The Toronado/Rosamunde doubleheader is a must at some point if you live anywhere near the Lower Haight, and for good reason.

The one complaint: the guy/girl non-ratio.  I have heard, but cannot confirm, that a female once drank a beer in here way back in '72.  So if that's what you're looking for, you might want to try a different Haight establishment.
author: Conor S.

description: I take all my beer snob friends here. The front door is the coolest part. Parking can be difficult. The other kew thing about this spot is the shirt
author: a a.

description: The best beer bar in existence. A Blind Pig and a sausage from Rosamunde sooths the soul. Tony, the bar back, understands the nuances of Bay Area sports and is a great conversationalist in his spare time. Toronado is a last night in SF type of place that will never go out of style.
author: Adam L.

description: Always has a great beer selection. Gets very crowded on the weekends, to the point where it's pretty difficult to get a beer at the bar, let alone a table. But the beer rotation is worth it.
author: Roman N.

description: And now we're up to five stars! Nearly a year straight of Monday nights here. Stu is the best! Death and Taxes make me randy, and I really love Pliney!
author: Edwin M.

description: It's all about the beer. When I want selection, I come here. They have so many beers on tap and in the bottle and seemingly a glass to match every kind. This is a beer lovers paradise. Would I come for the chicks? NO. But this place is a great place to come with 2 or 3 good friends for a few good beers and some good conversation.
author: Steve H.

description: "This calls for a beer" I declared as we left our new landlord's office. I have a feeling with a bar like this just two blocks from our new apartment, "This calls for a beer" is a declaration I am going to be frequently making. This place has an excellent selection of beers. The crowd was kinda boring, but it was 5:00 on Friday. Further inspection is bound to effect my rating.
author: Jesse H.

description: Ah, this is everything that is great about SF: a weird niche, full of tons of beers, with sausage nearby. I'm always shocked, I dont' know why, but some random microbrew that is served on their menu. Why should I be shocked? If it's good, it's on there!
author: Anna B.

description:
for a beer bar they sure are snarky when i trot up mid-day with my sausage in one hand, ID and cash in the other, and order a root beer. there hasn't been a time yet they haven't said "IM STILL GOING TO NEED TO CARD YOU" (like i'm still not tall enough to ride the roller coaster or something) as i'm already sliding it to them. you have root beer on tap! it's excellent! why so suprised? yes i know i resemble a 12 year old boy with nice tits wearing my civillian clothes and no make up, but seriously. i don't have room in my very post pubescent stomach for both my wild boar saucy-ges AND a whole pint of beer. not to mention seriously lacking the enzymes for any sort of respectable afternoon drinking. hmph!

lately i've been taking to just eating my snacks at the counter at R's -- better light for boggle games, but i never turn down to cozying down in a corner at toronado to soberly nurse a hangover or kick with  a boozy friend. i gotta check this place out at night sometime.
author: Frances L.

description:
notice that vaguely crusty crock pot in back of the bar? its contents are not on the menu, but it's full of honey warm, lightly spiced MEAD.

where else in san francisco can you feast on duck, boar, mead, and ale? 

fans of heroic epic poetry and geatland exiles: stop here (and next door) for nourishment before battling grendel...
author: jen s.

description: Best beer bar in SF.  Yes it gets too crowded.  Higher quality crowd than Zeitgeist.  Delicious sausages nextdoor.  Sooo many good beers . . .
author: Alex K.

description:
Where do I begin?  As someone who considers himself to a certain degree a connoisseur of beer, or less obnoxiously put someone who is always in search of a good cold one, I was intrigued by Toronado and its offerings.  I was not disappointed by the selection, but the overall experience left something to be desired.

Located on Lower Haight, a favorite locality of yours truly, Toronado is situated in what I feel is an ideal setting, with Ali Baba, Rosamunde's grill, and a plethora of other reasonably priced and tasty food options. Toronado has a wide range of fine Belgian and local brews, ranging from the more widely available Chimay, to the uber-sublime and floral Edel Weiss, which must be imbibed by any first timer.  

That said, a bar is more than just an establishment that dispenses booze, especially considering the range and variety of bars in the city.  Toronado may have one of a kind beers not found in any other bar, but does that overcome mitigating factors that tips it in the opposite direction?  I know it's already been said, the bartenders can be beyond curt to the point of brusque and curmudgeonly, and I've personally witnessed customers being snubbed for a number of reasons, some warranted, some not so much.  The demographic of the patrons also merits discussion, as the Haight attracts an eclectic mix of people, but can also be to the detriment of the environment of an establishment like a bar, and Toronado is a classic example.  While a crew of vigilante hog riders does add a certain element of anti-establishment social edge, a bar full of them creates a non-inviting and borderline hostile atmosphere.  That, and the entire space, not just the bathrooms, smells like an unplesant concoction of urine and pine sol.  Not good drinking times.  

So three stars from me, earned exclusively for the truly unique beers , and zero for the destination.  That said, what do you value?  Substance?  Style?  Both?  The choice is yours, choose and drink wisely.
author: Michael P.

description: Great beer bar!  I was totally impressed by the selection and atmosphere of this bar.  The staff is super friendly despite my initial intimidation with which beer to choose, I loosened up after a few beers.  My recommendation is...try them all!!  The bar is slightly on the smelly side, but you get used to it.  I wish they served food though.
author: Jonathan T.

description:
Went here for the first time this past Saturday which was a hoot of a good time. Went to get sausages first which were excellent and they let you take them into the bar to eat. A great partnership between the dank beer bar and the dank sausage shop directly next door. Was throughly amazed by their selection of beers upon entering. Looked over the menu for a while and noted the following brewery selections; Dogfish Head, Russian River, Drakes, Sprecher, Petrus, Chimay, Moonlight, Anchor, Anderson Valley, Speakeasy and more. I also noticed someone cracking what looked to be like a Belgium Longneck bottle of something heady. After a few pints, I saw that they also had a beer menu besides the one hanging on the wall. I may have missed out on some rarities, but I was not dissapointed with the selections we chose. Between the four of us, we each had 2 pints and shared sips of each others. Pliny The Elder, Midas Touch, Damnation, Death and Taxes were noted as being really fresh and tasty. The glassware selection and pairing was superb. The bar is not too large and from what I've heard really starts to fill up at night. Luckily we were there early afternoon, but I did notice it starting to fill up rather quickly. The lighting is somewhat dark and the decor was a history book of heady beers. They keep all their previous taps and I must say there are a lot of them. These were in addition to the 30-45 taps they currently were serving. My only complaint was the bartender could have been more polite and attentive. She didn't acknowledge me at the bar when I went up twice and served a couple others before me that came up after me. It would not have hurt them to have a 2nd bartender working either. Next time I'll be bringing my notepad to take notes on their selections and tastings.

If you visit San Francisco, this is a must stop when vising Haight Street. Check this place out in Lower Haight, grab a pint and a sausage and then head up to Haight Ashbury to check out Amoeba Records.
author: Benjamin P.

description: Great bartenders, and the best beer selection in SF. Try all their offerings from the German Schneider-Weisse company.
author: Adam Z.

description: I went here Friday night and had the sweetest tasting Belgian beer.  It was really good.  My favorite part was in the women's bathroom someone had written "Elvis Lives" on the wall.  Definitely a full house on a Friday night.
author: Jenna M.

description:
Beer beer beer.  Go to Toronado for beer.  Go with friends.  Drink beer.

Great selection, good prices, and that good old dive bar feel.  My Wednesday night visit was pleasantly crowded, manageably loud, and an overall good time with some old friends.
author: Alex L.

description: My friend had heard about this bar from several people and when we looked it up online it looked great... we were highly disapointed. The bartender seemed very annoyed when we asked for beer recommendations, and poured us beers that didn't taste anything like what we told him we liked. Not to mention, the bathrooms looked and smelled like the inside of a nasty outhouse in the summer. We ended up leaving before we finished our beers - I would never recomend this bar to anyone.
author: Crystal V.

description: Outstanding! Incredible selection and good prices. Also - a daily happy hour beginning at 11:30 in the morning and going until six? Awesome. They also seem to (I stress the "seem" part) lack the assholery found in similar places like Publick House. Great place.
author: Stephen K.

description: What can I say.  The Toronado is a great place to come for lunch. I have never been there at night.  I will pick up a sausage sandwich or a Philly Cheese Steak around the corner and sit down for  a few good beers.  Where else in the world can you get Moonlight Twist of Fate on cask condition.  Not mention one of the first times I went there, they were play Clay Pigeons on the TV.
author: Scott S.

description: This place is hilarious. Beer is good and the staff is even better. If you get sausages next door, make sure to return the baskets or you will get yelled at.
author: Carly W.

description: I was in Tornado yesterday for the second time. I will say the beer is great and there are endless beers on draft.  I have to say I was extremely disappointed at the service my roommate and I received this time. I hate to say that any place would still discriminate especially in the city of love San Francisco. But I have to say my roommate who is black and Me White experienced it here. You have to step back for a minute and give the bartender the benefit of the doubt. Right? Well we did just that. My roommate stood at the bar for over 30 minutes and was completely ignored money in hand. People coming in after us were being served. The bartender made it very obvious that he saw us. As soon as I joined my roommate at the bar I was served instantly. But the experience it self was uncool. This is 2010 for gods sake. Well It sucks for me cuz I love good beer. :(
author: Shana K.

description: mmmm:) I love beer, and there selection is pretty freakin' awesome!  But I love this bar, seriously I love it if this bar was personified I would marry it. This is my favorite bar in the city, for sure. They used to have the Duchess on draft, one of the best beers I have ever drunk.  The bartenders are pretty awesome, but they can be a little gruff, but gruff is what I want in a bartender.  If you are gonna be a prick then they might just be a prick back, if you are gonna come up and ask a stupid ass question then they might give you a hard time. I do love that they serve beers by locally owned breweries such as Speakeasy beers, definitely try to Double Daddy that they have on tap for the summer, if you don't grow chest hairs after that gimme a call!!
author: Cassie L.

description: Blind Pig IPA, Dupont Saison, Hopsickle, and Sausages next door? What more could a person want? Well, they have soccer on the T.V. and they've been know to play a whole album of Tool!
author: Chris G.

description: The "Nado" was my first real hangout when I arrived in SF back in 92. Hip SF crowd, great music and Boonvilles' Oatmeal Stout on tap.. what more could a person ask for?
author: Paul H.

description: Holly Shit!!!!!!!!!!!!! $2.75 beers and I got my first San Francisco buy back. Knowledgable barkeep, friendly, crowd, and they don't hassle you about your seeing eye dog.
author: t h.

description: Beer bar = guy bar.  Not too many women when I went, more of bring your own type of place.  They encourage you to bring in outside food.  The sausages next door are awesome.
author: Joel M.

description: A enjoyable bar with an amazing beer slection, and one where I can enjoy some sausage from Rosamunde.  Get there early or you will be standing.    Worth going to again and again.
author: Alured P.

description: Wow, do I love this place!  Took a pal there for his first time last night, and was reminded why.  A gruff but friendly bartender immediately stood my pal a hand pumped beer when he found out it was his birthday.  The Toronado is no dive bar.  They, simply put, have the very best selection of hand crafted beers in the country.  Every time I go, I meet people who are essentially beer tourists.  Instead of visiting Fisherman's Wharf, they make the trek to the Toronado, the mecca of hand crafted beer.  If you like your beer good, Toronado will put you in your happy place.
author: Liz R.

description: Grumpy bartender and amazing beer. The beer selection was absolutely amazing. They had way too many to choose from. I ended up trying their room temperature stuff which I enjoyed immensely. Pair that with some sausages from next door and you have a perfect meal.
author: Alex M.

description: I spent Christmas day 2006 watching football and drinking beer at Toronado, it will always be a fond memory for me... That and so many beers to choose from a girl doesn't know where to start...  Anchor Christmas beer on hand pump is always nice!
author: Joy C.

description: If you want a dive bar with tons of beers on tap, it does not get any better than Toronado.  The scene is just like any dive bar but the bartender and beer selection was fantastic.  I have never seen a bartender handle a packed bar so well.  Try any of the Belgian beer they are fantastic.
author: Sarah R.

description: Never, ever, have a best friend who lives close to a bar with good beer and a decent happy hour.  I have ONCE gone in and had just one beer.  It's hardly worth a trip if you don't sample at least 2-3 beers...This place is just pure liquid danger.
author: JORDAN M.

description: A favorite place to go to hang and have a few brews. Not your typical beer fare either. Last time there a Godzilla movie was on the tube. How cool to be sipping a beer while the sound of tiny twin Asian girls singing to Mothra mingles with the general bar noises
author: chris m.

description: beer fans rejoice at this local purveyor of beers from nearby and far away. Grab a sausage next door in rosamunde and strap yourself in for some unfamiliar but inviting brews.
author: hunter w.

description: One of my favorite bars on the planet.  What is not to love about it?  West Coast Beers (Best beer in the World) and Belgian Beer (2nd Best Beer in the World housed in a grungy bar in my favorite neighborhood in my favorite city in my favorite State with German Sausage shop next door where you can order a Vegan Sausage to consume alongside your Boont Amber, Lagunitas IPA, Racer 5, Death and Taxes, Russian River, Downtown Brown, Speakeasy, North Coast, Lost Coast, or whatever beer you are drinking.  Warning: If you're from the East Coast or most other non-West Coast part of the U.S., your palate may not be advanced enough to take all the hoppy goodness of the beers here and if you order a Sammie or some lame beer they may kick you out.
author: Roy J.

description: So many great beers that you'll have a hard time choosing....If you do and ask the bartenders what they suggest, then at least give them a bit of a clue on what you like to drink, for example: draft or bottle, pilsner or stout. They're not mind readers and they don't know you're tastes.  I suggest the Rattenberger!
author: Sabrina L.

description: Excellent beer selection, primarily geared towards Belgians and microbrews.  Also one of the few places in town with cask conditioned ("real") ale on tap.  (Yeay!)  No food service, but you are welcome to go next door and bring back a sausage from Rosamunde's or a slice of pizza from Mystic's.  Can be a bit noisy and crowded towards the evening, so come early if you want a table and conversation.
author: Lennart L.

description: I had not been to the Toronado in a few years. Sad I know.  It is not a dive bar, it is a funky place with tastemaker quality refreshments!  The assortment was awesome and I went for the De Struisse and a Dogfish Head... where else in the city can you do that consistently.
author: dan s.

description: My beer snob friend took me to this place and was amazed to see the number of different brews they carry on tap -- as far as the eye can see!  This is when I started to become a fan of beer.  Beer selection is superb.  the service however, I find intimidating.  I don't know much about beer so when i asked for suggestions and samples, the bartender looked a bit irritated although he did help me.  The place, is dingy and smelly, but it's still a cool place to kick back.  For awesome beer, I think this is the place to be, but if you want good beer and nice ambiance, I would go to Monk's Kettle.
author: Connie C.

description:
ok, the woman to man ratio is about 2 to 10, so this is an idea place for a person, like me, who NEVER gets hit on, but still only 3 stars cause i'm not into taking guys home from bars...

yeah, good selection of beer, i know.  other than that, it's a regular bar....most of the bartenders are friendly, some think they have earned the reputation to be . . . not so patient.  it's stinky, sticky and sweaty, but there's a great jukebox and the barrel never runs dry.
author: regina k.

description: GREAT BEER SELECTION! I highly recommend this place and there are tons of places to go and eat if you get hungry. the sausage spot next to it is the best combo with the beers here and you have tons of choices and will never run out! they have beers from all over the micro breweries from the bay area and the list is long..this is the place to be my friends!
author: Kathleen P.

description: Went to this place with some sausages from next door, intending to enjoy them with some kick-ass beer. Spent about 2 minutes inside which was all it took for me to NEVER go here again. The bartenders are so phenomenally rude that it will knock your socks off. It's almost worth going just to experience their perfected F-off attitudes, except then you'd be giving them business which they don't want much less deserve.
author: Leslie H.

description: when the bartender says- i know you, you're that girl who likes iron maiden! -you know you're in the right place.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Awesome!  A million types of craft beer.  A little crowded around game time, but worth it.  One of the best dive bars I've been to.
author: Jeremy L.

description: beers. an overstimulating number of choices. beers. good location. beers. good times. beers
author: kiki b.

description: Well there is a shit load of beer to choose from, however the tenders suck so you better know what your sipping before you approach the bar. Still when all is said and done the beer selection is impressive and it is located in lower Haight with loads of great spots near by....
author: sean l.

description: It's possible to be a little 'too' dog friendly. I don't mind the occasional pooch wandering around, but try to keep them off the tables and out of my lap if you don't mind. Beer's always stale here too.
author: Andrew L.

description: Arguably the best beer selection in San Francisco, no make that the West coast.  Still no Haecker Schorr Weiss which is my favorite beer but then again I don't know where to find it in San Francisco.  Toronado is most famous for their selection of Belgium beers on tap.  They also have a great micro root beer from the Sprecher brewery in Milwaukee.  The dutch door is a nice touch.  Service is uneven, decor is "dive" but no matter, people only come for the beer.
author: John S.

description: One of the best beer bars in the country. This is the must-visit beer spot in the Bay Area. Great selection of beers on tap and in the cellar that you won't find many other places anywhere. The annual barleywine fest and Belgian beer month are both great. Hit-or-miss bartenders who can be jerks--treat ordering here like ordering from the Seinfeld Soup Nazi and tip well and you'll be fine. Excellent jukebox. Phenomenal food in the neighborhood that you can take into the bar--my faves include Memphis Minnie's, Rosamunde Grill, Ali Baba's, Mystic Pizza, and King Foot Subs on Divisadero.
author: Matt W.

description: Great beer selection, casual environment...however some of my friends are put off by the bartenders who they report can sometimes remind one of the Seinfeld's Soup Nazi....kind of like Belgian Beer Nazis..."No beer for you!".  Personally, I haven't had much problems.
author: Christopher K.

description: Great beer and tons of different kinds.  You can't get a place to sit and enjoy it with friends though, becase the place is so packed.  I could definitely see myself going here a lot (even though it's far from my North Beach apartment) if it was bigger with more seating.  If you love beer, this is the place for you...
author: Nate V.

description: Loud, shitty rock music, hungover cokehead bartenders (although they will get you what you need and offer advice if you're patient), too crowded, too dirty, can't hear yourself think, and still -- beer mecca. A constantly rotating list of exotic beers, both draft and bottle. Go with a friend when you've both just received paychecks, and order beers based on the strangeness of their names. Be sure to eat beforehand or visit the sausage place next door because many of the beers are potent enough to inebriate a manatee. A must-visit for beer lovers.
author: MeatMaster X.

description: One of the best places on the planet for a pint or two. Incredible beer selection, including hand-pumped. Eclectic jukebox. Colorful characters on both sides of the bar. Plus it's located one of my favorite SF neighborhoods, gritty/funky Lower Haight.
author: John M.

description: The best beer selection in town, hands down.  I love their logo.
author: dave k.

description: I use to live in Hayes valley and came to Toronado quite a bit. I think this place has the best beers in SF. Would definitely recommend checking this place out.
author: Cyndee P.

description: If you love beer as much as I do there is no possible way in hell that this place gets less than five stars for any reason whatsoever.  I agree with Eric M.  places like this are near impossible to find anywhere.  Use the knowledge of the bartenders to your advantage and learn about beer for real.  And you can get sausage next door to boot.  For serious beer drinkers this is the best in California.
author: Matt P.

description: Remember when the Arnold Schwarzenegger soundboard was popular? well if you, dont it had a button on it that said had Arnold shouting "stop whinning". I think im done writing my review now.
author: Jonathan P.

description: I used to live in the Lower Haight, so I'd go to Toronado umm... maybe once a month. And the crew there would recognize me and get me my beer immediately, ahead of the touristy people. It was my 'hood and I was part of the community. :-) I remember chatting up the people who work there and the stories from their lives. The Lower Haight is sweet that way.
author: Sujeeth U.

description: If you love beer than you will have a hard time picking a beer at this place. It is so down to earth and chill hear. No matter what your flavor is you will find it here. Try it even if you dont like beer.
author: M C.

description: I'm a dive bar type of guy, and this has to be one of my new favorite bars in all of SF. Their on-tap selection is second to none (more than 20 beers), and the prices can't be beat for pints of strong IPA that can't be found in such form in any other bar. Ample space to sit down, and there is a back room with a TV. Four pints and I was drunk, that doesn't happen at just any bar for me. Also what's convenient is that there is easy access to both the Muni metro and the 71 and 22 lines, and the fact that most of the crusties and squatters stay on upper Haight away from the place.
author: Sean R.

description:
Let me preface this review with the fact that I love beer.

This bar has great beer. I guess dive bar seems to mean bar that allows the volume of conversation to be greater than the volume of music, and that is definitely true here  - which I love. 

Good beer, you can eat your take out here... friendly enough waitstaff.. whats not to like?
author: Nors P.

description: Hands down, favorite bar in the city. This place is right down the street from my apt. Combine that with a sausage from Rosamunde's next door and this a perfect night. This place has plenty of good seasonals plus my favorite, Blind Pig IPA from Russian River. Plus this place always is full of locals hanging out (no yuppies). Always low key, always a good time.
author: DJ A.

description: This place invented too-cool-for-school.  After you put on your black t-shirt to fit in at Suppenkuche head up to Toronado to get treated like dirt or ignored by the bartender.  KEEP IT!
author: Billy B.

description:
Scruffy beer joint with
Top notch selection of brews
Sausage sold next door
author: HaikuReview X.

description: Every time I walk in I can hear Joe Walsh guitars cranking up in the back of my mind... f*ckin-a!
author: Wil E.

description: Vegan Sausage from Rosamunde's next door, and some random choice of beer from here (there's so many amazing things on tap to choose from I always try something different) and I've never been disappointed by the experience.  It can get crowded, and hard to find a place to sit, but this place is great.  And if you're there too late for Rosamunde's, the Tamale Lady will often stop by later in the evening.
author: グレェ G.

description:
This bar has the greatest selection of beers on tap anywhere in the area.  The sausages right next door, which is owned by the same people are equally great.  Nothing like a maple sausage and oatmeal stout.

That said I don't recommend for people who are not locals.  Frankly they are down right rood at Toronado's. The bartender, doorman, and even guests don't know the meaning of customer service and are far from friendly.

if you don't mind feeling like the site of you makes everyone who works there sick than trust me its worth it!
author: Kilian M.

description: Toronado:  awesome beer selection, very fair prices, wonderful food from Rosamunde's next door, grumpy bartenders, loud music, smells pretty bad...all around great dive bar.
author: James M.

description: ive been coming here for the past 8 years and love it. great beer. . some people don't get the bartenders demeanor-but I love it. Jen and paul are awsome..beer selection is the best I've seen and a dollar off during happy hour
author: P. M.

description: If you're looking for a complete DIVE bar, this is the place for you. I went to Toronado on a Friday night, and there was a crowd but still several places to sit at the bar. I went with my girlfriend, and I'm pretty sure we were the only females in the entire place (girls, beware of the women's restroom here). I thought the service was good. I hadn't heard of any of the beers so the bartender asked me what I liked and gave me a good suggestion (which I ended up loving). He even gave us a free sample of an interesting beer we were curious about. If you're looking for a nice place that doesn't smell like a locker room, this isn't the place for you, but if you're looking for a place that knows their beer and serves it right, you might just enjoy Toranado.
author: Jamie W.

description: This is the place to go if you want to choose from a wide array of beers you've probably never heard from and might never see again... Fortunately they are, on the whole, delicious, as little else can be said about the rest of the spot.  Oh yeah, guns don't kill people, people with moustaches kill people.  watch out. A great place to get drunk quick and be on the move!
author: Owen D.

description:
Think:  "Upscale beer tasting in the basement of a frat house"
5 stars for the beer selection, 2 stars for the bar itself.  Its too bright and often stinks like you place does the next morning after having thrown a huge kegger.  

That being said, I'm not kidding about the beer selections.  TONS of great beers and, surprisingly, the prices are pretty darn reasonable.
author: Brian M.

description: Divey bar whose many on-tap beers seem to have raised it to destination status among beer-aficionados.  I don't even like beer all that much, but the White Knuckle (I think it was Marin Brewing) was a revelation in sweet, fruity beer goodness.  I also had a "Reality Czech" based mostly on the name.  People were bringing in food from some place next door.  Decent bathroom-wall literature.
author: Alex T.

description:
yes its grungy, and a definite dive bar but come on! this place has more beer on tap than you can count... or at least more than i can count when i'm wasted, which is usually the case when i go there. They have amazing beer, and I dont find the people that work there to be so bad. They were always friendly to me. But they dont take credit which is pretty irritating sometimes. 
The beer selection on tap is amazing, so is their bottled collection. Dont expect to find much else though. I always have a story when i go to this bar. I always meet some really random people and have awesome conversations there. Inevitably, one of my friends has tried way too much of their beer so i always have to go before they close but its always too soon. I dont normally find that there are a lot of women in here, its mostly a guy's place, which is even better for me. And when you drunkenly stumble out of this place,  there are great places for late night food very close by.
author: Triana L.

description:
This is the greatest beer bar I have been to in the United States.  There are other places that I like and enjoy, including the wickendon pub in Providence RI, the Sunset Bar in Boston, especially Monk's Cafe in Phildelphia and the Brickskeller in Washington DC.  

But Toronado easily beats them all, despite the service at times.  Depending on the bar tender and their mood, you can get someone who is exceptionally helpful or the owner's wife who can be quite surly at times.  Despite some of the worst service experiences I have had, this is still my favorite bar in San Francisco, and deep down I love laughing at a ex-frat boy who comes in and orders a fat tire or a budweiser and is shocked when the bar tender responds gruffly that it isn't on the board.
author: David B.

description:
If you have a taste for superior beer, and appreciate drinking in a no nonsense environment, Toronado is a must visit in the City.  There is no comparison as far as I know.

60 beers on tap... you can bring in your own food... hard rock on the juke box ... great bottle collection ... odd stickers on the wall ... odd people in the seats - what's not to love?

Happy hour is awesome - $3 for some of the best beer around (60 choices on tap). I recommend Death and Taxes, a black beer, and Pliny the Elder (a hoppy hoppy IPA). 

Weekends this place gets hectic, what with the general lack of space and the Marina invaders, but during the week (and during the afternoon) there isn't a better place to grab a brew. 

As for the bartenders? 

Jenny in the afternoons is a chill lady, though she did seem a little stoned, and her dogs are fun to play with if you get the chance. 

The Scottish dude at night is pretty cool, too. Just don't mess around - know what you want, pay respectfully, tip well. 

Please note. This place is not for: "brahs," ladies looking for Mudslides, people looking to dance or get laid, or Budweiser fans - the sorts of people that have given this unbelievable establishment the lousy reviews that's dragging down its rating.
author: Mister Z.

description:
I'd give it five stars if it didn't often smell of stale, spilled beer, but hey, I don't eat off the floor or in the bathrooms, so who cares?

I love that they don't serve food, which allows them to cater to all your beer needs.  Plus, they don't care if you bring your own food, and Rosamunde, next door, has some sort of deal going on with them that allows you to carry your basket o' sausagey goodness over and the folks at Toronado will return it for you.

Some folks might argue at the necessity of using the appropriate glassware for a particular beer, but I am always impressed that the bartenders will go out of their way to find either the glass printed with the name of the beer you are drinking or one that will properly showcase its flavors.

Service: I have yet to acquire a taste for at least one of the daytime bartenders, but I admit, as long as I can order more than one beer at a time so I never go thirsty, I could care less if he ignores me most of the time.  I don't go to bars to chat up the barkeep; I go to indulge in tasty libations.  At night, you'll always be treated well by Stuart, Alene, or Tad, unless you are a jackass, in which case, they'll be happy to have you escorted (read: thrown) to the the curb.  I like knowing that I can enjoy a beer without some jackass messing up the experience.

The beer selection on tap is definitely tipped towards the hoppy end of the spectrum, with some Belgians, Stouts, etc. mixed in.  If you like the malty side, check out their bottle list, with plenty of vintage selections, although the prices at City Beer are better.  As far as draft, reasonably priced beer goes, there aren't many better in my book.

Best of all, they are open 'til 2 A.M. every night of the week.  I love this place, and frequent it often.  Having recently moved to the bay area from Memphis and starving for great brews, I'm pleased to say it's across the bay from me, or I'd be there every day.

Fight for a seat at the bar or a table: it's worth it.  Just watch out for the crack dealers and thieves nestled in the shady alcoves on the way back to your car.
author: Tyler M.

description: Great place. Awesome selection (ofcourse) great culture-vibe. Could use an interior re-vamp.
author: Mr J.

description: Best selection of delicious beers in San Francisco AFAIK. There are several dozen on tap from around the country and around the world. Many more varieties in bottles too. The place is popular with beer lovers so the stuff moves and always tastes fresh to me. Its hard to choose but its easy to find gems. Try something hand-pumped, Belgian, etc. The place might look like a dump when you first stick your head in but its a very comfortable spot after you've settled in and drank some fine brews. Staff doesn't mind if you bring in food from one of the many restaurant, cafes and counters in the neighborhood (e.g., great BBQ at Memphis Minnie's). Varied crowd albeit skewed towards younger beer hall types.
author: mark y.

description: This place may look like a real sh*t-hole, but its a beer lovers paradise!  Gotta love it!
author: Terrel R.

description: Went for lunch today and forgot just how much I love this place.  The selection from behind the bar is the best in the city and the food options are not so bad either.  During the day this place is way less crowded and the bartenders are more friendly.  On a dreary Saturday, go here to drink in the afternoon.
author: Andy J.

description: After having been to some of the best beer bars in Boston, this place has an incredible selection of beer! The environment isn't quite what I was hoping for, but I'll still go there to enjoy delerium tremens on tap. mmmm.
author: Jason G.

description: Great dog friendly beer bar! Sure it stinks but who cares? Lots'a different types of my favorite poison! That battle axe (chick) who tends bar could use some charm school though. With Rosamunde next door, this bar is foolproof. A must try for all locals and outsiders as well!
author: Al Stickler X.

description: can't get enough of all their awesome beers on tap! good, cheap beer paired with rosamunde's sausages next door is next to heavenly. awesome bartenders too! it's just really popular so it can get crowded sometimes.
author: Jenna S.

description: by far the worse service in san francisco! not worth it!!!
author: Victoria F.

description: Most pretentious and belligerent bar staff I've ever encountered.
author: K L.

description: if you don't look and dress a certain way, the bartenders here won't serve you. i'm not kidding, i've had the staff here pretend i didn't exist on more than one occasion. the bartenders at Zeitgeist may be impatient dicks, but at least they don't discriminate.
author: Daryl F.

description: a word to the wise, the grumpy old people who work here usually don't hang around past 9pm these days, so if you actually want to enjoy this place, i'd suggest coming in later.
author: Tom H.

description: toronado rightfully deserves five stars...i'm a regular here and always dig the no-nonsense, yet friendly (unless you're a fratty DB) bartenders and bouncers. it's a place that i bring out of town visitors too b/c i think it's worthy..however, when a certain dude is working, the star count goes down. we were finishing our pizza around closing time and had some beer left in our glasses but were done drinking...dude would not stop rudely shouting at us to get the hell out and finish our beers (i had already told him that we were done drinking & just finishing our pizza). i realize that we needed to start clearing out, but if you want people to leave, then be a little nicer about it. it's not the first time that me or my friends have had issues with him. take the power-trip down a notch dude, seriously. don't make me stop coming here b/c in all other respects, this place is awesome!
author: Alicia O.

description: The door guy here is a absolute douche. The other night, I was supposed to meet up with some friends over there, and I called them up to see if I could bring in my dog, since she had been cooped up all day at home. They said it was cool, and that there were dogs in there, so I brought her along. The door guy stopped me before I even had a chance to say anything to him and said, she can't come in here. I said, oh I thought dogs were ok, and he said no, not her, she's too 'jumpy'. She wasn't jumping at all, she gets a little excited and wiggly , but whatever, fine, I don't want to argue, so I asked him if I could just go in and tell my friends that I couldn't stay, and he denied me! He said, I don't want the dog in here. I couldn't exactly just leave her outside! He was just such an arrogant ass, and I have heard friends of mine getting some serious unjustifiable attitude from staff here, so f'em. I appreciate attitude as much as the next person, but use it on people who deserve it, not people who are being totally respectful to you. I can get my beer elsewhere.
author: Jeannine S.

description: crowded when i went, but awesome tap selection. russian river is all you need.
author: Justin O.

description: I used to think this place was laid back but recently learned otherwise - just another place frontin' like a chill place but really just people impressed with themselves and their own, manufactured image.  Too dissapointing - not real.
author: d l.

description: The beer selection is great. The service is really, really, really crappy. I have been here many times because it is near my boyfriend's place & they have my favorite beer, Death & Taxes, but honestly the service has been so awful the last few times I've been there I'm not sure if I'll be back soon. The last time I was there one of the bartenders ran into me, spilling half my beer over me, my boyfriend, and the floor and just kept walking. No, I'm sorry, no acknowledgment that he nearly knocked me over. Funnily enough, he was walking away from cleaning up a spill. Here's a tip, if you open your eyes, look where you're going, and don't run into people you won't have so many spills to clean up. Maybe go here during some off-peak time, when the bartenders aren't so stressed by the standard Saturday night crowd... Also the music is really to loud. It's basically impossible to have a conversation.
author: Kelsey M.

description: this place is so packed full of dudes i almost mistook it for a gay bar, but everyone (myself included) matched the grimey decor of the place so i figured there must be loads of drinking going on here.  which there is.
author: Markus B.

description:
i no longer even try to go to this bar.  I love beer, and they've got lots and lots of it.  Some of it is even super fancy and hard to find and just plain delicious.  And it's an added bonus that you can bring in sausage from next door to enjoy them together.

But all the beer in the world is useless if you can't get served.  This is the only bar in the city that I've been to where I just can't even get the time of day, let alone a beer.  I'm polite, money in hand, waiting my turn, making eye contact and not calling out, but the (male) bartenders would rather chat with their friends or clean glasses or just disappear rather than serve me.  And it's not just once or twice that I've been burned, it's like 8 or more years of not getting served at this bar before I finally gave up.   I tip well when I do get a beer, but it's just not worth the effort.  I note that the awful service I've gotten has been from the male bartenders.  Via whatever coincidence, I think the persons who actually have served me the most often were female.  I think I even had to wait once for her to come on shift before I could get a beer.  But I don't go enough to remember if it was the same woman, or if all of the male bartenders were as guilty as the next.

Maybe I'd go at 2 or 3 in the afternoon, but never after 7pm.  Not when there are so many more interesting people to talk to in an effort to avoid serving beer.
author: Lamont L.

description:
Toronado has a great selection of tap beer.  I won't go there again.  Many places in the city have a good selection of beer on tap, so that fact alone shouldn't consistently rank Toronado among the dive bar legends.  

Now, let me preface this review by saying that Yelp reviews that lambaste a place for one specified bad experience, or poor service where you obviously shouldn't be expecting better, drive me nuts.  They are mostly irrelevant and vindictive.  However, occasional and unapologetic hypocrite that I am, I am going to do exactly the same thing.  

I don't expect much from a bartender at a place like Toronados aside from bringing me the correct beer in a timely manner.  Which the bartender did.  He then proceeded to give me change for a $10 bill instead of the $20 I had given him.  It was the only cash I had in my wallet (having just withdrawn it from the ATM) and it was my second drink of the evening, so there was no way I was mistaken.  After harshly asking me several times in a row if I was positive he had made a mistake (are you SURE, I mean POSITIVE, I mean ABSOLUTELY SURE) he went to correct his mistake.  And by correct his mistake I mean he got the money out of the cash register, but before returning it yelled about how he doesn't "fucking make mistakes" and threatened to remember me if I ever came in his bar again.  Well, buddy, apparently you did make a mistake, and a relatively big one-$10 is a slow evenings worth of beer-however, you did, at least, succeed in ensuring I that I won't be back again.  Being short-changed is one thing-I know it happens-but being yelled at and threatened in front of the entire bar, seconds after walking in, for being short-changed is another.

Like other inflammatory, purposefully hurtful reviews that so annoy me, I won't go into clientele, atmosphere, or anything else that people might be interested in knowing-all that is probably covered in at least one of the other 300+ reviews, anyway.
author: V. A.

description: This bar is one of the reasons I moved back to SF a year ago.  Thank you existing.  And if anyone who works there reads this....please bring back the Cream Ale... you had it in about a year ago.  i know it's girly, but i'm a chick and I can like IPA and tasty desert beers too.
author: Mira K.

description: My head was spinning from the beer selection even before I started drinking. I was with a friend who wanted "something light" so I tried my hardest to order "something light" for her with out embarrassing myself, as I think light beers are for wimps. Beers are for drinking, light beers are for peeing. If I wanted to pee a lot, I'd stick to water. I digress, the selection is awesome, and the prices are unheard of for a bar. Watching the bartenders here is like watching porn for service industry. If a customer tasting a lager (and asking for tastes when its balls busy at that) says it "has too much ale in it," he absolutely deserves to be verbally bitch slapped. Sorry people, but the prices are uncharacteristically low for a reason: you are not paying to have to the staff kiss your ass. Craft beers are a huge trend right now, and this place is not a place for trend followers, it is a place where people go when they know what they want the moment they step up to the bar. I was treated very well and enjoyed my experience completely (a little too completely judging by how I felt the next day) because I knew what I wanted, what I liked, and how to ask for it when I stepped in the bar.
author: z z.

description: just go and have a beer or two. its a lower haight landmark!
author: Sha A.

description: I was a little intoxicated when I visited this place, so I'm writing based on my drunken memory.  Having just come from the Hardly Strictly festi it was a perfect place to meet friends and have a few more pops.  Toronado had an extensive beer selection.  I was not in the right state to study the menu so I vested my trust in the judgement of the bartender.  I ordered two hefeweisens (mmmm...) and she poured one extra, probably because i was not entirely clear in my order, but she gave me the third- free of charge!  whoohoo!  I was starving so I dropped in next door and ordered a veal sausage, really random since I don't normally eat veal, it was delish either way.  You can bring your food back to the bar, seems as if they have some sort of deal, and they collect your basket once you are finished.  Glad I ended up here!
author: L J.

description: best beer bar in the city for sure and it is conveniently located next to the best sausage place in the city.  me and Tal drank our thru the Xmas brews last December and got TA-Dow!!!  hiccup**
author: Chard M.

description: Amazing beer selection! Impress your friends who call themselves beer experts...grab a sausage at Rosamundo next door and you've got an sweet meal for under 10 bucks.
author: Erica S.

description: if you like beer, HOORAY beer! :}  if you like liquor, it's a PISSER. :{
author: Pickle R.

description: Definitely a dude's bar.  It's dirty, very loud, the music is not good and they do not accept credit cards,  This said, I felt very comfortable walking in and settling down at the bar because I'm a sturdy female type, not a prissy pissant von dutchie.  I can handle myself and unwanted advances, have a knowledgable conversation about man-topics.  And the beer menu is fantastic.  While there was a lot on tap that I've never had, I went with the Delerium Tremens.  I sketched a man at the bar who is from Baltimore.  We talked a little but about enjoying the atmosphere, and he slid a comment in to make me able to translate my surroundings to you: "And there's a sausage place next door!" he exclaimed.  Although Toronado IS a sausage fest in it's own right, there is a joint next door that sells italian sausage sandwiches.  I just looked at him and said, "That is such a guy thing.  NO girl I know likes a bar because... "AWESOME!  THEY SELL SAUSAGE NEXT DOOR!"  I think he felt a little dumb after that, which he should because we talked about his wife being an artist, but I noticed that he had his wedding ring on his right ring finger.  Shame on you, Mr. Baltimore.  I know what that means.  Go eat some sausage.
author: Jessica M.

description: great beer selection (not much else at the bar, but you really just go here for the beer).  a very low-key, casual atmosphere...great to just chill with friends.
author: Roshni R.

description: awesome....... clean bar great beers.......the gentlemen tenders are lovely!....sweet hearts
author: Lora L.

description: I lived across the street from Toronado for 4 years and can tell you in good faith that it is hands down one of the best places to drink beer in the world.  Happy hour is epic, all timer, off the richter scale.  Double Daddy, Racer 5 the list goes on and on.  There is a barley wine festival once a year that will lat waste to many a person - very strong!  Nonetheless, come down here for a pint or 10!
author: Dyl D.

description: What better way to celebrate a long weekend than doing some serious drinking on a Sunday.  I went to the Barley Wine Festival, I was there for 5 hours which was way too long considering most of the beers contained anywhere from 10 - 14% alcohol!  But it was a lot of fun - who doesn't love a place that as soon as you enter a brawl starts (some inebriated dude threw something at the Australian bartender).  Best part about this place is the guy-girl ratio - it gave me dj vu from my Man Diego trip.
author: AngelaS F.

description: Great beer choices, great location, next door to Rosamunde, good happy hours.  You can bring in any food you want.  Great toilet writings, but bad smells.  Only down side, 'tenders can have attitude until you get to know them.  Have loved this place for years, especially when John Henry Pizza was next door.
author: AJ L.

description: thanks, wako for letting us know that it is belgian beer month at toronado!  i absolutely love this place!!  they have everything on tap...particularly my beloved hoegaarden!  i tried another belgian beer last night that i really liked, piraat, a belgian IPA.  delicious!  here is a link to the piraat beer...very interesting:  http://www.vansteenberge.com/htm/2en/21200en.htm.
author: Helen T.

description: Best Selection Of Beers On Tap But Watch Out For The Homeless Guy Sleeping Outside
author: Jullian W.

description: I LOVE this place and its probably a stong reason why lately, I have had a stirring to try and change my current job situation so I can move back to the Bay Area. In LA and during my stint in the OC, we had the Yardhouse, which probably has more beers to offer than Toronado, an extensive food menu, and much more seating. But- Toronado has my heart, and I will continue to have a slight contempt for the chain, mass marketed concept behind the Yardhouse, though I will continue to frequent them for their massive beer selection. Toronado is dark, dingy on the inside, has limited seating and a pretty dirty, ghetto bathroom. Happy hour is also from noon to 6 pm everyday and they have an awesome selection of brews from all over- from obscure microbrews to delicious belgian ales and wheat beers. This place gets packed on Thursday, Fridays, and Saturdays and it tends to get hard to find seating. Also- they have a bring your own food policy, and with Toronado's proximity to Rosamunde Sausage Grill, as well as a yummy middle eastern and ethiopian place, you have the best of both worlds. Delectable  food and delicious beers. I have heard complaints about the gruff service, but I have never had an issue. I usually ask the bartender for his reccomendation and I seem to get better tasting beer, and better service that way.I have spent hours upon hours on end in this place, drinking beer after beer and getting more and more wasted. I discovered my love for the 10% ABV Maredsous beer from Belgium here. After 3 of those, I was  more or less incapacitated and had to spend the next hour wandering around the Castro and Mission to sober up before my long drive home to my parents in Santa Cruz. ahh, memories:)
author: Manali K.

description: possibly the best beer selection in the city but it's probably worth going to monk's kettle or city beer store instead because the bartenders here are despicable people, so you'll come out angry (and smelling like puke), just like them.
author: Sophia L.

description:
I come from a state where beer is a religion, a way of life, and a cornerstone of the economy. I grew up on good beer that was cheap and available. Living in California the past 2 years has been a major shock. There is no good beer here that is cheap and available.

The Toronado was therefore refreshing, but not as refreshing as I'd like. California has the residual beer mentality that good = import, and therefore the more Belgians we sell in wine stores, bars, or upmarket restaurants, the more beer cred we get.

I experienced this disappointment with the Toronado list. Over half the spread was Belgian or Belgian style. For christ's sake, diversify.

The pro's: Moonlight and Russian River are both on the list. Happy hour is affordable and long-standing. Rosamunde's is next door.

The cons: Belgians are overrepresented. Little thought is given to stylistic diversity (there were no stouts and only one porter on the board when I stopped in). There is little thought given to regional diversity - not enough Californian brews on the board, and I only counted one Northwest brew (tragically, Full Sail Rip Curl - not exactly the best rep for the birthplace of the renaissance). No East Coast brews. What the fuck is going on? Divey/punkish atmosphere: take it or leave it. I grew up on traditional pub styles, but if you want your bars harder, whatever. Service: taciturn. Goth boy was behind the bar, I talked beer with him for a while when he wasn't busy. He didn't recognize my Alameda Brewing shirt (shame) and hadn't heard about the Lagunitas bust. On my second pint he nagged me for a tip in a snotty, condescending way. I tip at the end of my stay, not with every round. He lost the %20 I had tucked in the back of the wallet for him. More suckage is that they don't do tabs.

This is an acceptable beer bar, but the fact that it is the best in the bay makes me happy I'm going home in 3 weeks.
author: B. A.

description: eh. it's ok for a drink but damn it's too bright for an evening out. dim those lights a bit please I don't wanna see my friends when I drink.
author: Dave R.

description: not much to say bout the 'nado that hasn't been said before. i don't come here too often these days (beer has both gluten and mucho carbs, 2 things i avoid), but i like it here. always attracts a good neighborhood crowd (read: not obnoxious transports but good ole down home lower haighters). and what can you say about the beer? yummers. they have a bit of everything. bartenders could be a bit friendlier but they didn't bat an eye when i stumbled in here late saturday night after celebrating my bday and was bobbing and weaving while perched at the bar. mmmm hefeweizen.
author: Mary V.

description: it takes a lot to make me happy at a non-liquor bar, but this place obviously does the trick.  what a great place to hang out a discover new beers, particularly if you can go at a time when it's not crowded.
author: James R.

description: After being ignored for 20 minutes by one bartender on a recent visit, and after being treated with disdain by this same bartender on several other visits, I'm going to deal with Toronado differently in the future, to try to maximize my pleasure while I'm there.  I plan on phoning the bar and I will ask who is tending bar that evening.  If it's a real bartender, I'll go.  If not, I won't.  BTW, it is considered rude to offer a gratuity to the owner of any business, and it is out-of-line for a business owner to accept a tip.  Toronado still has a problem with the smell of spilled beer on the floor, which interferes with the enjoyment of the fine beers they serve.  I really hope the owner starts to improve the service and the smell.  I would like to go there more often.
author: Ex C.

description: this should be five stars it really should... I love the idea of this place... and when I am in the mood for a large crowd and questionable service I head over there... the beer selection is insane... I really like beer... but I hate crowds and every once in awhile I like to have a civil conversation with the person I am handing cash to... if you are a beer lover this should be on your list... but be warned... do not mess with the bartenders and be prepared to push your way to the bar...
author: joshua b.

description: A plethora of beers, all for reasonable prices.  I agree with the comment on the bartenders - I've had a surly bastard serve me as well. The selection is not to be missed, though.
author: J R.

description: I'm always overwhelmed with decisions here - there are so many different types of beer to choose from. It has the neighborhood bar feel (like a hipster cheers really) which I really love. There are always different walks of life here which make for an interesting people watching extravaganza (especially while they shove their faces with the sausages from next door - which taste amazing). I would recommend coming here in the afternoon/early evening on a weekday, I've found these are the best times to go.
author: Heather H.

description: not sure if i'd call this a dive bar as much as i'd call it a dude bar. this is a man's man's bar. beer and more beer. you get a sausage from next door, look around at all the beers that they have, and talk to guys (cause no girls really go here). i love the place, even even with the lack of girls.
author: Ameer N.

description: ahhh great selection at a set inexpensive price.   this is a great place to just drink... classic neighborhood bar
author: Mike L.

description: Yes, the beer selection is large, but of the 10 beers that my friends tried, 2 were quite bad. One of them didn't even got finished - my friend had to just get something else. My porter tasted like cold coffee. The service was OK, but the music got too loud to hold a conversation.
author: Alp M.

description: I've been going here for years.  LOVE IT!  FIrst it's like going someplace undercover.  Don't want to change out of yesterday's dirty jeans--don't.  Not that I'm like that in any way!  But it's small and the selection of beer is fantastic.
author: Misti L.

description: was brought here by a friend during their barleywine festival.  however, we came at the end so all the prize-winning barleywine were gone.  that's not to say that the remaining barleywine was bad -- they were all tasty.  amazing selection of beer on tap and bottled (their bottle list is ridiculous...$300+ for a 750ml of beer????) but the bar gets packed and sometimes there's only 1 bartender.  so you better know what beers you're getting (and also back-ups in case they're out of one) or else you'll get skipped and have to wait another 15 minutes awkwardly standing between/behind the people at the bar.
author: Jenny Q.

description:
- great beer selection, no they don't have hundreds but they have quality beers on tap.  recommend the Big Daddy IPA
- cool, friendly bartenders.  at first they can be a little intimidating but the 4 different bartenders that i've encountered have been nice and offered free tastes.
- perfect place to enjoy the sausage that you just bought at rosamunde
- lot's of guys, so ladies, as i said, it's the perfect place to enjoy all of that sausage
author: K V.

description: Not crowded at all on a Tuesday. I have a glassware fetish and Toronado didn't disappoint. These people are serious about beer without being fussy like Monk's Kettle.  I enjoyed my Schneidr Weisse, and love that you can bring in sausages from Rosamunde's next door.
author: Debbie K.

description: If you love beer, you probably already visit the Toronado.  This is the best beer selection in the city.  These guys get Belgian imports that you can't find anywhere else.  As an established beer destination, they also get all kinds of small batch brews from regional and noted craft brewers.  They even cellar annual specialty brews for multi-vintage tastings.  I always as for beer recommendations here since the list is so big and changes so often.  If you can specify a type of beer you'd like to try the bartenders can recommend one that's currently available.  If you say "I don't really like beer, what can do you recommend?", 1) you're at the wrong bar; 2) just get the Lindeman's Framboise.
author: Justin R.

description: i want to live here. seriously. there is an entire wall full of beer nozzles and logo knobs of all the beers they offer. the happy hour is KILLER ($2.50 for a lot of their best pints!). the crowd i still can't figure out - once i came on a sunday and it was a quieter night with some locals, the other time i came on the saturday before my birthday and it was full of guys in flannel shirts or leather jackets. i guess the staff can be short on their customers, but i chalk it up to the fact they got like 200 beers to memorize. that shit can't be easy.
author: Jenz y.

description: Metal on the juke, Dozens of good beers on tap, and almost always some elbow room. Great beer bar. Parking's a bitch.
author: Matt G.

description: lots of beers on tap. grab some food nearby and have a seat. great spot for a midday fix.
author: Dean E.

description: went there to the barleywine festival. a good 45 % of the beer had already been consumed. this drops two stars. but then ill go there on a regular night, try a good 58 different IPA'S at once, and then pass out on a marquee down the street partially nude, wondering why people buy beer at other bars....
author: Christopher J.

description:
rock solid 4 stars. awesome beer menu, great atmosphere. know your beers (your good micro and import beers) and don't ask stupid questions.

also, buy a sausage next door. you won't regret it.
author: Jason K.

description: Quite simply one of the best beer selections on the west coast, and the  Barley Wine festival is one of the best beer events in the country.  The bartenders, for the most part, are rude bastards tho.
author: Bryan J.

description: Obviously they have one of the most fantastic beer selections in the city.  They have tons on tap and even more in bottles including some amazing belgians that are a little pricey but a good thing to blow some tip money on.  The place is alright bartenders are total a-holes but I think they try to be.  You can take in outside food and all that good stuff.  All around a great beer bar especially if you can find a seat.
author: Daniel S.

description: The beers are good but the service is far from good. Avoid the lady with the dark hair and the vintage clothing and the worn looking face and the smart ass bitchy attitude thats' a Bettie Page wanna be and you may be okay. As for me i'll never go back there because of her. Any business that allows someone like that to work for them I make sure to stay clear of. Toronado gets no stars from me.
author: Bernice D.

description: Ya man! Right off the 22, so it's oh so convenient for me to pop on over from my eastside haunts. And the beer is oh so right. The selection is down right overwhelming... until you spend a couple of evenings working your way through all the wonderful selections. I've never had service that was downright offensive, but I have felt neglected at times. All that said, drink up.
author: Matt B.

description: any beer you want, as long as it doesn't suck.
author: Peter H.

description: amazing beer selection, reasonable prices, excellent sausages located next door
author: Horrible H.
